text: Disappointed in food and couldn't get free drink because used wine discount offer. This is just an OK restaurant and sorry We wasted one of our New Orleans dinners here

I'm waiting for the day this dump goes out of business permanently..
NEGLIGENCE US INEXCUSABLE

Joy Tsin Lau used to be great. Ive been here hundreds of times in the past for dinners, banquets, and weddings. Now, with the many other places in Chinatown, there really is no reason to go here. Over the years, Joy Tsin Lau has been slowly declining for many terrible and avoidable reasons. 

The service has become abysmal. The workers seem terrified of the owners and managers. They are constantly and publicly yelling at their employees and at customers. They refuse to cater to their patrons and are openly rude and dismissive. Even when my family specifically asked for rice or water, they kept giving us reasons as to why they shouldnt. When putting dishes onto the table, they would hit my family members or slam them onto to the table. They kept taking away our tea cups and tea pot even though we were using them. 

And the food was awful. Everything tasted like fake chinese food. Nothing was good or tasted like it should. There were dishes that werent apart of what we ordered but they tried to pass it off as it was, even when we asked about it. Seafood dishes were sorely overcooked. Everything was terrible from the atmosphere, the service, to the food. 

To too it all off, this restaurant appeared in headlines everywhere in 2015 for causing one of the largest foodbourne illness outbreaks by sickening over 100 patrons. They have also had dozens of other health violations over the last few years. I understand that places mess up sometimes, but this is surely a sign of an underlying internal issue. 

Do not eat here. There are so many better options, elsewhere. Not worth the risk.

The absolute worst company to deal with!!!! Save you time, money, and sanity!!!!! I ordered Blackwoods Honeyberry cigars MONTHS ago and they keep pushing the date out. These cigars are available at every gas station on the planet, but thought I would order from Thompson Cigars.... what a TERRiBLE mistake!!! I cancelled the original order, but a gal from customer service called and talked me into reordering, Biggest WAIST of TIME! Stay away!!!

This place sure have a great foods. Didn't make us miss Las Vegas. Workers are accommodating and welcoming until our visit today ‍ the manager was very rude and arrogant! He even picking up his nose  in front of us! Eeewwwww that was disgusting. I can't help it, so I have to asked him, why are u picking up your nose in front of our foods? And he was like I'm not touching it, so I was like, but I can drop to our foods? And he was like, I'm the manager here, so I was like, I don't care ! ‍  what I'm asking is why you picking up your nose? Then when we're about to pay, I showed him our military ID and just gave us 10% and I was just curious because every time we dine in here they give us like 20 or 25% I don't really remember but definitely not 10% but that's okay if that makes him feel good. And Thank you to the owner Dave T.  for giving all the military and their family a good discount  we appreciated it so much! It's just those people you put into work, don't know the meaning of customer service  ever since we moved here it's been our favorite place to go for lunch or dinner and even telling it to our Asian friends here in Indy and they come here and sending me pics. Saying oh we've been there, and the food was really awesome  and I feel proud for giving a great recommendations to them! But sad to say that this will be our last time dining here, we will just go to the fishers branch. Maybe will come back if he's no longer working here. Mr. Dave T. I was trying to communicate with you regarding this matter but I don't know how. So I hope you read this. Thank you 

Here his pic. If he's not picking up his nose he is removing the doo doo  on his eyes in front of the food. I am here inside while typing this and really don't have an appetite to eat my food that was done by him bec. There might be a boogies on it hahaha

They did not do a good job on my nails. I got a a fill in with gel nails. Their prices state 30 dollars they charged me $40 without a clear explanation. The work was not worth $40'at all. My nails are peeling in the same day. 

However they are nice people. But not quality work for their prices

For a place that does chicken it's just ok. I found both times that the chicken sandwich was kind of chewy. Biscuits the first time were terrific but the second time old. For the price it should be excellent. 
Went back and had another chicken sandwich it was so chewy I couldn't eat it. The manager explained its thigh meat or something. I don't care what kind of chicken meat it is if it's grey and hard to chew I don't want it.

My friends and I paid for VIP seating which was supposedly $600 + tip and tax but came out to ~$1000. We paid for grey goose, Jameson and champagne. They brought out the 2 bottles of alcohol and forgot about the champagne and the server tried to make us pay for the champagne. There is a private bathroom in the vip section and I told the Worker they were out of toilet paper. Instead of getting me toilet paper he skipped the line for the bathroom and used it himself. This place is disgusting and empty. Not worth the time or money. Also the DJ they hired sucked ass, he played random ass songs from the early 2000s until now with no particular order.

I have never had such a bad experience at a nail place. I had a groupon for a gel manicure. I just moved to the Riviera and I was looking for a new nail place (Art Nails in Carpenteria is awesome). The woman who did my nails was not very friendly, and I was treated differently because I had a Groupon. The woman cut my nails with a clipper, and she didn't shape them! I asked her if she was going to shape them when she started painting, and she said yes. They were uneven and square like when you cut with clippers!!!!! She then proceeded to paint them so I thought she was going to shape then afterwards or something. She finished with them and then when I said how they looked so bad she shooed me out to take another customer. I was such in shock I didn't know what to do. So this is my only recourse. Do not go here. Bad energy on top of it. I am so disappointed and I feel like I was treated so badly. :( I should be given a full refund for such a horrible experience. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME.

Grabbed a flight with friends and my fave is the Peachy Shenanigans. 

Hi-Lo-Peño was ok, Lucky Lucy was light and sweet, Little Joe Nitro was thick like a meal replacement, Clearwater Honey Cream was sweet like honey, and the Say That Three Times Fast was light with more flavor than a Bud Light. 

Service was good and the ambiance is chill.

Horrible, dirty, hot, cheap, didn't even have samples of gel color I had to guess from the bottle. The workers look so unhappy I wanted to kidnap them. Don't do it keep driving to a place with a better review
The bar tender took about 10 min to tell us it was closed with it being 1150 and hours say open until 2:00. And he was kind of rude about it.

This review is for the restaurant only. 
I can't find too many positive things to say about the food. The pot roast was fatty and dry and needed to be smothered in gravy for any taste. The fried chicken was greasy. The sides were good but nothing spectacular or overly impressive. The apple butter was not very good considering how much they hype it up. The rolls were a cross between a biscuit and a doughnut and cold.  They do have a small beer and wine selection. Would only give it a one star but the service warrants a two. We had a very large party of 16 people and our waitress Tommy was EXCELLENT. The food is cheap but considering how greasy and flavorless everything was, this place is not worth checking out. Definitely a pass.

The Mac and cheese was very good the first time I went. I decided to return for a second time and was greeted by the rudest hostess ever. There was 2 visible open tables and no one waiting to be seated. I asked for a table for a party of three and she rudely said, I have nothing, without mentioning a wait time or anything. So I asked can We wait, she responded I doubt anything will open, I have no idea how long people will stay. I have never been to a restaurant that completely dismissed patrons. No food is worth that treatment, I will never return and will recommend to others not to go. There are multiple places in New Hope with great food and great service!

We have not had pizza baron before and I wanted to give this place a try. I went to their website and I misread the special of 1 large 2 topping pizza (additional toppings are 1.50), 12 wings, fries and garlic bread for 19.95 and I got 2 large pizzas with 3 toppings each. I got there and they said my total was $42. I was confused and the kid that help me was really nice. I got the special for one and the other I was charged 18.99 for a large pizza. The lady who intervened was not all that customer service oriented and said that there are a lot of fake websites....seriously....who would make a fake website for this place. Anyhow we got our food and got in the car when I realized that I was charged for the special and got the pizza and wings but not the fries or garlic bread. I went back in and asked for them and the lady said that I was already given the fries and bread and that it was in the box. I asked what box....the pizza box and she said no the small box. The kid who was nice and helped me explained that he only gave me the wings and she got all pissy and told the guys to put small fries and 1 piece of garlic bread in a box to go. The fries were not very good...the garlic bread is a disgrace and shouldn't be called that (it was a melted butter and garlic salt mixture on the French bread) and the pizza was gross and the green bell peppers and onions were so tiny!! This place is over priced and the food is terrible. I have advised people I know to stay clear of this place. I only have 2 stars because the kid who helped me was really friendly and knows customer service.

So disappointed in this place. First of all they must close the beer garden outdoor area super early, with no signage or without locking their door. Second of all they straight up close early. Their hours are whack. Daytime place for sure. All their beers are gimmicky, no selection of red or amber ale or pale ale or lager whatsoever. Out of a dozen plus taps. Too many ipa's and hokey beers with silly names and ingredients. Tired hands does this better. Also I ordered an ice cream sandwich and expected it to be made in house or on par with weckerly's or basset's and it was just a shitty corner sto ice cream truck jawn for $3. Meh. Also no service everything is cafeteria style and you wait in a like and order at a counter.
The worst Chinese food ever. I normally don't complain much about food but this was pretty bad. I will never eat here again.

I love the color I got and the choices, but my manicure was done sloppy and the maintenance/cleanup of a normal manicure (hang nail clean up, etc) wasn't even attempted. I attempted contact/complaining, but nobody has reached out.

"Vietnamese and Louisiana food" is what the waiter told us and my family and I fully bought into the story- we were wrong. 

The meals were poorly executed and the flavors were a mashup of the wrong notes. 

I really wanted to like this place. It has amazing potential but it fell short of all expectations. We left feeling bloated and our wallets were sapped.

I ordered a large frozen Chai Latte. The guy was new and didn't know how to make it. No big deal. I changed my order to a vanilla frozen coffee instead. I received what looked like a vanilla milkshake. It was pure frozen vanilla flavoring!! I understand that the guy was new and he was very apologetic but why would they have some one there alone who doesn't know how to make anything?

The shame is the food is good but the service is terrible. I waited 30 minutes at the register while the cashier figured out delivery dudes orders. Help your customers first and delivery dudes can wait, especially if they have multiple orders.  The line was atleast 8-10 deep by the time I finally got my food.

So disappointing. The service and food compliment each other, horrible. I asked for water at least 4 times. I noticed  other people received things we did not ie crunchy noodles to nibble on as you peruse the menu or items that weren't even on the menu. I wanted egg foo young but it wasn't on the menu. I saw it being served at another table. I was told you have to ask for it. Oh!!! 
We had to ask for basic things, plates, napkins. Wayyyyy too much work. Food wise, the Chinese pizza was over cooked, pork in the rice and foo young had odd texture and taste--
Would you believe the waitress complained about her tip??? She thought she deserved 20 based on the bill. Do not expect proper tipping when you provide improper service. She stomped away from the table. 

We only went here because Saffron was packed. However, we will never, ever  return.

Swing and a miss. Three of us ordered steaks and all were cold. Clear they had been pre cooked and then reheated (partially). 
Appetizers were also off. Crab cake was so so.
Wine was pricey, likely 2.5-3x retail.
We got out of the restaurant for over 400 for four. 
We have enjoyed other places in Clearwater a lot more for a lot less.

*WARNING* CREDIT CARD THEFT. 
Stay away from this location. Waiters and Waitresses steal your credit card #s
This has happened 2x to us at this location. 
They maxed out our credit cards, they bought furniture, video Games, and all sorts of stuff. 
There is a credit card theft ring at this location. 
I have spoken to clients, family, and friends and
They have had the same thing happen to them.

I liked the menu variety, but unfortunately I found a hair in my Tom Yum noodle soup -- definitely not mine, as it was short and black (and I have long brown hair).  Sadly, I found it after I was most of the way through my dish.  Additionally, the soup seemed way hotter than "#2" on their spicy scale.

This is prob one of the worst pizza places that I have been too and way way over priced. When I got home I was shocked I paid as much as I did. 
Most of it looked like it came straight out of a can from GFS. I hate to sound mean but I'm just being honest when I say that my kids could have easily made a pizza just as good.

Horrible service and a ripoff. Went on a Saturday afternoon during college football games and found only one very harried server on duty. Ordered some appetizers and had a couple pints of local beer. I was shocked when the check came and found that the beers were $13 each!  There were no prices on the beer menu, so be warned!

The four stars are for Liz only! 

Lovely woman, does a wonderful job. She takes the time to address my cuticles the way I like them and doesn't give me an attitude.

I have had another tech before, I get the same color every time. I asked for the color and he used another color insisting that it was the correct color. 
He was also holding the nail polish bottle with a rag, hiding it. The manicure was sloppy, wrong color, and very rushed. He wouldn't address the issue of it being the wrong color.

And the owner could see I was upset and did nothing. The Nail House must be 150 yards from them. There are too many nail salons in the area, you would think they would be concerned about customer service

UPDATE 4-28-2018

I had an appt at 11:00 am. Got there and the tech was in the beginning of another person. She was taking the foil off her gel nails. The man told me to wait 15 min.  I DONT THINK SO

We make appts for a reason. I had other appts that day. I always have to wait  at least 10 min. I'm sick of it.  And he couldn't believe I wouldn't wait ten fifteen minutes. It was the principle of it. I shouldn't HAVE to wait bc they took someone right before my appt time.

So I went to The Nail House They took me right away.

Bad business. I really enjoyed Liz. She did a wonderful job and she has a lovely personality.

Horrible. Been here twice. Walked out the second time. They don't go by the sign in sheet or appointments. I waited an hour and just said forget it because people were getting in after me. If your not of the south side race, you won't be treated right.

WARNING!!!!! This place is being renovated!! 

PROS: Great location and excellent customer service

CONS: read the book that follows.....

When we pulled up we saw men working on the front of the building...at first sight we thought it was closed. The entrance is located on the side. There is a parking garage directly behind the hotel that charges 20 bucks per day..which isn't bad. The lobby is nice...but like I mentioned before it's being remodeled so there is a lot of activity going on with contractors. Only 1 elevator working that has a 5 person limit. We ended up climbing the stairs to the 6th floor because the wait was long. This was pretty much the norm for our trip..long elevator waits and stairs. Our room was tiny so if you want a bigger room do no book the Deluxe King. The handset on the phone didn't work...the hot water in the shower did not stay hot for long...there is dust everywhere....the walls are thin...we only had hand towels and larger towels...had to request face towels...


The place has potential. In my opinion I think they shouldn't take reservations until the renovations are completed.

Sad but I can no longer recommend this location. Used to be great , friendly staff , accurate orders. Must have been a management change because of the last four orders I have placed three of them have been incorrect. Whether incomplete or the store ignoring allergy requests, the ineptitude is astounding. I have been waiting five days for a refund and no action , not even from the regional manager. Sad, used to be pretty reliable , now it's a crap shoot. Avoid this location .

While we were somewhat pleased with our therapist, we will not return.  My son came home from school with a stomach virus on the day of his appointment.  I immediately called the office to cancel.  They told me since it was a same day cancelation, I would be charged.  I explained that my son was throwing up and physically could not come in.  I received a bill in the mail.  Horrible policy.
Messed up our order and terrible customer service when we called. Pizza was gross. Not made how Pizza Hut usually is. It was dry and tasted old

When I shop for shoes, I want to go somewhere I can try on shoes quickly (preferably by pulling the sizes myself) and not be hounded by a salesperson during the process. At Stout's, the salesperson tries to keep you in their store for a long time. They want to measure your foot, they want you to try on shoes that they recommend in addition to the ones that you want, and they push you to try on additional insoles that you can buy. 

Some people might like this type of service and think that it's a nice personal touch. Me, I just want to get in and out of a store as soon as possible, and to be left alone unless I have a question. I appreciate that Stout's has been around for so long and that they have a nice selection, but I don't appreciate their approach to sales.
Please train your workers to be little faster when making a sub or slicing deli meat. They are ridiculously slow...even when not busy.

I called them on Monday for an estimate on a complete roofing job, I followed up with a text message with my address and scope of work, still didn't get a response. They finally responded back to me on Wednesday stating they didn't know what the scope of work I needed. They called me on Wednesday @ 4:49pm again requesting the information that I had already provided, With a non-committal tone that stated that they would be in my area and would come out, and requested my information again for the 3rd time...Needless to say they never showed up. I'm guessing they are in the business of ignoring full roofing jobs.

Horrible customer service!! Literally stood there for a minute while 5 employees all talked to each other and the cashier lady just stared right through me! I wasn't sure wether to order or leave. Then she finally came back to earth and asked me if i wanted to order. Pretty sure that's why I'm standing there?! Got my drink and the barista made zero eye contact and didn't thank me. As a past Starbucks employee myself, they didn't do anything to standard and was the worst customer service I've encountered in a long time! Will not be back!

This place was recommended by the Uber driver and yelp reviews...not impressed at all. Brisket was dry and they cut it the wrong way!! You cut against the grain! Over priced and not friendly staff. They had many sauce selection which was the only thing saving from eating dry meat.

This place IS dirty and subpar, I'm shocked it's so pricy. The normal rate is 125-150 for a very small AVERAGE room. 

The deluxe rooms which aren't worth the price are a tad bigger with a mini fridge and microwave 

I didn't experience bedbugs (thank god) but the outside area of the hotel is absolutely filthy, I believe people come here just for a few hours and leave because the casino is right up the street, the front desk clerk is rude. You have to pay for the safe (1.00 a night) you have to pay upfront and not when you check out, the outside areas around the hotel smelled like urine. 

Would I stay here again? Absolutely not, but you get what you pay for.

Dont tell customers to bring it on down then when they arrive not offer help carrying four wheels in and then say too bad when it causes them to not arrive in time to have their vehicle serviced. I was a repeat and loyal customer, they didnt even have my info in the system anymore. This will be the last time i have them perform any service on my vehicle.

If I could give this place a zero I would. From the moment we arrived we could already hear other guest complaining about the wait for food. Still, as we work in this business we decided to wait. It took a little to get greeted and sat, but we got our drinks quickly enough and our server did warn us about the kitchen running a little behind. Cut to an hour and a half later, our server hadn't come back to the table even once since we got our drinks and we had heard multiple arguments from the kitchen staff in which cursing was involved. To make matters worse, there were children around. The whole restaurant went quiet at one particular moment when a served screamed the F/bomb in search of his food. Meanwhile the manager has been in the kitchen this whole time letting this go on. We finally asked for our check and left without ever getting our food. There were three of us and, again we all work in this field. It was absolutely inexcusable, and I would never recommend this location to anyone.
Not a good experience. Took me back late and do not actually finish the cleaning! No polishing at all as I was out of time.

I shop at this Winn Dixie almost daily. I really don't understand working at a place that you don't enjoy, if you don't want to work, stay your ass at home. I don't need your attitude. The cashier (Jeolisa) spoke twice to me, to ask for my plenty card & to tell me how much my total was, that's it! This is the first time I have had a cashier or any employee for that matter, to be impolite & NO I'm not bagging my own groceries this time, you can do that, that's NOT MY JOB!!! Maybe she had a bad day, we all have them, but you will never know I'm having a bad day at MY job. So do your job properly or QUIT!!!

After a poor experience with the Bates Manor room in June of last year we were not planning to return for the other rooms at Bates Escape.  We decided to give the location another try since they were offering a coupon for the Countdown room, and hoped this experience would make us want to return for the other rooms.  I wish we had stuck to our gut and not gone back at all.  Countdown was even worse than Bates Manor, and it honestly was the worst "escape room" I've seen in my 2  1/2  years and 25+ rooms.  I use quotes because I don't believe this can even be considered an escape room.  If it was my first experience with an escape room I never would've done another.  

The experience starts off with an abrasive and, frankly, sexist "admiral" yelling instructions at you about North Korean missiles.  The premise is both too real and too ridiculous in a way that majorly detracts from any immersion that the set provides.  The admiral continues to yell at you and use offensive idioms throughout the adventure under the premise of updating your orders and helping the mission.  It's 2018; there is no excuse for the use of "off like a prom dress in May" in any context.  In addition to being loud and uncomfortable, the admiral eats up time while you wait for him to finish the same instructions that eventually appear on screen.  On the subject of time, there is NO REASON for the timer to be counting down in only seconds.  No one, not even the military, refers to an hour as 3600 seconds and only counts down in seconds.  If Bates wanted a clock that would raise the stakes for players and manufacture a sense of urgency then one should be programmed to rapidly count down the milliseconds as well as displaying the minutes and seconds.

I will say that the decor is very immersive.  Bates Escape never seems to skimp on the set decorations that make their rooms transport you to wherever you're supposed to be.  In most cases that is a great thing, but in this room it seems to actually hinder game play.  Poorly lit rooms are burdened with a multitude of superfluous props that just wastes time instead of actually adding a difficulty level to the game.  Fifteen minutes into the game I already no longer cared about even finishing and just wanted out.  

If you are interested in a submarine simulation that involves repeatedly following the same set of instructions while being yelled at and having extremely loud alarms sound in your ear, then this is the room for you.  If you're interested in an actual escape room that involves solving clever puzzles then I would steer clear.  We counted a total of 2 puzzles that actually needed to be solved.  Everything else was just guessing or following step by step instructions.  If I wanted to follow written instructions to the letter I would've put together an Ikea bookshelf.  It probably would've been more mentally challenging.  The real tragedy is the ease with which the rooms at Bates could be some of the best around.  Marrying technology into an escape room should make a fun experience with a sense of accomplishment.  This was an entire room of "ok fine, what's next...".  There were no "a-ha" moments and no pride at figuring anything out.  We will not return to Bates Escape.

The food is hot but drive thru can take a while. 

We ended up here after a concert because Arby's closes at 11 p.m. - sad. But after extensive texting about what to eat, I learned that the quarter pounder is now made entirely of beef (when I asked what was it made of before, I was told to not ask scary questions). I also googled which had more meat, a quarter pounder or a double cheeseburger. Turns out a quarter pounder has ¼ pound of meat, duh, and a double cheeseburger has 1/5 pound. I was sold on the quarter pounder. 

My husband got a ten piece chicken nugget and asked for sweet and sour and Szechuan sauce instead of honey mustard. Good thing he checked before we drove away because they didn't give him the correct sauce, and it turns out they don't have Szechuan sauce. We were the only people in the drive thru and it took longer than usual to get our order. However, once we did get it, it was piping hot! That's one way to know it was fresh.

Food was your normal golden arches quality. I'm just taking away a couple stars because the employees sounded pretty ambivalent about being there, wrong sauces, and length of wait time.
Poor signage and extremely odd numbering scheme. All my visitors end up walking all the way around the building out of confusion.

Food was real good but 8-10 dollars for a 1/2 glass of wine? Please!
 We waited a few weeks for this reservation for 6 ; our table was more suited for 4. As we were waiting for our initial drink order, our servers were bringing apps that we hadn't ordered yet. No clue!  Should definitely offer some reasonably priced house wine by the bottle ! Won't come back!

We had been looking for a reason to stop and try this place, so we were stoked when we finally got to stop in about 7 on a Tuesday evening. 
There was only 1 other family of 4 in the dining area. We settled on two simple pepperoni's, an Athenian, and a Five Star, and made combos of 3 of those. Two people solemnly greeted us at the pizza station. They both appeared as though they either disliked their jobs, or life in general. We ordered one at a time, and it was a painfully slow process. 
We stopped for drinks, and what a mess! It made me stop and look around and the multiple dirty tables, nasty floor, and overall unclean surroundings. It made me wonder why two people were making pizza, and not one person was cleaning up. But, hey...on to the food. 
The pizza was so-so. The crust was good, but it really had minimal toppings, and the Athenian was missing a few all together. Even the salads was limp and small. For the cost, it really wasn't worth it. 
We all figured we'd hit the head before the long ride home, which was also an eye-opener. The bathrooms were just as dirty as the dining area.
Perhaps another location would be better, but this location is not one we'd return to for sure. I think we'll see what the one opening in the Boro is like next time, before we give up hope.

First let me warn you that parking is really bad in this area of the city, so you should avoid driving.  The restaurant is really small and when we arrived they pointed to our table which was crammed in and literally 2 inches from the seats of the next table.  With no way to get to our seats, my wife and I looked in amazement as the person greeting us said that we could have the table next to us move.  I told him he needs to ask them to move, which they did but why the staff didn't have the place set up properly in the first place is a mystery (I guess it's too hip to think).  Not a great way to start the dining experience. 

Ok, on to the dinner.  We started with the chicken liver toast and mussels.  The toast was delicious but the mussels were just so-so.  It was supposed to have chorizo sausage but there was very very little and what was there tasted flat.  The main courses were half chicken (not fried) and swordfish. Both were very good.  The dessert was good but the coffee was bitter. 

All in all the meal was good but not what I would have expected from a restaurant touted as one of Philly's best.

Addition: Not sure what the owner was trying to say in his response to my review but this was an honest assessment of our experience.  

Your response was not very customer oriented. I wasn't the genius that put a table in a spot that was NOT accessible.  

Let's just say I won't be returning.

Charged us 4.95 for 1 egg for my son.....asked about it and they said that was the price for 1 egg. We have eaten there tons of time but this will be the last. Sad as this used to be one of our favorite spots for diner type food.

I just wanted to buy a single box of cigars for my Dad for Christmas. As I submitted the order, I saw "Thank you for your order!" followed by something about my free trial for some subscription service that I did not sign up for would last for 30 days, then I would start getting charged $14.95/mo unless I wrote an email to a specific address to tell them I didn't want that. So I did that and they said I got removed. I haven't seen any charges on my card, so I'm assuming we're good.

THEN a few days later, I got a phone call while I was at work from a rep for Thompson Cigars who wanted me to sign up for another subscription-based thing and would not get off the phone with me until I told her I was at work and did not want to have this conversation.

NOW (a month later) I am getting MULTIPLE emails daily from Thompson Cigar.

Y'all are like a stage 5 clinger ex-boyfriend. Seriously. Tone it down. I just wanted to buy some cigars. I don't want 50 billion marketing emails, a very much unwanted subscription service, and PHONE CALLS. I would have been a good customer and bought cigars several times per year, but now I just want you to leave me alone! We're broken up. Please. Stop calling and writing.

First and last time dining here. The food was not edible. My friend and I ordered a few things to try. The 504 omelet which was sitting in what looked like a bowl of bacon grease. I didn't even taste it because it looked disgusting which my friend confirmed. The biscuits and gravy had 3 different types of sausage, one being hot sausage. It was horrible. The pancakes were pancakes, whatever... we left without eating and went to get breakfast somewhere else. $40 down the drain.  Biggest disappointment meal ever. It was my friends last meal before going to the airport to leave NOLA. The one good star is because the people were nice. Although the lady that took our order saw we were leaving without eating and didn't bother to ask if something was wrong.

I got the spinach & egg white breakfast sandwich.  I was a little disappointed to find the egg & spinach was one of those microwaved hockey puck disc things, on some regular grocery store bread, and quite bland.  I wasn't too crazy about it.  Service was friendly although I realized after leaving they gave me a mango green tea when I asked for the regular one.

Got seated by a cheerful hostess, Mimi, but the server we had (Joe) was being trained and we waited 20 minutes to have our order taken or to be offered water. And that is after I went in to ask if someone was going to come take our order while 3 people were folding napkins in the window behind us. 
My coffee was brought to me, but there was still lipstick from the customer before me I'm assuming on its rim. Ew. Asked for A1 and got an empty bottle. The replacement had to be shaken to get any out had me feeling like I needed to slip the server a $20 to get a real full bottle or something. 
I ordered the skillet and the eggs were so dried out seemingly compensated by an overwhelming abundance of cheddar cheese drenching it to mask the lack of life in the eggs. 
5 minutes after getting our food, our check was dropped off at the table with the "no rush" statement even though it felt premature after having to wait 3 minutes to eat the food in front of me while waiting for A1 to be brought for me to use. 
The skillet was super greasy, the sausage was super sugary so if your looking for a paleo/Keto meal stay clear, and the eggs that were in the skillet were way overpowered by potatoes onions and cheese. 
Service was lacking, food was below par, and I could see this spot being a go to in a moment of savage hunger after bartime. 
Mimi, the hostess, was wonderful the entire time but our server Joe clearly does not enjoy serving or have any customer service skills regardless of being trained to learn this particular restaurants flow. So thanks to Mimi for aiding us in not regretting the entire experience (just 99% of it). 
I would suggest FrogPond or Beverly's for your breakfast needs (worth the drive trust me).

I love BYB and never leave reviews but I am so disgusted and want to warn others to check their chicken tenders. I ordered a kids chicken tender and it was completely raw inside on both tenders . I have called and the assistant manager assured me it wasn't possible because he cooks them for 7 minutes and corporate standard is 5... well you can be the judge. These are raw and really hoping I don't get food poisoning because I only realized after I ate half of one

I have always enjoyed B-Dubs, but the service is really headed downhill. I had slow service suring my last visit 3 weeks back, considered it a "one off". Today our family of four sat close to 15 minutes without so much as someone coming over for a drink order. We walked out and went to eat next door. My wife let the greeters know what had happened, they apologized but didnt do anything to rectify the problem at that point. Service is everything to me, they failed miserably today....

Went to Rothman KOP for the first time, after severe exacerbation of longstanding and complex back problems.  Almost immediately, before my visit started,  an x-ray tech told me she wanted to take x-rays, even lthough I told her I brought a new MRI and x-rays from a few years ago.  She proceeded to take x-rays of my spine while in my street clothes, meaning the metal zipper on my high waisted pants would obscure part of the view of my spine.  Standard parameters on the American College of Radiology website state "You will be asked to remove some of your clothes and to wear a gown during the exam. You may also be asked to remove any metal objects or clothing that might interfere with the x-ray images." Afterwards, when seen by the Physician's Assistant, the x-rays they took weren't shown to me or discussed. Only the MRI that I brought was briefly shown to me.  I wasn't asked to change into a gown for an "exam" either, nor was my spine/back examined in any detail.  I was asked to bend forward and backward, sit and lift my legs and push them against the PA's hand, checking for strength or lack thereof.  A test for lack of feeling in my lower legs was done through my pant leg and knee socks, not against my skin.  After this minimal "exam" and after relating my complex history as briefly as possible, the PA said, "So, do you want surgery?"  Really?  I'm supposed to be the judge of when surgery is indicated?  Apparently, saying yes to surgery would have been the only way for me to be seen by the Orthopedic Surgeon, who, in my opinion, should be the one giving me an "expert" opinion as to whether or not I need surgery.  It's one thing to have a preliminary exam by a PA at a physician's office, and it's another thing to rely ONLY on a PA for an exam and treatment of a very complex issue.  From now on I will only go where I can see a board certified Orthopedic Surgeon for my treatment.
Waiting an hour for my food... waited 15 minutes for my coffee. Just an awful experience.

This store is the most ridiculous I ever did business with.Totally disorganized, can't get a simple window measurement correct and some there treat the customer with disregard and disrespect. It takes forever to get through to the person you need to talk with. They have a few good overworked employees who can't compensate for the incompetence and disorganization of this business. Good luck ordering  a window treatment. Their vendors hire people that can't do a simple measurement and get it right. Be prepared to spend a lot of time on the phone getting cut off and unanswered trying to fix their mistakes, after paying for a professional installation.

My husband and I went to eat at Sterling this evening with our two grandchildren which I won't say my grandchildren are perfect because they're not. One the 2 year old did cry for approximately 30 seconds maybe a minute at which time I was asked to leave the restaurant because he was disturbing other people the other people around me. When I apologize to them all said he was fine anyway to make a long story short I left the restaurant without eating my $50 dinner which we still had to pay for it and my husband had them box it up. If you have children definitely do not go eat at this restaurant. And to the restaurant you don't want children in the restaurant you should put a sign up that says so, I was a paying customer like everybody else I walked out crying and have never been so embarrassed and treated so badly in my life

If I could give zero stars I would. My 3 year old daughter and I drove 50 minutes from Land O Lakes, for some daddy/daughter time. We walked in, after driving around for a parking spot for 20 minutes, were greeted by the host. I asked for a table for two and was met with an excuse that we couldn't be seated because they were having issues...and may not seat people the rest of the evening.

Hungry and dejected my daughter and I walked out of the Iberian Rooster and started our search for another restaurant. Two more couples were getting ready to enter and I told them what we were told... they decided to see for themselves. As my daughter and I watched from the sidewalk, the host kindly greeted the couples and walked them to their seats. 

You draw the conclusion as to why they deserve less than favorable ratings. We will never be back and I will make sure to tell people not to visit Iberian Rooster... especially those with children.

The food was alright. Nothing to go home & rave about. I had the breakfast biscuit with poached eggs. The biscuit was dry & the sauce on top was blah. The fried biscuit thing with the powered flower was eh. My boyfriend had the banana pancake thing and he seemed to enjoy it. I wouldn't eat here again though....

If I could give negative stars I would. The wait times are ridiculous.  The staff is insensitive and careless about patient confidentiality. None of the medical staff here takes any patient concern serious. Good luck scheduling an appointment with any Doctor within the Sansum network, you'll probably die before you can get in to see someone.

The eel avocado sushi roll was awesome.   With that being said, this family of 4 simply could not finish our meals.   The sesame chicken and general tsos was way sugary.  The wok seared chili beef was way over salted.  I get Americanized Chinese food, but this was pretty awful.  This was the first time we ate here but have been to other Mandarin a Group places with satisfactory results.  I'm guessing it's this particular chef.

If I could give this place 0 stars I would...
I booked a class, received a confirmation email, and was very excited. However, the night before the class at 10:20pm I received an email saying that the owner had canceled my class. I figured the email was sent as a mistake and since my friend was attending the same class, she would be able to talk to the owner of the studio and it would all be sorted out once they spoke. When my friend confronted her prior to class started, the owner displayed behaviors that were extremely unprofessional. Not only did she brush my friend off, not wanting to deal with the issue but she talked in circles claiming she never sent the email (which my friend had a screen shot of and showed her) and that once the email was sent someone on the waitlist was able to fill my spot and there was nothing she could do. I'm extremely disappointed with how this whole issue was handled and will not be going back.

Worst experience at the Chik- fil-A in the Philadelphia airport today. I love Chick-fil-A's food and their employees are all usually very nice and pleasant, a nice touch compared to a lot of other fast food chains. But unfortunately not today. I get in line and I'm watching the employees and they all look like they hate their lives, no one has a smile on their face, and no one is making eye contact with any of the customers and they all have the worst tones in their voice, like we are inconveniencing them by coming to their business. I get up to the counter and one of the managers takes my order. I order the 8 count nuggets and medium fry. She's multi-tasking, again not even looking at me and she says something to me. I said excuse me, since I didn't understand what she said, and she repeated herself, "do you want the meal?" And I say no drink, just the nuggets and the fries, like I ordered the first time. I then pay and I move to the side to wait for my order. It's pretty busy as it's lunch time so there is a quiet a few people waiting for their food. I wait a few minutes and then move myself closer to the counter where they are handing out the orders at I knew my order must me coming up soon. I wait, but my name is not called. I then start seeing people that were behind me in line start receiving their food. I notice them calling out a lot of sandwiches so I think to myself they must be making more nuggets, so I keep waiting. Still my name is not called. And as I'm waiting this entire time I've been right next to the counter so I'm clearly visible to the employees that I'm waiting AND the manager that took my order is now handing out the food, and this whole time she doesn't even glance my way or notice I've been standing there for probably 10 minutes now. I finally realized they clearly skipped my order so I say something to the manager next time she comes to the counter "Excuse me, do you know if my order is coming for Amanda, an 8 count nugget and medium fry?" Again she seems too preoccupied to pay attention and she says "uhhh one sec." I then see her go over to the monitor with the orders on it and flipping through it trying to find my order. Then she tells another employee to ask me what my order is again, and I repeat again "8 count nugget and medium fry for Amanda". The manager finally gets my food together and hands it to the other employee to give to me. The employee says "sorry bout that, we gave you a 12 count nugget instead. Any sauce?" I said no and walked away with my food. Very disappointing service from Chik-fil-a today. And even more disappointing that the manager that took my order and then messed it up didn't even apologize. I understand it was a pretty hectic and busy time of the day and things happen, but I would have least liked an apology from the manager or act like you care at all, when Chik-fil-a usually prides itself on their customer service.

There is a Starbucks and McCalisters which is why we kept going back. Otherwise, it's nothing great. If you are gambling, the complimentary drinks take forever to come out. We waited over an hour then decided to leave. The club is nothin exciting. Bad karaoke. Bad music. They need better bands and better DJs.
No help. I found item in app. Could not find on rack. No help. I phoned the store. Everyone too busy to help was the response. Low price is useless if I can't get what I want

I have been an Aldi shopper for years, ever since they first opened their store on Easton Rd. Glenside Pa.  But, with that store closing and the Cheltenham store closed for remodeling the only store left in this area is the one in Willow Grove which feels impossible to shop in.  The overflow from the closed stores and the possible addition of new shoppers makes the parking lot dangerous to  maneuver in and the long lines for checking out are ridiculous.  It is impossible for a single person to run in and just pick up a couple of things when others are doing weekly shopping for a large family and of course there is no express line.  The fellow shoppers are kind and courteous ( another thing I like about Aldi) and some will let you go in front of them, but for grabbing some milk and eggs Aldi is no longer the store I go to.  The days of loving to shop at Aldi is past. The staff is always friendly and helpful but I see some wearisome faces.  And that includes mine.

Great Atmosphere. OK  but very overpriced food.  

The fat host who iguess is the owner is an absolute asshole

Smells like ass, everything is expensive, belligerent drunks everywhere (handle yourself!), noooooiiiiise, and bums (not talking homeless) that'll follow and harass you you if you don't give them money, a cigarette or a bite to eat. The amount of people that have given me f-yous and aggressive, "gonna fight" sentiments because I didn't give them a cig or change... At least ten from my three visits. You can only roll so much off your back. Entitled a-holes everywhere. 

The novelty wears off after your second run. It's a bulls#it street. There's *some good restaurants, but the bars are crap. Street performers clog things, and they're usually mediocre, not to be harsh. They play the gimmick of playing to the tourists, which're 98% of those there. "Ooo, novel," people will say. It's dumb there. Given, off-season, but yeah. People feel this need to mooch and mooch. You'll only love Bourbon Street if really drunk. But when you wake up, you'll realize it wasn't that great. Dudebro/frat-bro anuses and bumming losers that aren't even poor everywhere. It's a joke, some of these people.

Bourbon Street, to me, doesn't represent New Orleans or even the French Quarter. So much more going on than this cruddy, s#it smelling street. It's garbage. Seriously. I only give 2 stars because of a few places that're alright.

I recommend Royal Street and so many other parts of the French Quarter.

Employees are always smoking outside of the establishment. Inside of the store smells like cigarettes and food really wasn't worth it. Wrong

Several months later. 2-14-18 I come in, order food, and employees come in after smoke break and now all of the food smells horrible. Smh. We need to do better.
when i drop off my prescription the lady was very nice told me an hour wait. my complaint is they should have more then one pharmacist, we waited like 30 to find out they are behind an hour.

This place is way overrated, maybe people assume long lines mean good food.  Maybe it's a tourist trap or they pay well to advertise, maybe it's because they have oyster house in their name.

People it's not worth the long lines the menu is limited and you can get much better food elsewhere.  Do not get the crab cake it's crab filler kind of disappointing down here in the gulf.  The fried fish platter was good drinks not so great the shrimp appetizer was good as well same as bonefish grills bang bang shrimp.  Please save yourself the heartache.  If there's no line ok check it out but long line run away; and if lines are your thing go to Oceana it's worth it.

Says "world famous". HAH! This place had literally nothing on its menu that was being advertised. No juices, no almond chocolate croissant, no sticky bun. Terrible customer service as my friend and I were ordering. The employees were on their phone texting right in front of us. She seemed annoyed and just angry at life. The food we ended up ordering were bagels (which were toasted without even asking if we wanted them toasted), under baked muffins, and bagels that smelled. 

But I will say that the Nutty Buddy was delicious if you like coffee and have a sweet tooth.

I wanted to like the remodel but the theater was so friggin cold I feel as though I'm leaving with pneumonia. The lobby is freezing too. It's only 30 something degrees outside, turn on a heater so we can enjoy a movie!

Things you can do while you wait for your chicken:
1. Watch a 2 hour expose documentary on war-torn afghanistan
2. Walk ~7 miles
3. Learn how to knit a baby hat
4. Eat a complete 5 course meal at another restaurant with drinks while catching up with friends you haven't seen since high school.

I waited 2 hours and 10 minutes for some chicken. 2 hours and 10 minutes. I don't care if God himself blessed the chicken to endow those with 3 years of good fortune for those who eat it. No chicken is worth it.

I knew the wait would be long and they told me an hour and fifteen minutes. I left and came back to wait for an ADDITIONAL 55 minutes. FOR FRIED CHICKEN. There were only 2 people in line ahead of me, it's not like it was out the door! It was good, but the only thing I'd wait that long for to see is the birth of my first child.

They just spent untold thousands updating the interior so they could add touch screen displays and push the ordering work down to the customers. They now have a single floating employee covering assistance with the touch screens, the one register reserved for cash transactions, and complete coverage of the lobby's tidiness. And this is exactly at noon. It is the shabbiest restaurant update I have seen. 

Remove the two breakfast sandwiches for $4 and there will be no more reason for me to visit this, or any, McDonald's.

If you want to patronize a diner where the food is over-priced and mediocre (at best); where the chefs scream obscenities at the female waitresses and berate them to the point that the waitresses cry in front of customers; where there are packets of a "white powdery substance" on the floor of the dirty ladies room; where the staff are a bunch of miserable, entitled, brats; where you have to wait an hour to be seated because the kitchen is constantly "backed up"; where the portions are small, mismatched, and without presentation....then eat at this diner. Save yourself the money and  grab an egg McMuffin from McDonald's. The owners of this diner should be embarrassed.
They never have salads or baked potatoes at this location. So good luck trying to be semi-healthy.
Horrible place! Poor service ! Takes forever to get a drink! And there was a hair in our food

This was once my guilty pleasure American-Mexican place in Nashville but now it's just bad. Everything is made ahead of time and goes through a microwave (plate is hot but food isn't) and is generally dry and under seasoned.

Waiter was engaging but service was slow.  I ordered calamari which was served on a bed of wilted arugula which lead me to believe it was hot at one time but mine was served cool and limp.  The main scallop dish was good as was a faro salad. The high ceilings and the wood floor make for a noisy atmosphere.   My glass of wine was $17- probably should have purchased a whole bottle to enjoy AFTER dinner and at home.  Most likely will not return.

OK I haven't even checked out and I cannot stand it... My company booked us rooms here for a National conference so I had no choice and accommodations. The first night we were so exhausted that we just crashed the second night we opened the curtains to look out the window to see what the weather was and discovered black mold on the ceiling. I brought this to the attention of management and was treated politely and they offered me a new room which we moved to only to discover this room to had mold... Onto room number three where on top of the window you guessed it it's leaking and also has a mold issue. This is a newly renovated room... It is apparent that they do not do repairs but only mask The issue. My frustration level is beyond imaginable at this point. When I call down to the front desk the managers demeanor has quickly changed from accommodating and understanding to belligerent and confrontational as he told me they were aware of these issues within the hotel which was being renovated. I am only here for a short period of time so I'm not concerned with any long-term health risks however if I was with my child my feeling would be much different. I do not know how a facility that caters to the public could put them in harms way knowingly I find this to be reprehensible and beyond irresponsible. If you are going to check into this hotel I advise before you unpack and get comfortable check around for anything that might be unsettling.

On a overall setting, I will say that when it comes to quantity of the food, you definitely get your money's worth and the staffs are quite friendly. The issue I did have at Lemongrass Sushi & Thai is the food itself. I have better Thai food. I had the Chicken Green Curry it was not as spicy as requested. Also, the chicken does NOT and I repeat ... does NOT taste anything like chicken. I couldn't finish my meal. The chicken tasted rubbery. I was definitely disappointed. Also, most Thai food restaurants will provide you with a continuous amount of white rice. Lemongrass will charge you extra each time you ask for rice. The portion of it is too little especially if you're eating a large portion of curry. 
Lastly, the whole thing of servers touching everything in the room then when setting the table they touch the part of the silverware that goes in your mouth is a bit disturbing. 
My advice to you, be aware of what you're eating. Are you actually paying for the meat you requested or the substitute of it and whom has touched the silverware.

I have been a loyal customer at Assi for the past 6 years going there almost every weekend, spending about $100 per trip. I have probably spent over $5000 in groceries at that store throughout these years but I will be spending much less from this point onward. Let's just say that their customer service is CHEAP. Today I called to complain that I never received my jar of Chili oil that was $5.79 when I was unloading groceries at home, even though they charged my credit card for it. The manager said she needs to look at the video feed then get back to me. 10 mins later she called me back to say that the video shows that the cashier put it in my cart so I must've lost it in the parking lot. I said, well can I just get another one? Thinking come on, it is a $5 item. But she said no, she cannot help me. Okay, fine. If you are willing to lose a loyal customer for a $5 item, that is fine by me. I have been a long time customer who spend $100 every week at your place and I will try to lie and cheat you out of $5? I guess I'm not surprised since Asian people are cheap. (I'm Chinese) the only reason this place gets 2 stars is because the selection is diverse and mostly okay. Though their produce section has gotten worse over the years and their meats are overpriced.

I hated this place. I was a walk-in and kindly asked if they had time for a full set, they said they did which I was glad about. However, if I would've known they were going to rush through my manicure, I would have just waited until the following day. I asked my nail tech for a full set of ombré acrylics, and she did not know what she was doing. She was talking to the other technicians asking them how to do it, while they were working on other people. They were not ombré, they were crooked, they were choppy. They showed me an example and it was exactly what I wanted, but my nails looks HORRIFIC. The nail technician even said, "look how pretty" but they were not pretty. I wish I would have taken a photo to show you all but it was too bad to even take a picture. I came home and soaked my nails with acetone to remove them. Worst $60 I ever spent. I will not be coming here again. If you decide to come here, ask for something simple or make sure your tech knows what they are doing!

I took my car to get the fluids checked and replaced. Less than a week later my car over heated because it ran out of coolant. I paid premium price in my opinion for them to almost destroy my car. - terrible service

Five star reviews are fake. This particular location has horrid customer service, cold coffee and bad hamburger meat. Do yourself a favor and drive to the Wesley Chapel location. Its well worth the extra time if you have it.

What happened?

I was worried we wouldn't get seated for Friday happy hour but was wrong. Place was empty. They totally changed the menu not for the best.  The drinks were still fine but food was less than to be desired. Our flatbread seemed to be store bought with tomatoe sauce on it.  The veggie board was ok.

1st time visiting NO and stopped with family and friend at this place for breakfast.  Nothing special about this place or the the food.  The server had the audacity to leave once we just finished the breakfast because they want to give to other customers even though no one was waiting and there several empty tables.  I would give  - * if there was such option.   Would NOT recommend.

My auto insurance company referred them for replacing flat tire on a Sunday morning. I waited for 1 hour as mentioned. Called back when no one showed up after 1.5 hr. I was told they called me 3 times and cancelled the request on their own. In fact I didn't receive any calls from them. BUNCH OF LIARS...

We were quite distressed that when we had to cancel our reservation due to unforeseen circumstances -that even though it was a Friday night and I'm sure they were able to fill the table-we were still charged $25 per person. This was not written on their site . Unethical and just a bad policy.

Got a burger and fries. Burger tasted too processed. Signs around restaurant indicate hand made burgers. They weren't. Good portion size and nicely presented on a steel basket.  Ordered iced tea and it isn't fresh brewed, just junk out of a 'gold peak' dispenser from concentrate.  Overall, since the food and drink isn't good, I won't be back. The inside of restaurant doesn't look clean. It looks like it is run like a small family business and they aren't keeping up with modern burger places.

They took a $300 engine over of ours and never put it back on and then claims they stuck it in the trunk!! THATS A LIE because our trunk key chain is broken and WILL NOT OPEN without the physical key that you take out of the keychain. Since I had important electronics in my trunk I only gave them the chain part which all you need to press the start button to crank the engine up. I help onto the key part so they CANT OPEN THE TRUNK! What a bunch of thief's and liars they are! Wow

If you are planing to order online and you want delivery, please DONT!!! First you have to pay for delivery and that is not including tip to a driver! I don't know if they going by percentage of the bill but mine was $3 for delivery! I ordered pasta and side of salad. I got my food and soon as I opened it I called back just to let them know I will be coming for my refund! The (baby) bowl was more than HALF EMPTY!!!!! If they can't give you full bowl for $8 then I'm not eating there anymore and plus that delivery fee????!!!! No thank you!!!!
We went yesterday, and both me and my husband spent all night food with poisoning. The sushi didn't taste great either. Very disappointed, do not go here
Drinks are fine, and the employees are nice, but the outside area is consistently dirty--trash surrounding the sitting areas. Kinda gross unfortunately.

Just stopped by at 6:35pm to get a sandwich. As I approached the counter, the young female worker was spraying cleaner to the inside of the glass counter.... over all the food !!!!  Hope this cleaner was edible.
YUCK...................................

My wife and I have been wanting to try out Slaughter House ever since moving to the area but for one reason or the other, it just never worked out. Finally, this last Halloween, we were able to make it work. 

Slaughter House is held at Greater Nevada Field, which is where the Reno Ace's play. They offer the usual Haunted House experience and a Haunted Train attraction (more on that later). Considering if you purchased both attractions together (and getting access to the faster line) it would be cheaper, we decided to go that route. Afterwards, we wish we just went with the Haunted House. 

We waited in line for around 30 minutes before getting into the House and all in all, it was alright. Sure, it had moments that made me jump and even freaked me out a bit, but all told it just wasn't that great. There's one portion of the House where you're forced to walk through a ball pit that features a "scary" Clown to add to the discomfort. Normally, there would be nothing wrong with that. But, what is wrong with it is my wife has a very bad ankle and it could be rolled very easily. There was no warning at all about having to walk through a ball pit where rolling your ankle wouldn't be too difficult. So considering I was highly annoyed by this and focused on making sure my Wife didn't get hurt, it took any and all "scare" out of this portion. To his credit, the actor playing the Clown picked up on this and backed off. That was cool of him. 

As soon as it started, it ended. I felt like there was no grand finale or anything like that, you just suddenly left the maze and that was that. Pretty flat if you ask me. Oh, and the first thing they do upon entering the Haunted House is take your picture along side a creepy actor. It's your usual tourist trap type thing with them pitching you to purchase said picture at the end. Full transparency though, I bought it. Lol. It actually turned out to be a good photo of me and there aren't very many of those. Lol. 

Now here's the portion of the review where things really take a turn for the worst. The Haunted Train. It was probably the saddest thing I've ever experienced. The train carts are stupid small and cramped (it became apparent to me at this point that kids were the primary target audience for this), they played music by the band "Disturbed" (probably its only redeeming quality), and they attempted to scare you while you passed by Coke a Cola and Hot Dog vendor carts. Super scary. They didn't even TRY to cover these. I was able to spot the scare actors coming a mile away. It just flat out sucked, ok? The little kids on the ride weren't even scared. They either need to completely revamp this or scrap it all together. Seriously bad. Don't bother wasting your hard earned money on this. 

So the reason for the 2 stars is the fact that the Haunted House (the main attraction) was just ok and had a flat ending, the Train ride sucked, and the fact that a female Security Guard (at the main line entrance) could be heard by all of us in line talking a whole mess of sh*t about customers. Now,  I used to work in Customer Service and I hated every minute of it, so I completely understand how stupid and rude the general public can be. However, you NEVER talk about customers RIGHT IN FRONT OF THEM. That's just asinine even to me.  If you hate it, then do what I did. Go get a job where you don't have to deal with them. Problem solved. Also, all told, we spent north of $50 for the attractions and I'm sorry but for what you get, that's too much. It just wasn't worth the cost. 

So all told, there's a good chance that this was our first and final visit unless they make some big changes. We're more than likely going to opt to do something in Virginia City for Halloween this year. Then one upside to all this? Parking was free in the garage across the street. So there's that.
Aweful service! Just my boyfriend and I and the service was Aweful plus the food was cold. We will never go back!

The service was great, there were only 2 other tables seated.  The spring rolls were good, but no peanut sauce.  And they were chicken, we ordered shrimp.  We also got the pad Thai, shrimp for me, chicken for my husband.  Really not good.  Flavorless, flat and gooey. It didn't taste anything like pad Thai.  And we were jamming to some excellent rap.  We will not be back.

This location is beyond disgusting. Ketchup and mustard containers both so sticky I was afraid to touch them. Old dried mustard all over the container, slime oozing out of the ketchup bottle. Thought we'd just switch them with another table, but they were all like that. Tables and floors were sticky. My husband and two kids ordered chili Mac. They were served in take out containers "because we don't got a dish washer right now." What?! Ok, Whatever. But, the take out containers were only about 1/3 full. Ridiculous. We asked if that was the normal serving size, and the waiter said, "I don't know, if you want I guess I can go wash a plate for you." Again, What?!? I went up to the counter and asked to speak to the manager. The only answer I got was, "She's in back somewhere." We left to go get dinner somewhere else. Seriously, we should have walked out as soon as we saw the ketchup slime. This location needs to be shut down. Do better, Steak n Shake.

This is by far the worst place I've gone to dine in to get some pho. First of all, it took  almost 20 minutes for my fiance and I to order glasses of water, which still somehow came back wrong since I simply didn't want any ice. Next it took an additional hour just for us to get too bowls of salty pho which, yet again, came out wrong as well. Server was unattentive and barely even deserved a tip. Tipped anyway out of empathy as we both worked in the service industry once upon a time. Pho Michael is waaayyyyyyy better

And become I can't see a way to get this less than one star. After waiting 30 minutes, I got a refund and left. This is by far the slowest service ever. You shouldn't have to wait 30 minutes to get a simple hamburger.

Literally the WORST car wash ever.  Paid $12 for an "ultimate wash" and my car is actually dirtier than before.  Totally bizarre.  Vacuums are awful, barely suck anything.  Staff is polite, but the owners seriously need to update this place: everything is junk.  
I've never had my car detailed here, but I've used the car wash/vacuums plenty of times, and ALWAYS have an issue.  Looks like I'll take the extra hike over to Mount Washmore. The awnings above the vacuums were a nice update, but your Wash Wizard 2.0 is junk.  I'm also pretty sure it damaged my car, I just can't prove it....

I want to like the place so badly because the food is delicious BUT the service is HORRIFIC! Every time we've ordered from here they are either extremely late (tell us it's ready for pick up/delivery in 45 minutes....takes 2 hours) or the food is incorrect (asked for no spice for a dish for my 4 year old and it's extremely spiced). And to make things worse, they never do anything except say they are "really sorry." Time to start the search for a new Indian restaurant.

I've been to the Brunswick zone many times and have had great experiences. Unfortunately, it is under new management and is now called Bowlero. We went in on a Tuesday to bowl around 8pm and they have leagues going on with no open lanes. Understandable I guess. We went to the arcade where so many machines were out of service and none of the games gave you tickets if you won. Kind of defeats the purpose huh? They had laser tag, but no one manning that post either. Wouldn't go again.

Be very careful here. My friend and I checked our coats here in March. After returning to coat check by the end of the night, we found out that our coats were given away to other patrons. Edgar, the manager, reassured us that we would be fully reimbursed for our coats, so we left into the freezing cold with at least some hope that the situation would be rectified.

Well, we were wrong. After several emails and calls to Edgar, I finally got in touch with the main office, where I was assured that I would receive a call within the next few days. It's now been over a week and still no call back. It's absolutely ridiculous that we paid NOTO to lose our coats. Beware.

Barista was super nice. That's all i got from the good fairy. Coffees are meh.. the music truly sucks. The wireless access is worse than the music.  Wanted to stick a pith in my head. Not comin' back. Ugh.

Great friendly, efficient service when we parked our car and were dropped off at the airport.  Unfortunately we were not dropped off at the international terminal and had to walk.  Upon return we had a dead battery.  The driver offered to jump us and crossed the cables setting off sparks and shorting out our electrical system making the car unable to be jumped.  The employee was not honest with his employer who in turn offered no assistance.  Our family was stranded at the lot, an hour away from home, at 9pm at night.  We incurred travel and repair expenses that were caused by their driver.

PF Chang's get your act together. We use to love you but not anymore .  Much better food at Pei Wei .  We ate here last week and it was one big disappointment .  The hot and sour soup was  just broth and eggs. I swear it was egg drop soup but with a semi darker broth . It was very bland . My husband ordered pork fried rice . It had just a few pieces of deep fried pork in it . The rice was very old and dried out , almost crunchy . There was no egg in the dish and very few bean sprouts . It was tasteless . I ordered the shrimp pad Thai . It came covered in raw 4 inch long green onions, but only the green part . I'm talking approx 25 pieces of raw long green onions . At first I thought it was a joke or something .They were impossible to cut with the knife given and overwhelmed the dish when eaten whole . .  The shrimp were small and many were just tiny half pieces . The dish also came topped with a bunch of cold, uncooked tofu . Plain tofu has no taste and needs to be cooked with the dish to absorb some of the sauce .  The menu said it was a New and improved recipe ???We ordered dinner at 8:45 but fell as if we got the bottom of the barrel from the kitchen that was suppose to be opened till 10 .  From now on we are going to Pei Wei for about half the cost .  So disappointed in a place we use to enjoy .

Worst mani/ pedi. I asked for full set French tip multiple times and the girl did a manicure on my nails to do paint my nails. Then had to wait for another lady to do my real manicure and she put the wrong tips on and had to start over. So much glue under the nail it's uncomfortable. Also did not get full manicure. The pedicure was awful still have rough heals and dead skin. Two hours of my day wasted!

Originally this was average food. We didn't return for awhile and when we returned the food was really below par. We had tacos and chili rellanos. The food was poorly prepared and I was really disappointed. The only good thing was the service was good and the prices were low. Finally we tried it out one last time and the food was still not good. The bathroom was horrible and one of the servers stayed in the handicap bathroom texting while me and two ladies (one elderly) waited. The bathroom reeked and there was no hand towels. Needless to say the server did not wash her hands. I will not be returning.

Just had $800.00 in new tires put on yesterday. Called the and told them my tire pressure light was on they said it would go out in 15 min. Woke up this morning with it flat !!! Not happpy to be in here on Saturday when I took off early from work yesterday to get this done !!

The food is decent, we have ordered from here multiple times, both dine in and take out. EVERY SINGLE TIME we have dined in (now up to 3 times) I have found hair in the food. The staff is disrespectful and completely unprofessional. 2 of the 3 times we have had to get up and order because the waitress was too busy FaceTiming her friend to bother with us. 1 time we had amazing service and that was when the entire 10 mile radius of Norristown went out of power and Mister Ps was the only place open. I met the owner on one occasion and he was very friendly and asked if we needed anything. The staff represents the business, if you are not greeted upon entry thats already a bad sign... not to mention the customer having to do everything to get their order placed. I have done my fair share in restaurants and I'm surprised this place has so many reviews of "friendly staff"... maybe it's just my timing since every time I go it's the same two young females working. Note to the owner- if your staff gets off of their phone while "taking care of a customer" they will be able to hear the proper order and not charge for incorrect items having my entire credit purchase voided and recharged. 


The food is pretty darn good, the meat in the cheesesteaks are a great amount (could be cooked a little longer, the meat was pretty light) and the pasta was tasty the one time I had it. I just really wish the staff gave a crap, It's nice to go out to eat and be served but not when you have to serve yourself and get tude in the meantime.  rant over.

DO NOT STAY HERE! The hotel operations manager came into my room while I was in the bathroom without announcing himself.  I should note that the "do not disturb" sign was on my door.  I came out of the bathroom and found him in my wallet!! He said he was verifying who was in the room. I checked in, gave my name, spoke to the front desk 5 minutes beforehand. So they KNEW who was in the room.  It was also obvious that someone was in the room as my purse was on the table.  He was way too comfortable going in my wallet leading me to believe this wasn't the first time he's done something like this.  I filed a police report and he told the police he was within his rights to go through guests belongings since they are renting a space from him.  I have never heard of this.  Total violation of my safety and security. 

The hotel itself is dated and not indicative of a Marriott property.

Ordered off of caviar. Starving, I bit into my pizza. Ahhh, the coveted olive pit somehow had made its way onto my pizza. Somehow, my tooth did not break (yet). It may be cracked. 

Great job Sputino!  I still have the pit.

I would never usually get a mall cheesesteak, but I made the mistake of believing that one from Tony Luke's HAD to be good. I was wrong.
There are not enough descriptive words in the English language to say how BAD my chicken cheesesteak was. Just getting in from Springfield Mall and felt compelled to write this review because my food was so terrible.

Number one.... I don't even know why Tony Luke would put his name on this location. It is NOT EVEN CLOSE to his original location.  My sandwich wasn't even as good as one made from Steak-Umm. The chicken was hard, old and tasted like it had freezer burn.  The mayonnaise tasted like it had been left sitting out. There were not enough onions. The best thing about the sandwich was the bread, so that's what I ate.

This place is a joke. Don't ever try calling them..they won't answer. Believe me, I've called many times to try to make reservations.
I finally was able to make reservations online and while we're on our way there, I notice I received an
Email at 4:40pm for a 6pm bike tour that my ride was cancelled with no reason given. Called them and emailed them again...of course no answer. Maybe I'm just unlucky but don't make this the highlight of your day because they can cancel on you on a whim with no explanation why and will never answer their phone.

I have attempted several times to order a pizza on special times during the day...and there has been no pickup on the phone...I then went there one day to order it in person and the doors were wide open..yet when I got to the counter I was told they were shut down for a private party..yet no signage...the time before that .I tried to call to,order a pickup pizza ..no answer ..when I got there I was past the special,pizza ordering time...all workers were not friendly either and some rude

***f**king gross***beware***
how the fuck can you serve somthing that look like that? this place will get people sick or even worst, death!. this is what i get for having my food to go. if i feel sick in any ways i'm going to the emergency room and trust me all my medical expenses will be paid from the person who serve that f**king gross shit to me. sending this picture to the health department and calling the health department on this dirty filthy establishment. ***beware*** this place only care about your money and serving you rotten old food. janky establishment who doesn't care about quality and service to the people who pays good money, only to give them the grossest, nastiest, rotten, food that this mexican restaurant has to offer in reno!

The best selection of whiskey in the central west end.
Their old fashion is my favorite! 

I gave it a 2 star because the food was not to the same level as the drinks and the bartender/manger seemed like a tool. He was hitting my my obviously married sister and made her feel uncomfortable...

I usually go here for a protein shake after the gym because it's close to my gym, the protein shakes are good depending on what employee makes them.
