I've sat and ate there a few times and the food is just ok, nothing special, but I do like the fact that it's low calories. I will not be spending anymore of my money at this place because the service isn't good AT ALL, I was in there yesterday and the woman at the front made the wrong drink for me, and the manager comes out and gives me a attitude because her employee made the wrong drink, and doesn't even apologize. The manager then makes my drink and doesn't even hand me a straw but hands the guy behind me one. There definitely alternatives to this place in Philly, that I can go to.

Worst moving company ever. Don't book with them if you're doing a long distance move. They're so unprofessional. I repeat don't book with them. They become unresponsive and they broke a few of my items. They gave no discount even they I received my items a month after they told I would. 

The owner is a complete jack "butt". Yes I said it! You are! He's rude, he's argued with me over the phone. He's upset because of what I posted and he has to just deal with it. 

You should close your doors because you're not a real moving company. You contract with other drivers who can give two craps about your stuff.

Book with them at your own risk but I beg you not to. If you have problems I recommend filing a complaint with the better business bureau. Matter of fact, you should read the BBB reviews before you book and I'm pretty sure people have posted some fake behind reviews. You guys suck...

Expected basic based on rates and pet policy. Was surprised none the less. The good news is the spiders seem to have eaten all the bed bugs. Front desk staff was polite, though both of our reservations were messed up. One causing a 20 minute delay for a tired traveler.

Despite the lovely setting and ambiance, the food does not meet expectations. Parts of the dishes were cold, plates were not clean with crusted food on the edges, and the wait for the food quite long (about 30-40 minutes) even though the restaurant was sparsely filled. Food was mediocre, chose not to finish it. Live locally and will not be back.

I honestly don't understand what people like about this place. I've tried it three separate times now. Ordered something different each time. Each time the food literally made me gag. It must just be my taste buds, because I see positive reviews, and there were other people in there seemingly enjoying their food, but I feel like I would've enjoyed a burger off the McDonalds dollar menu more than I enjoyed my $11+tip burger at Red Robin.
Not worth the price at all !! Sooo small  it was hard to play around because there were so much people. And we had to pay extra for the foam pit ......  go to launch pad and stay away from here

We went to a Cheeseburger Cheeseburger for my son's birthday... his choice. Service was horrible. Sat there for 10 minutes before they came to take a drink order. They messed up our order. Did not came around once to check on us... we had to keep chasing them and it was not even busy. They just did not seem to even want to be there.

Wow. I wish I could give this place zero stars. The band tonight started verbally berating customers for no reason.  They completely stopped their set to say extremely inappropriate things over the mic. Almost every bar is great on broadway, but I felt so strongly compelled to write a review on the horrible experience and the a** hole band. Sorry for the bad photo of the lead singer, but I felt the establishment should know who created the 'hostile' environment and frankly I didn't even want to get close enough to take a good picture.

Terrible service and terrible sushi. The girl forgot our drinks, didn't apologize and made many excuses for how long everything took instead of just apologizing. The ramen wasn't bad but it's not worth the pain of this place.
They suck really hardNot being harsh or anything but I'm vegan I don't like it wait what

Very bland flavors on all three dishes we ordered (long tail, Bangkok, and pad Thai). There is no way anyone who enjoys Thai food will return to eat these noodles. Extremely disappointing lack of taste. Ingredients are very fresh and the noodles soups are piping hot. Service is efficient and excellent.

I ordered the Fish n Chips to go on Oct. 11th 2018 around 12 noon.  When I got home to eat my lunch I was excited, but my first bite into the French fries made me gag, all I could taste was rancid oil.  The fish took on this flavor more. I guess Metro Diner is trying to save money by not changing the fryer oil. This is a sign of a bad restaurant.  I had to throw my lunch away because it was not edible. I did not take my copy of the receipt nor did I inform them.  I really don't think it would matter, this place is all about volume.  I will not be returning or do I recommend this place.

Previously, I had enjoyed this establishment. Unfortunately, today was just an awful experience. 

While sitting at the bar, a manager came in and caused the bartender to turn her back to all her customers for a good 10 minutes. When she came back, finally, to take my order, I told her I thought that was annoying. 

I was then asked to leave Thunder Canyon Brewstillery, because I had the audacity to expect hospitality from the hospitality industry.

This place needs to be "me too," out of existence. The way managers treat female customers is disgusting.

Food isn't terrible but it's not great either. Servers are nice but inattentive so make sure you ask for refills, only one refill the entire hour. Don't get the tater tots, the tased like they were made in a microwave. If you get chicken take the skin off first, the chicken tastes fine though. This place has potential if they can execute food properly. Turn your music down about 50% so customers can hear what you say when you walk in, live music is great when your ears are t bleeding.

I've never ordered from Marcos but I was driving by and didn't want to cook so i stopped in. Young girl (Jessica I think) didn't come to greet me bush said she'll be there in a minute. No one else talked to me until a driver came in and asked if I had been helped and he told her he would box the pizzas so she could ring me up. I asked her about specials and she was clueless. I asked her about the online special and she said I could order it online. Well I was standing in the store so why couldn't she do it for me? She just walked off. Awesome. So I ordered from a different pizza place while I was in this store and went to get my dinner that was amazing. So no thanks won't even try here again.

Okay where to begin. 
The building looks beautiful in pictures but up close it is in need of some cleaning. The entry way and the common rooms are gorgeous. The continental breakfast was only available on 2 of the 4 days. There were 1 to 2 people on the premises to help with things you need but help isn't always given. However, room service is kept up. 
The room itself gets 3 stars. It has a full kitchen. A shower with toilet, sink outside the door, a flat screen tv, couch, center table, plenty of storage space, a queen size bed, two night stands.
Staying in the room gets 2 stars. The rooms balcony was locked and we were told it would be fixed it never was. The hot water lasted at the most 5 minutes total.... not enough for 2 people.  We told the caretaker he said it would be fixed...it wasn't. To make matters worse there were no curtains in our room.  The sun came pouring in.....so there was c no way I'd sleeping in. And even if we'd of wanted to sleep in the bed support was broken making the bed sag in the middle.  How difficult can it possibly be to replace a bed?
If you are handicapped there is no way to get into the building.  There is only steet parking.

I came to this location on (05/10/18).  I have been to this location three times now, and every single time I have walked away unhappy and with no bagel.  I will say that the employees are always friendly.  

When I go to a bagel shop I love to get my lox bagels and each time I have been to this location they are always out of the lox, I normally get there early morning no later then 12pm.  

Today I decided to give them one last try and I was told they do not have any lox. At this point I'm thinking this is crazy. The lady told me that during the summer they don't carry it.  If you are going to advertise lox bagels all over your store then I would expect you to carry lox on hand.   I will not return to this location.   I would call before hand if they have anything in stock.

I was looking for a propane tank and called Lowe's when a local Ace Hardware didn't have the right size. The first customer service agent was great! Welcoming and friendly. She transferred me to another department and the worker who picked up the phone was having a conversation for about 10 minutes with another worker. She briefly asked about propane to the third worker and then started using what sounded like a forklift. I was on the phone, listening to her work for 15 minutes while I drove to a Home Depot, was helped by a worker, and purchased my propane tank. At about 18 minutes I just hung up the phone with Lowe's.
This place is simply not what it used to be and I'd be writing for days the many complaints I have.

We ordered:
Summer Rolls
Soft Shell Crab Appetizer
Seafood Pad Thai
Crispy Squid & Vegetables
Side of Fried Rice

The summer rolls had barely any shrimp, the soft shell crab never came, the seafood in the pad Thai was over cooked, the squid wasn't crispy, and the fried rice was bland. 

The service was so bad. We never got refills for our waters. We don't recommend you try this place.

1/2 stars on food quality. Chicken wings on many visits have had coagulated blood around the bone. This means the chicken was not properly processed at the slaughtering house.  star on service. They never have enough servers during the lunch hour. And then the few they do have, s©k!  star on the bang for your $. Buffalo Wild Wings I'm on my way...

The manager, named John (not even sure if he gave me his correct name), on Friday is very rude and is a bully to his customers. He was unwilling to explain how a coupon worked since I've been there before and had no problem with the same deal. He was unwilling to show me the breakdown of my bill (said he couldn't turn the screen of his monitor to face me). He instead tried to intimidate me and threatened to call the cops if I didn't pay. I didn't refuse to pay. He picked up his cellphone and dialed a number. The money was in my hand; all I was asking was to have it explained to me. He refused to do this. John was rude and arrogant and should not be allowed to treat customers this way. He is very unprofessional.

We sat at a table and ordered drinks. I wanted to order food and she never brought a food menu. I waited and waited while I couldn't find her and went to the bathroom, I asked my friend to ask for a food menu while I was gone and the last call was 1 min ago for food... WHICH NO ONE TOLD US. I will NEVER come here again. So disrespectful, they ONLY serve white men (as pictured)

John McMahon of this company Knocked on my door and made all kinds of promises; I set up service...found ants 2 months later; Every time I call I wait on hold for extensive periods for a service person to schedule a time to come here and today when I called they told me I'd have to wait over a week.  They explained that they have one 2 hour window in a 3 week period on a Friday from 5pm to 7 pm where someone could come out. I had to call back 3 times and threaten to cancel before a reasonable person gave me an alternative time. No one answers the phone at the local office; it goes to a call center and The people that answer the phone follow a script and repeat the script over and over again. They are annoying and make you wait forever.   What a waste of a time. And, they make it VERY difficult to cancel as they tell you their account specialists are too busy to take your call and they will call you back...and of course, no one calls back.  I reported them to Amex and next the Better Business Bureau.  Total scam.

I have taken the trian from several locations before, but Gateway STL was the worst.  The inside of the station smelled and was dirty.  The employee outside by the customer pickup/drop off was by far one of the rudest people I have met.  The whistle power has clearly gone to her head.  She blew her whistle in peoples faces, approached people aggressively, and was extremely rude.  How else are passengers supposed to load/unload from the line than for the car to stop?  Each time a car stopped to allow passengers to enter/exit the vehicle, she came charging towards them blowing her whistle.  Finally on my pickup, I told her she could continue to blow her whistle all she wants, but that wasn't stopping me.  There needs to be a better system for this.  Very disappointed and would rather pay the extra $ to travel out of the Kirkwood station where this has never been an issue.

We were running a late errand, and having not eaten much all day, with little time for dinner, we decided to check out the newly renovated Burger King. I figured everything would be good as the place had just been built brand new from the ground up. 
Well, being up half the night in the bathroom made me realize my mistake. Won't be returning. 
I understand it's fast food, but it shouldn't have made me so sick.

I had high expectations for Cafe Patachou based on their high reviews. I don't know if they were having an off day or what - but I was not impressed at all. I came in an hour before closing for brunch with my sister. Opened the menu and the first thing I notice is the big block in the menu saying not to complain to followers about bad experience in the restaurant. I thought that was weird. The interior is beautiful I'll give them that; it's definitely a good atmosphere to brunch in and trendy towards what is popular nowadays. 

The waitress was nice but I got a little confused when she told us the coffee was self serve before we ordered. I thought she meant coffee was included or something since we did not order coffee. Thankfully I asked and she clarified it wasn't included.

I ordered a hot chocolate (steep at $4.50 but hey, treat yo' self!) and the croissant french toast. My hot chocolate came slightly overflowing which was messy but not something I would complain about... it seems a waste to have them make me another one just because it overflowed. Taste was below average, it tasted like the instant hot chocolate packs you can buy from the grocery store. I expected more for the price point. My croissant french toast tasted good I'll give them that, but the appearance was off putting as it came out as a flat hunk of dark colored something. When I looked at pictures afterwards I found that the amount of nuts on my entree was really small compared to other people's. Disappointing.

Overall, even though my french toast tasted fine I wouldn't recommend this place for brunch just because of the price point. Restaurants come down to taste and if I'm shelling out the big bucks for basic items they need to be out of this world. Some places can do it, sadly Cafe Patachou didn't do it for me. If their food taste and quality improved it would be worth it but sadly it didn't pay off taste wise for me. You could get similar at other places for much less money. 

Oh - I don't mind cleaning, I used to work in food service after all and I know how it is, but they set up the coffee right next to our table while they cleaned which was not the best atmosphere as people were coming and going next to our table. The restaurant was mostly empty so it seemed an odd spot to put it. The smell of the floor cleaner was kind of strong for me which also made our visit less pleasant. I had such high expectations for this place and I was really sad that it turned out the way it did.

Crusty dusty pizza! Corn meal toast crust NOTHING WHAT IT SHOULD BE. Thin crust mediocre. I should have known the place didn't know what they were doing when my server was confused by my  attempt to order a margarita pizza. WHY IS THIS PLACE BUSY?

The food is good and consistent at all locations but the two stars is mainly due to the ridiculous wait time on a pick up order. Called in a small order of bread sticks at 610 they said it would be ready in ten minutes. It's currently 641 and they're still not ready. Would just prefer a realistic estimate on pick up time especially given how hard it is to find parking around this location.

I will never go back to this place again... ordered two tacos with rice and beans and an empanada.. $14.00 after, I get my plate and what a disappointment... I thought it was Mexican food... NOT... more like Taco Bell .. food was cold and flavorless and nobody came to ask if everything was ok... 
I should've listened to my instincts when I asked the guy taking my order about certain kind of meat and he said "I don't know, I've never had any of this food"... I should've walked at that moment ..
Overpriced , poor quality food and bad service... this is how I rate this place.

The food is "pretty good." The "cheese steak" part is good but the bread could be better. 

However, during my visit, I witnessed [what seemed to be a manager or owner] be extremely rude to both a customer and his staff. Ruined our meals.

Really well done interior space.  Great for groups and just hanging out.  However, the food is just not that good.  Menu sounds great but the meal was very disappointing.  Prices are too high for the food and beer is just so so.  I won't be back.  Too bad.  It has so much potential.

We were there for my girlfriend's sister's graduation dinner.

We were VERY disappointed with the whole evening.  There were 2 other families there and they only had one server and one cook working, so everything took FOREVER.  It took us more than an hour to get our sushi rolls because the cook was busy with another table. Then the miso soup was piss poor, and when they brought out the salads, which was only enough for about 4 bites.

We had someone with a shell fish allergy and it was made clear on more than one occasion. So they cooked her chicken before he put the shrimp and scallops on the grill. He still tried to put shrimp on her plate after she told him 3 times NO!!! She had to yell at him for him to finally realize why she was yelling NO! He kept having to look at his order sheet and didn't look like he knew what he was doing.

It took us 3 hours to finally get our entrees cooked and we were disappointed in the food because it was bland!! The sushi tasted like it was frozen because it was decently chewy, I am a huge sushi fan and this fell flat on it's face.

I can tell you that we will NEVER be coming back and I will make sure that I never recommend this place to anyone unless they want to spend all night waiting for their frozen sushi. I would have walked out half way through but because we were with guests, we stayed to keep them company. I was so irritated by everything tonight. This is THE WORST place that I ever eaten at, and I am in the restaurant business so I like to eat at different places.

We got there at 8:30 and left around 11:15 and didn't even eat dessert and didn't even think about it because everything took so long and the food quality was very poor.

I fell in love with Korean BBQ when I went to Korea, so I was super excited when I saw that Sa-Ri-One opened in Brandon so close to home.  I invited 10 of my friends to join me for my birthday.

My friend called in and made a reservation for 10 at the cooktop table for Saturday at 6pm.  When the first of us arrived, they said they had no reservation.  My friend showed them her phone where she had spoken to someone for several minutes at the restaurant and they apologized for not having the reservation and seated the couple that were there.  When four of my party had arrived, the young waiter came and asked if we knew how many would be eating All you can eat.  They told us we would have to arrange our seating so that those who did not order all you can eat not sit with those who do.  Once everyone was there, we polled our group and all of us except for one was getting all you can eat.  One person only wanted a drink and dessert as she had a late lunch.  After a little arguing they allowed her to stay in her seat (did it really matter where she sat if she was the ONLY one not ordering BBQ?).  

As the food started to arrive, we were all very excited.  The waiter had a hard time figuring out where to place all of the side dishes.  Most of them tasted pretty good, in my opinion.  The meats arrived and they seemed fresh and we started to cook. (We were given no direction on times on the cooktop and it is very dark in the restaurant, so it is difficult to determine when meat is done cooking, just fyi).  We got one serving of meats and our server came back one time and asked what we'd like refilled and then never returned.  One friend ordered a drink and that took 40 minutes to arrive.  Our Rice came about 40 minutes after meat.  Another ordered an ice cream and that never arrived.  At 7:30 we had to call and cancel our other plans, yet we still had not been re-visited.  No water or soda refills, nothing.  


Another large group was sat just behind us and the same waiter was attentively working on their table.  
 
Just before 8:00, the waiter came by and told us that one of us would need to pay for the whole bill and have our friends pay us back, which of course we refused because none of us wanted to pay $300 for our $30 meal.  He said this was because it would take "15 minutes" to split the checks.  All of us had the same all you can eat BBQ with a soda added and one person got a side dish and another ordered an alcoholic drink.  Plus the one who got a drink and a fried ice cream.    When we refused we started a counter to see what time it would be when we finally left.  We were all done eating at this point (as we didn't get the refills or desserts we wanted) and getting frustrated with the lack of service.  
Just after 8, we were given our checks. Every one that had another order was wrong in some way.  Those of us who had only ordered the AYCE gave our payment in cash and cards.  Some were very clear that they needed change ($40 for a 30.00 charge which already had a 20% tip included, etc.).  The fixed checks returned at 8:30 and payment was taken.

At 8:45, a member of our party went and spoke to a person, who explained that he would get the manager to come to our table.  Just after that, we were brought back our tickets to sign and no change.  Those who needed change expressed that and we continued to wait.  At 9:00 we got up and started walking out, those who needed change stood at the cash register to get the change.  This was 3 hours after we had arrived and a full hour after the last person ate any food.  Once we got all the checks properly settled (despite the fact that our tip should not have been 20% as we did not get "all you can eat" NOR did we get the extra things we ordered or refills on water, etc), we left.  The one member of our party stayed behind and asked one gentleman why the manager never came by our table and he said that he kept trying to get him to come, but he refused.  That was a huge mistake as customer service is so incredibly important in gaining and keeping regulars.  


I am extremely disappointed in this experience.  It was very unorganized from the get-go and not ready for the size of the restaurant.  They are staffed as if they have two tables (on a Saturday night!) and unprepared for the level of support they need for Korean BBQ.  
The food itself was decent, but the experience took away from the food.  


If this location of Sa-Ri-One makes it, I might give it another chance, just because I love Korean BBQ, but I do not have high hopes.

Stopped by today and out of all the Pilots I've visited this by far has the most rude staff. Especially the manager, some bald guy. I tried getting a lottery ticket from the machine and the bill got jammed, I asked the cashier that was free for assistance (some girl with short hair) and she blankly stared at me and said she didn't know what to do. I waited for her to assist a costumer and then asked again what I should do. She said she didn't know and turned to the other girl with silver hair who in return just shrugged her shoulders. After a few minutes the manager was finally called. Mind you, the store only had about two customers looking around. He comes looking rather bothered and asks me where I inserted the money. WHERE DOES HE SUPPOSE I WOULD INSERT THE MONEY? Of course in the money slot! I asked him for the money I had inserted but was straight up ignored and after watching him basically fight the machine, he slammed the door closed and walked away. I've encountered rude staff but the whole place here seems miserable in every aspect. Everything is unkept. Oh well, what can one do.

Awful! I re-visited this restaurant after several months. It was afternoon, after-lunch hours. The staff had changed since the last time I was here. I did not see Lauren, who used be great. When you ask for a topping, they only put a little bit on, so you have to keep saying please add some more. Then, once your pizza is ready to go in the oven, it just sits outside the oven for 10 minutes, until they have more pizzas ready to go in the oven, for customers behind you in line. So, it is NOT quick service! Why can't you put my pizza into the oven, then work on the next customer? The pizza does not cook evenly in their 700 degree oven. The crust burns quickly from the bottom, the heat never gets inside the toppings. So, you have a burnt crust, but the toppings are barely baked, sometimes they get watery, if you have tomatoes.
I like the selection of toppings, and being able to choose any toppings at one flat rate by size, but the pizza simply does not bake well, the crust does not taste like a regular pizza. So, great concept, poorly executed.
Absolutely horrible went there for a shake waited in line for 45 mins to just leave bc it was an absolutely horrible wait. I will never go back there just ridiculous!

I don't know how this location has such a high rating. We had a major incident a few months ago and came back after the general manager contacted us. We've been back for breakfast with minimal issues but today for dinner the same manager we initially had issues with today was again worthless. My husband ordered a Coke Zero and the syrup ran out. He walked inside to let the manager know so it could be rectified. The manager said literally nothing and handed him a new cup and then walked off. We ordered their new chicken strips which are made to order. No big deal we'll wait for them, but 15 minutes? They then served cold fries with fresh chicken strips. My husband then goes back inside and asks for fresh fries. They gave then to him but the manager was MIA. I've given this place sufficient chances but they still lack every time.

I went to David's Bridal (Cottman) to find a wedding gown. A Zac Posen design to be exact. They didn't have anything but Vera Wang and David Bridal gowns in the store. 

I asked if she could find any mermaid styles for me? She said no and that they didn't really have anything in the store with that style.

The fact that the lady told me she couldn't find similar styles for me! I was shocked thinking what exactly is your job? 

I decided well since I'm here I might as well try something on.

I ended up trying on Vera straight off the mannequin. 

I said is this the only one in the store? She said yes.

The rooms were so tiny and she had to be in there with me. The dress alone took up half the space.

She asked if I've been anywhere else and I told her about my Kleinfeld experience the week before.

She became so excited and brought the other girls over and had me show them all my pictures and videos. Asked what drinks did they serve? The prices of the dresses? 

THEN said oh you're not going to find anything with that beading here.

What happened to team DB!? Throw your whole job away!

I called the Springfield store and asked if they had the dresses I was looking for- whoever answered the phone said yes. 

I drove 30mins...get there all for them to tell me they don't carry it in their store.

The lady at the greeting station made a phone call and said that The ONLY DB in the region that carries everything is the Plymouth Meeting store. She was very nice and helpful!

I understand that the Plymouth Meeting store is the closest to the DB Headquarters, but not everyone can make that trip. More selections should be in each one of your stores - or at least the most popular locations.

It's safe to say I won't be going back there to look at gowns for myself! The only reason I went to DB was because I was torn between two choices at Kleinfeld and wanted to explore other options. Thanks DB for making my decision. Back to Kleinfeld I go! 

We did however find a dress for my flower girls, so it wasn't a total waste....I guess.

This is literally the worse place I have even been. The service was so shit. The server just threw the menu on the table and was very rude. The food was also very bad. Never going back to this place again.

I want to love you...but.  I had the halibut special, which was really halibut nuggets with some nuts thrown on top.  Dry and tasteless.  My dinner-mate had the salmon, which was seriously overcooked.  The sides were good, the server was great.  We'll try again.

Cash only. Not posted on menu or front counter. Took forever to figure out how to get a menu and to get our check ( you gotta sit down and a waitress brings it to you) food not good and very expensive for what you get. I say skip this place. Waitress sweeping under your feet while you sit at table. Not worth it. Not a good vibe place. Skip it.

I guess I will be the unpopular opinion. I think this place is WAY overrated!! 

My sister and I came in for brunch an hour before their closing time, and they were already starting to clean and mop the dining room. There were probabably 4 other tables in there at the same time as us. Nothing like the smell of bleach as you have brunch! 30 minutes before closing they started to clean up the coffee bar area, and moved all the dispensers right next to our table. So people were still coming over to refill their coffee. It was nice and awkward to have people standing over you while you eat.

Menu was dull and didn't seem to have any personality to it. I ordered the BLT Patachou and added avocado. I wasn't expecting much because lets be honest.. its just a sandwich. But I was so disappointed! It was a small sandwich with maybe 4 peices of whole bacon on it, and the bacon had that chewy texture like it had been sitting under a heatlamp all morning. Sides were also just meh. I got fruit. 

My sister ordered some sort of french toast with pecans on it. It was literally the ugliest thing I have ever seen. It looked like a deformed  pancake. She said it tasted alright, but the portion was small. She also got a hot chocolate that came out overflowing and tasted like Swiss Miss. Not worth $4. 

The price point was way too high for the portions and selection. I paid $15 before tip for my meal, and left hungry. We tried it because all the hype and good reviews, but we left feeling underwhelmed.
Annoying customer service and they did something to my air blowing fan motor when checking the air filter in the dash. Filling it with crap. Now it's constantly making an obnoxious noise

We have come here for 8 plus years every year when we visit our family. We went today for my traditional heuve rancheros on Indian flat bread and when I ordered it the waitress asked me if I wanted it on flour tortilla or something else I didn't quite hear I said no I wanted it on the Indian flat bread please she said they no longer serve it on that but yet the Indian flat bread was on the menu as a side item. For some reason they wouldn't make it anymore even though all the items were there. the worst part is I really have looked forward to that meal every trip and for them to not want to accommodate the customers really was disappointing and we will not be return it because of it
This is my child's to go meal. I know the "vein" of the shrimp is actually...poo... aren't they supposed to remove this?

I was so excited to try this place but they use peanut oil and I am severely allergic. It's becoming more and more rare that places use peanut oil but unfortunately now I won't be able to try this place.

Not sure what I was just served, but Chinese food it was not.
After losing Szechuan Garden, I attempted to try another spot, my mistake. Closest Chines food is in Chicago. I hope I did not get diabetes from this meal as I am in sugar shock.

Ordered an outdoor tool shed online in May. It never arrived. Challenged the $438 charge but still had to pay for something I never received! Delivery truck driver said that he gave 30 minute delivery notice which is an outright lie. I wish I could give zero stars. I canceled my Home Depot credit card and have banned doing business with them for life.

So I am here to warn you about this company! 

DO NOT PURCHASE FROM THEM!!!
We purchased our sectional from them July 15th and it was delivered that same night. The crew brought it into the house unboxed the couch and put it together half way. Then hands me the clipboard and says sign for furniture. So I did and crew left. My husband and I put the furniture the rest of the way together and I noticed that the middle piece of the sectional was sagging in the back. So of course this place of business was closed to call anyone so we said we would call first thing in the morning on Monday. So I called and the gentleman I spoke to told me that there was nothing they were going to do because we shouldn't have signed for the furniture and asked if we purchased the warranty which we did and told us we needed to go through them to get the sectional replaced. I told the gentleman that I was floored that I would receive damaged furniture and have to make a warranty claim already. He said that how do they know that we didn't break the furniture over night I didn't even have the energy to fight with this gentleman. So my husband called the warranty company the next day and started a claim, the lady that was helping him said she was going to get into contact with the furniture store because if they delivered it damaged they needed to bring out a new piece. So after couple days of back and forth the furniture store said we were sol and warranty would have to cover it. Husband got back in contact with the lady that was helping him and she told him that they weren't going to replace it because the gentleman that she was dealing with at the furniture store admitted to her that the furniture was indeed BROKEN when it left the warehouse July 15th in the evening!!! So now we are stuck with a broken couch and no one to help replace or fix the couch.
I never really write reviews, but the turkey burger was like rubber and was ready in about 2 minutes from when I placed the order.

Hostess had a BAD attitude.... people behind us were getting seated before us.....  when the food came the guy talked back and even had a attitude.... food was good and our waitress was good and helpful

I bought a couch there one year ago.  It's garbage.  The fabric is ripping off the frame and the spring under the corner seat broke.  You can get a more durable couch for $300 bucks at IKEA.

I tried to file a claim since I bought the Goof Proof package and you can't get anyone on the line.  Their customer service post purchase is absolutely the worst.

Don't buy from this company, one of the worst I've ever run across!!!

Not for me. I asked for the shrimp boil. This is what I got. I only got one little sausage and 2 potatoes. The shrimp was over cooked/dirty. I felt gross eating it seeing all the gunk/shrimp poop, I just couldn't. We ordered the 424 oysters and those were a little better. The food was inconsistent, some of the oysters were hot and some cold... not worth the money. The service was good though
Waited over an hour for a pizza for them to tell me they tried to deliver it and no one was there. Bad service, manager was rude. If i could give zero stars, I would.

Ordered food from here twice. Been disappointed both times. The food doesn't taste authentic, the owner or I believe is the owner treat the employees as if they are nothing( from the time I've been there). If you want the food to have that Middle Eastern touch, at least train your cooks to perfected. The falafel tasted so bland, the wrap had an old taste,  as if it had been left outside for a very long time. Fries were too greasy for my liking. All in all it was a great disappointment. I tried to give them another opportunity to be disappointed again.

We had a huge dinner party there (our wedding rehearsal dinner) that brought in over $400 and the owner, Lisa was extremely rude to us. Our table was right in view of the sun so not only were we roasting, but the sun was in our eyes. We waited and waited for our server to come around to see if it could be closed and nobody came around so we closed the curtain temporarily to avoid the heat. Out of no where, lisa the owner came around the corner and started YELLING at us. After I told her what was going on she said she needed to keep it open so a table that was in our same section could have a view. This table set empty for an hour and if someone was seated, they would of had the same sunburn lol. I can't believe the owner of the restaurant would have this kind of behavior. She wasn't appreciative that we were having our rehearsal dinner there nor even throw us a congratulations! The food is....ok, nothing to bring us back, especially after how I was treated. Hopefully someone else buys them out. She should be ashamed of her rudeness, poor employees! 


Wow, not shocked by this owners rude response! Lisa, I said thank you sarcastically in hopes you'd stop and say, wow, no thank you for having your wedding rehearsal here. Sad the customer would even have to say thank you first, but not shocked. A GOOD owner would of came out and thanked a large group for choosing their restaurant or any size group for that matter, especially for their WEDDING rehearsal dinner. If you would of greeted us or even been more kind when approaching me in the beginning, we could of asked for you to close your curtain instead of relying on your customers to have to make their experience better for themselves. Maybe you should sit and eat in your restaurant once in a while and get the customers perspective. We were already trying to help your poor waitress to fix the tv that we were told would be able to be used to put up pictures for the wedding. Shocker, another thing besides your old raggedy curtain that needs replacing. How about putting some shades in as well so your customers don't get blinded or sunburned.  
A GOOD owner would of asked how the meal was at the end of the dinner and trust me in saying, we weren't complimenting your restaurant. We were disappointed in lots of things including the food. We could of expressed our concerns, but nope, you never came around. 
Lisa, you need to avoid being out in the front honey, please stay in the kitchen or office. I'm going to guess your turnover is pretty high, you're a horrible owner! I am all about supporting small businesses but I will not support yours along with everyone I know in Tucson, especially with your response and how rude you were to me in person. You have a long ways to go and a lot to learn, I'm betting you won't take this advice based on your response. You should go visit Mr. An's on oracle. He knows how to treat customers and is a GREAT business owner.
Horrible service. Way overpriced.  Not worth your time. Go to Four Seasons on Prince. This place is not going to make it if they don't change fast.

I'm not sure what's happened to this place. There is constant turnover at this place. The good employees never stay. I'm parked outside right now at 8:43am...I walked inside and the place is a ghost town. I waited for 5 min at the bar to place an order and nobody came. I even checked to make sure nobody was in the bathroom before I left. Where are the employees?!?! There's way too much competition in town now for Swami to continue slacking. I doubt they will be open in a year, constant decline. It's sad!

Cute location, poor food.

I honestly feel like my shrimp tacos came out of a pre-cooked bag of shrimp. The tortillas clearly had not been warmed. It seems the company relies on sour cream to add flavor to their meals.

The restaurant was in the midst of renovation, so maybe this was the reason for the poor food? I'm not sure, but it would have been nice to know if they were working without a full kitchen. 

Only came to find out about their renovation after being sat.

This is some bullll. Went to get my order and got home missing a good amount of items. Unless some fatso raccoon got into my car as I drove home and stole my food, I think they forgot to give me my darn order. I paid for some good ass over processed, fake cheese sticks along with some other similarly unhealthy items and I damn well better get them. Once I realized that my feed was missing, I went back and got it. Once I got home, I found out AGAIN they forgot the damn coleslaw. This is the second time you've wronged me, TGI Friday's. You shall rue this day.

Real bad food. I'm not sure how they got high ratings. Also, the staff doesn't seem to understand food either. 
Came in from recommendation that this was a great Asian place and had dim sum. They have a few dim sum dishes, but not a full menu like if you've been to a full dim sum restaurant. That's not the issue.  I ordered the shu mai and it came in traditional group of three. The first one was ok, the center fell apart a little when I bit into it. The second was doughy and I realized the noodle exterior wasn't the right type of noodle. The third I looked at more closely and saw that the noodle wrap was it fully steamed through I could still see the flour markings and the dough pushed and pulled because it was not fully cooked. Real disappointment there. 
At this point the second dish I ordered came out. I had the pork belly over the mac and cheese at the recommendation of the bartender. He gushed over it. Took the first bit of the pork belly, it was bad. It was chewy and tough like flank steak. I thought maybe, this was just the one piece, tried the next one, just as tough and chewy.  

I put the fork down and was definitely frowning as at that point the bartender came over and asked what was wrong. I told him, I didn't like the dish and he was shocked and asked why. I told him the pork belly was tough and chewy. He replied, "Well it's pork belly, what do you expect?".  So here's where I realize the bartender has no clue about food. I tell him pork belly is supposed to be melt in your mouth cooked. And he argued, no it's not. Then said he could get me something else.  I told him no, I have to get back to my meeting. And really, I didn't want to go for a third round of bad food.  The rest of the mac and cheese was fair, curry flavor with mint and pineapple and I felt just one too many flavors. And the noodles were at the mushy level of over cooked.  I had the bartender clear the plates after picking through hoping to find something good or at least eat enough to stretch me to my dinner break when I could go somewhere else. 

So I got the check, they charged me for the mac and cheese which I don't think I should have had to pay for as it was so bad. But I did and just called the whole experience a wash.  This place needs to work on quality control and hiring people that know more about food.

I was here recently and I ordered a Tito's and club soda and a few beers. The bartender proceeded to poor two mixed drinks, one with no Tito's. I asked her why, and she became belligerent. She sent over, I guess, her manager who knocked over the actual drink I had, and said "I guess it's not your lucky day."

"dewey's is way better" 

is the first thing that left my mouth after taking one bite of their pizza. this pizza is extremely hyped up- since it's average with small portions and a pretty overpriced tag. it's not bad, but you can definitely find way better (and bigger) pizza. 

had a side of their mac & cheese which was also good, but still slightly underwhelming. odd cheese flavor and was a small bowl even though it was full sized to share. just not the best place around.
The customer service is horrible, they won't answer upon having your information if your awaiting a tow. The lady that answered was very unprofessional.

Very underwhelming. Parking during the day is very difficult even though the restaurant may be quiet. This is still a train stop. It's pretty enough and the service was very good but today was really sub par food wise. My buddy asked for a chicken cheese steak, but received a beef one. I order a chicken parm but it was subparm. The roll was over toasted or stale and heated, either way yuck. Lots of cheese a sauce but the chicken was not hot. I'll assume it was made ahead and sat around. The onion rings where pretty good. I've eaten here a few times and happy hour is a pretty good deal. So....

I am currently in five guys waiting for food for my boyfriend. I heard they were recently closed but he said they were back open so I decided to pick up food for him. When I showed up to order they told me they were cash only which I was unaware of - per my boyfriend they were never cash only before. I decided to go get my own dinner, stop at the Atm and come back to get his. When I came back there was a sign posted on the door that stated "closed for medical issues." As I was standing at the door the entire staff laughed at me when they realized I was the girl who had gone to the ATM to get money and by the time I came back they were closed. Eventually, when the staff was done laughing they let me in and I was able to place my order and pay with cash. They told me my order would be under the name "ATM." I just can't understand how an entire restaurant staff could suddenly come down with medical issues forcing the entire restaurant to close early. In addition the mockery of the staff was seriously unappreciated. It doesn't surprise me that this location was recently closed as they are so inconsistent. You can definitely find a better burger and fries in center city that is more consistent and respectful to their customers.

Stopped here for a weekday lunch. There was almost no room for dine-in, so you might want to take out! I got the vegetarian po-boy. It was OK. The coconut bacon was delish and the sauce was a little different, but overall I would have liked it if there was less sauce and more vegetables. The sandwich was also cold. I might go back and try something different. The veggie gyro that my colleague got looked interesting and came with delish potatoes!

Terrible attitude from the waitresses the moment we stepped in. Extremely impatient and rude. The worst part:  We discovered a sticker still stuck to a sliced-up red bell pepper in one of our dishes, and when we questioned the waitress about it, she exclaimed that the restaurant doesn't wash any of its vegetables and told us to "deal with it and stop acting surprised." Will not be going back.

I do not recommend this place !! 

Attention! They are more interested in earning money than doing their work honestly! They didn't respect what I needed only to fix one tooth. They wanted to do more things than I specifically asked for.

From the first moment I made it very clear that I only needed to fill a slightly broken amalgam and I just wanted an RX of that tooth. The hygienist  said "OK, I GOT IT" and continued to do whole-mouth RX despite my request!

Dr. Kwok checked my mouth and started inventing things to fix, he wanted to convince myself that I have to remove the amalgams and make them porcelain for an aesthetic matter (even if they are healthy). What kind of dentist wants to break teeth / healthy fixes ??
Anyway....he said "I DON'T HAVE TIME TO DO IT TODAY,". What??? So...What did I come for?

By the way, the receptionist is a mess! She treated me as a liar in front of other customers, saying that I called for an urgent appointment because I was in pain! Nothing is further from reality!! Hopefully that work is given to someone who really wants to work and serve customers well. She has very bad attitude.

The offices aren't private, they are small and dirty. Just looking at the ceilings with humidity was disgusting! 
If you are evaluating it as an option, DISCARD IT!

Had reservation for 10 at 1pm Sunday July 1, 2018. I could not make reservation on Open Table but upon calling, the person who answered was very helpful and made reservation and explained that table had a two hour limit. He shared w me that Enon Church (which we are visiting) was less than 10 minutes away. 

Upon arrival, parking in the Relish lot was easy and we checked in 5 minutes early. To preface, the day of our reservation, the weather was unseasonably hot. We were seated in the room in the front. I understand brunch is set price but was surprised I was handed a cocktail menu but when I asked about sodas and tea, was told they were not included in brunch cost and the restaurant did not have printed non alcoholic drink menu. I was told to ask my waiter. With a reservation of ten that I was picking up tab, it would be nice to know how much tea and soda would cost. 

Everyone enjoyed brunch but I felt Relish fell short. We arrived at 1pm est and by 1:20 est the salmon was gone. The sign clearly said "Trout and Salmon." I informed staff salmon was gone and asked for them to put out more and was told they were out. Also they had a waffle station with strawberries and when we arrived at 1pm they were out of whipped cream and they never put any out. For the price of almost $30 per adult I was disappointed. A staff member in my opinion could have put more salmon out and run to store to get more whipped cream. 

The cook at omelette station was clearly irritated he was put on omelette duty when he was the chef that cooked all the food on display for buffet. He shared that with me as I waited for my omelette. 

My final comment is on food safety. The room where the food was for the buffet was very very hot and there was a seafood salad and mayo based pastas on middle buffet table along w fruit and pastries that were out but there was no ice keeping Seafood salad and mayo based pasta salads cool. Also the trout (minus salmon) did not have any ice. For fear of illness we did not eat seafood salad or mayo based pastas. 

Overall the restaurant is homey and staff nice. I feel food quality could be better and attention to detail would have made my score higher. For example when we arrived at 1pm the shrimp and grits station did not have any small bowls. We were forced to put on plates both times my niece went back for more. Upon final walk through about 2:15 there were small bowls for shrimp and grits. And the salmon was never replaced and still no whipped cream.

And I agree with other reviews. The fried chicken only had odd cuts. No chicken breasts or wings so I did not try it. Not sure what the fried fish was. Not appetizing at all. I also don't recall seeing any cornbread or collards.

Finance was a joke. 705 credit could not get loan. Went to State Farm , took 15 min. Had to show sales their own ad to get price. They wanted us to get extended warranty, we didn't have the money. They insinuated that Chevrolet we're junk so I had to have it. Strange behavior wish I had a recording for GM main office. I was going to tear up check and walk out, should have. Said we was on our own on warranty. Guess they won't fulfill chevy warranty work. How they get good reviews is beyond me. Do not buy from them. Won't honor internet ads unless pressed, insult the product they are selling, finance man behavior unacceptable. But no one will call us, nothing will change. They don't have to care a sucker is born every minute   Oh yea car broke 8 miles from dealer, new one. Going 60 motor shut off by itself. Now tire pressure on tires doesn't work. Total 25 miles for all these problems. Gee maybe he was right, chevy is junk.  Wish I would have checked yelp first. Now I'll have to go to kendall chevy for any work and pray they are not like this place   If I could I would take it back and get a Mitsubishi.
Awful service! Was here for over an hour before we got our food, wanted to walk out. Not prepared at all, they only have 1 cook. I WILL NEVER COME BACK HERE AGAIN!

Construction started indoors at 8 am on a Sunday. It's been going on for over an hour now. They're using power tools and hammering. Sounds like they're sawing something right above us. Front desk worker says there's nothing he can do. We can't sleep. I would've been better off sleeping in my car.

Love the ice cream!! But every time ive come n asked for something they always never have what i ask for! Its very dissapointing to ask for ur order n hear a we dnt have n have to change ur order few times to b able to kindda at the end some what of n ice cream! N it always seems like everyone else gets helped even ordering after me! They seem to get their order first!!!!!!

Drinks they make are not good.  Waited for an hour for a table and we had to remind them we were waiting 45 minutes into the wait.  The food wasn't very good.  I wouldn't recommend this place when they have better places with better staff.  Sad to say the food was better then the staff and the food wasn't anything to write home about.

I had a lot of fun in the casino.  I won some and I lost some.  My big complaint is the Market Street Buffet in the casino.  I won't go there again. The food didn't taste good and service at the buffet was lousy.  The hostess/cashier didn't tell me that they had crab legs and that they were an extra charge.  I would have paid extra for them but they didn't seem to want to sell them.  According to the person I went with the steak on the buffet was terrible and had a lot of gristle.  I wanted the steak but I couldn't get any because the employee left the steak as one big whole piece sitting under the heat lamp uncut and out of peoples reach.  It seemed to just be there for looks.  I tried numerous times to get his attention so I could get some steak but he was in his own little world oblivious to the customers and was absolutely no help.  The rolls were hard and stale.  In the event the casino was under attack you could have used them as a weapon. The salmon was ok.

This is the most incompetent usps I have ever dealt with located on Mccabe drive. 
 Back in late March and early April 2018, my IRS tax return was mysteriously lost. Then, just 2 months ago I purchased an item and it showed delivered but there was nothing in my mailbox. Sounds like a little or a lot of thievery goin on. I called the claims department and that was a waste of time. Since the item wasn't insured, they cannot reimburse. And since it was marked as delivered, they cannot do anything about it. Way to go is postal service!
And if you go in to that office, good luck finding anyone friendly!
If you live in the south meadows area, be aware!

Expensive, slow, small, loud. My table was dirty so I asked for a towel, she hands be napkins. I repeat, wet towel. She gets me a wet towel and let's me clean my own table, after spending $15 for a burger. Ok.

My sister and I went to the dealer on a Saturday around 5pm. We told the salesmen that my sister who's 17 turning 18 next week that she's looking for a new car because she is getting inheritance money next week to buy a new car. We test drove 5 cars at reedman and toll next door and had no issues. He informed us that she may not be able to drive a car because of her age which I understand since I work at a honda dealership. When he returned with General manager I assume they informed us she would not be able to drive a car until she is 18. We were totally fine with this however they did not even offer to show us a car or to have me drive the car. If this salesmen was smart he would have done this. (Mind you this dealership did not have 1 customer in it ) the main reason for this review I went to the restroom before we left and the way the building is setup it's like a maze and you can't see where people are around the corner. The sales manager was joking with a salesmen and rudely talking about us as if we left. This was a cash deal potentially leading to two other cars 3 total. However we will take our business to reedman and toll.

The menu is big and confusing with tons of small text. It was cheaply printed and nailed onto the wall. Quite a contrast to the LED displays at most restaurants. I feel like I am in post-Maria San Juan. 

The price of a big burrito is $12, a few dollars more than chipotle and not worth the extra cost. I felt compelled to tip when prepaying at the counter, but I regret having done that.

They have four total customers in the store and the two employees managed to temporarily lose my order. It seems they can't process two orders in their head without a computer to tell them what they need to do next. This may be an indication of everyone's very near future. 

It took more than 30 minutes to get the burrito and it was not worth the wait.

I just picked up food from this place today and I had to write a review to make sure unsuspecting people don't wander in here.  I ordered Spanikopita...this was a microwaved slab of dough with filling which I couldn't even cut with a knife, it was that chewy.  The Gyro Platter with fries ( again microwaved limp junk).  The actual Gyro was passable...but I will never go to this place again...and if they keep serving food like this I don't see how they will stay in business long....!!!!

Over 10 mins just to get soft drinks and water. Food came out and 2 in our group of 6 had issues. Shrimp platter was cold. Steak was over cooked. After wait staff was told about the shrimp it was Re-fried and the rest was put under a heat lamp. At that point it was uneatable. Management was very hospitable at addressing the issue and the dishes that did come out correctly were great.

I honestly never visit McDonald's anyways but occasionally after late nights working I'll stop by on my way home for some fries. Last Friday I rolled through the drive thru at 3:40am super hungry after working all night and went for the 10 piece chicken tenders only to arrive home to 10 seriously over cooked tenders that were so hard they were ignored even by my dog which is saying a lot. I called in and was told by John Curry (who was nice though I should have been told how difficult this was going to be) that I could come in whenever to get my order replaced since i wasn't going to drive back out at 4am. I even specified I didn't have my receipt to carry around in my pocket until i found another opportunity to return to which I was assured if I mentioned his name and the time and date of the meal it could be taken care of for me. Well that didn't happen I was told they could refund 4 of the 10 tenders which is not even worth driving for since I'm not a small sized child unless i wanted to come in at a later date to speak with the GM like I have time to take meetings with people over a fast food meal. Instead I will just write my review to warn everyone else not to come here and stop at the Salem's next time instead. Irritating waste of time

Our food was amazing, but they didn't serve us any drinks at the bar after 15 mins of waiting. The bar service was absolutely terrible. They seated us at a table and we ordered food and one beer, after that they decided to "cut us off" after one drink. Our server was Jeremy if I am correct and he had very bad customer service.

Worse fucking hotel in the St. Louis area. Called in 3 times to change bedding sheets. Sheets come in and there are thousands oh holes and lipstick stains. Hotel lobby smells like piss. I would not recommend this shit hole to anybody. Staff isn't friendly and check in crew is inexperienced and almost double charged us. It's midnight and we can't go to sleep because we DONT HAVE ANY BEDDING.
Contacted this company and scheduled a time for them to come by for an estimate and they never showed up or called again.

I do enjoy Zaxby's.  My go to is the grilled Chicken Caeser Salad and a nibbler on the side.  If you don't know what the nibbler is, it's a mini fried chicken sandwich.  I fool myself into thinking it's not all that bad for me because I'm only getting a salad and small bite size sandwich right?

So why the two stars?  Because this location had the slowest service I may have ever had at a Zaxby's.  I just don't want an experience with slow service to ruin someones, who may have never had Zaxby's, first time here.  I feel a fair warning should be noted.  Zaxby's is great, however, you may have to wait... at least here.

One of the worst meals I've had. The lobster was chewy and tuff with no flavor. They took it back and under cooked it the 2nd time. The wedge's lettuce was bitter and two times the dressing. The asparagus was cold and soggy.  The bread and dessert were good. The service was outstanding though. I will say they were on it and reconsider the meal wasn't up to the tasks. The service deserves a 5 star rating. The food 0. It's a shame because the restaurant is beautiful and conveniently located.

I've never wrote this in a review before but...this place has truly disgusting food. I mean how do you F-up tater tots. It's strictly bar food and it's really almost inedible. The food tastes like they have never cleaned the griddle, burnt and charred. I mean really, truly horrible. The fried food tastes like they've never changed the grease. I gave it one star because the waitress was nice. That's really the only positive thing I can say.  Did I mention it's pricey?!! Really NEVER EAT HERE!!!
The only thing I liked was the pulled pork egg rolls. Everything else sucked! Mac n cheese, steak, bread rolls, chicken was dry, salad was gross, the cobbler is way to sweet and just corn syrup!
The manager Sarah was rude over the phone. My husband called in for a pizza they messed up on and she denied get the address changed and have the pizza made.

The food is average. The Margarita was weird tasting, like it was not fresh. 

There were more waiters than customers and we still had slow service, which was strange. The service was nice but again it was very slow.

TLDR: Average or below. Too many great Mexican places around to drive out of your way for this one.

Horrible customer service !!!! 
It seemed like an issue to be seated as a lone diner then after 25 minutes I had to get up from my table to ask a worker who was wrapping silverware to get my server because I had been waiting so long. The worker said my burger was being "remade." REMADE ??? The server could have (SHOULD HAVE) advised me or checked on me especially since there was such a long wait. Finally my burger comes out without any explanation for the delay from the server. I immediately asked for a "to go" container, paid and left. I took my food to my room and when I bit into my burger it was hard and dry. VERY DISAPPOINTING EXPERIENCE!
Thanks Business lady but @mealyscustomercare.com will just give me more run around that my tolerance has run out on.  I'd rather just deal with the Better Business Bureau and my attorney.

I first tried to shop at the Carson City store....then went to Reno store.....Sad days for Penney's....  I went in to purchase a suit, and they have no one working in Men's suits department....They must have called around 3 times to find someone who knew how to measure and size me, all 4 representatives I spoke with had absolutely NO knowledge of there own mens products....Store is run by a handful of young cashiers, no one has anything but general knowledge of their products. Their reps like the other store seemed unhappy with their jobs as could be deducted from the far less than enthusiastic response to help.... Last suit I bought was 10 yrs ago, and the trained and skilled Mens Dept customer service rep was a PRO....now JCPenney's doesn't seem to care about the customers anymore.....about as much knowledge as a rep at Walmart. Sad Days, ended up buying 2 suits across the street at a specialty store.
worst restaurant in santa barbara ever!!!!  . sat down for an hour no service .  never ever coming here

Horrible! Food was cold and no one checked on us during the meal to see if everything was okay. The rice was hot but the seafood in the dish was cold. Also, thought it was over priced for quality and service.

I hate to write  this because I had high hopes but Nicky's was a disappointment tonight.  Maybe just a bad night for Nicky's ?  The staff were very friendly (host and server) and that was good but really about it.  The pizza was just "ok". I had the basil and mozzarella but it had about 6 tiny pieces of basil on it.   I ordered more basil which almost never came as I had to ask twice.  Flavor of the pizza was somewhat bland.  We waited a very long time, one pizza brought out , no silverware and plates   Waited way to long for  the other pizza  ordered at our table I and gave up on the salad.   Servers seemed disorganized as one asked us a couple times  if a dish she had was ours (which it was not).  Bummer.  The space is cool but they need to work on organization and doing a better job making the pizza special enough to come back for.  Disappointed

Currently sitting here in the dining area being forced to listen to Christian music... won't be bringing my family inside to this location again. I know we live in the south but this constant bombardment and intrusion of Christianity is really getting old. I don't care what you believe as long as you don't force it on me. Sitting here having dinner with my family and we are being told that nothing is possible without god. We are born sinners and need salvation. No thank you.

No stars! Silo needs a lesson in customer service. To start... it wasn't enough we made a brunch reservation for seven, gave a credit card and confirmed the reservation!! They called three times, including an hour before and kept reminding us we'd be charged $25 a head if we did not show. We were first time customers and do not have a history of no-showing. Perhaps this harassment should have been a clue to go elsewhere. When we showed up the door was locked until until the exact minute they were to open; a line had formed and when it was finally time to open, the hostess unlocked the door and walked off - did not even push the door open and welcome the guests! It went downhill from there. They sat us a table set for six and squeezed in a seventh chair --mind you, we had reservations for seven and had received three calls to be sure we'd be there or they'd charge us. The food was average at best and the service was sub-par. It was a special occasion for my parents 51st anniversary, and the entire experience was a let down. If you decide to eat at Silo, lower your expectations; maybe then, you will enjoy it.

I called ahead to book a private room for my birthday. I called in the beginning of a December for an early January date. I was informed that the 18 person room I requested booked out 2 months in advance due to the popularity and demand for that size room. The date I originally wanted could not be accommodated. No big deal. I changed my plans around with friends and switched the date to a later January date so that I could have the 18 person room. 

Upon our arrival the bouncer that stands outside questioned then confiscated my friends 2 prescription bill bottles, prescribed to her with her name on the bottles. It was Imodium and another medication for IBS. The bouncer stated "I don't know what's in these bottles; I can't let you take them in." She assertively stated that, she would need these medications immediately if she started to have stomach problems or any medical issues and that he would be denying my friend access to take the prescribed medication. The bouncer refused to listen and told her that he would not allow her in unless she gave him her prescriptions. Ugh, ok fine. She handed them over. 

Next disaster, the women at the front desk. I checked in for my 18 person private room, and they argued with me that I booked a 12 person room. After exchanging words back and forth, I succumbed to their awful customer service tactics, and went with the smaller room. Luckily, friends of mine had to cancel last minute and we were able to fit in the smaller room. I did ask if they would be willing to accommodate us with anything else, being that they made a mistake. They refused. The woman who came in to "help" show us how to use the karaoke machine in the private room was extremely dismissive and rude, leaving us with unanswered questions. We had to spend some time on our own figuring out this machine. By the way, the awful front desk women told us that we were to be out of the room at 12:00 "AND NOT A MINUTE MORE!" All around the customer service was TERRIBLE. The workers at Yakatori Boy do not understand the first thing about customer service. They were extremely unprofessional and dismissive. I am giving my rating on Yelp a 1 for customer service.

My friends made the night SO MUCH FUN! We sang and danced all night. And just when we thought the CUSTOMER SERVICE COULDN'T GET ANY WORSE they came in to give us our bill (of course) while rushing us out of the room after we spent A LOT of money on food and drinks all night. Remember the awful woman at the front when we checked in, "NOT A MINUTE MORE!" She wasn't kidding. They were very unorganized.

We really tried to let go of the awful customer service and make the most out of the night, and I think we were pretty successful. We still had a ton of fun and I would give our individual room a 5 start rating because of my friends and the fun we had, but be weary when booking reservations here. You will have to do a lot of follow up and confirm your reservations/booking, as they are very disorganized and unreliable.

Tourist trap. over priced chewy rubber. everyone in philly knows how awful this is. the only reason they're still in business is from one time tourist patrons.  a disgrace to Philadelphia & cheesesteaks all over, do ur self a favor & don't
Highly dissatisfied with this business the trainers do not follow through the owners do not follow up and they charge you for everything

Welcome to the park, then you walk and walk and bam there's the Parthenon?!  Very random.  This museum is more overstated outside than what is inside.  It would be nice to have more history into the explanation of Greek mythology and why this was chosen as a building project.  A video presentation would be helpful.  There are a lots of loose strings here.  There are replicas of some Ancient Greek mythological creatures and many idols - but not a lot to keep you enthralled with Greek mythological history.  The large idol of Athena is covered in real 23.8karat gold leaf.  It is astounding to think that this object was worshipped.  It would have been more interesting to know how these idols affected the devotion of the Greeks and how they played a part in history.  It makes sense how the apostle Paul was astounded at the number of gods that were worshipped by the Greeks and how he used their devotion to teach them about the true God of the Bible.

Unprofessional and shady management. Would not come here again. Overall, my night was not enjoyable at all given the money I spent. Service was slow and drinks weren't strong. Don't come here if you want to have a good time. The atmosphere here was not at all what I was expecting despite the fact they boast that they're the biggest and "best" nightclub in Philly

Ok at best. They came highly recommended and was pumped when I found out the would be close to my job. I got the "Regular Ass Burger", name that is stated on the menu, because they couldn't make the melt that day. The patty seemed thin much like a frozen patty. It was small, dry and most of the flavor came from the B&B pickles. The cheese fries with bacon were the best part but not enough to say I'd eat there again. I think they need a better patty.

I love burger king i love the deals they give you on your mobile app , i went today and was sad of what i received but its not always like that , today i had some cold fries but my burger was good & idk if its my tastebudds but right now the sprite dont seem to right lol , workers here are pretty nice though will say that , ill yelp again when i go there again ...

Very disappointed. We've been here before and have enjoyed it. Last night was an off night. Service was poor. I had to ask the hostess if anyone was waiting on us. Once we got someone's attention, service was slow. They got both my and my wife's orders wrong. They handled my mistake well by bringing a new dish. What was perhaps most disturbing was the dirty fingernails of the person bringing the food to the table. Gross!

What a poorly-run establishment. I placed a simple order today for our department and the experience was beyond pathetic. Our office is very close by and we order frequently. The guy who answered the phone at 11 am told me to hurry up because he was busy. I asked for a 12:30 pm delivery. 12:30 came and went and I called numerous times. He told me that they were busy and to give them some time. I told him that the pizza and wings were going to be cold for sure and he told me to call him back and let him know how it was. When the food finally came at 1:35, it was cold of course. I called and told him so and said that I didn't think we should have to pay. He told me to call back at 4 to talk to the manager. I called back at 4 and was told by the manager that he had to talk to his boss. Seriously????? Sal, you need to hire more competent people. What a bad experience for marginal food. Our company won't ever order from you again. You just lost a whole bunch of business over $46.74.

Really enjoy the Sparks location and the service and attention they give to each customer. This location don't ask you if you want white or dark meat, or for any sauces. Apple pies were cool not hot, and they didn't even ask or give any butter for the biscuit. Questionable future visits from our family.
Was not impressed . A little hole in the wall. We had the Buffett  the food was luke warm. Will not be baxk
This place went downhill quick.  Dreadful service, even with a nearly empty establishment at noon on a Saturday.

I went with a co-worker and I havent been in years and was in a debate about which Gyros place was the best.  I told him Kazina on Nolensville rd and he disagreed saying come to my place.  Well I had high hopes of this place again after years and was disappointed.  I was rushed through the service and preperation of my sandwich and this was the worst part of my experience.  Once I am rushed, my eating experience was ruined.  In regards to the taste and quality, i would say its average as I asked them to cook my meat well done and continue with the next customer who was my co worker and still he rushed me asking what i wanted on sandwhich.

This is the first time back here since they changed the kitchen staff and menu...and it will be the last. They eliminated 2 of the best things on the menu - the fish and chips and the nachos. So I ordered the smoky burger cooked medium well and a Sexi Mexi beer. The beer was ok but a little flat. My burger was not cooked to medium well and the servers response was "ok what do you want me to do? Do you want me to have them cook you a new burger?"  When I said I didn't need a new burger she told me they couldn't put it back on the grill because of cross contamination. Ok I get that but didn't have time to wait for a new burger. No "I'm sorry" at all. When she saw that I barely ate any of the burger my meal should have been comped but there was not so much as a discount or a coupon for a future meal as a way to get my business again. I certainly won't be back.

I used to work at the Christie Cookie in green hills and man was I disappointed eight this location. The cookies were hard and stale. These aren't cheap and for a company that mainly sells cookies....they should be tasting pretty darn good. Very disappointed!

Definitely a disappointment. The food lacked flavor. We also had a mix up with the order because we asked for ribs and mashed potatoes and they brought us grapes and mashed potatoes. Then we told them that was not what we ordered and someone different brought the grapes back out saying we ordered this. We explained again and they finally fixed the order and apologized. The made the ribs in like 10 minutes which were fatty and looked like the were boiled and smothered in BBQ sauce. The half rack was so small the size of each rib was the same size as a finger. One out of 5 ate all their food. The rest of us left half of it there. Wouldn't go back.

Im sad to know I'm giving 2 stars, but honestly I've had & is Way more places with better food. We ordered calamari, marinated grill chicken and shrimp and grits and boy o boy when the food came  she originally said to us " ooo don't touch the calamari because it's hot" since my baby was already digging in, I had expected it o be hot. As she left I reached in for a calamari and honestly if You want a Soggy, Cold, Bad batter Calamari then go right ahead. My husband and I didn't enjoy it at all and we never finished it. 
Secondly I'm someone who don't eat Pork at all, & while reading the menu I didn't see that the Shrimp and grips had 'pork' and as I started eating the grits was too SOUR , I don't know why and then finally I bite into something weird and just not a taste that I'm use to. So I go look at the menu online to read that's in it again the. Asked her " hey is this sausage Pork? " & her reply to me was " I don't know, but for you I can say Beef ".  I was really bothered by that response because I especially am bother I ate pork when I Don't eat that in my life! and she didn't even offer to go FIND OUT or take it off the tab since I BEARLY ATE ANYTHING! but I will Never go there again. 
And Lastly, the ONLY Thing I could say was good was the Fries.
Average food. Average service. Typical beach food at inflated prices. Sides were terrible. Order a la carte. Snappers down the road was 10 times better.

Unbelievably disappointing service at the bar. We sat at three empty bar stools and were never greeted, even after attempting to get the attention of one of the two bartenders. Five-seven minutes went by and I had to initiate conversation with the other bartender. I tried to be friendly and ask how she was doing and she simply stared at me-she didn't bother to ask if we'd like anything. I asked for waters to start and she stormed off without saying anything.  Another five minutes went by as we finished our waters and no one bothered to ask if we'd like anything else-we once again had to flag down another bartender. This establishment should not be included under the "service industry" umbrella because absolutely no service happened.

RUDE STAFF.  Waitress was rude from the first time she came up to the table.  Seemed to be annoyed 3 out of 4 of us ordered water (I tried to order a drink but they were out of what I wanted).
