She rarely came to the table, never smiled and all but ignored us after our food arrived.  We had to flag her down for the check and even that took multiple attempts. She essentially threw the check at us....despite this we are still good tippers!  This was supposed to be a pleasant meal out with out of towners.  Food is good but not worth the attitude problem.  This was the LAST time I will go to Teresa's even though we live 2 miles away.  Every visit has been good/ok food but with really crappy staff.  Don't waste your time!! Tucson is FULL of other good Mexican food.

If I could give "0" stars I would. I was there on a busy Saturday and was standing in line for the restroom. After waiting in line for over 20 minutes I was 2 back from the restroom door. The girl in front of me disappears from line and seconds later the bathroom door opens. I walk up to go in and half way thru the door a "female employee" of the bar grabs my shoulder and calls me out for cutting in line. BTW this person was not watching the bathroom line the whole time I was in it. I told her that there was a girl in front of me and she left before the room became available. She didn't know what to say but didn't appear sober either. I explained and went in to pee, and after coming out told her what I thought, she had no time for me, I was the bad guy. That was the last time and the last dollar I'll spend their. The owner of this place should be ashamed...

This is a frustrating dealership. The service department has always been fine, but I turned in my lease in March, and I began receiving notifications from the state about the car, which I had turned in. No one at the dealership advised me that I had to contact PennDOT regarding the vehicle turn in at the time that we returned it.

When I tried to call the dealership to let them know what was going on, I left two messages with the receptionist over the course of a week, and no one returned my call. I finally got ahold of someone this morning, and he was terse and condescending. I get that you're busy, car sales bro, but so am I, and customer service is your em effing job. I'm pissed. Exton is a better dealership. Too bad it's so far away.

So, I would not recommend coming here. Be nicer if you're going to sell expensive cars. If you're not nice, then don't go into sales, for eff's sake. That's why I'm not in sales. I'm not nice.

Actually not even a 1 star for this horrible experience that this company gave us. Called to make an appointment for my car alarm and installation of keyless entry 3 days before the day. They said you don't need to have appointment walk in is fine. I brought around 9am in the morning and I asked my friend to follow me because it might take long. So i asked them how long will it take this guy named miguel told us that it will be finish by 4-5 hours I also asked them if they want to check the car he said no it's fine so instead of going home we stayed at parkplace and watch movies because we live in south tucson. They called after 3 hours saying that they did not start the car yet because they only have 1 technician. So it might take the whole day so we went home. And then got a call around 5pm saying that they will not finish the car because my car is not matched with their parts.(I even asked them to check the car first and now they're saying that it needs to be check until tomorrow to get a compatible parts) so I decided to pick it up the next day and then I called them because it's noon time but i haven't receive their call. Worst customer service ever! Shout out to miguel. So basically i called them to check if they finish the car but they said i need to add 120 dollars i paid 200 some for their first quote and now they're telling me to add 120? That's ridiculous all of this inconvenience they are supposed to give a compensation. So to cut the dramas I just paid them additional 120 so i can get my car asap because I need to go to work the next day. I'm expecting that they will finish the car by saturday i drop it last friday so when we called them this miguel told us that they did not finish the job again for the third time. So i pick up the car because i gotta go to work and i was told to bring it back on wednesday so i made an appointment and miguel said that they will put it in the system. So i went back wednesday to drop it but i was told that it will take 2 hours only so me and my friend waited nearby. And they called again saying that their parts are not compatible againnnnn!!!!! So he said he wont be able to finish it. Thursday morning we called and the manager chris answered the phone he said miguel is off what the heck they don't even know that miguel did not inform us about the situation so basically chris did his best to handle it. So by thursday he finished the car and update us every hour so we know whats going on. Shout out to chris I'm giving you a full 5 star.  But when we picked up the car I was expecting to hear an apology from the staff especially miguel but He just ignored us and they did not even give us any compensation with this experience. we paid 300 some and not even getting a formal apology. Never ever gonna come back!!!!! Yes they were cheap but as i said I'm not ever gonna come back! Thank you!

When I purchased tickets online, the website somehow made me buy 4 tickets instead of two tickets and charged my card twice (which I did not realize until checking my credit card statement). Company refused to refund me, even when I asked if I could get a refund if they void the voucher. Now I am forced to either return for another room or lose my $65. Very disappointed. Only reason I am giving two stars is that the experience I had before finding out that the website charged me twice was good, although we had to wait a little while longer than the time we booked.
Pulled up at 10 min to close and I was blatantly ignored by the scummiest looking employee...maybe he did me a favor.

Decided to give this a go before checking out the reviews... We decided to try the pretzel-crusted fried chicken thigh. The meat itself was cooked pretty well, but it was then dipped in the batter and under-fried, leaving wet batter all through the nooks and crannies of the deboned chicken thigh. The biscuit tasted steamed or microwaved, very reminescent of an undercooked pilsberry biscuit from a can. The veggies were frozen at some point and turned out rubbery with no seasoning. The mashed potatoes were very sweet, but decent texture.

The cauliflower florentine lacked cohesion and taste, despite some decent dressing choices. The cauliflower was supposed to be charred, but it was pretty raw.

I guess all the time savings in cooking the food were to get our food out faster, which only took a few minutes. Service seemed fine and it sounded like they are still getting the kitchen up to speed.

If they're still around in a few months, will give them another try.

I won't be back here. The guy who does the brake tag inspections was literally yelling at me. I am under an unruly amount of stress right now, had a dog barking, moved down here from Michigan not too long ago and am not used to some of the southern lingo, have a new car I am getting used to, and it's noisy there with the washes. So when I slipped up or didn't hear him, he yelled at me and not in a way that was understanding and ensuring I could hear him better, but really unkind. I think it's important to at least try to be kind to everyone because you truly don't know what's going on in their lives and customers are giving up perhaps money they hardly have so they can support your living. It just was not a good experience and had me leaving the parking lot feeling badly.
The food was crappy...the drinks taste horriable...our server was a douche and had the nerve to run out side and ask why his tip wasn't higher I Ana single dad with 3 kids

We are relatively new to Tucson and wanted to go somewhere great for our anniversary: I was really excited to dress up, put in some effort and hit the town for a special night. I did some research, chose Vivace and made reservations for 8:30. The restaurant was still packed when we got there (which is actually a good sign), so we were seated awkwardly in the middle of the room, crammed against other tables and at an angle from each other, which made our conversation awkward, too. I couldn't even cross my legs without totally encroaching on my poor husband's leg space, and didn't even have enough room on the table to place my small clutch.  I would rather have waited for a table than be crammed in so uncomfortably. We felt like an inconvenience in the middle of the hustle and bustle, not like paying guests.

This isn't Vivace's fault but to add to our discomfort, multiple other tables very obviously stared at us as we came in and throughout our meal. It was so plain and off-putting that my husband almost got up and said something to one older gentlemen who stared at us and even maintained eye contact with my husband until his party left, about halfway into our meal. We got the feeling that it was an old boy's club and that we didn't belong. Again, that was NOT Vivace's fault, but it was incredibly uncomfortable and really put a damper on things. 

The service was fine for a busy Saturday night. Our waitress was polite and personable, but it was clear that she was busy. It took her a bit to make her rounds and get back to us. We did not fault her for that and tipped her well. I wish I could remember your name - thank you for your attentiveness and sweet words. 

The food was "meh." The menu looked great and the pictures online did, too, but both of us were underwhelmed when our food actually came. We ordered the antipasto to start and didn't even touch half of it -- enormous pieces of undercooked red bell peppers, undercooked "grilled" asparagus, unseasoned spinach that tasted like it came from a can. The artichokes, goat cheese and olives were good. 

I ordered the crab stuffed chicken on the waitress' recommendation. It was hot when served and cooked well, but the sauce was remarkably SWEET. I ate half of it before leaving the rest. She boxed it up for me when we left but I threw it out. Crab has a natural sweetness, of course, but the sauce on the chicken honestly tasted like someone used sugar instead of salt to season it. Maybe it's just a difference in palette but I'm not sure that I would want to come back for another try at Vivace based on that dish alone. My husband ordered the sausage and red pepper pasta. He said it was all right, nothing special. 

Because I left in our reservation notes that it was our anniversary, the waitress brought us a complementary piece of tiramisu with a candle in it - I really appreciated that gesture and credit Vivace with that nice touch.

We ended up going for drinks elsewhere. It wasn't that we had a bad night, per se, but it wasn't good by a long shot. Perhaps we just came on a bad day, but for supposedly being the number one Italian restaurant in Tucson, we left fairly disappointed. I would have loved to give Vivace more credit. Seems like a nice place with a great staff. Oh, well.

Ordered something on a friday evening then canceled it Saturday morning by email... Was told on tuesday that it shipped, so called customer service and was told I was supposed to call them... It doesn't say that on the website... Customer service was horrible and I'll never order from here again... And will let everyone I know what happened

Man is this joint in need of a remodel!!!  After parking, walked up to just a tired door. Rust where metal meets walls. UGH. Inside, again, just tired. But I was there for breakfast so we'll overlook the appearance. 
The wait staff was very pleasant and attentive. Coffee was offered immediately and delivered.  Waffle, two eggs scrambled and sausage.  I can't say a thing bad about the meal, I just can't say any good either. 
Ruby's is the definition of acceptable.  There are way better breakfast options in the area and I'm pretty sure I'll be making choices other than Ruby's.

Never ever again!  Very discriminatory restaurant. The minute we walked in the hostess looked at us down saying they were closed. They were about 8 minutes to open so we decided to valet our cars and wait until 4:30pm. When we walked in again the hostess said "how can I help you?" and we replied we just waiting 8 minutes to open so to have the manager approach us and tell us they have a dress code pointed at their dress code policy sign and to tell us have a nice day. He was rude. I understand they have a dress code that won't allow tank tops but he had no absolute good manners in the way he said it. When we walked out the Valet attendant was more apologetic and even mentioned she was not aware that they require a dress code. We were just craving a great steak on a relaxed Sunday and ended up in Longhorn. I have been a manager at Marriot for 23 years and we never discriminate no one neither treat people like that. Please don't support places like this where they judge people on appearance.

Clean has been out the window for quite a while at this location. Service keeps going by the wayside but then what do you expect for $4? Fine China and someone to occasionally wait on you? Your food is why I come but it's getting to hard to stomach the rest of what you have to put up with. Biglari has ruined an institution that I have gone to in multiple states and locations for 45 + years.

Went there for a friday dinner so expectedly there's more people around. This place used to be another thai restaurant that we went before but now its thai chili pepper. Good reviews in yelp so we gave it a try and allow us to give  a blow by blow review. We went in and there are a couple of vacant tables, the staff is no where to be seen so we waited.  A staff showed up but seems we were a ghost and just passed by us without acknowledgement. One staff saw us but just looked at us so we asked, table for two pls? Only then she pointed us to a table. Waited for 15 minutes before one came to take our order. We ordered yum duck, tom yum, pad thai and thai tea. Took 40 minutes. Ok, with so many take out orders via bite squad, we patiently waited and expected a freshly cooked and hot meals to be served. Nope, its surprisingly luke warm food. The pad thai is ok, tom yum soup tasted some like with some powder mix, and the yum duck has some anchovee taste. I like anchovee but its weird and made it salty for me. While dinning, we saw 3 sets of customers came in, seated, waited for a while, staff passing through them but not attending, then they left. This establishment needs to revisit their process. I think their food appeals to a number of customers mostly via delivery of Bite Squad but not for dine in customers. Hopefully they are better in some other hours of the day but definitely their staff and kitchen are not stacked up to handle a lot of customers and sadly they might start losing them.

The pizza is good most of the time, you have to call ahead and pick it up if you want it warm otherwise it's delivered almost cold and the delivery time is too long. Pizzas have gotten much smaller and more expensive, I've been going elsewhere!

As a woman traveling by myself I did not feel welcomed here. Previously the blond behind the bar has been very hospitable but the brunette tonight NEVER Acknowledged me! I finally had to cancel my order and ask for the check (in a very nice, subtle way). She just threw it down without saying "thank you" or even "here you go". I walked back to my hotel feeling very disrespected. As a professional woman I want to feel the place in inviting and friendly, I did not feel that way tonight. If you're a WOMAN TRAVELING ALONE DO NOT GO TO THIS BAR/RESTAURANT. I often travel to Philly, but will never come back here. 

hopefully this helps the next one

Long wait for absolutely no reason .. Came for stitches for my son and still here after three hours in this deserted hospital. The worst hospital ER around. Save yourself some frustration and go somewhere else.

Worst service.... Had my child server said you can't have the stroller here we moved... He said you can't have it here.... We said well where then he said I don't know you just can't have it where you had it.. No resolution... Asked for manager he attempted to get another employee....I said that's not the manager get the manager! He finally did.. Manager said I have no problem with where you had the stroller.... We left....2nd bad experience at the chain... I'm done....

Went here last night for dinner with my boyfriend and were excited to try it based on reviews. We were celebrating and wanted some pasta. We made a reservation and were seated promptly. The restaurant itself is cozy and only seats a small handful of tables which makes it good for smaller groups or dates. 

I ordered a glass of wine and my boyfriend got an Italian beer that was carbonated? It was bubbly so we both found that interesting. We ordered bruschetta to start and it was okay- the tomatoes were somewhat mushy and cut fairly large and didn't have any balsamic on it which is normally how I eat it. Then the waitress brought out the complementary pasta salad which was awesome and honestly my favorite part of the meal. I would ordered that stuff alone and eat a full bowl. They also brought out our salads, which again were just okay nothing special. We opted out of the complementary bread because we just ate bread with our bruschetta (this is important for later). 

The waitress brought out our entrees a few minutes after we finished our salads. My boyfriend ordered shrimp scampi and I ordered pollo primavera. Both dishes were served hot and smelled great. Our waitress brought our Parmesan and red pepper flakes. We both took a bite of our dishes and decided it needed a little kick. My dish had better flavor than my boyfriends but the broccoli in my dish was extremely over cooked and mushy. The chicken was slightly dry and I didn't eat much of it. My boyfriend's scampi was very bland and tasted mostly of butter and nothing else. He also barely ate any of his shrimp because he said it tasted freezer burned and awful. A few bites in we both decided that we'd like to have the complementary bread with our pasta so we asked our waitress if we could have it with our dinner. She brought it out a few minutes later and both my boyfriend and I took a slice and realized it was still cold in the middle. I know we asked for it at a funny time, but asking for the bread to be warm or at least room temperature seems a little crazy to me. It was surprising and disappointing considering that you are spending $15-$20 a plate for cold bread. At the end of the meal my boyfriend had a few pieces of uneaten shrimp that he didn't want to finish or save. I did take a box home with my leftover pasta. 

Our bill ended up being a little over $60 which would've been worth it if our entrees and bruschetta had been better. Probably won't be back due to the food not being worth the price tag. Would rate this a 2.5/5 if that were an option but can't justify 3 stars. 

Overall Pros: pasta salad is excellent that they serve before your meal and service is prompt and friendly. 

Overall Cons: food honestly- bland, over cooked and freezer burned.

Made a reservation days in advance, still had to wait over 30 minutes. Ridiculous. The food wasn't even that good. I would trust this business to follow through with a reservation, and look at another restaurant in the area

What a SCAM of a "business." DONT DO IT!!! About a month after ordering $80 worth of cigars we decided to order again. As I'm on the phone about a question I'm told I need to go through "age verification" because it's my first time ordering. Well if you read the above correctly you'll see that I in fact ordered one time before without this mythical "age verification." I agreed to go through "age verification" and that consisted of the very confused sounding customer service agent reading my address back to me. 

Not 3 hours later customer service calls back and tries to essentially trick me into buying a monthly box of cigars. They made it seem like something was wrong with my current order, asked me what type of cigars I liked and not 5 seconds later I was told it would be like $180 a month. The audacity!!! If I see 1 penny on my credit card bill from them that I did not authorize, they better pray they got some good lawyers on hand.

These types of people are what's wrong with this country. Tricking and scamming people into buying your product because you can't sell without it. I'm thoroughly disgusted and I wholeheartedly regret sending my money to you in the first place. When every response to a negative yelp review is "we apologize for the inconvenience we've caused you" you might want to rethink your business practices. 

I will NEVER ever ever buy cigars and accessories from here ever again and I urge you to do the same. Find somewhere reputable, because this is not it.
Went at 7 pm.  Only 1 other man in the restaurant eating when I got there.  The food was mostly old and hard.  I will not go back.  I'm amazed this place can afford the rent here.

Took our car to this store for a simple oil change. Got it home and noticed a few oil stains in the driveway. I looked under the car and oil was all over the bottom of the car.  Took it back and they guy said it had a stripped oil drain plug. They stripped it!
Said our next oil change would be free. Charged $80 bucks for an oil change. 
I have been doing oil changes for over 40 years and never stripped a drain plug. I will not be going back and would not take my lawn mower to this place. 
That is just not taking the time to do the job right. It could have cost us an engine and now we have oil stains on our driveway. Thanks Firestone.

Not only did the busgirl/hostess take my wine away when it still had a sip or two in it, but out of the 4 things we ordered, I would say 1 had flavor - the lamb meatballs. The "crispy" gnocchi was soggy and resembled canned pork & beans. The spaghetti was slightly over cooked and lacking in taste, I actually left half behind which I never do with pasta. The grilled asparagus had to have been frozen. Possibly the kind from Trader Joe's that comes with grill marks already on it. I wanted to like this place because the location is great and the building is beautiful. But it just missed the mark for me.

My car was hit by a student driver at a parking lot. I got several estimates though the student driver was willing to pay for the repair. Caliber's price was in the middle range and the expected wait time was long (4 weeks), but I chose Caliber nevertheless because I used Caliber before and was happy with its services. 

However, my frustration started there:

- After 4 weeks of waiting, I dropped my car at Caliber. Two days later, Tom at Caliber informed me on the phone that the bumper he ordered could not support the reverse parking sensors I had on the car. He added that they were not well installed anyway. I told him they were in the right place and functioned well. 

- Since I had already waited for so long, I agreed to move on. (In hindsight, I should have backed off then.) The repair was supposed to be completed in 5 days, but the snow storm came (not their fault). One week after the storm (Day 14), there was still no update. So I called them and they simply said the car was not ready; no explanation or apology for being late or for not updating me of the situation. 

- Five more days later, they told me my car was ready and I asked for a pickup. They sent two people to drop off my car, which I was grateful for. Just before signing the paper, I noticed that the colors did not match and one side of the bumper was sticking out. I drove my car back to them, and they were not happy about it. 

- Without looking at my car, one woman came to tell me that the bumper had different reflection from they other parts. However, the bumper was not the only part they painted; they also painted the side panel, which also had a different color. Without checking the color, Tom came out to dismiss the wrong paint color but agreed to look at the mismatched part. I was about to leave my car there when he said he already sent two workers to drop off my car and that they were about to close (The time was 4:30pm. 5:30 is their close time). 

- I insisted on leaving the car there and walking home myself. Tom told me the car would be ready the next day (which is a Wednesday). Not hearing back on Wednesday, I called them again. This time Tom said they were busy and my car would be ready on Thursday. He said one of my original panels was repainted by some bodyshop (not true), as an excuse for the color mismatch. 

- On Thursday, Tom told me that he's not happy with the new painting either (guess they made the same mistake) and the car would be repainted. 

- On Friday, they called me to offer a car rental. I didn't take it because we didn't need it for the weekend. (Meanwhile, my wife had been taking Uber for her commute to work every work day for two weeks.) 

- On Monday, I called back again, only to be told that the car was not ready. So I took the rental offer. 

- Another Friday came around. Finally I was told the car was ready. The color was right this time, but the bumper still stuck out a little and none of the backup sensors worked. By then I was exhausted by the process and simply took the car.

Do not go to this place on Sunday 11-12. Two hour ordeal. Pushy patrons that cut in front of the line, long long wait to be seated and almost as long of wait for food. Food good but not worth the wait. They have lots of wait staff but are short on kitchen staff it seems.

Eh. I don't need to go back unless my husband somehow talks me into it. He said his tacos were OK. I had tamales and they just weren't good. There was hardly any cheese, nor was there much flavor. Parts of it were cold, too. Maybe it was an off day, since so many reviews of this place seem to be far more positive.

this place is garbage the hostess was so rude she literally toss the menu at me our server took forever to come and take our order our food took even longer by the time we got it the wings were freaking cold and then one of the waitress started sweeping right next to us lifting all this dirt right into our food over all bww is a place for people that are really drunk that they can't probably taste how disgusting the food is i will never ever go to a bww again

We came to this bar because our friend really liked the music but the beers are a dollar more than other places and the bartender is miserable! The place is empty besides our large group so you would think the bartender would be nicer!

The hotel itself has potential. The manager was rude. The key to the room did not work, so it took about an hour and a half to get into a room. The gave us an upgrade, and the room was next door to the one that wouldn't open, so they decided to try to fix the lock at midnight it sounded like someone was breaking into our room. We asked for soap and were given 1 small bar. Only 1 elevator worked for 15 floors in a hotel that was 98% to its capacity. It was only a one night stay,  but it was miserable. I won't be back.
Only come here if your starving. The Food tastes terrible. The Service is hit or miss. Idk what they do with the chicken but it tastes like rubber.
I'm  standing in Target right by 4 team members in the men's department and they must be too busy to help me.

I lived in Kansas City and St. Louis for most of my life, so I may be a hard critic, but I don't get how this place has such a great rating. I had the brisket dinner and my other half got the verde burrito with pulled chicken. The chicken tasted extremely gamey; we couldn't even eat it. The mac & cheese was incredibly bland. The brisket was mediocre. The best thing I had was the fries and house bbq sauce. Their beer selection was pretty good.

Omg.  This place is last on my list now in New Orleans.  Waited forever for food to come out.  When it arrived it was cold.  I was told the special I ordered was a roasted fish with a baked potato.  When it arrived it was a grilled fish on brabant potatoes.  I asked where my baked potato was and she pointed to the cubed Brabant potatoes and tried to convince me that it was baked potato.  LOL.  I asked to speak to the manager and they never showed up.  STAY AWAY!

Went this evening 1/6/18 hungry for a pitcher of sangria and some appetizers.  The appetizers were never to be. Due to the incompetence of our server. We had the ssssssllllloooooowwwweeeesssssttttttttttt server of all time(don't remember his name). I know the weather is cold and everyone is moving slower......but c'mon, this reminded me of the iguanas in the keys that can't move when the weather is cold. Did I mention there were only 4 parties in the courtyard?   And we all had different servers?   I watched as everyone else was getting served. Their food came and went.  FINALLY....our server appeared as we were finishing our pitcher of sangria!!!!   Low and behold, the unseen had appeared!!! We got stuck with the ssssssslllllllooooooowwww one.   We just asked for check and left. So we left hungry and went and ordered pizza!!!!   
Retrain Or fire this guy!!!!

Welcome to the land of soulless hipsters! We used to love this place. Not so much anymore. This used to be a nice and welcoming place. Now, there is basically no service anymore, you have to pick your silverware, order at the counter. If you happen to show up with a stroller, nobody will give a f*ck and help you get a high chair. Today the options for lunch were soup + salad + grilled cheese (melted cheese on a toast) + another "tartine" + a cheeseburger + falafel. There was no cheeseburger anymore. How difficult is it to purchase some extra ground meat when it happens to be super bowl parade day??? So no cheeseburger. So no real option if you feel hungry. This place should be called starving pigeon guys! I got the falafel. And then I was sick for the whole afternoon. And then you feel like
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tj_hT7vrJd8

I am an IHG Spire Elite member who spends 150 nights a year in hotel rooms. This is the worst hotel in the United States for its price. Here are the highlights:

1. No room service for a week. At one point I was calling the Front Desk, Manager and Guest Services every hour seeking an update on when I could get towels or the room cleaned, nobody answered or returned messages. Not once. So if you aren't willing to wake up at 7 am on vacation to have your room cleaned, they won't come back. I found the cleaning lady in the hallway and was told, "I get off work in 20 minutes, I'll come back at 8 am tomorrow" (she never did). 

2. Hidden fees. The hotel implemented this orange wristband policy. Even if you had your room key and id, you couldn't enter the hotel if your name wasn't on the original reservation and you had a security wristband. My niece stays 45 minutes away and wanted to come by and visit for an hour, grab coffee and show me her recent paintings. Hotel security told her "go away or go to jail, NOW." I came down and explained she was just stopping by for an hour and they pointed to the Starbucks across the street and told us to go there, unless I wanted to purchase a security wristband for her for $100 cash only.

3. The room. I booked a Suite for the week, it was pathetic. No mini-fridge, small, dirty, and smelled like someone pissed in it if you let it get warm enough. No room changes were permitted and I was told it's "just how old hotels smell." I asked to be relocated to another IHG property in town and was told everything was booked and a refund would not be permitted. 

4. Everything was "out of order." The pool, the fitness room, the restaurant. Everything was closed for Mardi Gras, the hotel was nothing more than an overpriced motel 8 bed to sleep on. I've never seen a hotel use being at full capacity as an excuse for shutting everything down and treating everyone like garbage before - go to any Super Bowl or World Cup and the staff are actually happy to have a full, vibrant, hotel.

I remembered from my summer visit of this place being amazing (great sauce, great crust and fresh toppings), but just came down and was craving their pizza only to find a dry crust, no sauce and flavorless topping. Very disappointed and will need to find another spot for classic pizza taste.

Sorry for the horrible review, but had much higher expectations for a place that had never disappointed before!

I have never had such a bland tasteless combination or house friend rice. Its obvious they didnt put any efford making this. The house lo mein was also horrible!! I will definitely not order food from this place anymore.

Waited 35 minutes for food order to be taken then another 1 hour and 15 minutes for a personal pizza to arrive at the table. SERVICE FAILURE.  the pizza sauce used to be great,  but now they've added "heat" and it's too spicy. FOOD FAILURE.  Dont bother going to magpies, it's not worth it.

They messed up my simple order of beef Enchalada with lettuce on the side by giving me pork or chicken (I couldn't identify the meat) and what looked like extra lettuce. Taste was off and the Salsa was too hot to enjoy as well. I only give 2 stars because my boyfriend really enjoyed his taco/burrito combo. Price was cheap. You get what you pay for.

The mama's special pizza is so good, and so fine. But if you buy from mama's, never buy the pizza Verde, even if you are on an extreme diet or a vegetarian.
It didn't have some of the veggies on it that the menu stated, and it only had about 1oz of cheese, in total. I am disappointed, Mamas. You may want to take  this item off the menu, because it is really a waste of $20.00 when I expected a meal.

We booked a room for my birthday. Unfortunately after I already was booked I read the reviews and found out how dirty this place was. After calling Expedia which I booked through and the hotel many times no one would refund me my money. I spoke to the manager and again she told me there was nothing she could do, even after I told them about the bed bug issue I found in the reviews. This is a complete scam hotel DO NOT book here. I will be calling the health department on this place !! I have no idea how this place had 3/5 stars on Expedia !! I understand having a no refund policy on certain situations, but when your business is accused of bed bugs there should be a refund or some kind of proof and reassurance that the place is up to code. Im totally disappointed and disgusted at the customer service with the business!

Unfortunately I have gone at least three times now before five o'clock and they have been completely out of Paleo donuts. This is especially annoying in Nashville where it takes a long time sitting in traffic just to get there and be disappointed. Also when going with friends getting regular donuts I have had to sit and watch them enjoy their delicious treats. It would be great if they could increase the amount of plaeo donuts they make to reflect demand. If this has happened to me at least three times five hours before their listed closing time of 10pm then it has to happen to others often.

Horrible!  I hired them to take some junk to the dump.  They took it a few streets over and dumped it in someone's driveway, then pocketed the money for the dump.  

The neighbor called the police and then I was called.

The owner then explained that he asked the crew how they took it to the dump so fast and they told him they dumped the junk in a place they normally dump it. Obviously, he didn't reprimand them for randomly dumping it until I called him back and complained.

The owner promised me a refund for all the stress caused by the incident and though I followed up to ask when I was getting the refund numerous times during the next few weeks, I never did get it.

Don't waste your time and money.  Hire a honest and professional junk removal service.

Slow service, weak drinks,
And no air conditioning.
I vote you skip it

We had an arranged trip for 7 people for both arrival and departure two months prior to our trip in Ft Myers. The first shuttle driver kept texting someone from his phone, I was concerned because it was at night and he was driving through a construction zone. I felt unsafe. Our original destination had changed and we had confirmation of the change, but the driver did not. He nearly brought us to the wrong location. 

Our return trip driver - who was early and very professional and friendly - did not know we had 7 to transport and we had to make secondary arrangements or nearly half of us could have missed our flight! I would not recommend this service in the future. Clearly there is a lack of important details between logistics and the information the drivers get.
Usually one of my favorite places. But not this time. They took an hour to bring me out a glorified ham sandwich. Not cool at all.

My husband and I went for a couples Swedish massage. Before we went, I checked into whether the business was registered with the State. It is. But there is no way the individual massage therapists my husband and I had were licensed. I get massages often and realize that each massage and each therapist is different. But this was just wrong start to finish. 

I had exactly the opposite experience of many reviewers. My massage was WAY TOO HARD. And I like a really firm pressure on my massages. He never asked me any questions about medical history or preferred pressure. I had to twice tell him he was hurting me. And the rest of the time I just tried to tolerate it. I was sore for 4 days after a "Swedish" massage (not deep tissue, which can sometimes leave you sore). That was not even remotely similar to a Swedish massage. I don't know what it was. And some of the massage "techniques" were just bizarre. I decided not to detail them all because they were so ridiculous I was afraid people wouldn't believe my review. I was confused through most of my massage. The one good thing I can say is that he was very respectful in always making sure I was covered up.

My husband's massage experience was similar, but without the pain. When the "massage therapists" left the room, he looked at me and said WTH was that?

We did not have the "up-sell" experience that others posted about. No one tried to get us to spend more money on the current massage. They did however offer us a discounted pre-purchase of our next massage. Uh, no thank you. We did have a Groupon and had to pay the $5.60 tax as others mentioned. But I didn't feel that we were treated any differently because of the Groupon. The therapists never told us their names, but the ratty envelopes that were presented to us for tips said "Owen" and "Suu."

The app was malfunctioning and there was clearly a coupon that would not pull up. The app didnt work on 2 different phones, so I was told to delete the redownload the app and still didn't work.  I reluctantly still paid full price which was the reason for this post. Burger was good, but sundae was melted. Give employees some empowerment

We stopped in for an early breakfast before a flight home. They didn't have tables big enough to accommodate our party and weren't willing to assist with accommodating our party. The server was less than welcoming, more like we inconvenienced her. They had lots of rules, where the chairs could be placed, where children could sit, etc. food was decent and prices were average.

Beautiful hotel setting, great pool too. Unfortunately the staff is unfriendly and not accommodating at all. For the money, you'd expect families to be welcomed and staff to be friendly, this isn't the case. We tried three times to get into the restaurant (Carrettas) and still were not able to get a reservation-the hostess was short and not friendly or apologetic in the least bit. The marketplace (coffee stand) in the lobby was staffed by only one person who wasn't happy to be there or friendly-she was stressed out and seemed shocked when I tipped her and thanked her for being there in the morning-it was obvious she was overworked and unhappy. Even the hotel general manager (who'd you'd expect to go over the top with customer service) seemed too arrogant to help guests and rolled his eyes when we asked a question. We'll gladly take our money elsewhere next time and not be visiting again.

Ordered delivery it arrived cold 30 minutes early. How is that possible. Shoulda been steaming arriving at 5:30 when I asked for it at 6. Good thing I was home or it would have been frozen by 6. Give me my 7.50 dollar tip and 2.50 delivery charge back!

Took 2 and a half hours to deliver on a weekday.. sent me a free pizza coupon in mail to make up for it. Made order for new free pizza. Which cost me $3 with extra topping plus tip. When they showed up told me I owed $21 because I called in and asked for a couple extra pepperchini on the side. (They already give anyways just wanted a couple more) then the employee said no you actually called in twice changing order... I asked for an extra packet of red pepper spice lol when I called back in. So charge me full price now for a free pizza plus tip! Never again will I order from here

Delicious pastry but none worth the attitude. The place is beautiful as are the people who work there and their pastries. But, there's an air of pretense which makes me avoid the place. However, a friend loves their macaroons so on occasion I go in for a hostess gift. I try not to.

Just a little advice...if someone calls to get information and request a service, it's probably not best to tell them that "you have a VERY loyal clientele and will pass their number along to the next person if any appointments become available." Thanks for your concern with my business, I'll take it else where.

This is by far the worst Burger King ever. We ordered through the drive through and of course they messed up our order. We asked for no onions so we go back to get our order corrected. The guy preparing the burgers apologized and made them again. I'm thinking everything is okay. They still put onions on my burger once again.. then didn't give us our fries. I have no clue who manages this place but it's completely horrible. I will never return here. The staff is unprofessional and rude as hell for no apparent reason. If you don't like the food industry then you shouldn't work there. Period! If I could give this place 0 stars I definitely would. I never seen such rude people in my life. And appearance is everything. They all looked liked they rolled outta bed. Smh. Poor poor poor service.

Came for lunch Monday. After ten minutes with no menu finally got our own. Waitress looked at me three times and never came to our table. After 15 minutes we left. Manager was eating at the bar and did not try to help the two waitresses out. Oh and putting the menus under your arm pits is pretty gross. Saw this every time they went to the tables.. Called to complain and Sarah said she'd pass it on to the owner. Yeah right

Dirty Room! Horrible service. Tried many times for resolution. Housekeeping, front desk, management...no one seems to care at this hotel! Did encounter one great bellman...other than that, RUN from this hotel!

I got a chai latte. It was decent, overpriced and really sweet. The girl at the counter was very grumpy. Also no WiFi, and they were playing very loud rock music the whole time. Not my ideal place to enjoy coffee with someone and definitely not a good place to do work or homework!

Manager is a turd, waited for 15 minutes in the parking lot after we were parked, Turd came out after I called at the 15 minute mark... After turd took my time stamped receipt, he took another 9 minutes

Very disappointed with this nail salon. Walked in on an empty Wednesday night with only two people getting their nails done. I was not greeted, and when the lady asked me what I wanted it was so quiet I could hardly hear. After the customer told me what she was saying I told her I would like a gel manicure. The nail technician told me to pick a color, so I did and then I sat down and waited. I waited for 20 min, no one told me how long the wait was or anything so I just left. Very unprofessional and annoying experience. 100% would not recommend!

This holiday inn was way over priced for its location and amenities! There are a few fast food places nearby and a Cracker Barrel but other than that you would have to drive a bit to find anything . The continental breakfast begins at 6:30 a.m. which I felt was a little late for travelers.  The hotel was clean enough but decor was just average and it had an odd smell. I'd opt for another location next time I'm traveling that way.
Placed an order to go and the man who answered the phone cursed at me a few times and then laughed I will never order from this place again.
Not real creole food. Mediocre service . Good bartender though ( she looks like Ellen lol ) stay away from the itty bitty crab cakes and pasta ‍

I would give negative stars. The employees at this establishment are incapable of doing anything. They close at ten but google says they are open 24hrs, even the window does. But when their friends come thru the drive thru, they can serve them. The employees are disrespectful and will treat you like you are stupid. They also NEVER get orders right. NO ONIONS MEANS NO ONIONS ASSHOLES.

Worst barbeque west of China.  I had a chicken bbq with suasage sandwich.  The chicken was dry and flavorless and the sausage was cold.  My partner had a brisket sandwich  and did not know it was flooded with cheese whiz.  I would not recommend this place to my dog.

Very bad service after care. Said warrantee (5 years I think )  on the tables if it cracks, or crack on chair and sofa. (Less than a year )But when tech came and tried to repair it. But he couldn't and just left. When I called, they said some one is working on it, but never get it done.  

I actually receive the letter from a attorney office want me to be part of the court, I think Kane furniture owners nationwide gather together and sue Kane's, they have has issues with product that only last a couple of years and Kane's don't provide service even with warrantee. It's like a scam to me. Hope it helps.

This place is terrible!! They are always out of half their food by 1:30pm.  I have been here 5 times, but only eaten here once, because all they ever have is some of their sandwiches.  They never have their salads and very rarely have pizzas.  If it's not already premade that day, the staff says they don't have it.  Staff is very rude to customers!

My dog was throwing up and had diarrhea so I brought them here because it was Thanksgiving of course. It took me 15 minutes to get greeted- they got his weight then put me in a room in about 15 minutes later came in and took his temperature in his vitals and then I didn't see another person for an hour. Add to time there were two cars in the parking lot when I left there was only one - mine. I went out into the waiting room and start hollering in trying to find anyone for another 15 minutes in there wasn't anybody.  Worst service ever- This is an emergency hospital and my could have dog died in the waiting room- and no one would've known
Only tried here once...the restaurant is nice I must say.....but the food was horrible. This was in 2015...so idk if they changed chefs over time but when I tried I actually waisted my 50.00.

Literally the worst service of my entire life. Went for wing Wednesday with 5 friends. Wings took over an hour and a half... for the first plate to come out and cold. The order came out wrong and one plate at a time. After the third plate we said we didn't want to wait any longer and asked for the manager. When we spoke to the manager about the service she was incredibly rude. Wouldn't take any food off of our bill until we argued about it. Safe to say none of us will ever go back.
Stopped by as a walk-in Monday at 4pm. Sign said it was open but door was pad locked. Make sure to call before you come to make sure they are still in business.

After having seen this bakery on tv I was excited to try it. The items are pricey, but considering the wholesomeness, I was willing to try a few things. I was just here and waited for several minutes for someone to come help me. There was someone on the phone in the back and I know she saw me, but she never offered to help me, even after I stood still by the register. Consequently, I left, keeping my money in my pocket.

Worst customer service. We waited for 1 hour 20 minutes to get the food, we did not get our order after 1 hour 20 minutes also, when we went and asked the manager for the food, his response was very rude. He said "If you are not able to wait patiently, get the hell out of here". This is the worst restaurant i have ever gone.

If you are in a hurry and on your way to work this is NOT the place to go.  Visited on weekends and same lackadaisical attitude.  Hire more people and teach them speed and accuracy.  The hassle is not worth the $5 breakfast sandwich.

Not really happy with the new "ocean friendly, no straw policy"....  this totally ruins the Mai Tai experience. We are locals and have been going there for years. Consider this, who wants to sip the float of dark rum off top, and I personally like to squeeze the orange and lime slice into my drink and then stir it all together before taking the first sip! BRiNG back the straws.... paper and the cheap biodegradable are options!! 

Aloha & Cheers!!

Came here on the soft opening... I was pretty optimistic however after our visit I doubt I will be back. I have worked in hospitality so I am pretty patient but this was in my opinion horrible. 

1. Food runner delivered our chips and salsa to the table beside us. They didn't have a menus, waters, or a server so in my opinion I found it pretty apparent it wasn't for them. 
2. Our food was also delivered to a table of 6 people with only 2 entrees. At this point my boyfriend spoke up and yelled "hey I think that's our food". After he had already sat the food on the table. 
3. WE FOUND A RUBBER BAND IN OUR BEANS. ( taking a bite of rubber with our food.. delicious ) 
4. Once we mentioned it to our waiter which again it's a rubber band okay I get it. I'm not completely appalled but the fact a manager never came to apologize after it was reported by the server made me pretty furious. It's your soft opening so customer service is everything. 
5. Bill time! We got a whopping $1 discount LOL. Why even give a discount it's only for a dollar. Hey, thanks manager 
 
Margaritas were decent but ...... that's it.

We came here for the UFC fights and have been sitting here on the patio for over a half an hour with no service.  We tried to go to the bar and they won't let anyone use the bar because  there is a private party where there is no one here.  My wife asked a waitress for service and she said someone would be tight with you.  That was 20 minutes ago.  Worst service we've had downtown in 5 years.

Dimmitt has been sending me letters wanting to buy my Cadillac for years.  Over-and-over these letters keep coming with promises of how they need the car, will pay more than it is worth, etc.

Well, the time finally came to sell the car.  It is a pristine, exceedingly low mileage, Cadillac, fully loaded with options.  Certainly a car that will fly off a used car lot, particularly a Cadillac lot.  Heck, Dimmitt has been chasing me for years to get their hands on this car.

I set up an appointment and am told to see a specific Sales Manager.  I go in and ask for him.  Well, in spite of having this meeting set up just 30 minutes earlier, he seems to be MIA.  So, I'm handed off to a "flunky" who then proceeds to hand me off to yet another person down the ladder.

About this point I am realizing they are clueless on why I am there.  They never asked any clarifying questions, simply went off based on what I told them to track down a Cadillac with my specs for me to pick up that day!?  An example of they assume and don't actually connect with their customer.

When they couldn't find said car on their lot, they then came back and asked why I was there.  Duh, I have this appointment, like I told you, with this Sales Manager who is MIA apparently, for him to buy my Cadillac.  Oh, well then bottom of ladder person can go away as the "flunky" will handle it now...

As an aside, the only person in this whole mix who actually had any integrity and customer service skills was that guy at the bottom of the food chain.  Sad that leadership and management at Dimmitt are all sizzle and no meat.

Well, to cut this story short, the offer was an embarrassment, so low no one would have taken it.  So much for Dimmitt wanting my Cadillac and being willing to pay extra for it.  A low ball offer, without explanation, and a cheap attempt to put pressure on me by printing the offer on a fake check to make it look like I could run out and cash said fake check.

Dimmitt needs to work on integrity; customer service; and treating people as solid human beings who work for a living and want and deserve a fair deal.  Instead Dimmitt appears to be all sizzle; fancy showrooms; more staff than you can count; the appearance is what they worry about and what they focus on, and the substance is not there.

Go to another dealer!

I was pleased to hear that a non veg Indian restaurant had open up in Carrollwood.  I had heard good things about it.  After trying it....I have to say I had a mixed experience.  Bottom line is the food is good but the service is terrible.  The naan and lamb rogan josh was very good.  Butter chicken was a bit bland but not bad.  We also had a dhaal which was very good.  All in all I would recommend the food.  Unfortunately I can't say the same for the service.  Upon entrance, we were greeted by a stone faced man who clearly didn't seem happy to be there.  They only had one server besides this host for the first hour were there.  And this was around 7 on a Saturday !.  The host and one server were running around trying to serve like 7-8 tables.  Why they wouldn't hire extra servers on a Saturday is beyond me .  It took ages for a server to come and ask what we would like to drink .  I ordered a beer and waited forever.  I finally had to ask the server to come over to remind him to get my beer.  They don't write down the order so we got wrong type of naan and were missing side dishes.  The people who work there don't smile and are not friendly and are clearly over worked.  This kind of negates the good food for me. This is a simple fix on the part of the owners of this establishment in my opinion.  Hire more servers .  Train them to write down the orders and to be friendly.

I shop at sprouts 3-4 times per month for my family. That being said- there have been some issues with long wait ( i am only one at deli counter) at deli- too many times they do not have the sides for the take-out chicken special. This most previous experience left us so frustrated - I could not understand how on earth the Manager there is not fired for complete and utter poor attitude and rudeness. All i can say is WOW, this man is not nice! In dairy out of every item on my list- ok it happens. We were in chip/snacks aisle, I noticed a lady moving stuff on shelves and asked her if she ever tried a snack I was choosing- she abrupted replied , I don't eat any sugar and pushed past us. I said oh that wasn't what I was asking, i was just wondering (POOF SHE WAS GONE). I get to health and beauty looking for 3 items, i see an open door with someone at a computer, there are at least 4 other customers in the dept... I push on searching and find one item but it looks 'bad' 'old' discolored' , I search for second item ( i had gotten a sample of a while back and then third item i cannot locate either. i am standing looking like a lost puppy and 2 employees walk right past as I am saying excuse me & ignore me. I go to check out and ask for manager.  A man comes out angry from the get- i attempt to explain about the lady is snacks , his response well shes in grocery so what does that have to do with health and beauty? and he gets angrier as I am trying to show him the 'old' 'discolored item and asking of there is someone to help to which he gets even more mad stating she is training, TRAINING while customers are WAITING- and he makes no mention or apology but basically gets someone and walks away - thsi SOMEONE walks up to me and say ' I AM IN SO MUCH PAIN WHAT IS IT YOU WANT'' , I am takem aback- if someone is ill they should not be complaining to customers right off the get or could be sent home for sick day- didnt understand that- while the manager COULD have just helped best he could. She has no idea what I am talking about even tho I am showing her photos- to which one she says oh must be out & walks away. At thsi point we are totally fed up- we get in line and the cashier is nice at first- but i am mad and tho i am not shouting I AM COMPLAINING abotu the managers actiosn and rudeness- so NOW she gets an attitude towards me and my hubby and says 'sorry you had troubles , and he is .. the stops herself and I guess its all bad' I state its not her fault and  now shes angry and says ' oh well thanks for telling me its not my fault and shakes her head at me. I believe that the manager there whose attitude is just anger, rude and not customer friendly is shedding down onto his employees- NO ONE there was happy. I am about to quit shopping here- I spend hundreds of dollars a month here and this is how I am treated.  Also the lady in pain was like peeking out at us at checkout from behind an end cap - we noticed it and it was very strange- wasn;t she supposed to be at a computer in her so called "TRAINING" with literally 40 customers in the store shopping- very busy there at times on Sundays! I did leave with forgetting items I wanted bc I was so frustrated at the attitudes of those employees/manager we encountered on our trip- when ya go to whole foods if you see an employee they alwasy ask if you are finding everything ok- and if they cant help they hunt down someone FOR YOU to help. Sprouts customer service is terrible

Tiny servings, probably because I was close to their closing time. First Mexican restaurant I've ever been to where they charge extra for chips and salsa. Got the taco and enchilada lunch special, very basic, nothing impressive about this experience. The taco trucks in Cali blow this place away. Verde salsa was ok, had good spice, that's the only reason i have it 2 stars.

Everyone was so rude here. I work at a Starbucks and if I acted the way they did I would have been fired a long time ago! It was only 9:30 am and no one was in there...it was like we were bothering them by being there.

Every time I visit this Starbucks, I'm disappointed.  Today, it was so loud I couldn't read the newspaper.  Staff was vacuuming the food case - so they turned up the music to hear it - then had to speak to one another so loud that it was impossible to think.  This store needs new management.  I generally avoid it, but it was  the location I needed today.

Wow! Wish I would have read these first. Spent 1000s of dollars with this store. My 315 desk chair started to flake off. It was leather. I went back they said there is nothing they can do. Really Kane's? They showed me new chairs and said I would have to pay full price. Manager after manager said nothing could be done. I was really disappointed in this. It was no way to treat a customer. There are lots of other furniture stores close by. Not a wise move but I see this is how this store rolls. Good bye Kane's. Doing business like this your days are numbered.

My group of over girlfriends (over the age of 40) went because we live in the burbs and felt like getting dressed up and pretending we were 25 for a night and enjoy their Saturday "80's / 90's music" night.  

Overall the place was about how we expected - loud, full of people way younger than us, but the vibe was pretty good.  

The reason I'm giving this review 2 stars is because there was no 80's/90's music and what they played was just not that good.  we tried to make the best of it, but left after an hour or so and ended up at some tiny bar a few blocks away that was playing 80's/90's music and we danced like crazy.  I see no reason to go back to Concourse.

Horrible experience. We went to the new location on eagle road. We waited for 30 minutes before our food came and it was cold and she gave us the wrong order. So if that's not bad enough I told the server that we would not be coming back, I wasn't mean or yelling, I just camly said we won't be back. So a few minutes later one of the managers a female came to our table and looked very angry and pissed off at me. Hmm...what happened to the customer did nothing wrong but wanted a hot breakfast....she then proceeded to scold me for the next 5 minutes that her server is new and how dare I speak up. It was my fault that they were in a new location and I got the new server. I had to stop eating and let my food get colder to make eye contact as she continued to chew me out for complaining about my food being cold and bringing out the wrong order to me. It was the most bizarre thing I have ever experienced. My husband was so embarrassed for her behavior towards us. I have never been treated so rudely anywhere. Oh and the last thing she did after she ranted and raved for 5 minutes was slam our check on the table and said I  comped your meal, then she stormed off. I was so embarrassed that I couldn't eat another bite and we just left. Worst restaurant experience ever

Honestly I'm not a big reviewer because i hate talking badly about places. I picked up my order today excited because they were the #2 pick for me. The service was great, everyone was so nice. The food however... not so much.

I ordered the Pork Dumplings that I saw pictures of all over that looked delicious. I didn't even get those, I got normal steamed dumplings. They were OK - a little starchy but the pork inside was good. 
I also got the crab wontons. They were awful. Whatever they use to fry is just bad. It had an OVERWHELMING fishy smell; to the extent of after the first bite i couldnt take it anymore.
And then to the honey walnut chicken... i had such high hopes for it. But again, whatever they fry it in is god awful. It was too mushy and it tasted like fish (???? It's chicken???) 
I wouldnt recommend. I spent $35 for awful food

Their service sucks!!!!  I discontinued our phone because it rarely worked. Every time we have gone to turn our tv on in reno, we get Netflix, Amazon, etc but no television that we pay for. I was on hold for 25 minutes. No human being. Hung up and called back and I have been on hold for 10 min. I'm trying to find out if the outage is in Maui or Reno.   If, when I had my company, if I operated my biz like this I KNOW I would have no business.  I guess I'll start looking for a new providet

We came during a shift change and with waiters standing all around our server was over 20 minutes late and we were made to wait for Shay. Out going server seeing keeping us abreast of the situation, went ahead and took our appetizer order. This is a novelty restaurant with high prices and ordinary grilled food.  Burger ordered medium had no pink in it -- overcooked.  $12.50. Not for a discriminating pallet.

Ordered online for the most part the order was correct except both sandwiches weren't toasted no pickles on the side even though that was under special instructions and no cheese on a steak and cheese sandwich. Reading all the text on a online order is something that needs to be looked into. The last time I was here the customer service was something to be desired so I thought ordering online I would just walk in and pick up my order but they got they got the order wrong in the end anyway.

This place sucks.  We called ahead to be sure we could play and were told there would be no problem.  We got there 45 mins later, only to go though getting cards for 15 minutes.  When we asked where we'd be playing the guy who "booked" us said we would have to wait at least 4 hours.

"Why 4 hours?" We asked.  ""Well, the parties that reserve lanes usually find it's so much fun they extend their time."

"Feel free to hang out in our lounge" (and get further gouged by overpriced food and drink). 

That's what I call lame.  Don't waste your time and blood pressure on this corporate jackhole.
No.  I ordered online. There was no connection between the pizza I order and what I received other than they were both circular, included cheese and red sauce.

This hotel is pretty...comfortable beds, good location. HOWEVER, I've never had such poor customer service in all my years of traveling around the world. My husband and I had a 3 night stay at this location and had issues every day we were there. Our first day, we left our room around 10:00 a.m. and did not return until 8:00 p.m. Once we got to our room, we found our door bolted OPEN! No telling how long it had been like that. We went to our room phone to call the manager on duty, but our phone didn't work. So we had to back down to the lobby to tell someone about what had happened. When we spoke to the manager on duty, he told us to go check and ensure nothing was missing and that he'd meet us in our room in a few minutes. He never showed up. The next day, we arrived back to our room to find things in our suitcase not as we left them and NO towels in our bathroom (for the second time), and our phone still not working. Once again, we complained to the manager on duty, and got an apology and a promise he would "conduct an investigation" into what happened. The next day, we asked to speak with the new manager on duty, Nicole. The front desk clerk went into Nicole's office to let her know we needed to speak with her. When the front desk clerk came back out, she said Nicole wanted to know why we wanted to talk to her. We said we had some issues with our room we needed to discuss with her. She went back to Nicole and told her--once she returned, she said Nicole would be right out. Nicole was evidently too busy to come speak with us. We waited in the lobby for more than 15 minutes for her to come out of her office, but had to leave to catch our flight. I'm disgusted by this hotel's lack of concern for their customers and their safety. DO NOT BOOK at this hotel. THEY don't care about your safety or any of your concerns. NO concessions were offered to my husband and I for all the BS we went through because of their staff.

Well my first life used to always be in kitchens. 
I got one large King Leon Pizza.  The sauce is very tasty and they use a good cheese. That's all. 

The crust is hard and very bland. 
Meatball is the highlight and there was only 1 piece of meatball per slice of pizza. It  was an 8 slice pizza. About 2 ounces of meatball per slice of pizza.  On top the meatball is only located in one spot. Great ingredients but at the end it's a pizza. The highest cost for the pizza are the proteins then the cheese.  

The crust was lacking any salt  and it was cooked long enough that the crust became cardboard. I would be as happy for pizza from Blaze or Dominos.  
Especially at $28 dollars!!!!

The good:   Awesome tacos,  if you like Taco Bell tacos you'll love these.  

The bad:  what's up with all the hot sauces, almost 20 types, too many to choose from, and they don't event go with the type of food offered.   You don't have many other choices of good eats here.

Came here on my birthday, 11/11. I really wanted to love this place. Really. It had a great feel to it and an upstairs, outdoor balcony with tons of TV's? What's not to love, right? We were the first on the balcony and I bought drinks on the way out there. We found our table and watched the end of the soccer match prior to NFL starting. Great start! Perfect weather. Then, more people came and received service from what appeared to be wonderful staff. My wife and I waited, no service. More and more people came, sitting at tables next to us receiving service. Us? Not a server to be had. I finally waived one down, asking for the tv to be changed (needed a remote) and he said he would be right back. Never saw him again! Needless to say, I had to get up for drinks any time we wanted one. I really, truly wanted to stay, spend my money and enjoy my birthday watching football in an amazing place, but it was not to be. When another couple joined us, they, too, did not get service. He went in and asked for a server. When she came out, she acted as we were bothering her! During the well over an hour we were there, we never did get the tv changed or orders taken. Sad, really.

I very rarely write reviews...this was a terrible place to visit.  When I arrived at the front desk, 3 rooms that just checked in were getting refunds and leaving.  It was not dirty, it was actually FILTHY!  I don't think I need to say anything else.

I only have a star because I have too and the people at least women there were nice. But the fact u try n overcharge and change they price u said for something I didn't even want originally because you don't know how to do it is beyond me. And the job u did isn't even that good They don't look like the shape type or length I asked for but u still charged extra for it. And made my nail crooked as hell and then fixed it n it still looks like shit. I WILL NEVER COME HERE AGAIN!!!

Truly appalled that as a family we have been visiting this location yearly for almost 15 years and yesterday night walked in at 945 (7 of us) to get ice cream and could instantly sense the workers were upset we were there. One worker went as far to say they had no cups to make shakes but then handed the first of our group a shake with a cup from a stack of about 50 from behind the counter. Then we attempted to add our newest (9 month old) family members name to the rest of ours which are up on the upper wall so we had a member of our family on another's shoulder and instead of being asked nicely to get down (apparently due to policy changes names can't be written up high) we were truly yelled at aggressively and rudely by a worker. He completed ignored us when we tried to explain our whole families names were up there was there anything he could do ?

The one star is for the cooks. The food was good, but the service and management were absolutely horrible. It took 20 minutes to for me and my husband to even be greeted then maybe another 15 minutes for my husband to get his orange juice. We spent about two hours there and watched as people who were seated after us eat and leave before us. Would not recommend and will not return. I was so dissatisfied I would not even order it to go because I do not want them to have another dime of my money.

This is the worst motel I've ever stayed in, and I stayed in one that didn't even have televisions for a month once. We made a reservation here because we had planned to travel with our pet. We changed our mind about bringing her, but decided to keep the reservation. We arrived at 4 pm for check in, which is supposed to be at 3pm. Meaning, with a reservation, you should be able to go to your room then. The room was not ready. In fact, it wasn't ready until 8pm.  We had to find ways to entertain a tired 9 year old for four hours. They gave us an upstairs room, despite mentioning disabilities on our reservation, so we had to climb stairs since there is no elevator. Very painful with knee issues, but at this point it would be more hassle to wait for another room. The room was requested non-smoking, but smelled like an ashtray. The casinos smell better. We had to go buy Lysol just to help with the smell. There are cigarette burns in both blankets, stains we aren't sure whether they are makeup or blood on the chair, counter and wall and the tv remote was broken. The bathtub had hair and dirt from the previous occupant, gross! The door does not close properly unless you tug it hard. The windows cannot be opened. The floor had stained on it, so we are keeping our socks on at all times. Considering they delayed our check in four hours to "clean" the rooms, it is not very clean in here at all. The front desk person was rude when we inquired about the room not being ready. On our second day, we had to get our keys reset because they canceled out our key access while we were gone, twice. Basically, don't stay here. Spend a little more for a different hotel/motel. This isn't even acceptable for a cheap motel. Horrible!

This place had so much potential. Stopped by periodically every six months or so for the last couple of years, and the deterioration of this establishment is shocking. There is actual trash on the floor and hanging off of the cabinets. Their dirty dishes bucket was overflowing to the point where nothing more could fit. The smoke alarm was beeping in need of a battery change and the bathrooms and all the cleanliness of a back alley. All of that, and the coffee took almost 20 minutes to get to us. The coffee is good, but this place needs to be a coffee truck and not a stand alone. Our last visit

Place was nice & food was good but got treated like shit. I get I am a younger (22) & so was everyone I was with but that shouldn't change how we should get treated. We are paying just like everyone else in the restaurant. Other than that it was alright

We came by for some birthday ice cream
We had butterfinger mix in, Oreo milk shake, coffee ice cream hot fudge sundae and black cherry ice cream hot fudge sundae. The mix in and shake were good. That being said my coffee sundae was given to me with nuts and no hot fudge and the blackcherry sundae also did not have   hot fudge. He did fix it when we asked about it but mine was very melted by the time I actually got to eat it. 
We will not be back for birthday ice cream.

Besides Pepperfire Hot Chicken, this place is most likely my least favorite hot chicken place. It just didn't live up to the expectation. After we got seated, we had to wait 45 minutes for our food that then came out over cooked or so bland. The nachos were underwhelming and my chicken was so dry. Friends salads were so basic and we just left feeling empty. The wait wasn't worth it. Could have been a bad day, but would not be going back to figure it out.

I'm so sad.  I love Torino and recommend it to others all of the time, 
last night, however...  Granted it was Mother's Day but we walked in at 5:45 and were told that all tables, indoors and out, were reserved.  The entire patio was empty and some tables not set and indoors there were probably 8-10 tables of varying size sitting empty with no "reserved"signs on them.  I walked out and called the restaurant and asked to make a reservation and was told there was no room.  We were kindly welcomed at another nearby spot who cleared a table for us and actually gave us a recently cleared booth inside of the only high top in the place. 

While we were waiting for,our food I went back to Torino and opened the front door.  The same indoor tables as well as every single table outside we're still empty.  Reserved and filled up, my rump!
Not impressed .The staff are not competent.Every time I go here it seems I am misinformed and have to come back the next day. But everybody is nice and they have clean restrooms.

They seem incapable of cooking a burger to order.
For dinner or lunch, I just quit coming here because they under cook my burger every time, once so bad it was still deep red and bloody.
I've met people who rave about the place, and maybe it was just me but 6 out of 6 times in 3 years I was disappointed.
Skip it. Go to Juicys or Beefys or Scoopers. Plenty of better burgers around town.

I've been to Iron Hill more times than I can remember. I remember when they had the crab quesadilla as an appetizer option which was like 10 years ago. I've been to the PA, DE and NJ locations. When in NJ I always went to the Voorhees location and never had an issue. Last night I decided to introduce a friend to the fabulousness of Iron Hill and I was craving a Santa Fe Turkey Burger and Sweet Potato fries. I decided to try the Maple Shade location and made reservations . I should have just gone to the Voorhees location.

We sat in the bar area and waited for our server as we reviewed the menu. Our server was a blonde Caucasian woman who really did not seem interested in serving us. We put our drink orders in. I asked for the cucumber raspberry drink, it was watered down. My friend asked for water with lemon and lime, she just brought her a glass of water, no ice, no lemon no lime. We should have seen this as a warning as to how the evening was going to go. I ordered the margarita on the rocks, no salt. She brings me a margarita with a salt rim. Is she even listening to us? 

We put our food order in and our appetizers come on time however we were sitting waiting 30 mins after we finished our appetizers for our food. Of course our order came out burnt and lacking. I asked for no guacamole on my burger she brings a dry burger with just bacon burger and cheese. But there are other ingredients that are supposed to be on there! At this point I had enough with the shitty service. I asked for the manager and Matt was understanding and very apologetic. 

I don't know what the issue was. We were courteous, always said thank you but this woman seemed to have an issue that I was the only black face in there and I was hanging with my Caucasian friend. As she was kind and courteous and served her other Caucasian patrons with a smile.

This restaurant is an extremely poor value. Our server was very unprofessional. We were never offered bread which was included with our meal. My wife ordered a Bacon burger which was served with zero condiments and none were ever offered. It was a poor excuse for a burger.  I ordered the sirloin and ribs. I asked for my steak to be cooked medium. My steak was prepared well done. I had to send it back and waited 15 minutes for a replacement steak.  The manager who stood off in the background the entire time, never greeted not one single guest the entire time we were there.  Overall our experience was dismal at best.  Applebee's or Chili's is a better restaurant for half the price.

Ordered from here not too long ago. Was really disappointed in the quality of food. Took nearly 2 hours. Which is fine. I understand it can be busy. But they forgot some of the order. I asked for parm and red pepper. They didn't put it in and the food was cold at arrival.

Not only was Function Coffee Labs not FUNCTIONAL they were rude. We had two separate to go cups of coffee where the lids came off spilling coffee everywhere. 
In addition to lids that didn't fit the cups, they advertised a tasting and then acted like we were crazy when we asked about it. Plus the coffee sucked.

Worst Taco Bell ever. Wait 30 minutes for food I never got, because they didn't receive on their end and wanted me to reorder it, like I paid I showed you the receipt, but they did give me my order. Also when I would ask for it they would walk away mid conversation. And the time I was there 5 people came up because there order was wrong. Also why do they say the inside closes at 12 when it doesn't.

If you are looking for friendly helpful customer service this isn't the place. However if you enjoy rude pathetic excuses from incompetent employees then you've found the right place! I wish the owner cared enough to fix it.
Very rude, it was only 5 munites. Don't go there..... boss was rude and so dont waste your money
