This place was absolutely horrible. My family just went there for what we thought would be a family fun night. Unfortunately it wasn't fun at all. We arrived at 6:00pm and were told there would be approx a 45 min wait to bowl. We attempted to get food and drinks in the meantime. The facility was short staffed and had to wait over an hour for our food and bar service was nonexistent. There was 1 bartender that was struggling to help all the customers. I had to use the ladies room and it was absolutely disgusting. There was trash all over the floor and to top it off the soap dispenser was empty. Needless to say we left at approx 8:30pm and still hadn't been called for bowling. If you are looking for a clean fun place please pass this place by.

Has management changed at the bar recently? Have always had a good time here until recently, when the bar staff has just been plain rude.  As other reviews have pointed out, don't go here and order water, it seems to break some unwritten rule.  Aside from that the piano players are good and showtunes night is fun.

So sorry I didn't read reviews before I went. I should have backed out when I saw the estimate and gone somewhere else. Outrageous price for bloodwork and Xrays, and learned nothing. After $775, told to go Banfield for fluid analysis and ultrasound, which they dont do there. Don't get conned. DO NOT GO THERE!!

We came here on a Tuesday night before a show at the grand ole opry. It was my birthday and we just wanted a quick bit before the show. There were probably 5 people in the restaurant so we expected it to fairly(I understand the service industry) quick. We got our food after about 30 minutes and the pasta was terrible. It just tasted very odd and we didn't like it. I politely ordered a side of fries and didn't mention the food because my mom was going to finish it. She decided she didn't like it either and we put our napkins on our plates waiting for the check. About 20 minutes later the waiter came back by and asked if something was wrong. Again we politely and calmly said we didn't like the food and would just like the check. At no point did either of us complain or ask for it comped. The waiter told us to hold on and disappeared again. Came back later saying he couldn't find his manager anywhere and handed us the check. The manager came up and asked if there was a problem. I just said that I did not like the food because it wasn't very good. He impatiently said "well I wish you had told me sooner" (not sure how that could've been possible) and "can I get the cook to make it differently". Calmly stated that we had a concert to get to and needed to go. He then went to the disappeared again. Eventually had to go to the bar and gave them cash so that we could make the concert. Manager proceeded to go into the kitchen literally screaming louder than anyone I've ever heard in my life. I've worked in retail and customer service my whole life. I promise I understand frustration and rude customers but this reaction was insane. I have never heard someone so loud and angry. The entire restaurant heard it and the staff looked visibly frightened. Just totally odd and inappropriate. Feel bad for the staff here.

Just ordered for the first time. The special fried rice was literally soy sauce dumped on top white rice with meat on top.  This is the WORST food ever. Just don't order from here. Tastes disgusting and I'm kind of amazed at how bad this experience is.

This place is awful.

Came here on a Saturday night with friends and ordered food. 2 hours later some people's food came out. Half the food was burnt and clearly under the lights too long. The other half never came. 

Never coming here again.

Stopped by for a wedding and decided to get a quick French manicure and pedicure. Walked in was told a few minutes wait ended up sitting for 40 min. And I guess a little untruth is fine since I didn't have an appointment. Pedicure started and I noticed the tech didn't open a fresh cuticle cutter so before he started I asked him if it was sanitized and he said "I washed it with water" DISGUSTING! He then left me sitting in the station for 25 minutes as he did someone else's nails. Of course I cancelled the pedicure and went on for the French manicure which was rushed and super messy. There was no apology from the manager or the tech. If you have diabetes STAY AWAY or take your own utensils.

Pretty awful. Actually, I can't give Chuck's a review because, even though we reserved a table at  Chuck's for 1:30 pm we were told that it's not open at that time and we'd have to eat upstairs at the bar. The menu is smaller in the bar and the waitress was awful. The steak sandwich is inedible...the steak was too tough to chew. Awful food, awful service and the view is not that good. Find a better restaurant on State Street.

Guys this place is not good. 
My husband's order: soggy bread and chewy corned beef
My order: apparently one of their signature dishes...cold Eggs Benedict that tasted of vinegar, tough fried chicken, and stale old biscuits all plated on top of some random raw spinach leaves. It was cold. S i

The service was not stellar and the floor was dirty.

The ratings on the Yelp app were not indicative of our experience or the quality of the food, which made having to pay for parking and wait forever a huge letdown. Not sure why we were so strongly mislead.

I will begin with a few positives.  There is a public parking lot.  The Bliss staff uses some single use tools on each client.  These items are handed to customers with order forms to carry to the chair as pointed.  The people are a diverse group.  The space looks neat and clean.  There is no smell of acrylic nails.  The color options were good.
  
     I am not very happy with this place.  There was NO hello or welcome. 
 "Pick color!  We pay first here" (Are they worried about having to fix a wet nail smudge.)  Other reviews mention this.  I mentioned my concern with dry skin/calluses.  I was told I must pay extra for a special service spa pedicure.  Eva did her job well.  I was not impressed with Gaby.  

     It seemed the massage at the dryer area was an extra fee, Prices were posted there, 2 other clients seemed to just tip.  This is confusing.  

     When proceeding to tip the technician.  I then saw a coffee / tea pot and empty bottle of wine with a posting nearby stating "You are welcome to a free glass of wine but be responsible."  I really would have liked something to drink especially water.  This was my first visit and no great customer service was offered.

Avoid. Avoid. Avoid. 

This is literally one of the poorest run facilities. My challenges have included being charged the wrong amount for items, the groomers being poorly trained and the grooming data system consistently losing my dog's vaccination data. 

There may be other petsmart locations which are top notch. Avoid the one at 100 Oaks. 

Pay 10% more and go to local places like Wags and Whiskers or The Dog Spot.

There is not much that is redeeming about this restaurant. The food is mediocre at best and the service is hit or miss...mostly miss. The whole place could use a good cleaning, too. The bar area is fun and lively.

I have never had such bad health care.

I had Dr Molly Wheelwright and she is the worst physician I have ever had. I had been seeing her since early 2015 and her and her receptionists could never get anything right.

First and foremost. I was on anti depressants prescribed by Molly. Molly only gave me a months worth per prescription, which is fine but she required that I take a physical every single month to get a new prescription. Even though I told her that with my job, that I do not get my schedule until 2 weeks in advance and I work 10-13 hr shifts and could not make appointments far in the future. She told me that I could take take the latest appointments and put a note that it was okay if I showed up late. Well, I would show up late to my appointments and I would get turned away and have to reschedule. And then when I show up for appointments on time, she would get to me an hour after I arrive. So I had to pay for my meds, pay for each physical per month, and pay for appointments that I did not show up on time for. So a huge money suck. I had to go off my meds because there would days or even a week gap between me running out of my meds and getting the new prescription, it was literally causing me physical pain to go through withdrawal almost every month. I told Molly this. She said the physicals were required for her peace of mind.

When I needed a referral to a sleep doctor, Molly's office first sent the request to someone who did not take my insurance. The second person they sent it to, was in the wrong city. The 3rd person they sent it to, was the second person, a second time. They finally sent it to the right person on the 4th try. What should have taken a week, took over 2 months with me hounding them because they cannot be trusted to do their job.

I had pain and instability in my knees and for months and Molly did not give me a referral until a year after my problems started. The first referral was for an XRay and a waste of time because it found nothing. The 2nd referral was for an MRI and it found that I had torn my ACL. Molly had dismissed my pain for over a year and delayed me getting treatment because of her disbelief.

When I asked to get some blood work done, I had to wait 2 months. When I got there, Molly told me it was my fault for not pushing her staff harder to get in sooner.

That same appointment I needed her to do my pap. It clearly states in my folder that I am allergic to Latex. Molly did not have latex. She then proceeded to tell me that if they could not find latex free gloves (KEEP IN MIND THAT I WORK IN HEALTH AND NO ONE HAS LATEX GLOVES! THAT ALLERGY IS SO PREVALENT THAT ALMOST EVERYONE EXCLUSIVELY CARRIES NITRILE GLOVES AND THIS IS A WOMAN DOCTOR WHO SPECIALIZES IN WOMEN'S HEALTH AND SHE DOESN'T HAVE LATEX FREE GLOVES!?!?!) that I can reschedule. It took them about 10 min to find latex free gloves.

I finally told Molly that I would be taking my health elsewhere and she called me "Murphy's Law" because everything that could go wrong with me, did. She also proceeded to start baby talking to me. I kid you not. Instead of saying, "I am sorry you had such a bad experience with me." She said (not an exaggeration), "I'm sawreey wou had a bad twime." I, nearly 30, was talked to, like a baby, by a grown medical professional.

I have never been so humiliated and belittled. 

I've told everyone I know to not go here, I hope you don't either.

After being approved for a lease on a new Wrangler Jeep at Jerry Ulm Chrysler Dodge Jeep Ram in Tampa, FL, on Friday, I received a call Tuesday from Danny Daher atthe financial Department to tell me they need for me to resign all my documents and change our agreement after I signed all the paperwork and was approved. Now mind you, I was at their facility for 6 hours negotiating and my offer was agreed upon after my credit was pulled with a tier 1 credit score. I explained to them when I sign the documents that I do not want any terms changed and hidden fees added. I read all the paperwork and signed. Tuesday I get a call to go back in and resign and they are changing our agreement. How can they change our terms after every was agreed and credit pulled.  I was not going to resign with new terms after being there for 6 hours the week before. They chose to resell the car as a used car (so they say), then to work with me, I turned over the keys and left. I have never dealt with any company that was so unprofessional and conniving. I was taken advantaged of at Jerry Ulm Chrysler Dodge Jeep Ram in Tampa and hope they don't sell you a used Jeep as a new vehicle

Service was extremely slow and the server was apologetic but not genuine about it. First bucket of beers came without ice. Took over an hour to get new beers that were cold. Took nearly an hour to get chips and salsa that we ordered. After we complained, we were told that we would be comped the chips & salsa, but then after she left our tab, she took the tray that had our chips & salsa, even though I'd just taken a bite. She tried to apologize about the service again, stating there was a new GM and that he didn't know how to schedule people. Then she attempted to take the bucket of beers that had 3 left in it and we had to set it back down on the table. This was an unfortunate vacation experience. I know where to tell people to avoid.

As I travel for business, I hit the local steakhouse to see which city does it best. From the service, to food prep to price, this St Elmo is the worst steakhouse I've been too. 

First, we had 6:30 reservations butt weren't seated until 7:20. 

Second, we ordered their famous shrimp cocktail and it was amazing! Can see why they sell that cocktail sauce by the bottle.

Third, our steaks were cold with little no flavor and we had to send them back just to get to warm. I always order the bone in ribeye, so I'm judging the same cut of steak. I can tell you this was the worst steak I've had at a local steakhouse. 

This place benefits from local bias and apparently the locals have been suffering through this for over 100 years.

Go ANYWHERE but here

They were friendly enough and appear to have done a good job, however they were VERY slow. Since when does it take over an hour to change out two front tires?? They then took about 45 minutes to do an alignment. Half the time there was no one around my truck, especially the first hour. I would not recommend this service. They weren't even busy.

Staff deserves a better product to work with. Very salty food. Cheesesteaks are sub par. Restaurants get a better cut of food. It's a shame this place doesn't do much with what they Buy. Don't waste your time or money here. Staff is awesome hard working! I gave a better than 20% tip. They took the over salty fries off the bill.

NYE at Underground in Nashville was one of the worst experiences getting in to the place for the 20 guest we had so called VIP table which was horrible to get that cost 4000 to rent. I complained about a horrible door guy to Tom D. who was my contact supposely only heard from him once and said a Kelley was going to call to give me details never contacted me. Get to Underground and Tom is the door guy rude as anything just asked I have a 4000 table and my guest frozen outside. He ignores me and complain straight to Tom D today just to keep it to themselves and I and he is rude again in his email trying to blame my group for not coming all together. I would not get any VIP table at this place no matter if Nashville is sold out
it was just ok, nothing outstanding especially for the price this was the roseville one

It breaks my heart to write this review. We came here several times in years past and loved it but everything has fallen off. Our server was mostly non-existent, the food was bland and the cocktails were weak. The only food we could agree we liked was the bread. They get 2 stars instead of 1 star only out of past respect.

I usually have an okay experience, but today I went for a couple of fish I'd been planning on getting for a large tank with a few aggressive species. I asked for the larger of the fish and walked away to look for the next fish. The guy had given me the two smallest ones in the tank and when I asked if he could get me the larger ones like I asked he said, "well it's already out of the tank so it's yours." So once you bag the wrong fish, I automatically have to buy it? I got tired of arguing and explaining that they would be eaten in my tank so I went to the front to check out and even the cashier said, "holy cow those are tiny." So i explained to her the situation and she just said, "well you get to watch them grow." So I'm setting up an emergency tank now to let these guys grow up separate from anyone that might hurt them. I should have just turned and walked out, but it's the only store I could find this fish at. But they don't have to worry about me coming back. Or any of my hobbyist friends.

We have been going here from many yrs.
The food is good but I was not pleased at all with what they did at checkout.
Signs says all credit cards. We find out today that's not true.
They would not let us use an American Express card.
Yet one week ago we use it there.
She said no we need to use Visa card or Master card.
When she was told her sign say American Express is accepted. She would not say a thing.
Not pleased at all.

The following happened over the span of about THREE HOURS: 

-Booked facial online with credit card (never again) for later that day, and called to cancel about 1.5 hours later. 
-Was told I'd be charged 50% for same-day cancellation--even though it would have been impossible to give 24-hour notice (as I only booked 1.5 hours earlier)...and despite telling them that, as NEW customer, I had not noticed the policy when I booked.   
-They would NOT make an exception 
-Receptionist, assistant manager, and general manager all refused to make an exception. 
-Was given a non-functioning phone number for the franchise owner.
-Was told the franchise owner would call me.  
-Charged by Massage Envy for a service I never received, which I both booked and canceled in under two hours.
-Have yet to hear from franchise owner three days later.

My conclusion: This is not an honest business.

I normally love the food here but I couldn't be anymore disappointed after my last experience. Came in waited 15 mins to order. Got a shot which came speedy. The problem is after the shot I ordered a beer which never came till I went to the bar after waiting 30 mins and after waiting over an hour for food and seeing 3 tables served that came in after me get there food I canceled the order and was given a discount on the drinks. After waiting over an hour and still never being served and you serve 3 tables food that came in after me and u still have the nerve to charge me for the 2 drinks I will never come back.

Booked this hotel number of months before arriving..they called two weeks before to tell us they were renovating the particular floor we were on..the parlor suite..they put us on another floor in a suite..arrived at the hotel and that room along with pool and fitness center closed for renovations..never let us know..the toilet overflowed in our room! We reported it at 7:30 am and when we returned to our room at 2 pm, it still hadn't been fixed..! I have nothing good to say about this place! There are plenty of hotels in the same area..

BEFORE YOU SHOP HERE READ THIS ASAP!!!

The store is very well put together and well stocked.  The sales associates are nice so long as things go the way they should.  However, they know very little about the internet presence of the company or the unbelievable amount of red tape it takes to get from one issue to another.  The left does not know what the right is doing from the store level to corporate so here's my advice.  Do not return anything unless you want them to have your money for weeks and weeks and then tell you all sort of stories about why this person was wrong for saying one thing and that person is wrong for saying another.  I would rather see anyone go to Bryn Mawr for their specially fitted shoes.  A LOT LESS AG!!
This place is a joke. The owner is extremely rude. Save your money and shop elsewhere.

I had a really poor experience here. The check in lady was nice and welcoming, and the waiting lounge was fine, but I met with Randi M Menesses for what I was hoping was just hives. She came in and let me know thats not what it was, but that she didn't know what it was, but it looked like Shingles. She kept saying how she wasn't a dermatologist, but I'm going to treat you for Shingles. Never once did she ask if she could refer me, or tell me to go to a regular doctor or a specialist. When she didn't know what it was she left to go Google a few things. To top it off, as I left one of the nurses was staring at my arm in confusion, and said "have a great day", never once looked me in the eyes.

Went in today with a friend of mine and saw an exchange that made me not want to go back. An employee was talking with customers, when they left he turned and yelled across the room to another employee "it's just so easy." In front of other customers. He also joked that my friend buy $200 headphones instead of the $25 ones she came in to purchase. All in all, average options and below average customer service.

There is a reason Brophy bros is packed and this place is empty.Their "Award winning" clam chouder was thin and needed salt just to make it edible. No sourdoughbread and when we requested bread a roll came after we finished our soup and no butter. Bloody Mary's were drinkable but barely. The celery was old and hard to chew. Do yourself a favor  and skip this place. We've had so many good meals in Santa Barbara  that I guess we were spoiled.

Pretty small hot dogs and portion sizes.  
I walked in stoked to eat a big hot dog, i left disappointed and hungry.

I have never had such rude service at a Starbucks before. Quite shocking for the area of Nashville. I walked in used the restroom and went to the counter where I was the only person in line and waited while being ignore for at least 4 minutes while the lady carried on a conversation with her co worker all while Counting her tips. Once she finally finished and announced her grand total of tips she finally recognized that I was standing there patiently waiting to order. She was not very friendly nor apologetic for the wait. 

I order my drinks and my brothers (all the same drinks) and once received walked outside and took a sip of my drink and recognized that it didn't taste like it normally does. So I walked back into the store where the lady who made the drink basically told me that it's not normally a sweet drink and do I want her to add sweetener? My brother also at this time tried his drink and verified his wasn't sweet either and came in behind me as I'm speaking to the lady. The other lady jumps into the conversation and basically says that his normal Starbucks is not making his drink following the recipe. So they are not normally sweet. However they can add vanilla sweetener to our drinks if we would like. Instead of arguing with them we accepted the vanilla sweetener and went on our way. 

I felt this duo are just lazy and argumentative and did not want to remake the drinks properly.

okay, you fooled me today.  i love your burger and fries. but today i think you tricked me. it was a pre-formed patty. sort of tasteless and think, not the same as before. so i won't get another one until you go back to the real deal. sorry.

Unfortunately this is my local mcdonalds.  It is constantly chaos. The staff seem disorganized and disinterested in the customer.  No one looks happy. Half the time you get a sandwich it is put together like they closed their eyes and guessed.  One patty left, one right, cheese half off the bun.  For some reason they keep the ketchup behind the counter so person after person has to ask for it.  
I do notice it's better when the primary manager is there.  
They need a management and training overhaul.  The one in Exton is completely different.  Every one smiling and polite.  Everything is clean and organized.   Tables clean.  The staff just seems happier.
Went through the drive thru on lunch and got a spicy chicken sandwich with just lettuce and mayo. No chicken. Can't call because their phone doesn't work. Very disappointed.

I've been here a few times now, and I must say each time gets worse! I first came to the 45th Street Pub maybe 2 years ago and I thought it was a cool place to get some wings and a drink to unwind! I have recently gone 3 times on a Saturday and once during the week. Saturdays seem to be the best time, as there is a DJ and seems to be a nice crowd. But what I do not like is when the DJ leaves the managers do not want to put on the jukebox in order for the people, the patrons to continue listening to music until the bar closes. 

They will literally shut off music off and all you can hear for the next 1.5 hours is everyone speaking. 

The bartenders can be rude, and they do not call last call, they imply it and expect you to know it's last call. 

It's a cool, neighborhood place, but not a place to frequent!
Cocktails were good, but way overpriced, staff not that fun or friendly. There are better bars in town, that have just as good cocktails, with better price, and friendly staff.

Came here the other night for ice cream with family who are visiting from out of the country.  They love Baskin Robbins ice cream and asked for it by name and I was happy to oblige as I have always enjoyed it as well.  However, after how we were treated, I will NEVER return to a Baskin Robbins again.  An employee was impatient (though there was no line and not close to closing time) and flippant with her language in an ethnically charged manner.   This person should not be working in a service industry position and I hold the owner and the manager responsible for not recognizing that.  You have lost my business.

Upon pulling up we saw that there was a wait, so we knew the food had to be good. We waited for a table for about 30 minutes before we (husband and myself) saw 2 seats at the bar. 
I'm a Acme Oyster house fan through and true but we saw them chargrilling oysters and had to try and ooooweeee Acme has some competition with the chargrilled oysters. But it stops there. And this is why they only get 2 stars

I ordered the stuffed crab and bbq shrimp with two sides. Mac and cheese and mixed veggies. The veggies was flavorless, luke warm and had hard pieces to chew. The Mac was borderline indigestible... it was cut up spaghetti noodles and cheese sauce. The stuffed crab was just crab stuffing on a crab shaped tin foil. The only thing good that I ordered was the bbq shrimp which was a mess because they were whole shrimp with shell in a bowl of bbq sauce. My husband ordered the shrimp pasta and said he couldn't taste the shrimp but the sauce and pasta was tasty ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

I used to love this place, good alternative to penn station! But recently they have slumped on fries, which they charge a TON for, and they often don't have them cooked and ready when the sun is. They also have the absolutely worst lids of any place anywhere. Last time my fries where not cooked or warm! When I went back taking and extra 15 min of my time to do, they didn't want to replace the sub! The manager took and threw it, Yes physically threw it in the trash! Then when I gave them the receipt to get a new one he refused to make one for me, when he finally did make one he told me very rudely it wasn't his problem he had already made one! I have never seen such horrible service in my life! While the food is decent I will NEVER GO BACK BECAUSE OF HOW THEY TREAT PEOPLE AND TRY TO CHEAT TO SAVE A PEENY ON EVERYTHING!

WHY is this place always out of at least one entree that I'm trying to order?! I've been here 4 times now and 3 of them I've had this issue. And yes, as others have also said, it can be painfully slow. Definitely not up to par as compared to other locations I've visited.

Went here on a Saturday. Place was dead. Took almost 2 hours to get food. Waitresses were rude and snobby. I've eaten at fast food places that had better service. When our party wanted refills or some bread while waiting for food the waitresses felt like we were bothering them. Too much to list for complaints just simply go elsewhere food is s

I bought a battery from 775 Vapes. It was not working right. It was blinking sporadically, so I took it back in. They told me it needed a new coil. I tried that and it didn't work. I went back in and told them about the problem and he smoked for a little while and couldn't get it to blink. He didn't believe me and he wouldn't give me another battery. I took my business elsewhere...

Last 5 trips through the drive-thru, we asked for a "bowl"...and got a "platter" and charged for a platter....never a receipt in the bag...we will be going back to the Kietzke location...they never miss.  Just think, if they charge $4 more for the platter for 50 people, they scammed people out of another $200 for the night, eh???

I stayed here for 3 nights this weekend with my wife. The hotel itself and rooms are impeccable. The 1 star review is for Justin 1 of the Valet guys, who nearly ran me over speeding out of where the valet cars are parked. The other guys working referenced his name and told me he regularly speeds out of there and they have told him he is going to hit someone some day. Management needs to review the video of him speeding out of there and nearly hitting me. This tarnished our last day in New Orleans. Disrespectful and careless people should not work for Omni.

I was excited to try this place after eating at Geno's last night, however I was extremely disappointed. We bought a cannoli and some Italian cookies. The cookies were good, however I did not care for the cannoli. I've had plenty of authentic cannolis before in my life, as I'm Italian myself. I asked the employee how frequently the cannoli filling was made to make sure it was fresh, to which she responded daily. She also informed me that the filling is made with goats cheese, which makes the flavor of the cannoli much different. After asking the employee if I was able to exchange the cannoli was something else, she responded that would be fine. As soon as I got to the counter to exchange my cannoli, another brunette employee was making faces and acting extremely uncomfortable. I explained to her that I didn't care for the cannoli and the other blonde employee said it was was okay to exchange it. The brunette employee walked to the back, ignoring the situation while making comments, which I could not hear. After asking this employee what the issue was, she was incredibly rude, said she wasn't the manager and they aren't allowed to take food back. This situation could have been avoided had the new blonde employee known the policy was not to exchange food. I will not be returning to this establishment again, as the customer service was terrible.

Horrible service. A friend and I got a Groupon. Their website says to text or email for an appointment. I texted multiple times and either did not get a response or got one days later just saying "no sorry we don't have any openings that day" without even giving me options. Emailed the email listed AND the email I found for who I think is the owner and never got a response from that. I tried making an appointment for 4 weeks. Finally texted and said look if I can't get a response with an appropriate appointment then that's it. Got a response saying they could get me in on a Monday in April. Such a joke. Going to try and get my money back. So much for that....back to hand and stone I go. You're probably better off doing that too. #treeofdisappointment

this mcdonald's was the most high tech i've been to, but probably one of the rudest employees. the supervisor seemed nice but questioned us whether or not we got water in our "water cups" we did, but she was nonetheless still rude as hell, i will never return here because they embarrassed me and my family. don't go unless u want to be treated like you're less than them.

Unbelievable that after ordering cigars, before the cigars even arrived, I received a separate letter in the mail from 
Thompson telling me that I am responsible for filing a use tax form to my state on my purchase by the 20th of the next month. So now I have to fill out a form, and mail it in, along with a check for a couple of bucks, instead of just being able to pay the sales tax along with my purchase. 

YOU are the business, YOU should be charging me the tax for the state that you shipped it to, and take on that responsibility. I have never seen such a thing, and will not be ordering from this company again. Plenty of other options out there with the same quality and price of product that do not put this hassle on their customers.

We went to a band competition at the Dome.  I was excited even though I knew that the Rams were long gone.  Well the Rams are gone and the place is run down!  The handrails were wobbly and I was worried about using them.  Restrooms were out due to renovation.  Hmm, there were 74 bands plus family here and now you close restrooms?  
We ate at the concession stand. I ordered two cheeseburgers, two chips, and two drinks for $31!   We got to our seats and one of the cheeseburgers was charred on the outside but raw(completely) on the inside!  It was immediately spit out!  Did not take it back because we stood in line for 30 minutes for the first time due to lack of concessions.  We did not purchase anything again from the concession!.  When we came back, I brought in candy bars and water.  A beautiful iconic place to allow it to rundown so!

I can't tell if the reviews from people are just because they haven't had good breakfast or they've been eating at the Golden Corral for so long that this is just right in swing with their primitive desires. 

The tables are understaffed and overpacked by Section, so your server really doesn't give you the time you need or care.

We waited for 20 minutes to be seated with two toddlers after being told 10 minutes, and then when we sat there was a dozen empty tables available. 

The food was good. What I got.... 
I ordered a biscuit, and then had to ask for it. 
Then realized that I didn't even get the bacon I ordered, so ... that's awesome. 
Then had to ask that it be removed off my check. 
Just silly sh!t...

Let's be realistic. 
You want good breakfast, friendly staff, and the right order--Chik Fil A wins every time against Joe Mama's.

The absolute worst! It took four trips to this store to order a front door for them to finally setup someone to come out and take the measurements. The first time we went, there was nobody at the desk so someone paged the employee who never showed up. It's been over a month. The measurements were not done correctly and they want to send him back to our house to do them over. Still have not heard from them to set up the second appointment. You would think they would want to sell us a $1200 door plus a pantry door. I'll take my money somewhere else! Lowe's corporate offices needs to start reading these posts!!!

I was told this was a tourist trap before I had to come to try it for myself. The cheesesteaks themselves are average at beast, the portion is pretty small. This place is just something to go to so you can post on your Instagram, not to have a GOOD cheesesteak IMO. 
On a side note parking and seating is absolutely horrible.

NO WAY! This is not a 4 star restaurant. I assume it is a family run restaurant and need more help. Either hire more people or have more kids. The kids hustle just not enough of them. How this achieved 4 stars must be all of the 70 year olds who live in the apartments because the food was disappointing. Like a previous post the lamb was gamey actually i could only eat a portion of it and left most of it. The nan was stale and my wife's meal wasn't much better.It is the first time in 5 years and multiple countries that Yelp let us down!

If you're looking for notary services... AVOID THIS PLACE.  The sign on the door explaining in advance that "because of vacation" there may not be a notary available should have told me to walk away... Walked in and apparently interrupted a very important conversation between two employees... after one begrudgingly took out the notary registry it was obvious this was not what she wanted to do!!  Ended up needing to take my work elsewhere... save yourself the headache!!!

You have to know that it isn't going to be that great of a room but you get what you pay for. You have at least great cable, nice kitchen area and all the employees at this place are sooooooo friendly. I had the gentlemen who works overnight (tall gentleman with the pierced ear) always go out of his way to help me. Thank you Sir!!

@ 9:15 am today, I was picked up Sasha from Enterprise, to go get a rental from them threw collision max ( paying for it).
I get there, and I'm approched by janyssa rosario, no hi, how are you, nothing, the first thing she says is " I need your credit Card" I explained to her that 2 weeks ago I got a rental threw collision max and the guy never took my card. So she said " I'll yakt your DL" I handed it to her.
Then she places a form with all this personal info requested on it, I asked why do I need to fill this out? 
She said we need it, I explained to her again, collision max paying and I did not do that the last time.
She looks at me with a dead look in her face and says, " Im not going to give you a car with out it" .
I started filling out the form, I asked why my insurance, since collision max paying, she repeats the same sentence, " I'm not gonna give you the car with out it"
Then I got to the  references part, I asked why the refrencere? She says, it's for emergency contact, I told her, it's says refrenrefe not emergency, her answer to mad again the same sentence, I'm not gonna give you the car with out it, by now I'm annoyed.
I wrote my boyfriend and sister, and told her I only got them, her response again, " I'm not gonna give you the car with out it and in need employer, I told her I wrote  N/A cause I'm not working, and she repeats the same sentence again  now I'm beyond annoyed, I'm agraveted!!!! 
So I asked her " how many times are you going to repeat your self like I'm stupid? You gonna say it again?" Her respond was " I'm not gonna give you the car with out it"  at that point, I asked for a manager, she said she was, so I told her she sucks at her job and I want the GM name and number....she grabs a buisnbuscard and walks to the office on the side and gets on the phone.
I told her that she needs to give me the info of the he GM not call him to go very him heads up....
That's when I called Victoria at collision max and told her what had happened, so Victoria said she will call her.
As we wait I googled head quarters of enterprise to make a complaint.
She comes back and says to me that she will drop me off and walks out the front door, so I grabbed my stuff and followed her, she opens the door and let's it go it slammed on me and as I walked threw she turns to tell me, that she was busy helping another customer and I'm gonna have to wait. I told her she started helping me and she needs finish with me and not start with someone else, her answer to me was " you have to wait until I'm done" I told her no, take me back  now, she tells me that she is not gonna take me, so I told her  enterprise brought Me here, enterprise will take me back, you are not leaving me stranded here.
That when 5 minutes later, another girl came and took us.

I called the GM Eddie Lugo left his m a message, let's see how long it will take to call me and talked to escalations in head quarters and put a complaint.

Jaynessa Rosario, you need to have better customer service, and what ever made you have a bad morning, you should leave that else where and not mix it with you job. You need to have better customer service skills and approch and I recommend a class including anger management and therapy and o teach you to cope with anger and not taking it out on others who just wanted a rental car.
Control issues that you have, only ruin the business, a business that you don't own, so you don't care about 

Never ever coming back again and I will never recommend.

This hotel is straight out of a horror movie.

Check in went okay after finally finding a place to park (we mistakenly thought this was a good sign). First red flag - the elevators were broken since June and no repair was going to happen. We begged but were placed on the 9th floor - the hallways were dark, under lit; just a broken ankle waiting to happen. Lugged everything up and second red flag - keys wouldn't work. Walked all the way down for replacements. Room(s) had two beds, no blankets, tiny TV, and okay bathroom, but the toilet was the smallest I've ever seen, almost a potty training size. Carpets were just gross inside and outside the room, no bugs, but strange smells. Breakfast was going to be a highlight, but instead picked from 3 types of boxed cereals, a few danish, and powdered eggs, no meat, no bread, just milk and apple juice. Weird. We clogged the toilet the first day, and saw more people leaving then checking in during our far too long stay of two days. This place will be closed in less than a month, hopefully!! Stay at your own risk...

Ugh, this place is overrated. The upstairs dining area is stuffy, drab and downright depressing. Service was unbelievably slow. Food was meh at best. However, the crab cake was bomb. That's the only reason I'm giving this place two stars, which still feels like a stretch.

Management illegally dumps trash on adjoining street and is unresponsive to home owners in the neighborhood. It's a crime in Philadelphia to place trash other than at the curb in front of the property so if you live near a central property and they put their trash in front of your home the City says you should call 911 and post photos on the 311 app as documentation.
Jerks! Meet an employee driving a company vehicle and tried to talk to him and possibly get a business card and he acted like I was dirt under his nails . Ugh

The food was pretty decent, no complaints there. If the food was the only factor, probably would be 3-4 stars. But this is supposed to be fast-casual right? I was thinking like a smash burger type pace. It was literally 42 minutes from order to food. Homestead is faster than that. May try again in a few months when they have their kinks worked out (apparently they had two people quit today and a broken cook top, but still, at least let us know that up front). Food was decent, but Hugo's is just around the corner...

I ordered for the first time today (a Saturday)1 at 6:25pm. Pretty empty. Tables sticky when I waited for the food. Didn't matter to me too much the overall decor was pleasant. I ordered at 6:25 they estimated 10-15 minutes. My food wasn't done until 6:50. That's fine, under half an hour for take out is usually acceptable especially cause this is a restaurant not a fast food take out place. It seemed like it was a dad and son running the place and that made it pretty authentic. Polite and respectful. However they don't seem like they have a lot of business. 

As for the food I ordered chicken biryani and chicken curry. I'm hoping this will beat zaikas and maliks for Indian food as it is very close to my house. It has 4.5 star rating before I even tried it. They gave me mango chutney for me to try in a little container. Everything was neatly packaged in the bag to go. Yes! Those tight sealed containers that I can reuse! Portions didn't seem too right for he chicken curry. They left out the plain naan that's supposed to be included with the curry. Oh no.

Chicken biryani doesn't look like how it's supposed to. The chicken is roasted chicken almost like a tandoori which I definitely wanted to avoid. Not the type you use in biryani! I feel like I ordered chicken tandoori with rice. And I hate tandoori unfortunately! Doesn't mix well. 

Garlic Naan was thick. Different than any Naans I had which are normally  thinner. It makes it more bready than it needs to but I don't mind. 

Chicken curry was more of a sauce than curry. The sauce was thin fell off my fork. 

Ugh! Really Disappointed!! REALLY WANTED TO LIKE THIS PLACE! Came here starving after not eating all day didn't even finish anything they gave me. Ugh! Maybe they thought they could get away with serving me this cause I'm not Indian! Not worth $24.82 :( plus the $2 tip

This hotel would not even work with me to move my reservation when my flight was cancelled due to weather.  I wasn't even asking for money back, just a date change and was told they were unable to even discuss it with me and hung up on me.

Dope venue, bad beer, overpriced food. Terrible names, super sweet beers could barely drink more than one without getting sick. Someone explain to me how wonder bread and packaged cheese is $9. Unfortunately I could see myself coming back, but I won't be happy about it.

What an awful place.  Peng Acharon is the station manager.  I must comment on her illegal and unethical treatment of the postal carriers here.  Her answer, sometimes you don't get paid, tough. Her indifference to employees and taking care of business in a practical and ethical manner are so unethical as to be unbelievable. Just because you belong to a union does not mean you get to crap on people.  Her cohort in crime is Sean.  Threatening people, not paying people, our post master general for Reno must be SO PROUD of the quality of your work.  I'm doing all I can for Karma to bite you.

My husband recommended this place so we brought my parents to eat here. No qualms on the service, our server was just fine but my rating is for the overall experience. One bathroom, nothing on the menus so look on the wall for the kids and senior menu on a whiteboard (I didn't see it until after we ordered). Unorganized enough for me to not make another visit. Definitely a dive restaurant.
Disappointed that Vino and Ban Gogh is no longer there! At least take it off of your website guys!

I was was here while traveling.  Host was awesome. Table service was not the best.  Past primavera...vegetables were not done, pasta was overdone (even had burnt pieces) and the kids Mac and Cheese was overcooked.  When the waiter asked if There were any plates to clear he didn't seem to care I handed him a full plate of pasta primavera. Restaurant is loud...not the place for conversation.

Don't order the carhop service... ended up sitting outside unattended for 15 minutes. Then had to eventually go in anyway to pick up the order.
I could understand if they were busy. However there was staff standing by the door talking and the place is half empty. When I expressed my concern my food had been sitting on the bar unattended and forgotten. Not so much as I'm sorry from the staff.

Tried Rize for the second time after many many months. Ordered through GrubHub again and once again everything was cold. Both orders of fries were cold and mushy. The pizza was cold and the crust was not crispy at all. I am kicking myself for giving it a second chance and wasting $113 bucks. Including $26 for a terrible "Holiday" Rize crust pizza pie. What a waste of money and calories. Back to ordering pizza, etc. from Fontana's on Grub Hub.

Very rude and unprofessional staff. After being hung up on by a staff member in the middle of my sentence, I called back and finally spoke to manager by the name of Martin, whom was even more unprofessional. As I simply inquired about the behavior of the previous 4 Hang-Ups, he denied it ever happened. I explained I had record on my phone displaying it. He rudely asked what I wanted him to do and proceeded to tell me I was wasting his time. Very unprofessional staff, they clearly have never had a class in what customer service is or how to treat people. To allow this behavior at a management level says alot about a company.Its just sad. I wish I read all of the other negative reviews that reflect my same experience. I would have avoided the frustration and this awful post office location altogether. I'd recommend going to any other location if you prefer to be treated like a human being.

First of all let me state: I LOVE IHOP!!!!!
Now, my waitress was great, as anyone who has ever waited on me at this location. But, because my friend and I sent our food back because: 
a. The scrambled cheese eggs looked like eggs that were already made and just had cheese melted on top of them.
b. My friend's hashbrowns didn't look fully cooked.
c. Our bacon wasn't crispy as we had asked when ordered.
The cook, yes THE COOK, came out to our table, to me specifically, and told me that if I had a problem with my food that I should come see him. 
Very rude, very unprofessional, very tacky.
Needless to say, we left without eating. 
I WILL NEVER EAT IN THAT ESTABLISHMENT AGAIN. 
IHOP, you've lost a very loyal customer.
I was expecting much more for the hype and money. Seafood was nothing special and pricing was high.

Worst Burger King around. The staff is just worried about hanging out with one another. I only hope it gets better because this location is less than a mile from my house. Corporate needs to step in and handle this! Food is subpar quality and almost always cold.

I came to this location and interacted with a salesman that basically modeled every aspect of poor business. 

No personal attention paid. Employee barked a few questions, would show up here and there, between running around. Also heard him disparage and correct another employee from across the store (tip: good managers will do this in private). Was told if I wanted personal attention come back "on a rainy day in August." 

When asked why they don't just hire more staff, the salesman told me "this job is too complicated to hire more staff." He was serious too. It had an amazing irony considering all he has done was measure me briefly and bring me to the suits that might fit. But hey, if you wanna spend $800 on a suit off a rack and measure yourself, highly recommended.

Don't waste your time or money with this sub-par unsafe airline.  There customer service is completely non-existent.  I was on a booked flight with a passenger next to me that was so large that he could not fit between the arm rests.  He was consuming my seat along with his own.   I had to sit at a severe angle hanging out into the aisle.  My back is so kinked after 2 1/2 hours like this I'll need to visit a chiropractor.  The stewardess rather than trying to do ANYTHING made a snide comment about it being a tight fit.  She could have at least apologized for the 1/2 of a seat that I paid for.  And she made this snide remark about it being a tight fit right in front of the large passenger.  I really felt kinda sorry for him, I'm not sure if she was trying to shame me or him?    I did not try and discuss this any further while on the plane in fear that any disagreement would get me escorted of the flight by security.  I recently saw this happen on another flight for no reasonable reason other than a customer speaking his mind and the authoritarian airlines just kicking him off rather than addressing the problem.    I understand that airline seats are smaller than ever and people are growing larger.  But when a passenger can't fit between the arm rests and must leave them up to overflow into the adjacent seats a line needs to be drawn.  Not only is it not fair for myself, a paying customer, to forfeit half of his seat to stranger to be smothered.  It is also a safety issue when a person of this size can not navigate in and out of the seat and aisle of the plane in a reasonable timely manner on his own accord.    In addition it left me hanging out into the aisle blocking traffic.  If there had been an accident this man would have trapped another passenger in their seat and appeared to be physically unable to fit through the emergency hatch?  That could cause a life threatening situation.  After the flight was over I went to the counter at the airport and asked what the policy was for oversize people and explained the situation.  Of course they didn't apologize or want to discuss the matter at all, they just gave me a customer service number, lol.  It was 15 minutes to get someone on the phone who admitted this person should have purchased 2 seats and at the same time refused to do absolutely anything to make up for the situation.  Not a dollar, free drink coupons or anything whatsoever.  Just told me he should have bought 2 seats and they were sorry for my uncomfortable ride but they did get me there in my seat so the rest shouldn't matter.  They could not refund, discount or offer anything to reimburse me for purchasing 1 seat and receiving a 1/2 seat with a large man smothering me.  She really acted like it was my fault he didn't buy 2 tickets.  I reminded her they are responsible for ticket sales and customers safety, not me.   Anyhow, I'm never flying this airline again, they literally have zero customer service.  Just google them and you'll see countless horror stories from the customers they don't care about.

Won't go back to this place. As I never even had the opportunity to taste the food here. I attended this place with my sister who had been several times before. However on this day the two of us entered and immediately sat down. They were not at all that busy. An older lady who didn't speak much English began to take our  order. We excitedly ordered the calamari. As soon as she walked off. Strangely might I add, my sister and I began discussing day to day events. Pretty much minding our own business. While waiting on the calamari a younger woman approached our table. Mind you she didn't introduce herself as someone who works here. Anywho she began to accuse us of talking about her grandmother . What?!?? The old lady who took our order. Umm ok. We tried to explain that we didn't know what she was b talking about but she left us no time to do anything. She told us to leave and get out. Yelling loudly In front of other guest. I have never been so embarrassed in my life. If I could give this place negative stars I would.  

Although this event did occur a few years back way before yelp days , I wanted to caution any young brown foodies. Because I definitely think this was a pure act of racism. 

To note, I have not been back. And will not. They do not appreciate our buying power. Do not waste your money here.

Ordered online and it literal took over an hour for the food to arrive. When I called, the person on the phone just said "sorry" . No attempts of customer satisfaction was made. When I tried to call back for a second time, they recognized my phone number and literally picked up the line & hung up immediately before saying anything. They could've at least threw a free soda or dessert or better not charge me at all. To top it all of the food was NOT HOT leading me to believe it's been sitting for quite some time.' Highly disappointed for the first time using this location. The customer service was trash. And the pizza as far as taste was just alright at best.

Bullet points:
Portions were too small. 
Meat was charred. 
Food and service were overpriced.

Overall, the service was adequate, if minimal.

For tourists reading this: sure, why not. You're not going to find anything cheaper in the neighborhood and at least it's got a combo of Philly/borderline historical feel while also being very clean and inviting.

For everyone else: no way. SOOO expensive. Food quality is pretty good but just go to an actual restaurant for those prices. .

My boyfriend and I went last week for my birthday, and I was super excited about having fried chicken! I will say the service, setting and small touches are perfect. They have that part down. However the food and menu itself leaves much to be desired. 

The menu is confusing if coming from a 'picnic' point of view. The waitress mentioned that the food is meant to be shared picnic style (which adds to the confusion) so I ordered the fried chicken basket and my boyfriend ordered the naked chicken sandwich and we decided to share. neither of which come with sides so we ordered the potatoes that I believe we're supposed to be fried. The fried chicken was boneless, flattened, very bland chicken. I was very disappointed. The sandwich was cold and the potatoes were very weird, not fried. Also they don't have Mac and cheese, fries or ketchup, which to me is what goes with fried chicken and especially what I think of if thinking 'picnic'. At the end we ended up spending way too much for a mediocre meal in a confusing setting.

Wait times.....redic 

Reception staff.....redic

Friendliness.....not here 

Attentiveness.....not here

Understanding that people pay more than a copay and their time is just as important...not here

Will I come back.....neverrrrrrr

This is the second time I've had a bad experience here. Both times we sat in the bar. Both times it took at least 15-20 min to get greeted. I'm a server, I've been a server for 6+ years. So I'm especially paying attention when I go  out to eat. Our server walked past about 3 times before he noticed us. On top of that, about 3-4 other staff members seen us sitting there and no one ever greeted us. Our server had 3 other tables, one of which was sitting there before us and still haven't been greeted. He finally greeted them and then us, and takes our drink order. I ordered a water and my bf ordered a mojito. Server didn't seem to know if they had mojitos or not so his response was to open the drink menu and put it in front my my bfs face and say "this is what we have. I'm gonna go get this table's drink order and your water and I'll be back" and walks off. They have TONS of mojitos. My bf has to point out the exact one he wanted. Server told us the bar is being slow and the kitchen is as well, so that was already something a customer doesn't want to here considering it's a slow Sunday night. The mojito came after our food, it was watered down so I'm assuming it was either made poorly or sitting on the bar and no one brought it to us. My bf's steak was supposed to be mid rare and came out well done, and my pasta was undercooked. A manager walked by us MULTIPLE times and she never stopped to say a word. She just walked around like a lost puppy. I'm sorry but a manager should be touching every table ESPECIALLY after the entrees arrive to make sure everything came out good. Because some customers won't address something wrong to the server, but they will to a manager. This is what helps get your problem experience percentages down. The server offered us free dessert because of the drink taking so long and said that's what he's been doing all day to other customers. Another thing a customer doesn't want to hear. The manager still never came over to see how everything was even after comping the dessert. She seemed like she didn't care. Our server tried to get her attention a few times and she just walked away. The servers were being very obnoxiously loud by the bar and the bartender was only worried about the girls sitting at the bar and not his other drink orders along with guests that weren't getting greeted in a timely manner. I'm done going to this T.G.I. Friday's. And I'll be sure to let everyone know my experience. I will throw in that the server was sweet and I know he was in the weeds with his other tables because no one was helping and he was also fairly new to serving. It wasn't his fault, there's just no communication here and the management is a joke. I hope he finds a better place to work for.

We'll see if my opinion changes, but so far I'm very unimpressed. They would not let us check in when we arrived, and informed us that we would have a guaranteed room at 4:00. Came back at 4 and not only was there not a room ready (STILL) but they wouldn't even let us pay for the room to at least get that part out of the way. I am sitting in the lobby in my swimming trunks waiting because we had gone to the beach to use up some time, figuring the room would be ready when promised. Stupid me. Like I said, if we ever get into a room, my opinion may change. So far though, this sucks!

NOT GOOD. I've lived in Los Angeles the majority of my life and needless to say I've had some wonderful Mexican food. St. Louis has very few decent Mexican restaurants and Fuzzy's is not one of them. Awful just awful service. Took half an hour to get our food. Rude staff and depressing atmosphere. My burrito was soggy and cold and everyone in my group was disgusted with their food. Cold and tasteless was their response. Avoid this place at all costs and please ignore any positive reviews. This place is simply horrible.

Went to have a drink midday for wife's birthday and few appetizers on a Wednesday. We stood at "please wait to be seated" several minutes while employees walked past us. Finally, we walked towards the kitchen and asked if we could sit down. They said yes. So we sit and after we sat...we weren't acknowledged by waitress for about ten minutes after we sat. It wasn't crowded. It was about 5 people at the bar that already had drinks and four others in the entire restaurant. We ended up walking out...and someone yelled "sorry" as we walked out of the door. It's disappointing because I had a corporate dinner event there for college students I flew in and spent over $800 in food a few months earlier.  Never again.

Stop in nice atmosphere. Had the pulled pork special. Wasn't impressed with food . There was supposed to bar-b-que on the sandwich. Had much better. The was  wine awesome. Would go  back to have wine. The food?????

Very good service. Very mediocre food. Don't bother with the food. We live in MT.  The Mexican food there is much better than this place so we were very disappointed.  I'm sorry to be so harsh but seriously these were the worst fish tacos I have ever had.  No interesting ingredients, ..we were all so completely  unimpressed with the food , although I feel bad because  I really  thought the staff was exceptional. The restaurant has a corporate feel... to what I was looking for or expecting. Do yourself a favor...try a different Mexican restaurant..I wish we did.

We usually count on Cheddars for a solid, hot meal. Not today. Hubby and I arrived for an early dinner, around 3:45pm. Restaurant was almost empty, but we waited several minutes before a server came to our table. She was engaged in a conversation with another table about her job. 

The salad was very brown and wilted. The entree was not as warm as it should have been. The chicken tenders were tough and chewy, not crispy and tender.

We asked for another salad, and it was brought. But, it lacked the shaved Parmesan cheese. We made multiple requests for the croissant that is usually served with the salad.

When the manager brought the replacement salad, there was no inquiry about our complaint. You could get the feeling that Cheddars doesn't care about customer experience.

I've been to Sucré at least 4 times. It was intriguing at first...but after my last time, I'm thinking it's too pricey for what you get. I was disappointed with the gelato. It melted really quick and had a weird texture. The bread pudding is good, but not worth over $7. The macaroons are okay, but it's hard to justify the purchase at $2.50 each. The giant brownie looked great but it was dry. The same goes for the cupcakes. Underwhelming!! I think I'm done with this place.

Flies. Yuck. Slow service. Very slow service. Hot inside. The door was open instead of using the A/C. High prices. The ice cream is good. I had a hot fudge sundae and it was delicious. I won't return.

Updating my review from prior, food quality is still OK but customer service is seriously lacking. The employees have changed and the ones that are there now appear to really hate their jobs. Seriously lacking in customer service which can certainly kill your business.

Staaaay away. It's just sketchy AF. My boyfriend and I checked in here because we were going to a concert near by. We got up to our room and immediately started calling other hotels and checked out within 30 mins. Didn't spend enough time in the room to take in the filth but when we checked in the two people at the front desk didn't acknowledge us for several minutes until I caught their attention. Just poor and weird customer service. The other clientele that we saw were shady. The elevator was extremely slow and we got stuck on the sketchy mezzanine and had to take the stairwell to the stairwell to our room on floor 2. The stairwell was SCARY and with how the elevator operates, you'll be stuck in the freaky stairwell. Just don't bother with this place. This place is a public health disaster and should be shut down.

It's been almost a month and I have yet to receive a response from the owner about my experience at the grooming salon. I asked to be contacted and also wrote an email.

My main reason for one star is clear:
When I went for my original appointment, the entire store was closed. I received a call an hour later stating the groomer was unaware there was an appointment.
I rescheduled and upon arrival the groomer was pleasant, but seemed overwhelmed. She told me it would be awhile.
5 hours later I received a call that my dog was done. When I picked her up I asked if she was locked up the whole time. The guy told me yes, but she was walked. I asked why they didn't call sooner if they had to keep her locked that long. He then told me they did try to call me. When I said I had no call history, he said well it doesn't matter ma'am.

It does matter. You lied, accused me of being an absent dog owner and the. Proceeded to tell me that my dog has x, y and z wrong with her. He said the owner was well aware of the situation and took care of it.
She did not. I never spoke to her.

I went here to support a small business. I will never go back because frankly no dog or human should have to be treated like that. Shameful

If I could, this place would get a 0. I ordered on October 21st​ at 4:30 pm, and I never received my order. Called them about 10 times - no response. Then to give them a second shot, I ordered from them today. I got my order with breadsticks and cinnamon sticks, but I didn't get sauce or icing. I called, and someone said the delivery guy will come back in a half hour... He never came back. Called pizza hut - no response. Never ordering here again.

Highly disappointed with a 4-star rating.  Meat was cold, tasteless and very grisly.  Ordered steak tacos and guacamole.  Guac also lacked flavor and tasted like it was store bought.  Would not recommend.

Don't be angry that you're serving hot donuts on a cold rainy day; isn't that what Autumn is about? Came in at 7:30 on a weekend in the rain, only to be asked to stand outside in the rain with my tiny cocker spaniel companion. May not be a "service" dog but definitely has more manners, service and empathy than this crew. We were the basically the first customers of the morning. Too much hostility for South Street vibes. No hello, thank you, or excuse me when carrying a rug over my head and felt like they just wanted me to get out of the way. I know they just opened but it already seems they need people skills training. The best federal donuts location is the original.

I used to love coming here and would order frequently. My go to was the fettuccini Alfredo but the sauce has been so tasteless the last few visits. The last time I was there, I asked to have garlic added to my pasta in hopes that It would give it some flavor. That was a bad move. I had a good 1/2 cup If not more of what seemed to be raw garlic just mixed in. First bite was a fork full of raw crunchy garlic. Couldn't believe it. They wouldn't give me a refund. I tried picking out the garlic while I was sitting there but there was just too much. I took the rest to go just to see how much more garlic I could pick out.

We got a jumbo pizza for about $12 and it wasn't worth it. There was barely any cheese and they cheaped out on the sauce. You can go to Dominos and spend the same amount for two items on the menu for $5.99 each and that'll definitelly fill at least two people when this pizza couldn't.

I cant't give more than one star because we waited for about 15 minutes and nobody came to our table after we were seated.  Nobody even acknowledged us.  A family of four and not even a, "Be with you in a minute." Nothing.  We ended up standing up and walking out back to our hotel room to order pizza.  It is 2018, I surely hope the reason we're weren't acknowledged had absolutely nothing to do with the fact we were the only caucasian family in the restaurant.  I am sure there is no correlation since it is 2018 and all. Just an observation and unique coincidence I suppose.

We just ordered to go food from here and the food was terrible, the swamp platter was inedible and the fried catfish and crab cakes were just as bad - a meal that comes in at this price and the only food that was decent were the hush puppies and French fried.  such a complete let down to waste a meal on this.  On a side note my husband had the boiled shrimp as he waited for our food and he said they were very good.

I am an out of towner but I have family that I visit once a year in Tarpon Springs. We visited this restaurant last year for my aunts birthday and loved it. We had a great server, the food was great, and the view was great. I dont know what's happened since last year but tonight's visit sucked! I made a reservation as an early birthday dinner for myself and my boyfriend. I said on the phone that I would like a table by the water. Well when we arrived we were sat outside but not in view of the water. I asked the server if we could sit where there was a view and she said all those tables were reserved... ok but I made a reservation and asked for one by the water. I guess nothing could be done ok. 

So one of the things I raved about from my first visit was tableside guacamole. They make it fresh tableside its fun to watch and fresh and delicious. I ask for it, they are out of avocados.... seriously? On a Friday night you didnt stock up on avocados for your signature appetizer? So at this point I'm really disappointed that two of the main reasons I wanted my birthday dinner at this restaurant are now not happening for me.  Then our food came out, it was mediocre. Nothing like what I remember from last year and my boyfriends dinner was cold. We didnt feel like bugging our waitress over it because she was actually really sweet considering we were in foul moods over all of this.

The other thing that I dont remember from my previous visit was the waitresses wear booty shorts. If I wanted to have a girl stand next to us in khaki underwear with my boyfriend we would go to Hooters. I remember this place being classy but maybe it decided to go in a different direction. Wont be coming back and we will be warning everyone I know about this place.

This place is terrible!! You walk in there and if you do not automatically go straight to someone to "check in," you will be ignored the entire time. I literally just stood around seeing the one associate with the iPad say something to EVERY. SINGLE. PERSON. THAT. WALKED. IN, except for the people that was already there! I was fully prepared to walk in, get the device I wanted, pay full price, and walk out! What happened to the good old days when you go straight to a counter and have someone bring out the item you want, and just pay right there. You honestly should not have to wait 15-20 minutes if you know exactly what you want. 

And, please, if you are going to have associates walk around and "help" their customers, please have a name badge. I am positive the name you have provided is your own, but if I do not know who I am dealing with by simply looking at your name badge, that's just plain bad customer service.

Chain restaurants aren't my favorite, but the draw to this one is the outdoor seating.  
This time of year in Tucson is perfect for being outside. 
The head scratcher in the several times I've dined here, is the long wait for food and drinks. Most of the times I've been here the place has been less than 50% capacity. 
It's so aggravating to order appetizers and cocktails, wait 35-40 minutes for the apps to come, and then have the entrees show up immediately after. We even specified that we wanting our apps BEFORE our entrees. So as we ate the delicious salads, and yummy deviled eggs, our food got cold. 
If this issue only happened once, I wouldn't be writing about it but it's consistently the same thing. 
The food has always been solid here, but the long wait to get food, accompanied by the lack of delivery timing is a big turn off.

just finished a nice ny steak at firebirds. uts veterans day, and they ran a special buy one get one free for vets. great idea! but the place was packed. grabbed a small table by the fireplace. started with the green salad,  with spiced walnuts.  pretty good. but a third of the way thru the salad, my entree showed up! before i could ask for the kitchen to hold it so it stayed hot, the plate plopped down and the server was gone! steak was good, but not hot, like the baked potato and broccoli. i didnt stay for dessert.

Positive Points: Located in the heart of Bourbon & Canal Street. Close to CVS, Walgreens & a slew of restaurants/entertainment & much more.
Cons: Much needed renovations. The air conditioner sounds like a factory grade machine, the walls are so thin, there's not much you CAN'T hear of your neighbors. Customer Service is hit or miss as is Housekeeping. On our last day, after contacting the front desk about an uncleaned room, I was informed that housekeeping was done for the day. They would however drop towels off. I went our room and towels were strewn on the vanity along with Coffee packs. Upon reporting it, the consensus was: And????? Outside of location, this establishment needs an overhaul, both in construction & customer service/engagement.

The good: the coconut crunchy tofu burrito is solid, as is the chipotle salsa. The Buenos burrito is enjoyable but not strictly speaking special.

The bad: Buenos is Mexican food for affluent white people. The food isn't particularly flavorful. It's overpriced. It is far from authentic. Hit up Betos instead for some top notch tacos at two thirds the price.

I've been to it's nuts on Route 29 Titusville and we always enjoyed eating there. However the Lambertville location was just a horrible experience. I called to order two dinners of fried chicken. I asked the woman on the phone how long it would be until the food would be ready she said to come now. When I arrived they told me that the french fries were not cooked and it would be a wait. I'm waiting for 10 minutes and they didn't even cook my fries yet. I told her I didn't want to wait anymore to just give me mashed potatoes instead. So she proceeded to hand me my food and it seems like it was a bit much. I ordered two dinners with two pieces of chicken each and she gave me 12 pieces of chicken. There were people standing around and obviously not caring about my order I had put in. I will never go back I think the service and the food is not good at all. I hope they read this and improve how their business is being run

I should of passed on this place considering the bad/fair reviews however my husband suggested it so we tried. The drink was gross, server didn't put in correct order & we waited 12 minutes to be served. I believe it's a 60 second greet time at most restaurants. Even though I was unhappy the server was very nice , perhaps the bar staff & kitchen staff is the problem . Either way I won't go back.

Everytime I give it "one more try" I am disappointed again!!!!  I spent $233 on terrible food!  The dinner menu is horrible its mainly apps, salad and nothing else worth the money you will spend.  The chicken parm platter was old and recooked, dry and flavorless.  The burger was not throughly cooked.  The mini crab cake sliders were wet and mushy.  I have to give one star to leave a review but they don't deserve any.

I will say the service was ok and the new decor is pleasing.

I've been twice since moving to the area. Both times the carpets were not vacuumed well (grass and debris left all over), the windows had streaks all over them and the step boards were never wiped down. For $39 one would expect much better quality. I will say the gentleman checking me out apologized for the lack of detail and cleaned it himself but seriously.

Well, very disappointed to say the least. Sent my husband for something quick. I gave him a specific order (via text and he read it to them), they told him "that's a South Philly"...he said ok, I guess trusting they'd make the sandwich like I like. Well, my sandwich was missing my favorite meat that makes a sandwich for me...Prosciutto! Sadly, it made my first experience not that great. Also, the meat is not that great of quality and the mayo is absolutely disgusting. My husband enjoyed his sandwich though, but he is not as picky as I. If I am paying I want it how I want it. I knew I should have ran and just got lunch myself, because I watch (if possible) to ensure they make it the way I like it!

This is my first time to review a restaurant because i can usually take bad customer service. But this time i want to give bad review to the "Friends Restaurant" inside Assi Plaza. I don't don't know if the gentleman who served me and my wife today is the owner but he don't know any customer service at all.  Just because i am an immigrant asian dark colored he had too much prejudice. He don't talk nicely and too harsh dealing. we would never eat in that place again. Very bad experience. Very prejudice.

I dont know how sheraton can put they're name on this place.
It is so run down that it is unbelievable! Carpet is horrendous. The double beds are very small. Two can not sleep on one. There was probably 10% of rooms occupied and they did not have a king bed available. No micro or fridge. Breakfast was horrible. Everything cold, even the coffee. The only thing positive was the staff. They were all very nice. They all must be embarrassed of the facility.

Was prescribed wrong medication for my rabbit. Rabbit died.  Rabbit had a stroke and developed Tilt head.  I could let her suffer so had Tampa Veterinary hospital euthanize her. Hardest thing I ever did. Because of a vet error

Moved to Florida in December and after 12 days of being here had a car accident that totaled my 2016 Honda Civic...went to replace my car here and it has been nothing but a problem since the purchase!  First off the financing was misleading and then we get the title and registration and they screwed that all up; contacted our sales person and he never replied!  We are dedicated Honda purchaser since 1999 but will not buy another car from Brandon Honda because it has been nothing but a problem since we signed papers the day we took car off the lot.....still trying to fix the screw ups to this day!  We don't have time to play games with such an unprofessional dealership!  We have purchased Honda's in Michigan, Arizona, California and Brandon Florida and this i has been our worst experience so far!  Go somewhere else if you want good follow up and attention

Had a lengthy frustrating drive through experience - I'm not a fast food expert but 30 minutes of waiting for a small 4 item order when there was only one car in front of me in line seems like a problem ? Had a hungry 3 year old in the back seat-- I tried my best to be warm and friendly but the attitude coming back in my direction was cold and unwelcoming -- I was told that they were closing soon when I placed my order at 8:30pm (10pm is posted closing time) and then asked to pull into a handicapped parking space because it was going to take several extra minutes to make some chicken and did I still want to continue with the order? I'm just unhappy with the cold way I was treated and the fact that 30 minutes were required to service only 2 vehicles in line (the one in front of me and my car being #2--
