Stay away from this dry cleaner.  They stained 3 of my dress shirts in the same place and I gave them multiple opportunities to fix it. To the dry cleaners credit, they fixed 2 out of 3, but enough is enough.  They also did a horrible job of pressing my shirts on my last pick up.  STAY AWAY!!!!!

The movie time was 7:15 pm, and at 7:25 pm I had to go out and ask one the employees at the concession stand to please start the movie. I waited 5 more minutes and then finally the screen came on. Everyone loves watching trailers of course, but since they started the movie late, they skipped a few of those too. They showed the first second of the trailer and then stopped it and skipped it, that really pissed me off. At the end of the movie, I could not even enjoy the animated conclusion of the movie because one of the employees basically kicked me out to clean the room. This happened on Tuesday 6/25/2018, the movie was the Incredibles 2, and it was scheduled at 7:15 pm. Also the whole building could use a little more cleaning and getting rid of certain smell.

It's simple. I am looking for 3 things when I go out to eat. 
Good food
Reasonable price 
And good service. 

Not a fan of Cans. Sub par food, over priced and a hipster arrogant bartender. Sorry that's 3 strikes, not going back.

Location is good but the food is very mediocre. 

They keep a long line outside but when we made it inside, there were tons of open tables. The AC was blasting and it was super cold. Even though there weren't that many people inside, the service took a really long time. 

The food was ok, but it wasn't anything you couldn't get at any other bar/restaurant. I would skip this place and save your appetite for some of the other yummy places around bourbon street.
OVERPRICED.  My bill was $65 for two people (juice not included). Better restaurants in the area for the price. Food was good but not amazing. The music was underwhelming. Service was lovely.
Not even worth the time it takes to park. Even if you call ahead for an appointment. Rude people with no skills.

DO NOT GO HERE !!!! Delievered couch at 1130 at night no cup holders installed holes there w fabric over top but not cut . Been calling 2 to 3 times a week for 5 WEEKS !!! Same BS everytime . Oh so sorry this never happened before need to talk to warehouse manager blah blah blah blah .Only  all I got back was to remove bad review ! HA . Said sure once you fix my couch . Well 3 moeq weeks nothing so I will write a bad review on e er site ;)

I have been coming here for years and I have never been more dissatisfied. I went in to get my toes done and the worker painted them really bad. When I told him if he could please fix them he said that my toe nail was messed up and the reason they looked bad. He kept arguing with me instead of fixing it. In the end I told him I didn't want them painted anymore if he could remove the polish, he got upset and started yelling at me that I was still needed to pay. I told him I wasn't going to pay for a service I was not pleased with and he threw the cotton ball at me and told me to remove my own nail polish. Never coming here again!

My daughter and I went to the Perino's on Sunday, 2/11/18, we got seated right away the waitress was friendly, but OMG the crawfish were small for 29.95 for 5 lbs. I am so glad we ordered potatoes and corn because that's what filled us up. Never again will I go there. I will continue to go to Sal's Seafood in Marrero.

Lori Guin, Westwego, La.
Boring. This outlet is nothing special.  However, the shopping center is pretty with lots or artwork

Guys this place is not good. 

My husband's order: soggy bread and chewy corned beef

My order: apparently one of their signature dishes...cold Eggs Benedict that tasted of vinegar, tough fried chicken, and stale old biscuits all plated on top of some random raw spinach leaves. It was cold. 

The service was not stellar and the floor was dirty.

2 stars because the upgrades are nice.  Leather chairs, etc.  That being said, I have never gone to this theater and not had trouble with people being super loud.  Talking during the movie, playing with phones, clapping and cheering, these are all really annoying things to do in a movie theater.  You're not in your living room.  The guy next to me last night actually ANSWERED HIS PHONE in the middle of the movie.  I'll stick with the B&B in Wildwood.  It's quieter.

Just had the worst overall experience there.   Food came out from obviously being under the heat lamp for 30 min.  We watched our drink at the bar for 15 min before anyone brought them over to us and I had to get up and go find a knife for myself.  No thanks!
Not impressed it's a downgrade version of Fogo chicken was horrible salad bar is ridiculous

This place started of great, with an excellent service and wonderful food. Almost a year after the first time I went to this specific location and becoming a regular in like being there at least three nights a week the staff has became awfully complacent, arrogant and full of themselves. I can't believe how much a business like this can change in such a short period of time specially when some of the bartenders think that they are better than anybody else they are serving to. They talk down to customers and if anything believe that they do you a favor when you ask for something or order a meal. They have to understand that they are in the service industry and like anyone else they should treat everyone with respect and appreciation because there are a million places where to fine dine and guess what when you have a bad experience with the service, the quality of the product can be exceptional but the aftertaste or arrogant people is never forgotten.

pretty overrated. I went for my boyfriend and I's anniversary and we wish we went somewhere else with more attentive service. The food was good but the service wasn't. If you get a good server you're lucky and i'm sure you'll have a good time... but if you don't, well, good luck.

Very rude people at the gulf coast optometrist, I should have listen to the reviews on here. I have been going to another eyeglass world and they were very nice but this place is just rude. Especially the blonde girl at the optometrist front desk I ask for a container to put my current contacts in and she slammed it on the counter. Acting like I was a burden. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else!

Toups South is one of my favorite, AND, least favorite places to go in New Orleans. I have been 3 or 4 times and it is always the same result (except for one trip to the Counter Club for brunch - that was legitimately fantastic).....Excellent, excellent food, matched with disgustingly poor service.

As for the service - they aren't mean or rude necessarily, but you tend to sit around waiting for service when needed, while the staff chats amongst themselves, texts on their phones and goes through the motions. I have never once felt like I was important to them as a customer. Tonight for example the bartender was arguing with another employee in front of us. She was upset about something relating to happy hour and belittling the other employee . I'd much rather have the cooks be my servers and tip them instead of anyone in FOH. 

As for the food - It's ridiculously delicious. They use a variety of cuts and preparations, and it's all done in house. Its simple, yet creative at the same time. You can tell there is a lot of thought and passion behind everything they send out. Personal favorite is the foie gras, but plenty of good ones.

Food is a certain 4-5 star. Service is a more certain 1. If the service were even average I would go far more often.

6 months ago I purchased an iPhone 7 used for $500.  After an update, the iPhone no longer had service.  Went to AT&T twice thinking it was the SIM card.  Turns out iPhone 7's have a glitch and Apple online stated they would repair it at no cost if I take it to an Apple store.  Made an appointment and went out in the Christmas rush on a Sunday to get it repaired.  We were told they would not repair it because I don't have a warranty.  But your phone is a defective piece of crap!!  They gave us $250 toward a new phone in a trade in.  

Your phone is defective and there are articles about it.  And you don't back up your product.  There are things I like about the iphones, but there are MANY MANY more things I love about Androids.  I go back and forth every new phone.  I think I'm done with Apple.  And honestly, Steve Jobs passed away and I don't think Apple will ever be ahead of the rest again.  It's just another phone

Not good. My bustle broke before my reception after spending $125 on it. Photos of what my dress looked like before and after i had to knot the train and tie it to my belt. Tried not to worry at my wedding, because it was my wedding, but it looks horrible in photos. 

Also, was only supposed to have three fittings when I came in for the bird they had not altered my dress from the second. And they quoted me more than $150 less than what I ended up paying. Frustrating.

Was excited to try their Trenton style pizza.  Got it for pickup.  Got home to eat and the pizza was burnt so black I could taste nothing but charred crust.  So disappointed they didn't hold back and give me one that wasn't burnt.

I just went there to try the Empanadas well, the cashier ruined my experience! They have a deal where you can get 3 empanadas for about $10. Otherwise, 1 costs you $3.85. I got 4 empanadas and was expecting to get the 3 empanadas for $10 and paying $3.85 for the 4th piece. But he charged me $16.75 for 4 empanadas. I even told him that this is not fair and does not make sense but he did offer to do anything, he just blamed the owners or managers for this charge. I even told him that I could just buy 3 and 1 later, but he did not do anything and told me that i got 4 and not 3, and suggested to come back again . LOL well this won't happen! I definitely won't be coming back to this place. It is simply a rip off! Feels like they are desperate to charge their customers extra! The cashier should be done suggesting me to pay separate or even offer me to get more empanadas so it would be the best value for me the customer! Just a rip of! Made me feel bad too. Basically, they punished me for buying more!

I wasn't too impressed. $6 for a hot dog with no sides. Everything a la carte, and the service wasn't that great. I ordered the Windy City Chicken and it wasn't anything special. Pretty bland, not a ton of sand which there. I could've gone to subway and spent less, got more food, and it probably would've tasted the same, if not better. My friends were none too impressed with the dogs. Beer selection was decent, just wasn't thrilled. Stairs seemed kind of dangerous too.
They do the job. Gave them another chance but if you want to get the job done for half the cost go to Brothers Auto just down the road on 5318 S MacDill Ave

Check your credit card statement if you eat here. They added 6 dollars to my bill. I noticed the theft when I checked my credit card statement online. I thought maybe it was a mistake, so I called... they hung up on me twice. Do not eat here.
The service was rude, lettuce was wilted, and the food was not tasty at all. I'm not sure how they stay in business. Did I go on a bad day?

I ended up taking my car back in early January to get all the issues resolved for what was estimated as a few day repair -- instead it took just about two weeks, and on at least five different occasions I had to remind them of what they were supposed to be fixing. They failed to call back on four separate occasions this time, though did surprisingly manage to call once when they said they would.

After failing to get any kind of updated timeline from the collision center for a few days I called the BMW service center where they'd sent the car
 -- turns out the delay was largely because they'd ordered the wrong replacement horn not once, but twice, and installed the second incorrect one before they realized the issue.

From what I can tell they forgot to realign the headlights, so I'll just have to have that done at BMW in Sacramento or the Bay Area when I need to take it in for my 16,000 mile service. Beyond that everything seems to be working, and hopefully this will be the last time I need to update this review.
Poor service, consistently does not give sauces even when asked, and does not use all the ingredients in certain items like the eggnormous burrito.

El servicio es lento y en la salsa tenía un cabello y dueño solo lo quito y nadamas hay dejo la salda no lo cambio ni dijo disculpas nada este lugar no lo recomendaría y eso que fue mi primer vivita ah ese lugar y la verda no está buena la comida ..................

I appreciate that this place does a lot of good in helping injured marine animals recover and so to that, 5 stars!! But there are some things I was super disappointed with. The price ($25 per person) is a lot of money and there isn't a lot to see. There is a small aquarium with a couple of dolphins, some sea turtles, otters, and sting rays.   The dolphins are cool and the trainers are willing to chat with the crowd.  

The parking garage is $10 which seems steep and is practically a block And a half away.  Not very accessible if you have someone which special needs and needs handicapped accessibility. My other issue is that they practically harass you to do the photo op when you first get there.  If I'm paying $25 for anything, let me out of the photo op! 

Ultimately, I just wish they would have displayed more info about how they help the animals or emphasized that there isn't much to see.

Typical Aloft; when Marriott absorbs Starwood they should get rid of Aloft and Four Points brands. I got a room with a window which I guess is rare. I'm Platinum and Gold for life. I almost broke my neck getting in the shower. So slippery. Need some grip tape. The lobby is nice. Lindsey at check in was great. The bath towels were so rough like with starch. Neither of the two local beers available. 

Fail.

Attended for a fundraiser for a school. Two HUGE stars for donating the restaurant for the event. The bingo was entertaining and we had a blast. Service was very good too. On the flip side, the place is beyond disgusting. The carpet is so old and soaked with food and beverages that the place stinks of vomit when you walk in. The carpet gooshes when you step on it. I had on flip flops~gross. Just gross. We ordered the Mary's hand, assortment of apps for the table. Wangs and mac&cheese balls were the highlight. Wangs (wings) were so good husband ordered another plate for his dinner. I had a basic burger. It was ok. The bun was a bit too hardy. Fries were scarce. Visited bathrooms before leaving. Whole place needs a deep cleaning and throw out that skanky vomit smelling carpet.

Amazing pizza. Terrible service. Ordered a pizza online and when I went to pick it up (30minutes later even though it stated it would be ready in 15), they hadn't even started the order. The people were very rude as well. Will not be going back.

Tldr: food was solid 3-4 stars but a giant cockroach flew down from the ceiling onto my shoulder during dinner, and the staff handled it so poorly. I want all visitors to know about it. 

I am not going to talk too much about the food. We ordered the cajun fries, NO favorites, redfish and bread pudding.  They were tasty.

The real kicker of the story here started when we got done ordering our food.  I felt something smack against the side of my face. When I reached for it, I felt it move down onto the table.  We then realized that there was a 3 inch long roach right there on our table crawling around. I jumped out of my seat right away because I am absolutely terrified of roaches. A few moments later, the staff came by, and "took care of it".  We changed table but I was so traumatized that the rest of the dinner was less than enjoyable.  

Our young waiter came and was somewhat apologetic about it.  He even told me about a time a roach jumped down his shirt. Thanks for that mental image...not. We ate our dinner and then came the bill.  I was so surprised to see our bill charged as full, given to us without another word of apology. No, no, no.. I asked to speak with the manager, and came a gentleman wearing a red tie.  I explained the incident to him calmly, and he explained that the restaurant passed all health checks and that they have no control over the court yard where the roaches can come from.  Um... did he just try to justify this?  I pressed on and said how is a roach landing on your customer INSIDE the restaurant an expected outcome of dining here? And then he got defensive and said that roaches can fly wherever they want and there isn't anything he can do.  I was furious at that point. Not because a roach landed on me, but because this manager thought my poor dining experience in his restaurant was not his problem.  A few more rounds back and forth, he suggested a 10% discount and free dessert.  I didn't think he was going to be more sympathetic than that so we paid the bill and left with a bitter taste in our mouths.  With so many good places nearby, I cannot recommend anyone to dine here if you care about good dining experience. YIKES.

I was skeptical of this place as being inauthentic and hipster before checking it out based on their over-the-top sign, but that's not at all why I didn't like it.  Not really hipster and at least semi-authentic.  I ordered take-out and my food was prepared really quickly, which I always appreciate.  I didn't get ice cream but it seemed like there was a crazy variety of toppings and flavors.  I also really liked the huge condiment bar with a good variety of tasty things: pickled onions, radishes, cilantro, and multiple types of salsa.  But that was the extent of the things I enjoyed about my experience with this restaurant.  

I ordered the Torta Ahogada, which is described as carnitas topped with pickled onions and smothered in house-made hot sauce.  It comes with taquitos as a side.  What I got was indeed smothered in hot sauce-- ON TOP OF THE BUN.  I kid you not, the entire top side of the torta was coated with a thick layer of extremely spicy sauce.  How does one eat a sandwich with the main condiment on top of the bun?  You can't hold it, and the coating literally made the bread too soggy to cut.  There was so much sauce on it that it was pretty much inedible because it was so overwhelmingly spicy-- and I'm a person who likes hot HOT stuff.  I ended up peeling away the bun and just eating the carnitas on the inside (which were decent) because, oh yeah, there were NO pickled onions on it.  The kicker is that the 'taquitos' (2) the torta was served with were literally just rolled, deep fried flour tortillas.  No filling.  It was pretty much fried dough.  

I don't know if whoever prepared this got the dish laughably wrong, or if it's really just supposed to be served this way, but either way....WTF?

I was skeptical about the reviews on here since Outback usually serves a decent chain product.  Well, the reviews were spot on!  Staff were nice, but the food was awful!  I ordered a medium rare steak that came out medium well.  I was then served broccoli that was brown. I was truly taken back by the broccoli I was served.  Last time I spend any money at this establishment.

It's STL Bread Co....that's about it. However, what sets this location apart from others is this place is incredibly dirty!! I don't recall a single visit where the trash collection area wasn't overflowing with dishes and trash. Also, the dining area is in constant need of vacuuming and tables wiped down.

Owner/Busboy/Waiter- whomever he is-is rude. It's the middle of winter and he refuses to turn the heat on. Everyone in restaurant was wearing their coats and gloves, including the staff! Extremely slow service.
There are way better diners in the area. Prices are high for just average diner foods and the service is slow almost always. Your best bet is breakfast in the morning.

I read great reviews about this place and therefore decided to try this place out. I had the tomatoe basil Swiss croissant and it was great however the service and unfriendly staff is the reason for my 2 star review. I would still recommend French truck coffee or spitfire cafe over this place

Visiting Nashville I wanted to treat myself to a fill and a gel mani and also a pedi. Found this place and it had mostly good reviews so I gave it a try. BIG mistake. Entering the salon it looks nice and the staff greeted me plesantly. I picked my color and they set me up with "Elvis". He was not friendly but not mean just there! He later offered a glass of wine which came in a dirty glass. Strike 1. The pedi I received was actually pretty good. He could have done a better job with the heel actions but overall No complaints. But my fill was a disaster from the beginning. I told him please keep the same shape (ballerina) He made them more narrow. Polish was streaky and there were gaps between my cuticle and the polish. I spoke to "Elvis" about it during, he did nothing to rectify it. Went to the desk spoke to the manager (didn't catch his name buff dude with a beachy surfer vibe) acknowledged the issue offered to do the manicure over again. I didn't have time, again I was visiting and had dinner plans. He then started to advise on how much of a rock star "Elvis" was! ( See what I did there) He explained how he's always booked. Really dude? I'm here with streaky nails and you want to talk about his greatness? He finally and begrudgingly offered a $15 discount and even after that my service total was $75. Over priced for less then stellar service. I can't speak for the other nail techs but "Elvis" should definitely leave the building on this one.

P.S. a day later and 3 nails are already chipping.

This is a little bit of a late review, but I just wanted to let people know NOT to take their double coated dogs here. I decided to try out a place closer to home and brought in my chow for a grooming (he was groomed monthly and also brushed daily) and the groomer took the time to tell me how horribly matted he was (and really try to make me feel bad about it??) and that he would need to be shaved. I obviously said Hell No and took him to his usual groomer the next day where he was groomed with absolutely no problems and definitely NOT shaved. 

I've had chows all my life and I know for a fact that my dog's fur was certainly not matted nor any different than any other double coated dog's during the winter months. 

I'm mostly upset that the groomer went so far out of her way to accuse me of being a bad dog owner. But I'm definitely glad I didn't leave my dog with her as she apparently doesn't know how to groom a Chow at all.
This place is fresh alright - Fresh out of the can ! 2 stars at best -Don't waste your time. There is better Mexican options in the area.
Ordered Crabcake and Shrimp Alfredo the other. The pasta was not creamy at all. It was bland and dry.

HORRIBLE SALON. Do NOT go here! Walked in, waited 5 minutes to be seated. Then went to the chair, lady followed about 30 seconds later filled up the tub and no one ever came back. After about 5 minutes she came back to finagle something then left. 5 minutes later I walked out. Foot drenched and all. DO NOT GO HERE. Rude staff, horrible service, all they care about is money and shoving food in their faces.

I rely on other reviews so rarely post a bad one. My weekend trip to Oceana was horrid, one of the worst meals I have had and I travel 100 days per year.  Nothing was good so after stale bread, oysters that tasted bad/were gritty, and tough, we left.  We had several other items that were cold and tasteless.  Meal was closer to a "1" than a "3."

Came here for NYE and it was the worst experience of my life. Not only could we not check in our coats, our friends had to bribe the bouncer to get into the club after 45 minutes of standing in freezing temperatures. This was after they paid for their $136 for their actual tickets. We only got served drinks after bribing the bartenders. Then when the lights turned on we noticed that the entire night we were dancing on broken glass. Since NOTO is two stories that glass could have been easily kicked to the bottom floor and hit someone. In fact as we left the club we saw a girl bleeding from her foot, and after asking several staff members for a band aid, they did not provide one. The only thing they could find was a towel and the girl had to walk barefoot and bleeding in freezing temperatures to her Uber. I emailed NOTO for a refund and all I could get was a free ticket to one of their concerts in January. I told them I simply could not risk my safety at the club after this experience. That girl could have been me or any of my friends. They have yet to respond and refund my money. Please do NOT give this club any more of your business, it is NOT the nicest club in the Philadelphia. There are bars that are hole in the walls that have more concern for their customers safety than this club. DO NOT RISK getting hurt at this place, it is not worth it.

I called for an estimate. 2015 Kia Soul, cutting a new key and programming fob, ( i had already purchased new blank key and fob)  Worker said $150 to $200.....The Dealership only wanted $180 for the whole thing including new key and fob, Kinda confusing when a car dealership is cheaper, that never happens.

So I came to this place because it was open late and it was convenient to my location. Off of initial instinct I thought the salon it self was beautiful and I also liked that it was kid free (I love children but sometimes it's nice just to get away) anyway I thought I would receive a 5 star treatment. I wanted to get a regular mani and pedi, however the guy and this older woman kept trying to persuade me to get a gel mani and pedi instead. After having to assert I only wanted a regular mani and pedi the older woman with the honey blonde hair got an attitude with me. I get to the back where the spa seats are for the pedicure and it was literally $25.00 for a 8 Min pedicure, I'm NOT exaggerating! The lady rushed my pedicure and not once did I get upset or even ask her what her hurry was. Instead I decided to just yelp my experience. As I am writing this review, the lady literally just drops a clump of nail polish on my toe and doesn't even bother to wipe it off she just keeps going over it instead. I asked her if she was okay and she just smiled and kept going. After she rushed my pedicure she just told me to go over there (now this is my first time here I have no idea where she's referring to) I'm not even going to wait until my experience here is over for me to give one star. Professionalism is a must and this older lady clearly lacked it! The water for my manicure was cold af, she also did a poor job doing it then her excuse was because I wasn't getting gel the polish didn't look right on me and she wasn't comfortable doing it. Even though I had paid her already, I told her in the future all she had to say was she didn't want to do my nails. Then she said her excuse was bc my nail length wasn't long. The owner then comes to tell me my business isn't wanted there because of my rating. He then proceeded to say because I "hate the world" that isn't good for me. What he meant was "because I freely wrote my review based off my experience that was not favorable for him, he's mad". If I had got loud or disrespectful I could understand his response but I didn't even say anything I just kept my mouth closed and wrote about it. I'm done ranting. If I could give a zero I would just for their lack of professionalism!

My husband and I have been going here since it opened.  This used to be a nice place to grab a burger and fries.  Well, now it isn't.  We went there on Saturday night.  It was only a few minutes to get a table.  (It used to be packed on weekend and maybe 20 minutes.)  When we were seated, the table still had USED, wadded up napkins on it, which they didn't take.  And the rest of the table was still really dirty.  I had to pour water on it and wipe it down to get it clean.  Then I went in the bathroom to wash my hands.  We would have left but we were starving.  The food came.  My husband had a burger and onion rings.  The onion rings were blah!  I had the turkey and cranberry sandwich was ok.  I had fries which were not fully cooked. I also had an ice tea which was so weak it was more like water with food coloring.  Overall the experience was terrible. And if the tables were this dirty, it makes me wonder how dirty the kitchen is.  This place used to be spotless.  Talk about going DOWN HILL!!

From the front desk at check-in to check-out my experience here has been atrocious. I'm not sure if the people who work here understands the meaning of customer service. I'm not referring to any outrageous requests, but basic requests that all travelers would make. There are many choices within this city, this one is a last resort.
All the menu items have unusual ingredients that turn me away from them. Prices are high
Lunch time. Empty restaurant. Two employees on their phones. Sticky tables. 20 minute wait for simple order. Worst Chinese I've had in St. Louis.

The atmosphere is very nice but the food was not great. I got the blackened fish tacos which had way too many peppercorns on them and it just tasted cheap and the Mac and cheese spirals were simply boiled rigatoni with shredded cheddar cheese dumped on top. None of my family members liked their food either. Cocktails are good.

I've been at this location for the past three years and was very pleased with the service until this time. I made a reservation for a bus to stop at the Golden Corral. Manager Tanya (very nice) offered me the bus rate and wrote my name down. I called the week before and confirmed they read my name out of the book and the time. I called the day before to make the total number 60 Tom the manager took the information. I called 30 minutes before the reservation to notify them we were on our way when The manager Tom (who wouldn't give me his last name) told me couldn't accommodate my reservation. He said he would put me on the waiting list and it would be 1 1/2 hour wait. He said he couldn't honor my reservation but he was going to make a reservation for me at a later time?  Come on I have 60 people ready to get off the bus for a reservation that was confirmed by 3 different employees of Golden Corral and you want to change my reservation 30 minutes before time and you didn't even call me? Tom you dropped the ball on this one. Very displeased with the service. Where are the other managers that took care of us for the past three years?
Do not eat here! I have never been more sick in all my life, food poisoning so bad I spent 2 days in the hospital!

So disappointed in this service.  Had no complaints until they went from 2 day per week to 1 day per week at the same price.  Service cut in half should also cut the cost in half.   They came today and only took 1 of 2 cans of garbage.  So the service goes drastically down and price stays the same? So illogical.  Calling the state next.  Doesn't even sound ethical/legal.

Well it is cheap! Mariam at front desk great, but this place is gross. Bed had no blanket. What!? Yes, like they give you two sheets.  Shower head was falling out of wall. Stains on carpet and wall. Paper thin walls so bad we had to request a fan to drown out the talking and coughing from next door. I couldn't wait to check out. So uncomfortable.

The service was good and this was the only positive thing I can say about this place. Its basically glorified strip mall food.
It looked pretty and the ingredients were fresh but the flavor was way off. The griddled lamb tasted like spoonful of curry and had a bad after taste. The jumbo garlic shrimp for $16 looked promising but had less flavor than the $8 garlic shrimp I get from the strip mall Chinese restaurant down the street. Overall it was confused and lacking. Han Dynasty was far better.

This place is the worst. We went to Galantis which was completely oversold and super dangerous. If there were a fire or any emergency event we all would've died. Staff are extremely rude and pushy, shoving you out of the way if you are near VIP which is impossible to avoid when you have completely oversold the space. They did not scan our tickets upon entry and had no way to track how many people were inside. Even the sound system blows, Galantis's microphones weren't working so you could only hear the music. The crowd is full of frat/finance bros, one of whom groped a girl I was standing next to after she turned him down. I wasn't able to use the bathroom once because the lines were so long. A bunch of people's coats in coat check were lost at the end of the night and getting out of the club with my jacket took over a half hour. People were climbing over the coat check counter to look for their coats. I could really go on, but don't want to spend any more of my time thinking about this place. I will definitely never be back and will advise everyone I know to never go to this place, it should be shut down. Don't waste your time or money at NOTO, it's an awful experience and dangerous because they prioritize making money over customer experience/safety.

The hallway is super sketchy and the elevator is sooo slow. I practically aged waiting for the elevator. There were no big towels just hand towels. We were in town for a concert . We woke up skipped the breakfeast and got the hell out.

I love the old school steak houses with the showmanship and art of flambé anything. My son and I decided after carefully going through other choices of steakhouses in the Reno area, Harrah's Steak House was the winner. 

We get in the casino and looking for the directions to the steakhouse well it was behind us next to the keno area by the entrance door downstairs. Hmmm no sign but the on next tot he stairs lol. 

Anyway we get downstairs and you can already tell it's one of those old school steak houses with the servers in their tux's, flambé carts and dessert tables on display. I was getting excited and I knew I was getting something flambéd. Whatever it was.


Before we ordered, we were served our waters, bread basket, butter and amuse bouche. We started with a seafood platter for two. Which came with 2 halves shelled lobster tails, 4 Cajun shrimps, 2 oysters on the half shell, 4 pieces of seared Cajun ahi tuna all wet! Why they are all laid on cubed ice that is used for your drinks. Not crushed ice that is for seafood. And why the Cajun flavor on anything? I just want seafood no flavor just dipping sauces to choose from. Sure they gave me soy, cocktail sauce, seafood mustard like sauce, but what's worth the sweet pickle, wasabi, pickled ginger because I'm not putting that on the Cajun tuna, that's just not right. Aside from the Cajun seasoning, why was the shrimps over cooked, so rubbery. Don't order this! 

Second course was stage lobster bisque, this was good. Not amazing but good. 

Mains were shrimp scampi and New York med rare add. On Oscar topping. Here's the problem, the linguini was over cooked, the shrimps once again hard and rubbery which was over cooked. The steak more rare than med rare, the Oscar topping looked like bits of shredded crab leg meat in a weird sauce. It didn't look appetizing. So don't bother with the Oscar topping upgrade. Actually don't bother with the scampi either. 

For dessert yes we kept going, I said I was going to get something flambéd! We ordered the banana fosters for two because that's the minimum which is $30 and profiteroles with hot fudge. The desserts were the WINNER!! I would come here just for the desserts! I wanted to try the cherries jubilee but my son like banana fosters uhg. 

Would I come here again sure for desserts. Yes they were busy and it seemed like they only really wanted to cater to the loud obnoxious drinking customers and the servers are working the tables for more tips. The other server I witnessed leave mid ordering from customer to say bye to his other customers that have apparently been regulars which was laughable but rude. Our server was at least trying to pay attention even though he is working the other table hard. I mean we probably spent more money than the other table of 4 but we weren't drinking and they were so he was pouring that wine. 

At least now I won't wonder about this place, sometimes you just need to experience it yourself and give an honest review.

I wouldn't be surprised if they can block negative comments cause the management is trashy like that but do NOT live here. Yes the entire complex is aesthetically pleasing but you will end up screwed in some way. We have had so many issues with management/maintenance here the list is endless. Not to mention what set me off to post this comment was the fact that I was just working out in the gym here, which I have enjoyed for the 2 years we've lived here, and was legitimately screamed at by a complete stranger. I was running on the treadmill and my mom called me so I answered and we were talking for 33 seconds....yes....I checked the time stamp on the call....33 seconds. And the man on the bike next to me (probably early 60s...not only enough to be a grouchy old man, who by the way even grouchy old men don't speak like this to people, trust me I have a soft spot for old people) screamed at me "HEY, I DONT NEED TO LISTEN TO YOU!" I was dumbfounded. I had no words. My fiancé yanked his earplugs out of his ears because he heard this man scream at me. And he mouthed to me if I wanted him to say something and I said no. I had absolutely no words for this man. We quickly finished our work out and left. So that was honestly the cherry on top of the 2 awful years living here. Thankfully we are house hunting to get the HECK OUT OF ISLES OF GATEWAY!!!

After waiting 3 weeks for my appointment I called on a Monday to verify the Saturday time for my maintenance for life oil change on my 2008 Hyundai Tucson. Only to be told that that had no record of my appointment and the best that they could do was have me bring my car in first thing in the morning and take my chances that they may or may not be able to get to it. I will never buy another vehicle from Click. I'm taking all my business to Tucson Suburu from now on. They have never treated me like this place. Unbelievable. I've met Mr. Click many times since moving to Tucson back in 1973 and just cannot believe he has let things deteriorate to this point. Evidently he has lost all accountability for quality control.

I was just here last night with friends and we had the worst experience. When we got there we had expected that we would have to wait for a lane since it was a Saturday night, so when we were quoted an hour we understood. 

We got there at 7pm and didn't get a lane until 10pm.  To make matters worse, during our game our screen froze and they said they would fix it "in a minute". Half hour later nothing was fixed. They mentioned that I just needed to start bowling and it would be okay. It worked for about another half hour and the screen froze again. They told us we had to move to another lane altogether since the screen wasn't working. 

Also, if the bartender is getting overwhelmed with the amount of guests at the bar and someone has to wait 20+ minutes for a drink, perhaps scheduling more bartenders would be a good solution. 
 
Do NOT recommend going here. Pick any other bowling place or just go for pool.

Sadly wasn't too impressed. Food was great, but overpriced. Portion size was definitely too small, and the wait for food and service was too long for a Monday morning. They were understaffed or incompetent servers. Also, NO alcohol! Its a crime to not have a mimosa with your brunch. Oh did I forget to mention my husband walked into the men's bathroom to find a big SHIT on the ground? I'd say if you're looking for a great brunch spot in Oro Valley, this might be your THIRD choice... or last.

Came here at 6:30 on a Tuesday night - just my son and I. First time here. Place was fairly busy. Got sat right away. After about 10 minutes - a waitress came by and asked to take our drink order. My son and I ordered soft drinks - she brought it out within a few minutes. She tells us that she is not our waitress and our waitress will be by ASAP. Another 10 minutes go by and the waitress finally comes to our table - keep in mind we have now been here for 20 minutes and the waitress only now comes to our table.  She apologizes and explains she was held up at another table. Kind of a lame excuse but whatever. My son and I order. Food comes out relatively quickly (perhaps 15 minutes later). Son and I both ordered the Alfredo. It was good. Wouldn't say great - but above average / good.   Rating based on slow service. Breaking it out:

Service - 2 stars
Food - 3 stars 

I think I may have gone on an off night based on the excellent reviews so I will try them again in a couple of weeks. Hopefully it will turn out better and I will update this review at that time.

After having Chopstick's delivery my food, I've written a glowing review on this place several months ago.   
I recently placed an online order and picked it up and what I saw standing in the pick up window made me question where the Health Department is? One individual in particular had on the most filthy shirt and shorts I've ever seen. Needless to say he worn no gloves, yet he is ladling out the soup and packaging up the orders. I've seen homeless people in the city with better personal hygiene. 

Seeing this, my eyes panned the inside of the former Checker's drive thru only to look up at the air conditioning vents with some sort of black buildup coating the area around the vent.  These are images I cannot get out of my head, therefore I will not go back!

TBH I love Red Robin but this last experience has made me rethink it. Yes it's great deal for your money if you actually get your bottomless fries when you request them. Normally I get them and get them fast and still fresh from the fryer. This past Saturday was not one of those days. I requested an order for refill of my sweet potato fries but didn't get them for 20 minutes, when I got them they were cold. My nephew didn't get his kids meal drink until I asked for it twice after the food was delivered. My sisters asked for a refill of their steak fries which never came. We ran out of water and waited 30 minutes for our server to even asknowledge us. When she did she took our cups and refilled them but she didn't bring new cups she just refilled the old ones and gave us back our water cups with the old straws....normally we would get new cups with new straws as this is more hygenic. After not getting our request for more steak fries we had to wait 20 minutes for  anyone to even acknowledge us so we could request the bill to which another server was kind enough to acknowledge us. 

We went to Red Robin to have a meal out with my sister for her birthday but since our service was so poor we just wanted to leave without ordering dessert. Normally I am more tolerant especially during dinner rush but I saw our server chatting away with the host desk and doing her best not to do her job. 

Our server finally came back after we had already complained and requested the check from management and the other server to inquire if we were good but by that time we just wanted to pay the bill and leave.  

This was by far the worst service I've had here so far.

Food tastes decent even though it takes upwards of 30 minutes to get it, and portions are 25% smaller than what you'd expect for the price. I've been 3 times over the past 8 months....mainly since it's the closest bbq to my house.... I'd much prefer Moe's or Blue Oak... but I get suckered in due to the proximity and their smoker draws me in like a drunken fool chasing neon lights... Anyway: today, dropped by around 7pm... they were already "out of chicken".... they only opened at 5pm... yep... ran out of chicken in two hours. All of their beers are $6 or more, except for one cheaper option: dixie for $3.50. They are too cool for bud lights etc... only "craft and microbrews"..... We asked cashier how long food was taking today since it always takes forever.... and she said "I have no idea".... um... ok... lady... thanks for your guidance.....  As per usual, we took our seats at the picnic table to begin the never ending wait.... drank all my beer... drank most of my water.... heard the jazz band play an entire album.... Finally, 30 minutes later... here comes our food minus the mac n' cheese.... b/c they were out of it... but making more and would bring it out later.... OK... side items are supposed to accompany bbq... not to be eaten in courses.... But we knew in advance we were dealing with a special needs child... and were hungry... and Moes was closed due to a private party (we went there first).... so we trudged through our halfway decent ribs and brisket.... Brisket was reheated on the pit on top of aluminum foil which the brisket stuck to like vinyl flooring... had to scrape it off as much as possible without eating the foil too....  We ate 2/3rds of our meal and wondered if the mac n' cheese was ever going to come.... We saw other tables eating it... so my GF ventured over to the pit master to inquire and sure enough "OH, I'm sorry, I forgot".... the pit master doubles as the food runner... dumbest idea ever... let me run some food while burning your brisket to the foil....  Mac n Cheese was OK, Baked beans were only 90% cooked... still a bit crunchy... But their main secret ingredient going for them is WE WERE HUNGRY.... and good people watching on the patio... 3rd time wasn't the charm... Doubt there will ever be a fourth unless I succumb to that smoker... that damn smoker.... Arghhhh....!!

This hotel sucked ass and balls...and those balls had been inside the ass in question. Elevator broken, meth heads roaming the fucking hallway, breakfast was in some dive bar the place picked up I mean are you fucking kidding me?

I had to use this place when my car was getting repaired. They don't really have good customer service when people come in. I saw a couple people slip through the cracks of getting greeted while there were three employees at the counter. They aren't really good at updating you with what's going in with picking up a vehicle. They just have you sit and wait. Whenever they were acknowledging you they were friendly. The car was clean and I always appreciate that they pick you up and drop you off.

I was looking forward to coming here! They have great reviews and are spoken highly of by word of mouth. When I arrived, they were closed. While figuring out an alternative plan, Doordash delivery showed up to pick up an order. Nobody turned off their ordering so customers were still expecting food ! I posted a picture of the notice on the door to verify for others that they are currently not in operation, and now I have management threatening to sue me. They are also accusing me of living upstairs? I guess they are at odds with someone who lives there and are confusing my identity? Either way this seems like the type of management I can't get down with... Probably will not return if they reopen

This place is seriously cute looking but that's about where the positive ends. I came in here with my mother who is Israeli and has an accent but perfect, totally clear English and is a bit older, so mobility isn't always perfect. So first let's talk about the food. The menu is very limited and they are very proud of themselves for having the impossible burger. I've had the impossible burger in other cities and usually they don't burn it, but here they do so I would definitely not recommend wasting your experience of the impossible burger here. It is delicious when made appropriately. My mom had a normal burger and said it was good but she also had the French onion soup and said it was awful. The service was seriously Xenophobic. I'm also I was born in the US so I have no accent so they kept acting like they needed me to translate her very clear English. The service was very uncomfortable and our waitress was clearly not attentive to us at all and very distracted by the fact that my mom is not in her 30s and has an accent which you can understand perfectly. I ordered the impossible burger with white cheddar on it she gave it to me with Swiss it was pretty disgusting and it was burnt. My mom, having less than young teeth, asked for very very soft vegetables and for some reason they gave it to her Al Dante and of course she couldn't eat it. Two people came out to 'handle' this request as though it was unreasonable or unruly. They acted almost as though she was asking for something extraordinary. A person with dentures sometimes needs soft vegetables. Then we got the bill and it was a $50 bill for two garbage burgers terrible soup and terrible service. I would never come here ever again. Unless you want to just enjoy the cute ambiance it is definitely cute

This used to be my favorite nail salon when it was The Nail Bar. Ever since management has changed, the service has gradually worsened. First, walking in, the manager told me there was no wait. I watched as she paged/called a technician for 20 minutes. The technician never came, so I was assigned to someone else. Then, I watched as this new technician diluted the nail polish with some kind of liquid prior to painting my toes. She also did not touch the cuticles. I also noticed that all of the staff was speaking in a foreign language to one another, instead of speaking to their clients (which was one thing that was so nice about The Nail Bar-they never did that). Pedicure was subpar and gel manicure even more so. I sure hope this establishment makes changes, as I'd hate for them to lose business when it used to be the best in town.
I ordered yellow curry and there was a bug in it just plainly sitting on top so I'm gonna have to not recommend this place.

Mother's Day- walked in @11:15AM and got seated right away. Several open tables. Drink orders taken and delivered right away. Food order in by 11:30. Food delivered to our table at 12:35. YES over an hour later.  Tables around us got sat, ordered, ate and left while our our order was in. 

Here is the deal it happens. Waitress is nice enough about it, but we are sitting right next to the bar where manager is at the whole time. She tells him when we complain at the 1 hour mark. He says loud enough to make sure we can hear, " OK well there is nothing I can do about it, tell them they are working hard back there". Never says anything to us, but comes across like a jerk. 

My breakfast wrap came out cold and dry. My daughters scrambled eggs were not edible but everything else tasted great. 

I won't be back.

Funny how you forgot that you were talking smack because I didn't agree with your paid discount called me names said my wife called me names when you talked to her. Why would i pay for a preventative pest control? I had ants I wanted then gone. Maybe you shouldn't have fine print in your ads. I didn't get a refund from Groupon.
Maybe you shouldn't call people names if they don't agree with you.

Very unprofessional

Used to be a great place.  They changed ownership and now this place is as dishonest as any. They will take advantage of senior citizens especially if you go there for a state inspection. Two years in a row they would want us to hand over 900 dollars. A long list of items that they find on my car to fail inspection makes you think these guys should be working for NASA. Well you are being warned. These guys are getting desperate for money. Your money is their money.  What used to be a trustworthy place now is run by thief. Avoid !!
This review is rated based on the service rendered by this establishment. Make sure you have significant time if you decide to try it out.
Great ambiance but the coffee is not my cup of tea. Lightly roasted beans should produce a more complex flavor but I'm not there yet.
This was the worst service I have ever experienced. I waited for an hour and a half and I had a reservation.

Do you have to fail an IQ year to work in the shoe department here?  These employees suck. They acted as though they were doing me a favor by "helping" me. When I asked the salesperson, Howard, if the shoe fit my son, he gave me a blank stare and said, "I dunno."  When I asked him if he had another size, again I got the response, "I dunno."  I asked him, "Well can you check?" and he looked really annoyed that I expected him to do his job. 

I have 5 sons and have spent a small fortune at this place. Unfortunately, there is nowhere else to go. The service here is REPEATEDLY bad.

Went there based on several recommendations. We left disappointed, this is very over hyped. The customer service was the worst we've had so far on our trip. The food wasn't particularly special, not bad by any means, but not amazing. Maybe it was just an off night.

The lack of professionalism has driven me to remove both my vehicles from my monthly membership with Prime. I paid for an Elite membership while only getting the lesser level treatment for my vehicle and the same with my second vehicle. I do NOT recommend this place.

We asked for diet coke.  They don't have diet coke.
We asked for sweet-n-low.  They don't have sweet-n-low.

Was not going to wait around for a third time to be told they don't have a basic item that all restaurants should have, so we went somewhere else.

This was a first time visit for family of four.  It will also be our last time.   The inside is small and cramped. The food was mediocre at best.   The service was below average but dramatically improved as it became closer to "tip" time.   Overall the place was not very clean.  The condiment containers on our table did not appear to have been cleaned since they were put out.   A disappointing dining experience for all of us.

Worst Bbq I have ever had. Ordered the brisket melt, suppose to have pepperjack, looked like provolone. Ordered side of smoked green beans, which tasted like they just poured liquid smoke on them, so bad tasting i couldnt eat more than 2 bites of the green beans. The sandwich hardly had any meat, mostly just chunks of Fat. I definetly will not waste my time or my money going back there. You want real BBq, go to Dickeys, well worth the money.

Someone recommended Ralphs, so we went with our 8 year old. We were unaware it was not for kids, so that was on us. Our daughter is a very well mannered little girl anyway, so we figured no problem.

Well, we were wrong. We were treated like we brought in the bubonic plague. We were starving, so the adults got various dishes, while my daughter got pasta with sauce. The waiter treated my daughter like she was invisible.She was so polite said hi and asked if she could please have something to drink. The waiter looks at her,then ignores her and looks at me. I then repeat the request, and ask what non soft drinks they have and the nasty waiter says "Cranberry juice or water thats it" ummm ok. He was not all that much better with the adults. He was short and terse with us.

I get it was not setup for kids, but a restaurant needs to have some basic respect for any customers. When a child has more respect for others, a lesson should be learned.

My daughters parting wisdom as we left was "Wow daddy they were not very nice, i hope we don't Come here again"

I assured her, we wont.

Do your research before paying for anything. I went in for a simple oil change, and afterwards was recommended 3-4 different services by the service advisor to add on. It's to be expected, I know there's basic upkeep for my CRV that's clocked in at 70k miles. Thing is, they were going to cost me about an extra $500 altogether (transmission flush, power steering flush, and differential service). I found a better quote elsewhere and when I told my advisor this, he had other offers to do the transmission flush for less than was originally (it not being a "full" flush, which honestly doesn't even need to be done yet, but it would have been nice to know the full extent of my options and prices while he left me to make my decision). Worst of all, in regards to the power steering flush, I know my car has electric steering and therefore has no fluid to need flushing (potentially costing me $140). What??? Who checked off that this fluid "Needs Attention" on the R/O?? And then to quote me $140 for it in order to maintain a warranty?? It literally doesn't exist in my car, and I get the sense someone hoped I wouldn't know better.

Please please please don't get your chicken wings or anything from here .... I worked for L& I for years and citated them numerous times for uncleniless & hairs & feathers on their chicken.  Please if you don't want to get sick don't go here

Nice vibe and friendly service in a trendy neighborhood. But food was not good, not consistent among identical orders at the table -- and with premium prices for simple Mexican food. Group of nine. Pitcher of margarita was OK if you like extreme bitter. Cabillitos burger was too salty and therefore not edible, as were the accompanying fries. Waitress offered to replace it with something else, which was nice, but we didn't have time. Two in our group got the Pollo enchiladas and they were cold in the middle. My fellow guests otherwise dug them. Wouldn't recommend.

Routinely wrong, if you call and complain they'll make it seem like it was your fault for not triple checking the order before leaving. Won't apologize for the constant mistakes, but will get offended if you suggest they do their job better instead of trying to put the blame on you.

Oh, they also massively raised their prices in the past few months. So service has gotten worse while they want you to pay more. Do yourself a favor and avoid this place.

I used to work by Main Street so I'd come here with coworkers and was always disappointed. Maybe I hoped for too much during happy hour or dinner. I came here again recently with my family and realized that I'd actually had good service comparatively in the past. I don't know if the target market for Trailhead is people with far too much time and far too few tastebuds but that's what it felt like. Food isn't seasoned well, it's probably cold by the time it comes out to you (is that a kitchen issue or a server issue?) and the server often disappears for a half hour at a time. Again, this isn't isolated to one visit but rather years of visits. Every place on Main Street St. Charles seems to think they don't have to offer good food or service because they have some kind of captive audience, meanwhile the restaurants of Streets of St. Charles have stepped up and offer much better food. After you finish your shopping, make the short trip over to SoSC and try food that actually has flavor.

The worst service ever. Took over 20 mins to find someone to help in electronics. When the Assistant Manager was found, Jerry was very helpful. I cannot say the same for his staff. He had to tell them to go help other customers, that were waiting as well. He could not get any assistance from the employee eating popcorn.

ABSOLUTE WORST SERVICE! If I could give this place a 0, I would. We ordered online through GrubHub around 9:45 pm on a Saturday and estimated delivery time was 11:00pm and I received a confirmation message from GrubHub saying the food was in the process of being made and they updated the delivery time to 11:10pm. I call at 11:03pm to check on my order. It took 7 Times to call in order to get a hold of this rude man who said "WE'RE CLOSED BYE" and I replied "whoa hold on a second" and explained to him my order and questioned if it was on the way. He said they never received my order and to take it up with GrubHub. When I called GrubHub they said that they had the confirmation number from the restaurant that they received this order. They further explained that they've been doing this to people all day and this is the only place in all of Nashville that they ever had a problem with.

I went in for estimate for fixing the right rear side and bumper replacement . Andre quoted me ~ $850 .
A week later , I came across offer 10% off for another location . The guy gave me quote bit more than $1000 for same work. Suprisingly, he refered me to the same Location I went first place . 
I decided to come back to Andre, he pulled up the quotes and saw the new quote the other guy just did for me in the sys ( turn out you can get two different price from Maacco locations? ) . I went ahead leave my car.
first time of coming  back, I found scratch on the new bumper,. the explanation is since it is after-market part, it is not perfect and but he will order another .
Second time of coming  back, I noticed there was a gap between the upper part where it was fixed,repainted  and new bumper, I asked him if this looks right to him? once agan, he said it is after-market , you can not expect it to be perfect; since I wanted it cheap, I should've known this. I know they making $$ of the new bumper by charging me $149 and yet can't at least check its quality ??? He also mentioned that I should not go to the other location and  "WASTED" his coworker time after he gave me quote already. I had him put my old bumper back on.
Third time of coming back, the old bumper is intact with a gap , I showed him pic I took shows no gap before the repair,  and asked him to explain  since this is no after-market part, he said b/c the bumper was bumped into so it  no longer fit as before(?) and how he  did not charge me labor to put it on (?) . I did final check on the paint part,noticed buble and dents on the new paint, I waited 10 minutes for it to be fixed. Went in make payment. Came out , checked again, found buble on another side, he said they did not work on this part. after another 10 minutes, he brought the car back and explained it was from the top coat they put on. (??) . 
he took the bumper of the bill and still charged me work labor
Poor work quality and lack of professionalism !

I would not even give one star because the food and service was so bad. I went here one week ago on a Wednesday for dinner at 7pm. Service was horrible. Plates were dirty. Our server said the food would take a while. It did. When the food came it was the worse Mexican food I have ever had. Taco bell seems gourmet in comparison to what was on my plate. soggy bad tasting burrito just thrown on the plate messy. Soggy tacos. hard, cold, dry fries. beans looked like regurgitation. I complained to the server who agreed with me that the food is bad there and he is looking for a new job. Since everyone complains about the food. He apologized that although we didn't eat the food we still have to pay. which I did. but I will NOT be back to Don Pablos Nixon Drive. You lost a customer.

Save your money and avoid the hibachi. Steak was drowned in some sauce along with the vegetables. Neither had any flavor at all. Super runny yumyum sauce. Sadly I've had more flavor at a food court hibachi.

I have no opinion about pediatricians and services they provide. This is only about people who make appointments. They give me the impression that they are not eager to take new patients. It may me think if they are understaff and not able to provide efficient service. I was looking for a pediatrician for my son. I was put on hold twice for more than 3 minutes each call. The only time I got to talk to a staff, I was told to call back with my son's insurance card ready. Next time called, a long hold time.. I called Tanque Verde pediatrics instead and was able to get an appointment made with the first call.

I went out to this bar several times last year for the Eagles games and we always sit in the back in the non smoking room and we always have great service. Tonight 12/30/18 we went there and the first waitress was great and was on her game..her shift was over and she asked us if we could cash out and someone else would be with us.  So we cashed out and then another waitress took over or else was supposed to take over.... we received our first check at 4:53pm. After which the new waitress never came over, she came in a few times and waited on the first table in the back(ignoring the rest, including us) we said excuse me only to be ignored and even went up to the bar to get drinks and we were ignored.. my sister said to the waitress behind the bar "excuse me can you please come to table by the window when you have a second"  she said yeah and still never came back....it was 5:57 when we finally decided to leave.  We went back to the same waitress Frustrated and told her not to worry about sending anyone back and she said she didn't realize anyone was waiting It's unfortunate because we typically like coming here and consider it to be "good luck" since we went there for playoff games and the Super Bowl.

I had a VERY UNPLEASANT experience here last evening!! I went with my 62 year old sister-in law to pick up a very large load of lumber (we are building a shed). Oh by the way I am 65! We were struggling to load over $500 of plywood and 2x4x12 and 2x4x16 (dozens of them) on to three push carts while two Lowe's employees-watched us struggling. My sister in law shouted (she is partially deaf and speaks loud as a rule) at one employee to cut a wire band holding some wood. Now he was about 60 feet away and they had just finished moving a fork lift truck past us! So this employee walks up and gives her serious attitude for "Shouting" at him! She explained that she is partially deaf and that is just how she always talks! I so very badly wanted to leave the three carts of lumber where it sat and WALK OUT! But we had already spent the better part of an hour and we still had to get it loaded, drive home and unload! One saving grace was Anthony, an employee who helped us load our trailer! He was SUPER! My real regret was that I did not ask to speak to a manager! Home Depot will be getting ALL my business from now on!!

Super busy, like all places in DT St Louis. If you are a fan of waiting in line, eating off serving tray layered with paper, picking out of 100 items that get you confused, bunch of bottles of bbq sauces all tasting the same right nbyour table top leaving no place for your food, huge portions if sides, self service....hmm, then this is fit for you.
The Ribs come dry and you basically lather it with sauce. The option of 2 sides, which they ran out of most of the times. The pulled pork is sold by onces and just layes in a corner again with no seasoning or sauce, buns are given on the side. Only burgers come assembled. 
I mean for that kind of service and food they should be charging half the price.

Food is medicore. There is ZERO ventilation, and the dishes smell like dishwasher. Waitress was an absolute monster. Baked in Cruella makeup with the attitude to match. 

What happened to this place?

Food was okay but this was probably the worst service I have ever had! We came at about 12:30 and there were only a couple more guests here. It took us 50 minutes to get our food, meanwhile tables who arrived after us were served about 20 minutes before us. When our food finally came the bread on my turkey avocado blt was soggy. It then took another 20 minutes for our waitress to come back around to fix my order. At this point my girlfriend had finished eating so when it finally came back out we just asked for a box and check. She brought the box but not the check. It then took another 15 minutes to get our check. Longest lunch of my life, and nothing about it was worth it.

The driver did not show-up and I almost missed my flight.  I was told to take a taxi at cost of $95.  I got a receipt but it did not include the time pick-up time on it and Super Shuttle refused to reimburse me.  They never apologized for failing to pick me up in the first place.  Do not use them.  Find another company that's reliable.

Ok, the room was clean and a normal room...nothing special. The staff is less than accommodating when you need anything. If you need to put your luggage in a car and leave it to eat breakfast they want to charge you again for a whole day of parking. Why not have a secure easy system in place to hold luggage? Also the cleaning fee for a 1 night stay is over the top and the cancellation policy is less than adequate! Horrible experience and I have traveled all over the world so I have plenty to compare this place.

DO NOT I REPEAT DO NOT ATTEND A SPECIALTY SHOW HERE!!! I purchased tickets for a 10pm Magic Mike show stood on line for 2 plus hours to get in. Th line was around the corner and all the way to Buffalo Wild Wings. The ENTIRE back of the line was brought in thru a side door and everyone else that has been waiting patiently DID NOT GET IN!!! An "employee" came to tell the people waiting on line after the show had already started to go in thru the side door to get in "quicker" DOES THAT MAKE SENSE?!?! What is the use of the front entrance then!!! Apparently the front entrance is for the peons! NEVER EVER AGAIN will I attend a function at Hamburger Mary's!

I started a new job in Speedway so I'm trying out different places to find what I like. Stopped at Canton today. Paid $8 for a lunch sweet and sour chicken. The chicken was way undercooked and I had to throw it all away. The egg drop soup tasted burnt and I had to pay $1.64 for the crackers for soup. I will not be going back. Ever.

6/9 here again... why? Why ??? Why????  80 mins for Cheetah....   upstairs of the outpost reserved.   What a joke... 

1/27 here again.    This time the bar is all out of everything.   It's 11:30 am and the lines for rides are 55 min wait lol...    yeah...   just spent an additional $300 so my family can "enjoy" the day.   Smh...   this park.... why do I keep coming backv


11/11 - Here again.   After last incident BG gave us skip the line passes.   Only good for one line jump per ride (not quick que unlimited).   We used them yesterday and it was an ok day.   Today the kids were in line for Cobras Curse.   Estimated wait showing?  65 mins.   Actually time? 2 hours 5mins!!!   Yes my children spend half a day waiting to ride a ride !!!!    Why?  Lightening?   ZERO.   It was Busch Gardens favorite recording "Due to technical difficulties".   

Yesterday they removed the Platinum parking without notice.   That was a total nightmare trying to navigate two handicapped folks about a mile to get into the park.   I sent a message to guest relations...   (nobody cares.).   We will purchase quick que unlimited for the kids tomorrow ($150.00 extra) because without it the Park is a complete waste of time.   Unless you want to spend all day waiting in line.   





Completely awful!!!!   I can understand weather but holy sh!t...    every single ride "Down for technical difficulties...".  Omg....   we've been here two days and our children have got on 3 rides.    Between weather and "technical difficulties."   We paid $1500 PLUS HOTEL for me, my husband, and 3 children.    This park has gone down hill BIGTIME!   

Also our kids went to get on the SHEIKRA and they were in the seat and the ride shut down.   The tech workers are there working within a few minutes but it too ma few hours.   They tried to go back and they were told NO too small.  I've posted photos.   It's close but NO....   

I am headed to customer service to voice my complaints and I bet they don't do crap!

I really wanted to love this place because the decor and atmosphere is adorable but the food left a lot to be desired.

- Japancake [ SHREDDED SAVORY CABBAGE, AIOLI, JALAPENO, MB HOT SAUCE ] Added a fried egg: Tasted like straight up pickled cabbage. The fried egg made it less vinegar-y but there weren't any other flavors.

- What's Kraken? [ TOAST, BLACK SESAME SPREAD, CHORIZO, OCTOPUS, GIARDINIERA ]: Octopus was over cooked and chewy. The black sesame spread looked like a poop smear on the plate and you couldn't even scrap any of it off the plate because it had hardened. There was barely any chorizo. Not good at all.

- Southern Livin' [ FRIED PICKLED OKRA, CORN CHOW CHOW, HEIRLOOM TOMATO REMOULADE ]:  Not bad. My second best dish of the night. Doesn't mean much though. It was just fried okra.

- Tatchos [ TATER TOTS, LAMB CHILI, BEER CHEDDAR, SCALLION ]: Best dish of the night. The lamb chili had a game-y taste that's to be expected and it was still edible.

We also got a few cocktails that were really well made.

Overall, the atmosphere and drinks were good. The bar was bustling as we were leaving! However the food was just a NO THANKS for me. Service was friendly.

We are a vegetarian family and found this little place on yelp while on the west side. Inconspicuously situated off Fisk ave, we immediately noticed a charming outdoor seating area with picnic tables and fresh Flowers. Inside was a little less inviting with only two small tables and a cramped windowless dining room. We opted to sit inside because of the 90 degree weather. We had veggie burgers, bbq tofu sandwich, potatoes, Mac n cheese and ginger beer. There were some issues with our order to the tune of, no vegan cheese on our burgers (which we were charged for) and no side of sliced tofu, which we'd also ordered and paid for but they'd misunderstood to hear as we wanted extra on the sandwich. When we were asked to pay for another order of tofu we politely did so. Even the additional order was bbq which was not the sliced tofu we ordered off the menu. Despite these discrepancies, the food was ok. Pricing was a bit high, 65$ after paying twice for extra tofu. Probably won't be back but think it's got potential if they could pay more attention to detail.

I've never tried this place and it's close to our house so we thought we'd give it a try. We walked in to no host at the host stand which blew my mind because there was hardly anyone else in the restaurant. The waitress ignored all of grandmas positive feedback about the food, which she should have acknowledged because there weren't many positive things about the food. I ordered the brisket and it had a bunch of fat on it and I got about 12 green beans with my order. My brothers fish and chips was dry and my mothers tacos were drenched in grease. I know where I'm never eating again.

Worst customer service I have EVER experienced. They treated my friend and I like we were an inconvenience. They were pushy on more expensive options, completely disrespectful and took their feelings out on our pedicure. They rushed through it and the end result was so bad my friend and I redid our nails when we got home. I do not recommend this place at all. I will never go back. Terrible experience and TERRIBLE customer service!
Short staffed, never have wheat bread when they say the do, never get order completely right, disappointing.

We contacted this business for a complete set of kitchen cabinets. The guy came out and measured. A month went by and not a word from them. I called and was told they were busy and it would be another week. We never heard from them again. Three months and still waiting. Poor customer service. Even if you are busy you should have the courtesy of keeping contact with a customer willing to spend over $10K for simple boxes with doors.

Food was ok. Not great. Gruper was overcooked and dry. Stone crabs are overpriced and flavorless because they just boil them over and over. Keylime pie SUCKED and hostess wasn't very friendly. She looked us up and down and we almost left the smelly joint. Our waitress was nice but had the same speel about everything on the menu. I gave a 2 rating because the location of Tierra Verde is awesome but this place is not!!!  If you want a great seafood dinner, I would try the Tampa Blue Crab and Seafood Market, its fresh and they cook for you.

Boo!  Posted yesterday about a poor experience at October's "After Hours" due to 1/2 of the museum best exhibits being closed (Virtual reality, planetarium, etc. being closed due to renovations.  Not on museums site not when you by tickets!!  Also the activities were weak with wait times 30 plus minutes.  Could by adult drinks bout they ran out of ingredients (also costly). Folks: this was NOTHING LIKE LAST YEAR!  Boring!!! Costume dress of Harry Potter quite BORING!!  Love this museum BUY poor presentation this year for "After Hours" this October!  Will not return until all renovations are completed.  Had family members travel quite a distance for this major disappointment.  Nice part: the staff are kind, helpful and informative.   Lets see how quick this gets hidden or deleted!!!!!!!!
Yup, still horrible here. Why go through drive through if they are going to ask you to pull over after you get to the window, then wait 10 minutes? People, get your act together!
Found ants in my friends drink. Probably because they don't clean the fruit containers. Waiter acted like it was normal.

This is our second time as a family at Sandpearl and a couple of the same issues are coming back. One: No toilet paper (it's like gold at this place), two: housekeeping sucks! I don't know why it takes us calling the front desk to get the room clean. Also, it's our third day here and no clean sheets, gross!! The only reason we came back here was because of the location, it's perfect, right on the beach. Another thing that irked me this time around was the hotel charging us to use the chairs and umbrella on the beach, it used to be included. Needless to say, we will not be coming back.

Side note: wanted to give a shout out to the Starbucks lady, coffee was great every time! Even better than at some regular Starbucks locations.

It's hard to tell what's worse, the food or the service. Either way, go somewhere else. The food is gross and the service is terrible. There is a reason their rating is so low so save yourself a headache and a waste of money, go somewhere else. Anywhere else. This place is terrible and they don't care.
Two stars is generous. Pretty sure the gumbo was Campbell's soup with rice in it. Waiter was slow and unattentive. Floors were sticky. Other food was edible I guess?

Just ok.  Gas Price was higher than the gas station I usually go to on Calle Real. Also tried their car wash.  There was Only 1 wash bay and The line was about 7 cars deep. Took 30 mins until it was my turn. Afterwards the sides and hood of my car were still dirty.  The roof was a little cleaner. In my opinion,  Not worth the money
disappointed && annoyed ... poor poor service ,  && VERRRRY rude. overall a big joke.

So my first time here was Saturday. My friends mom was running the marathon that day so we decided to hang out. I had servers Anna and Wendy who were great. A decent pork tenderloin too. However as they started to get busier after the race a staff member whom I was told was the busser was extremely rude and made the whole experience less appealing. He was older with gray hair and I thought he might have been the owner or manager. I'm glad to hear he wasn't. Hopefully he can get some customer service training. I'm in the food industry as well and know how important it is.

I went to this salon before and I had a good experience. Unfortunately, this time the salon was so dirty, the smell- it stinked and they were flies everywhere. I will never go there again!!! It was not a spa-like relaxing feel you want at the salon while getting pampered. On top of it my nails were filed crooked. I couldn't wait to leave to go home and file my own nails so they look even.
