So decided to try this place, very minimum on what you get for there 65.00 pedicure/ manicure. I had to come home and take polish off my skin around my toes. She cut into my cuticle have blood on my nail and it's super tender. As for my manicure she wrapped my husbands hand I never got my hands wrapped or massaged.  Usually tip 20 for both manicure and pedicure but only tipped 10.00 and probably should have tipped nothing. Very, very disappointed. Wanted to make this place a once a month trip, but my husband was disappointed too. So it will be the first and last time we go there.

Update ... can't put shoe on this morning.  She Fed up my toe!

I used to enjoy eating @Vero Amore. Today is the end of our long relationship. My house salad was less than fresh, rotten wilted greens. No one should have to comb through a salad making sure it's fresh. To many times to count. On to the pepperoni pizza. Requested extra crispy. Curious there were 2 other tables, both had their food, yet it took over 30 mins to get my pizza. Salad came within minutes. It was not crispy, it had way to much cheese which contributed to it being soggy and maybe 6 to 9 slices of pepperoni under the globs of cheese. I  stomached 1/3 of the greens and left the pizza behind.  Every time @Dove Mountain the dough is lacking salt which in turn makes for a bland lifeless pizza.

If there was ever a Chili's featured on the tv show "Bar Rescue" this would be it! Poor uncaring service, unsanitary conditions, out of items on the menu. The whole place seems sticky, especially the bar. My wife loves the Chili's chips and salsa, so from now on we will drive a little farther to different (hopefully cleaner) Chili's. If I worked for Chili's corporate and was in charge of this restaurant I would immediately close it down and regroup. More of a liability than asset.

They took me for over $3000 and refused to refund when I questioned their treatment and credibility.  Please do NOT give them money upfront and please report them to the Tennessee Board of Medical examiners if you have issues.  I never saw an actual MD my entire time there, only chiropractors and nurse practitioners who are not qualified to treat endocrine issues.

Update based on reply:  His claims are false. I tried to cancel within 24 hours and was told I would be out $1400.  So if I had not signed paper the day before I would owe nothing but 1 day later I owe $1400. It is a strange business practice that they charge $1400 to diagnose you when I have major medical insurance which they also charged for tests.  I was given a list of providers which included an endocrinologist who I NEVER saw.  I was there fo an already DIAGNOSED thyroid issue. I am out the money as I stated and after months of trying and they mostly ignoring me my husband told me to let it go as it was not worth the stress they were causing me. I still see the commercials I fell for. I just wanted to feel better. So will still take ever opportunity to warn people so that what happened to me does not happen to them.  I have nothing to lose at this point I am already out the money.  But they have much to gain by keeping up this charade.   The Tennessee Medical Board finding are confidential so I don't know the outcome of my claim but I do believe that Tennessee Medical Examiners and Better Business Bureau are your best bet at stopping this from continuing and helping to resolve issues
Good chicken. But extremely hot. I like my chicken hot but it's a little too hot for me.

Honestly, not sure what all the rave reviews are about. This shop seemed just like another mechanic/tire shop to me. I went in after I blew a tire on a pothole. They ended up changing two of my tires. I was originally quoted $420 for 2 tire changes, alignment, and some insurance they were trying to sell me. I eventually got the price down to $280 for two tires. I also tried to use a coupon I found online that they didn't honor for no reason in particular. 

I would recommend another tire shop. 

Try discount tires if you are looking to pay less then $150 per tire.

What a terrible Taco Bell. I know what you're thinking "it's Taco Bell! What do you expect?!"

I understand mistakes happen, but don't get mad at customers for bringing back an incorrect order. They got the sauce packets right, so I guess that's a plus. Just a terrible store with terrible employees
Ordered the kung pal shrimp. There were 6 baby shrimp in the whole thing. Rip off. Will never order there again

We were walking past and my husband and son who both love meat very much pulled me in to eat here. I should have gone with my instinct when I saw the shabby and dirty interior that this wasn't the best place to eat. While we waited for our food to come, I went to the bathroom and had to hold my breathe because of the fetid odor inside. Thankfully, I didn't loose my appetite, and when my meat pie came, I was eager to love it, but it was just ok. The meat inside was a bit too spicy and overpowering. My husband ordered a poboy for $12 and it was the size of half poboy you get at other places in the city that are half the price. It didn't come with fries or a salad. He said it was ok. We ordered a side of fries but they were soggy and looked like they were reheated. My son said his sandwich was amazing, but he gets into a rapture over cafeteria food. Now maybe there are some things on the menu that would wow me, but this place needs to be cleaner and more generous with portions and offer free (freshly cooked) fries with meals over 8 bucks.

This used to be a favorite spot of mine (and several friends), until the bartenders (namely Delia) decided to charge for doubles (without asking) and balk at any tip less than 15%.  What a shame, especially coming into the slow season.  2 for 1 drink happy hour special was also eliminated without notice.  With several new bar/restaurants opening, this establishment had better wise up, and appreciate the regulars that keep the lights on.

I wish I had better things to say about this place but I would not recommend this restaurant. The side salad and homemade italian dressing was really good but there was only 6 pieces of lettuce. It was very small. The calamari was extra rubbery and bland. I ordered a side of alfredo for the garlic bread but didn't come out until my meal. The waitress also failed to tell us that it would be an extra $4 for each side. I ordered the chicken fettuccini alfredo and the chicken was inedible. It either disintegrated in your mouth or was so chewy you actually couldn't chew it. It reminded me of pre-cooked bagged chicken strips. It might have been. Gross.They didn't offer to remake it. I wouldn't have accepted for them to remake it because it so long to receive our food to begin with. They also didn't give us a credit or any type of refund. The only reason I am leaving two stars is because the salad dressing was good and the server was okay. Oh did I forget to say that the table was so small my friend had to eat on her lap? Ridiculous. Save your $100 for dinner and so elsewhere.

Shopping in person with IKEA is amazing but if you're unfortunate not to have one close by, they do now offer online ordering.  I have to say that the online ordering takes forever.  Don't expect to get anything within days.  It will actually take weeks.  It's disappointing too because I have a property that I want to stage and I won't be able to do it in time because of the late shipment.  I don't understand why the length of time?  I'm ordering very simple things like throw pillow covers, etc.  I really wish there was a store close by that I could go to.  I was so excited to see that they started online orders but it's really not a benefit unless they can speed their process up.

My best friend and I when to this restaurant on August 1st for dinner. And the Service was terrible, this is not the time we've been there. When they were located in a smaller size restaurant they had excellent service and use to love going there to eat lunch or dinner but I won't go back again. Which is sad for my neighborhood bc I live in the same where twisted ranch is located at. They had some great food before as well. Last night I ordered the flatbread and it was good but it took them 15 mins for them to bring it out to me and my best friend had already ate and was still waiting with me for food. I asked for a refill on my soda and it told 10mins for them to bring it to me. I'm sorry but ridiculous!!

The bread here was ok. More importantly I asked if any bread was gluten-free. I was told one of the loaves was (Wife is gluten free) multiple times even though the ingredient list or label didn't say it about the bread. I was still concerned after I looked online and I called back and found out it was a mistake.  They nicely tried to give a refund but could not.  None of the breads here are gluten free and staff was not knowledgeable.

Friendly service, seated right away.  Food on the other hand was horrible.  I ordered French toast which came with 3 pieces.  The bread was literally dipped in the egg for 1 second.  It was just egg coated bread.  The home fries were hard flavorless rocks.  Eggs were cooked well and that was it for the food.  I would only come here for service not food.

What a disappointment. Went for lunch with my husband on a rare weekday off.
We both ordered lunch special "garden fresh vegetables with shiitake and tofu" 
LIES.. not fresh at all, some of the assortment seemed as if it was reheated, day old brown napa  cabbage. The carrot chunks and zucchini had seen better days. TBH the only fresh looking/tasting items in dish was the bok choy. The shiitakes turned out to be nothing more than 2 slices of white button mushrooms. The 3 tiny tofu pieces included were bland. Now what really gets me is the dish was supposed to be served with Jasmine rice. We eat Jasmine rice nearly everyday and this, if it was Jasmine at all, was of such poor, broken quality that they should be ashamed to serve it, much less for 10.95. 
I'm surprised to learn this is the place that earns top Thai in Tucson, what a joke! 
On the plus side the establishment was clean, the cucumber salad was good, the server was pleasant and the water had no off putting odor or flavor. Bangkok Cafe does not get my recommendation.

I'm very disappointed in the staff, I booked and appointment for a fill and later read there website that if u have lashes from another salon that that they need to be removed.... so I called, told receptionist that I may need to have lashes removed and a full set put on. I asked if I had booked enough time.. she said that there was no problem and whatever I needed would be taken care of... I got there 30 min early, saw a few lash technicians playing on their phones and when I finally was asked to come get my lashes done, late, I was told that she couldn't do it and didn't have time before her next client... I made and appointment for the next day after I get off work and was called later in the afternoon told told they don't have enough time then either... they were very rude and very unprofessional... I'm really irritated... so much that I decided to write a review...  a bad one... something I don't ever do...very disappointed...

I've been there twice since they opened. 
The Good: Clean, huge portions, fast
The Bad: Poor customer service/unfriendly, VERY SALTY food, and no fountain drinks or even tap water offered
The Ugly: Does not compensate/resolve/rectify messed up orders fairly 
Will not return

DON'T GO HERE!! And definitely DON'T give them your credit card!! Had the worst restaurant/bar experience of my life. Ordered fries with gravy that were never delivered even after asking 4 times over an hour period. Mac and cheese came out after 50 minutes and sat on the bar counter in front of us for 10 minutes getting cold before we could get the barback's attention & ask them to give it to us. The bartender lied to us and said there was no way to contact the manager & lied about what his manager even looked like & then the barback was able to call the manager on a walkie-talkie. Manager was the opposite of helpful & basically said there was nothing that could be done. Left after 1.5+ hours, never got the fries at all, was told they were taken off check, paid for what we actually had and then was DOUBLE CHARGED for that order anyway (way more than what the fries were)!!! They also continue to have 2 $5 holds on my credit card that I can't get taken off the until they process....apparently just so they can literally steal more money. No apology nothing from anyone there except the Barback who was very nice. This establishment cares nothing about customers and is dishonest. It's in a great location but there are TONS of other great places around. I've never had service nearly this bad in Charleston, Boston, NYC, or any other large city I've been to. Please don't give this place your credit card so they can steal your money and put fraudulent charges on it too!

I called to cancel an appointment and the lady Adrien at the counter first talked about my moms name with her tone and sarcasm. Also, when I tried to tell her that we needed to reschedule she talked down to me!! Customer service is off and I don't recommend going to this salon

I want to start by saying that the Penrose is by far the worst hotel I've ever been in, and I'm not exaggerating. We are from Iowa and we had no idea the condition of this place as the reviews and the pictures were very misleading. We checked in July 1st and tried to go up to our floor, only to find out the elevator was not working without personnel. They had a guy working the elevator that appeared to be high as he smelled strongly of weed. To make the situation even more sketchy, the door and ceiling of the elevator were bare, wires and everything exposed, and it did not at all seem safe. When we got to our room, we opened the door only to be hit with a strong scent of cigarette smoke, seeping from the carpet. The room was dim and had minimal furniture, constrasting the pictures online. There was drywall dust (or something unknown) coating the floor boards throughout the entire room and the trim was the extended carpet, which looked super trashy. The furniture was broken and cracked. The room did not seem clean in the slightest and we were hesitant to sit on any of the limited furniture present in the room. When we went down to the lobby we decided to take the stairwell as we would have to call down if we wanted to take the hazardous elevator- the stairwell smelled like urine and felt like we were walking down to our deaths. I honestly can not believe this place is still operational. We called and complained and got refunded after spending hours on the phone with Expedia- the worst experience with a hotel EVER!  I would not even let my animals stay in this place. Absolutely terrible.

I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. From the moment my friends and I walked into the building on Saturday night (3/31), the receptionist was incredibly rude. She asked me once, "are you checking in?" and I said "yes." The valet man said something behind me and with a VERY annoyed expression, she said "I'm talking to them... are you checking in?" I said yes again. I needed to called Expedia and change the name of my reservation because I booked the room and am not 21. The receptionist is really rude and condescending... "I can't do anything for you if you aren't 21, here's Expedia's number. Ask them to change the name." 

As I am calling Expedia, I watch her interact with numerous other residents in the hotel and she is pleasant, sweet, smiling, and laughing. Her demeanor was rude towards us from the beginning and I'm not sure why. I get the name switched and they tell me they will fax the confirmation to the hotel that show the change. I go back to the receptionist and she looks at my reservation. In the same irritated and rude tone she tells me that it still says my name and to continue waiting while she keeps checking on it.  I let her know that Expedia faxed a copy of the confirmation as well and she says "yeah well we don't have that, so that doesn't matter." OKAYYYY geez. 

I am finally able to check in and her attitude is consistent when I need to go check my license plate number on my car. Scoffing like I am truly the biggest inconvenience in her entire life. I have never been treated like such a bother. I would never come back! Take your money elsewhere, customer service here is TRASH

This stay has been a nightmare.... First they didn't have the room that was booked over a month ago ready until after 8pm. Then non-smoking room stunk like smoke. The room was filthy with hair in shower and what I can only hope was make up all over the room not blood. This absolutely ruined my family's vacation!!!

Okay, so I have been here five times (face palm) so I think it's time to do a review. At first, I was attracted to this place because it was BYOB, but in my opinion the service is horrible. Long wait times even when you make an "appointment". (I was waited 45 minutes over my scheduled appointment time and several other customers have too). They never even communicate with you or keep you updated. It's like they don't even consider your time as a customer....at all.  Cold pedicure water and let's just say the work is also very mediocre. 
I honestly kept going here out of stupidity and with this being the only place that I knew about. It's time for me to walk away because this place is too pricey for mediocre service and work.  They also need to get their time management skills together. Don't tell a customer that it is okay to come in for a certain appointment time when you know IT IS NOT. 
Also, Friday, March 16th I went in for a gel manicure, which came out too thick and peeled the next day. I thought about going up there to have the repair but didn't even want to waste anymore time of my life at this place. ( Shrugs) 
Time to find a small that caters to a small clientele and adheres to appointment times that they give to customers.

It was good. The staff wasn't that friendly and seemed to be bothered when we asked for more water. It took quite some time before they brought out our check. Our waiter consistently check on the other customers and failed to check on us. He would not even make eye contact! I am willing to give them a second chance. If we get the same waiter I'll simply ask for a different one.

We were going to the Arden Theater last night and decided  to Wister for supper before an 8 PM show. We arrived at 6:30, sat down, the menus hadn't changed since early summer. We ordered salad and fish. The salad arrived a little after 7, the fish about a half hour later. It was under cooked, I asked if it could be cooked a bit more. About fifteen minutes later I  asked about my dinner. The waitress then tells me they had to completely recook the dish. 
By the time it arrived it was too late, they took it off the check. I had a brownie at the Arden. Pretty disappointing ...

The beer came in a very heavy frosted glass which kept the beer cold during our extended wait for the tacos. 

Disappointed in the small taco's with a little protein in them. The chips were greasy.

Wonderful service, but terrible quality of food. I ordered the arugula and prosciutto salad....the walnuts were dry and stale. Also there was no way that was prosciutto in the salad. It was a standard smoked ham and there was 2 lbs of it chopped up on a bed of arugula. I wanted so bad to like it, but I couldn't eat more than 4 bites. My husband ordered a cheese burger. The brioche bun was delicious! But the meat? Frozen and weird after taste. The fries were also not fresh and they were cold. 

The scary thing about my visit... I sat upstairs and could see below to the chef at the grill. During the first ten minutes a plate showed up on his counter with three buffalo wings. It looked like a used plate. I have no idea why it was there, it was on the counter where food was prepared for the restaurant. It sat there for over 20 minutes. I did not see him eat it, but it made me feel unease. I questioned my food immediately. 

Stay Far far away!

I made the decision to change my hair from Aveda blonde to black. It was the beginning of a nightmare, which I'm paying for to this very day! I've been so upset about this that I haven't even been able to write a review until now. The hairdresser was apparently one of their top colorists. When we were at the basin rinsing out the color, she had to call over somebody else for their advice, and told me that she had to redo the color. There was already concern in her voice, but she said that the color not taking is common when going from blonde to black ( and I do understand that it has to be a gradual process). When she was rinsing out the color for the second time, it was obvious that the color took in some sections and not in others. Worse still there was now significant breakage. She called over another senior colorist, and they both looked at me and tried to say that my hair wasn't taking the color because of styling tools I have been using at home, and the way that I treat my hair at home. I had to stop them both from embarrassing themselves further, as I am a regular at the Aveda salon in the French quarter, only using aveda or kerrastase products! Even the receptionist at the front desk looked a little shocked at the end result. 

The breakage has been so severe, that my beautiful healthy shoulder length blonde hair, was now a random mix of brownish /black, and  kept breaking off.... resembling a cross between a mullet and a pixie cut. I've required professional treatments, and the making of a wig to allow my hair to grow back to some level where I can style and color again !

I really hate to give this hotel a one star rating. In fact, I rarely write negative reviews unless deeply disappointed.

My buddy and I took a trip from Atlanta to New Orleans on Christmas. We loved the city, and loved the convenience (very close to Bourbon st) and amenities (fitness center, lobby, etc.) that Sheraton offered.

After the three-day trip, I had terrible itch around my neck and arms on the road trip home. And the itch got worse and worse in the following few days. I initially thought it was an allergic reaction to oysters that we had the last day at New Orleans. Many people are allergic to oysters; I thought I might have developed one. Then I found that there was a small bite in the center of each red spot, and realized that all red spots located in the areas - arms and neck - with direct contact with bed sheet. I realized that these are bedbug bites.

The terrible itchiness drove me to write a complaint to Sheraton. I got a prompt reply that the issue has been directed to the hotel manager at New Orleans and that I would hear back within five business days. It never happened. I waited for three weeks and contacted them again, and received a reply saying that the hotel has conducted a careful and thorough investigation that concluded no bedbug issue. 

I was surprised to read it, as 1) the hotel never asked my dates of stay or room number and 2) they never asked about my symptoms. I question how 'careful' and 'thorough' an investigation can be when they care not to collect any relevant information from me. 

I did some research and found that I was not the first person to complain about bedbug issue at this hotel. I don't understand how they dismissed my complaint and suffering so easily. My experience shows how little this hotel cares about its customers.

The girl at the cash register does not know what she is doing.  Two other employees, were also unaware of how the restaurant functions, regarding rewards.  This took way too long!  Tried using the restaurant provided rewards and it became a major piece of work and way too much time!  Food was subpar and cold when served.  Shake came when I was almost finished eating.  Greasy, cold and expensive.  I won't go back!

Was supposed to go here to get a haircut because the guy that works there is a former Marine. Their hours are not posted on the front, so I asked if they were open today earlier. Came back at 2:05 and as I was walking in a fat guy with a fade was there changing the sign. I leaned in and asked if he had time for a quick cut. He cut me off mid sentenced and barked nope 3 times. I live around the corner. I'm in the Marines and get a haircut once a week. He lost some money.

I spent $10,000 at Kanes Furniture in Ocoee, I spent three month's trying to get my furniture and bedding. I finally wanted to just cancel my order and shop somewhere else. After talking to their manager Cyrus Pahlavi, he said they were going to make this right and he was going to take care of this personally. That being said the nightmare continued. They delivered the wrong beds that I paid 3,000.00 for, after waiting 6 weeks, so I had to wait 2 and a half months, than the headboard was given to me damaged and the dresser was broken after I had to wait 2 months to get them. Than I ordered a mirrored fire place that also took almost three months. I explained to the manager my husband had terminal cancer and this was very stressful. In the end he gave me a credit, I was not happy but I felt like they did their best. I would of just moved forward. I never saw the credit on my bill he told me not to worry it could take two months. So I waited after two months still never saw the credit so I called. Big surprise that manager was fired. So after trying to work with Riccardo Robutti the current manager that would not even speak to me in person. Called me a liar and said too bad. So even after everything they put me through they even insulted me and told me to take a flying leap. Very unethical, even though I have always shopped at Kanes I will never shop there again. I recommend you don't either.I feel like I got robbed.

I really liked Cozy Corner when I first started coming here and they only used to do breakfast. Unfortunately, now that they have a liquor license and serve dinner too, the wait times had just been sooo long. It also doesn't help that we came here for brunch/lunch time on a Sunday. Maybe they get backed up quite a bit as they also do uber eats? I just feel disappointed too because I feel like our server could have been more apologetic but they were all acting so surprised and not one of them wanted to admit fault. Not once did I hear, "I'm sorry for the wait". I mean they gave the food for free but honestly, if they didn't I wouldn't even pay for it because to say the least, it was the saddest meal I've ever had served to me. I mean after an hour waiting they served me the hatch heat chicken sandwich with the bread burnt and they tried to hide it by putting it underneath. It came with a plate of raw tomatoes that were supposed to have been inside the sandwich but it was just weird. On top of that, my bf ordered 2 orders of biscuits and gravy, and an hour in of waiting they told us they're out. At the least his french toast was actually good though. I really like Cozy Corner and would definitely give them another try but hopefully they can improve their customer service and the quality of their food.

I have suspected for a long time that this dry cleaners does not iron anything.  After receiving a particularly untidy, un-ironed, batch of supposedly dry-cleaned clothes from Any Garment Cleaners today, I called the store and asked if they iron anything.  I was told NO, THEY DO NOT IRON ANYTHING.  They send it through a steam machine.  What is a steam machine?  This is horrible.  I wonder now if they even dry-clean anything.  So there you have it, ANY GARMENT CLEANERS ON RT. 70 IN CHERRY HILL, NJ DOES NOT IRON YOUR CLOTHES.  They may put a crease in pants.  Got it straight from a long-term employee.

This store is a huge disappointment and not only are their associates not helpful, their manager is just as useless. I placed an order weeks ago and was told I would receive my bag in 7-10 days. That timeframe came and went and when I called client services SEVERAL times, no one could provide me with a clear update and told me the store would call me back. No one ever called after 5 times of leaving messages. After driving 45 minutes out of my way to speak with someone in person, I'm told I'm on "reservation" with no guesstimated timeframe and no guarantee that I will even receive the bag even though my boyfriend was charged the full amount of the bag...which they refer to as a "deposit"...REALLY!?!?  The people that work for client services and the employees at the store need a course on Business 101 and Customer Service 101. They don't care about their customers, don't bother to return calls or convey the right information to their customers. If you want a nice designer bag, go to Gucci or Chanel...at least they'll take care of you and you'll be paying for quality AND service!!!!

Ps. Be prepared to wait in a line...like they're some VIP club. Get over yourselves LV!!!

Stay away from this dealership. They would just waste your time. I saw a Pacifica listed on cars.com and double checked on their website for the x amount listed. Called them to check if the price is correct. And the guy who answered the phone confirmed that I will be paying the price listed minus any additional rebates available. I told him that I don't think I qualify for any additional rebates. My wife and I drove an hour with two kids to get there and after the test drive Joe the salesman told me the lowest they can come is XX amount which was $1200 more than the listed price. In addition I can't get 0% financing. Their listing clearly stated 0% and 1750 rebate. I asked Joe I guess his name is Joseph why their price is higher and I can't finance it for 0% and he said he doesn't do the online postings. What a lame answer. I'm mad and annoyed.

Came here for an oil change but they ended up causing a bigger problem. During my oil change they said my car need plug replacements(?) took it in a week later to get the so-called plugs replaced and with in 2/3 days the check engine light came on took it back and instead of checking the car and fixing the problem they just turned off the light. Needless to say my car was / is not ok other lights have now come on and when I went back to them they sent me over to firestone to get it check because they didn't know what was wrong! Bad service all around
HORRIBLE!!!! definitely not worth the money. How is this place even still open!?!? I take chances and eat from here and I get SICK every time! Worst place ever
Stopped by today at 8:45 am. All they had were plain yeast donuts. They need a better selection or drop the S from Donuts.

UTTER FAIL!  Seriously?? First visit to BYB and what a disaster. We did a dine in... thank goodness, because had we driven away with this order I would have been ANGRY rather than disappointed. Having never been here and not seeing a standard cheeseburger on the menu, I asked for a cheeseburger meal. I was directed to order the classic. When it arrived with no cheese, I said (to the same man I ordered it from) "they forgot the cheese." He responds, "Oh, well the classic doesn't come with cheese." but...i ordered a cheeseburger. I also ordered a peach cobbler, (because when I asked what they had i was told peach, pecan and blackberry). After the food came the same kid says, "We don't have peach." Ok, I responded, just bring my son a chocolate shake in stead. I get an ok and he leaves. A manager returns and hands me 2.50 and apologized for not having the cobbler. I said, thank you and took what i thought was the difference in price. NOPE. Shake never arrived. My kid ordered a salad rather than fries, meal came with fries. I asked for the salad, it came with no dressing. I asked for Italian, I was told they only have honey mustard, ranch, BBQ SAUCE AND KETCHUP. For a salad?? Come on guys. It's a meal, not rocket science!! 
Will not be back but I will say that the staff was all VERY friendly ;)
Costco will not repair this tire. They want us to purchase a new tire because "the nail is in the sidewall. Look for yourself. Costco will not honor their warranty.

Would not recommend El lemon to anyone. Prices are decent but the food is terrible. Would not consider it authentic either. Have tried the restaurant numerous times in hopes it would get better. However, after today I will never be back. Ordered 3 tacos al pastor and enchiladas de mole. The phone girl messed up my order and charged me for 6 tacos. No big deal, maybe she just heard wrong over the phone. She took the box back into the kitchen and the chief removed 3 tacos from the box. He was not wearing gloves when he did this as well the rest of the staff working was not wearing gloves. This really grossed me out! I ate my mole but the sauce was not very good. It was served with rice and beans they were nothing special. I will not be returning to El limon any time soon.
i went there for the bbq fish,  it tasted not good, and the size of the fish was extremely small. Not worth the price.
Giving 1 star because I had to. Dirty and discussing!  Found a hair in my food and they did nothing about it!  Save a trip and go elsewhere

The employees don't even look up when a new customer walks in to ask what services they need. Then they lie about how long the wait is to get you to waste your time. I had to wait 10 minutes just to see the SNS colors. There is nothing special about this salon. I will be taking my business elsewhere.

I didn't think to read any reviews ahead of time before my bff and I went to Picnic Provisions for lunch (on Fri 9/28), because of the reputation of the chef and owners, and the menu seemed straightforward enough. Plus, we knew we were going for the Crawfish Boil Fried Chicken "basket" (plate), which comes with 5 pieces, not 6 as shown on the pdf of the menu I'd seen online. Not a great start but still enough for two.

Most of my disappointment has already been described by the other 2 and 3 star reviews. 

We started with a house salad that I don't remember the name of. We had to ask for more dressing on the side since it all seemed to be lumped into one spot, and it was missing the blue cheese, which I guess got lost in translation because we did ask for it on the side. 

For the entree, we weren't expecting boneless, so you only get breasts and thighs. I'm not sure why that's not just specified on the menu. I didn't mind no wings but missed drumsticks. The flavor and texture were fine, and the Crystal mash helped. The 'sides' were a total disappointment. Usually when I see 'mirliton' my eyes light up but everything was just chopped up and mixed together,  including sausage in crumbles. I get that they tried to elevate crawfish boil fixins, but I didn't enjoy that presentation or the flavor. I'm not sure how it's prepared, maybe just a light sautee in crawfish boil seasoning, because the carrots and garlic were barely cooked; crunchy carrots are still edible but not raw garlic. And the one tiny piece of corn was useless, esp when splitting a plate. 

Other glitches: 1. The glass that came with my can of beer was very warm, probably right out of the dishwasher. Easy fix, I just poured my ice water into the warm glass and used my water glass for the beer instead. 2. Later when I asked for a Coke, I was told they were out -- as another reviewer mentioned, if that's really the case, just go buy some -- but a few minutes later my friend noticed another table had some. (I think all soft drinks and beers are served in cans, I guess to emphasize the picnic style.) I asked the waiter to double check, unless the other table just happened to get the last two. She did and found one for me, not cold but at least she brought ice. (You can see I have a thing with expecting my drinks to be cold, ha.)

Prices were okay and servers were friendly. None of the glitches were deal breakers and I'm sure they'll work them out over time, but the signature fried chicken dish was disappointing and I'm not tempted by the rest of the menu, so I don't see any reason to go back.

Their customer service is awful.  They never call you back with a status.  Our RV was there over 6 weeks and when we got the bill they had only spent 7 hours working on it.  They take on more work than they can handle and keep everyone waiting.

The older blonde manager lady is SO unnecessarily rude to customers and employees. The cashier ringing us up was very undertrained and didn't ring up any of our order as it was supposed to be, didn't even add all of what we ordered. Manager came to "help" AFTER watching the cashier mess the whole thing up, yelled at the cashier, only made the situation worse and refused to give us our entire order even though we'd paid for it on two separate tickets. She had the worst attitude of anyone I've ever had to deal with in a professional setting. Would not even give me the chance to speak without cutting me off. The food was cold too. Now I remember why I don't go to McDonald's. I live 0.03 miles away and still won't go there again.

I came on a walk in and it's nice because they took us right in, but when we sit down they start trying to paint my friends nails and he's a guy and the guy doing my nails starts talking about cocaine. The guy doing my nails has this friend who's a girl and is coming into our conversations and is trying to get my friends nails painted and he chose a color without my consent and just started painting and I don't really know and it was super fast and didn't really enjoy it. And now that he's done I'm looking at my nails and he completely did a bad job and missed so much of my nail.
Walked out last night. Party of 8. Extremely unprofessional and rude service from manager. They seem to think their food is better than it really is to treat good people this way.

Bistro Di Marino has been a favorite of mine for years and the food there remains excellent but after back to back terrible experiences on special occasions, we will not be going back.  For Mother's Day, we arrived for our 5 pm reservation time to find that they overbooked, tried to call us but did not have the correct phone number, so they actually moved our reservation anyway. While waiting, we called many other restaurants but could not get in on this busy day. We were finally seated next to the front door and because of the overcrowding, people would come in the door (cold, rainy day) and stand in the doorway with the door open - no one from Bistro addressed this so I had to constantly get up and shut the door. It took two hours to get some of our entrees - I ordered gnocchi with one meatball but only the gnocchi was served and I was told the meatball is on its way - but my meal was finished before it did so I had them wrap it.  After a long, frustrating 2-1/2 hours, we decided to skip coffee and dessert and just ask for the check. Not a very special day for the two Mon's in our party. But the short rib gnocchi at Bistro was too delicious to resist so we decided to go back for Father's Day for an early 4:30 reservation, hoping Mother's Day was just an anomaly. It was a different but still disappointing experience. The place was relatively empty for Father's Day so long delays were not the issue but lack of preparation and/or poor management was. I was happy to see a favorite on the appetizer menu so I (Dad) ordered the fried oysters. As the rest of the family was being served their appetizers, I was then informed that they did not have oysters - not that big of a deal that they did not have some menu items but the timing could have been better. As dinner moved along, we were constantly brought dishes that belonged to the table next to us while our food was constantly brought to the adjacent table first before being brought to us (not a major issue but certainly more disorganization).  As for the meal itself, the short rib gnocchi was still amazing and everyone else was happy with their meal. Then came dessert time and with pun intended, the "icing on the cake of disappointment". I ordered tiramisu - and I will say the tiramisu is one of about 6 desserts that they serve here and it is also amazing. I don't often order dessert and was looking forward to this - until the server came back moments later and informed me that they were out of tiramisu. Now I can envision how it may not be possible to get oysters on some days, or how mistakes by management or staff could result in not telling a customer for 20 minutes that the appetizer he ordered is not available, but not having a signature dessert on a special occasion day can only mean one of two things: either bad management or owners that just don't care because customers will still come. The result is two ruined special occasion days for my family. And one more note, back in about February we went to Bistro for a 7 pm reservation and I ordered my favorite meal. The server told me they were out of it and that they always run out of the short rib gnocchi early on a Saturday night because it is so popular.  You would think they would adjust the quantity of this product to meet customer demand - but i guess the attitude here is that customers will get what we have, not what they want. The short rib gnocchi at Bistro is one of my favorite meals but I will find a new favorite to replace this.

Was here on Saturday for one of my good friends birthday party.She had made reservation for 12 people  a day before the reservation.when we got there they told us they don't have the reservation and it was lost after the fact that we had made it the day before and also called them to confirm it. She decided to choose this restaurant because they had good review and it was also a new restaurant in the city.

list of disappointment:

- My party was treated like kids that didn't know how to speak correct english we came her to enjoy our meal that were paying for not to be getting corrected by our waiter that think they know everything.

-We had order charbroiled oyster and steak that came out so burnt you wouldn't even want to put it in your mouth the waiter took it back and told us new one was going to come out and it never did and  charge us for it.

-We were getting over charged for item that wasn't suppose to be on the check.

we had also ask for the check before the food had came out and they told us that it wasn't possible and that we had to stay there till our food come out felt like we was being held there and can't leave.My friends had asked for a manager on duty and he came out looking so unprofessional with flip flop a dirty tee and dirty short to come speak to us and told us all he can do is say sorry.We are all business owner that deal with customer service on a daily basic .For the manager on duty for  future reference i will learn how to speak to your customer when something goes wrong. i felt like we were not getting the service like others that was in the restaurant.i will never refer any of my friends or family to this restaurant.

Horrible experience! First I ordered delivery to our hotel, special of 2 pizzas w/two toppings each, needed one cheese for kids & asked to add one topping of the two I wasn't getting on the cheese to other pizza and they said no ! Then delivery guy called to meet him outside of hotel? Never had a delivery person called & ask as what's the delivery fee and tip which in this case exceeded 30% of order cost? Besides the lousy customer service, the food was just bad ! pizza was blah...stale garlic bread. Don't waste your money on this place...the drive thru at any fast food joint will be a lot better and fresh.

Very unprofessional and bad experience. 
They were not busy at all and i had to wait at least 10 min just for them to get done talking and goofing off. I told the girl my order 3 times and she didn't wright it down then had me waiting another 10-15 min thinking it was being made ...... then she's asking me the 4th time what the order was and having me follow her to put it in. It wasn't clean as I had a lot of time to look around. I will not be back to this location. After such bad Service I expected the food to at least be decent and it was absolutely awful.

Waited 45 minutes for a waitress. She brought us our food and never came back. We had to go find her to pay the bill. The bartender used HIS HAND to scoop ice into my drink. Will never go back ever again.

In its defense, this restaurant recently opened in the Bellevue area. Its biggest strength is the friendliness of its staff. Here are the negatives, that unfortunately outweigh any benefits....foreeeevvvver to get food. Ordered a simple Eggs Benedict with avocado added. Took 45 minutes for the food to arrive; when it did little slivers of avocado were on top and had clearly been sitting under a geat source for way too long. The food itself was a big disappointment in terms of flavor. Then, it took way too long to get the bill and get out of there. Hopegully they will work the bugs out.
Grater Nevada CU has the slowest customer service. None available on weekends. And their app is not user friendly. I cannot recommend and will be closing my accounts. #fail

Food is only okay. The customer service is terrible. I needed to make a change on my reservation. They refuse to answer the phone, they just put you on hold every time until you give up. Happened 6 times in one day. I waited 23 minutes on hold the first time. Should have cancelled then, because the food was disappointing.

Don't order takeout if you're in a hurry. I got there when they said it would be ready and no one spoke to me. Then they insisted that I sit down. After ten minutes, they came out and asked me what I ordered -- they hadn't even started it yet. Then the food less than great. The pad Thai was really dry. Very disappointing. My previous experiences eating in the dining room a few years ago were much better.
Bathrooms were disgusting.  Our slices of pizza tasted like they were reheated from yesterday...definitely not fresh.  Water not filtered, and warm.  Grinder was awful...tasted like a dirty rag.

False Advertisement- Beware, things are not as they appear online!!Seems like they put more money was put into advertising than the actual hotel. $10 "free parking." I reserved the room for 2 but there was only 1 towel and washcloth & no soap or tp. I called to have more sent up and was told I had to come get them from the front desk. I'm on the 11th floor. After waiting 7min for the elevator the mildew smell was strong enough to take the stairs. I opened the stairwell door, it was so dark that I stayed for the elevator. There was some light, but not on my floor. Then finally at the front desk i was told that someone would bring my towels

Despite the Starbucks.com website and the sign posted on the door of this location saying it opened at 5 am, when I arrived at nearly 5:30 the employees were in the back parking lot and told me they weren't open.

The tire shop has managed to get 3 strikes from me. It is mismanaged and understaffed every time I have tried to use them. I have purchased tires here twice and was dissatisfied on both installations. The only reason it gets 2 stars is the pricing, that is the only positive thing I can say about them.

Why does this company have to suck so hard?  Giving massages isn't rocket science so, c'mon. I booked a massage online and when I showed up they couldn't find the appointment anywhere. After several minutes, including a call to another location because I must have booked somewhere else, they found the appointment for their location at the specified time. Oh, guess what?  They didn't have any available appointments at their location or the other one. So sorry you left work for this - let us book another appointment so we can pull the football out again Mr Brown. 

What is the point if an online booking system if you don't integrate with it?  Apparently they have it just to screw their customers. Great business model!  Well done
Nope nope nope. This stuff is not good. I've definitely had better gluten-free (etc...) goodies. I'm upset I spent money on this stuff.

I don't come to New Orleans to eat at a sub par Vegas buffet.  But that's exactly what the Court of Two Sisters felt like.  I've heard that much like Cameron Diaz, the Court of Two Sisters was quite a spectacle in its hey day.  But now both Diaz and the Court are basically washed up, dilapidated shells of their former selves.  And, suffice to say, Justin Timberlake wouldn't touch either of these train wrecks today. 

As another Yelper wrote, the buffet lines are about as good as a Golden Corral buffet.  Food is cold, mushy and generally unpleasant.  But worse than the food was the atmosphere.  I felt like I was trapped in an over crowded Caribbean cruise ship. The Court is so busy corralling us in that it's literally Thunderdome.  It's anarchy.  It's every man for himself.  At one point an obese Clemson fan took a butter knife and fought an elderly woman for the last piece of soggy lemon cake.

Much like Michael Bublè, Sunday brunch should be refined.  Champagne.  Lightly poached eggs.  Perhaps a macaroon or a sweet Creme Brulè to finish off the afternoon.  Unfortunately The Court of Two Sisters was more like a NASCAR race cafeteria. 

The only redeeming part of this experience was the staff.  Although completely overrun by starving tourists apparently suffering from saturated fat withdrawals, the wait staff were quick, courteous and efficient.

Bottom line - it ain't that cheap and it ain't that good.  Try somewhere else.

Absolutely horrible experience here. The bartender (owner) was belligerent drunk because she had taken 5 shots in a row with another customer. She took 30 minutes to cash my friends and I out. She ended up charging my friend for the wrong meal and had to call over a waitress to reverse the charge because she was so drunk she could not do it herself. She told my friend she was being a b**** 3 times just because we were trying to figure out the wrong charge. She then continued to tell that same friend that she would still f*** her face. She slapped my butt 3 times throughout the night. 

Just very in appropriate behavior, especially for an owner of a "family friendly" restaurant. I think it's fairly obvious that I will not be returning.

Curbside service so this is solely referring to the food. It sucked.. how is the bread toasted but ice cold.. the clam "chowder" broth was so thin, somebody thought I was eating Cheerios because I poured the small crackers in there .. couldn't even bare to want to finish it.. the lobster it self wasn't bad for the little they put on there. lobster roll platter with clam chowder is what they call it.. it's a joke to anybody looking forward to anything close to that. Only reason I gave it a 2 was because I used a coupon and didn't pay full price.

They do not listen to what you say when telling them how you want it cut. They cut it the way they want every time. If you want to overpay for someone else to choose your haircut that will be done in less than 10 minutes this is your place. Might as well go to great clips. My haircut looks fine but I have been there 3 times, each time a different barber, and all three times I left with a cut that was not at all what I asked for. I will not return for a 4th.

Had reservation for 10 on Sunday 07/01 at 1 pm. Staff was as nice as we arrived a few minutes early. Were seated in the cooler area in front of restaurant. While staff was nice I was disappointed in buffet. I understood brunch was set menu, but aside from cocktail menus there were no menus for tea, coffee, soda, etc. with 10 folks it would be nice to know how much extra tea, soda, coffee would be on top of standard brunch cost. Was told by staff drink prices (aside from cocktails) were not published and communicated by staff. 
Second issue was arriving at 1pm for seating and Both smoked salmon (sign said smoked salmon and trout) and whipped cream for strawberries and waffles were out. I asked several staff members and was told salmon and whipped cream would not be replaced. How hard is it to have someone carve more salmon and someone run to store to get more whipped cream for remaining 2 hours of service. Again at $27 bucks per person that is not much to ask. Also room with buffet food was extremely hot. Smoked trout, salmon (which smoked salmon was gone by 1:15 pm) seafood salad and several mayonnaise based pasta salads and a seafood salad were out with no ice to keep cool in the sweltering heat in serving area was an extreme concern for me and my party. We avoided those items due to heat in serving area. For the price this was not acceptable. 
Several in the party enjoyed what was safe to eat and available. Favorites were shrimp and grits and some of fruit. Was surprised fried chicken did not include wings. 
Won't recommend this top 15 brunch spot in 2015. I expressed my disappointment to several people about smoked salmon, whipped cream and lack of drink menus to several staff members with no response/concern.

Bait and switch with pricing. First I contacted them in the late fall of 2017 and I got a coupon for $99 for the 2 piece ultra elite table pad. I called last week because I was ready to order only to be told that price wasn't good anymore. I was quoted a much higher rate. A new salesperson called me on Sunday and said that they could do $140 including shipping for this table pad. I paid it and waited for the color samples that i did not receive when I first called. I selected the color and when I went to measure, I saw that there is a leaf in the table. i tried to call yesterday but the rep wasn't there and I asked why I was contacted by a new rep and not the original rep and the person on the phone wouldn't answer. He also didn't offer for me to speak to a manager or someone else. I thought that was rather shady if the original rep did not know that I called. I finally got the new rep on the phone today (I called her - she did not call me back) and I was told that it was going to be another $40 since there is a leaf involved. The price keeps going up and I have to hunt people down to ask a question. I'm not very happy about this right now. I asked for a refund. Hopefully I will get it without trouble.

It's taken me awhile to find the right words but today I have them. Overpriced. Undertalented. Awful haircut. 

My sister can cut my hair better than what I got. I went there because of high reviews. Never again.

Super disappointed. We used to be Taco Bus fans, but in the last year have noticed a decline in service and overall quality of the food. Tonight we visited the downtown location. Our burrito was pretty awful. Our vegan steak strips were not cooked correctly (gummy and gooey and mushy). We also paid two dollars extra for vegan cheese, which we realized was not in the burrito after a few bites. When I took it up to the counter the cook opened it with her bare (!) hands and said "there's plenty of cheese in there" (there truly was none). Never offered to give us a side or add any to the burrito. We also noticed other unsanitary things going on behind the counter (cook was texting and drinking soda, never changed gloves). Super disappointed, definitely won't be back. Going to try Taco Sun, Lolis or Capital Tacos next time.

By far the worst service here in NOLA! Waiter was maybe having not such a great morning. Was not friendly seemed rude at times. Food was ok..the grits were not even warmed and when we let the waiter know she didn't even care to make it right! Will not waste my money there again there are way too many places to eat here that way better and friendly staff!

We went to the restaurant with high expectations based upon the Yelp reviews. We were thoroughly disappointed in all aspects of the experience. I had the Health Sushi Roll and Yellowtail Sashimi. My wife had the Rainbow Roll.  The portions were large, but the sushi did not taste good. Mine was bland and tasteless. The Yellowtail Sashimi was not fresh and was dry. I could not eat it. The waitress was surprised by me leaving it uneaten. I mentioned the problem and was disappointed that she still charged me for the sashimi. My wife's sushi was also tasteless. It was the worst sushi that we ever ordered. The service was inattentive. The waitress never once inquired about providing refills on the drinks. We went there for a 5-star experience and walked away with a 1-star memory. BTW, both of us ended up with an upset stomach from the food.

As with most Santa Fe's this one fails to excite you every time. 

You can choose from many flavorless options. It's unfortunate because the staff is really good. 

I honestly have no clue how they stay afloat other than the old crowd. I hate to be so negative but it was a really rough meal. Not worth the cost and I won't be back.

Extremely disappointed to say the least. I've been bringing my (small) dog here for doggy day camp the last 8 or so years. The employees are generally great (from what I know) but after today it makes me wonder all the things we don't know that actually go on. Went to pick my dog up around 4:45 paid and waited. My dog was laying beside a HUGE dog, calm, chill. As the girl went to the door to retrieve my dog another (small) dog not only snapped but bit my dogs face, my dog yelped very loud and ran and hid under the play ground they have set up in the room. But no body did much or thought much. The other girl who was actually in the room watching over the animals looked at me in absolute horror (NOW scooping up the little you know what) as the other girl goes over and pulls my dog out by her paper collar against her will. I try to remain calm knowing animals have their off days & there is only so much one can do in that situation. I say to the girl I'm an extremely loyal customer and come here all the time I do not want that dog in with my dog ever again please make note of it, thanked her and left. Trying not to flip out as I too work in customer service. I get home and my dog seems okay but I'm getting more and more upset so I call. Was told oh that's how that dog reacts to doors he does it ALL.THE.TIME. Excuse me what? Why would you allow a dog with obvious aggression towards something normal in there? I wonder how many other dogs it's bitten and if their owners have had the pleasure of watching it. I was dismissed. Makes me wonder what's happened in all these years that I don't know about. I guess if billy punches Suzy in the face every time the bell rings for recess it's also just a normal reaction right? Wrong. I FEEL like I'm overeating but honestly that's my like my child and it wasn't a good feeling, and it couldn't have been a good one for her either. I'll take a moment and write to corporate but most of the times who you hire is a direct reflection of who's above you so I don't I'll get far. I am done with pets mart and after all the recent horror stories I've heard I guess I should've been done a long time ago. You've got some great employees but maybe some could use more training. Also ... the policy on aggressive dogs.

Alex, the owner of Bella Maria sends me a message to take off a negative review of Apple Pizza off of  the Bella Maria page.
I have no idea what he is talking about.
I go to look at the page and I can't, because I am blocked.
I call the shop Mon., and they are closed.
I messaged Alex on Tues., and told him that I don't know anything about a negative Apple Review on his page.
I don't even think that that could have been done.
I told him I was blocked, and he said he did not do it.
I then said" Don't Pee On My Leg And Tell Me It's Raining", and that his food sucks.
I have been in the restaurant and hotel business for 50 years, and have never been harassed like this, and I was a customer who would spend $100.00 at a time, and would bring Alex a bottle of wine.
All of a sudden I was not blocked anymore.
I went through his entire page and there was no negative Apple Pizza review on it.
How was it taken off, if I didn't take it off?
Because it was never on there in the first place.
The moral of the story is:
Some people, you cannot be nice to.
Take your business elsewhere!
Called up around 3:30 pm, and ordered a large order of food($100.00 plus) including Chicken Parms with spaghetti.
Was told, no spaghetti because pasta cook does not come in till 4.
So we got Chicken Parm Sandwiches.
When picking up the food at 3:45 pm, the pasta cook was in the store, with many other employees
Really, Was it to much trouble for anyone in the store to boil some spaghetti to fill a customers order correctly?
It's a disgrace!
Shame On Bella Maria Tomato Pies!

Update.....it's been 12 weeks since I ordered my furniture when I was told in store 3-4 weeks for delivery and then signed paperwork for 3-8 weeks.  Was told recently I'd be waiting another 7-8 weeks, bringing the tentative wait time to 19-20 weeks. Is this a joke? because I'm not laughing. You should be ashamed of yourselves.  I don't even get returned phone calls from managers
Bad customer service. Lady is rude. Paid for a 2 liter and didn't deliver it. Tried to place the blame on Grubhub. Won't be ordering from them again.
This place is a joke. How are you a grocery store and have no carts or baskets for your customers?! I live in speedway and will never come to this shit hole again.

Not my cup of bbq. Nice place but I found it lacking when it came to the food. I had the platter with smoked turkey. It looked and tasted more like spam than turkey. Not edible. Garlic bread consisted of a piece of white bread toasted and with a smear of garlic butter. Mine was burnt. My companion's wasn't completely toasted on one side. The green beans were delicious and had much better meat cooked in with them. 

I wasn't a fan of the sauces. Went with the sweet but just didn't find it enough to get past the meat. I'll stick with Sonny's. Haven't found anything to rival them in this area yet. I'm from the Midwest and know what good BBQ tastes like and it isn't here. Sorry. 

Clean facility and nice staff.

Well should of read the reviews... should a said nope don't do it, wait till tomorrow to eat, make a top ramen, but decided to make a stop at this McDonalds... 2 card ahead I'm thinking back in CALI 5mins, nah not here in Reno, got here a little before 1030, it's now 11... this place is garbage, run run run look elsewhere for that last minute dinner

The food is very salty... couldn't even eat more than 3 truffle fries. I know food is supposed to hold flavor, however all the food from this establishment held salt.. not gonna order from here again or recommend it. Maybe if they took the main ingredient of salt out of their recipes by %75... then maybe.. also their wings are small and overcooked... not the best

Over priced and poor food quality. They charge you extra for toast and it is only one slice. Tried this place three tries, but never consistent.  If they want to charge those kind I've dollars food quality needs to improve and service needs a definite improvement.

This place was recommended by a few people..... however, I have to say the service was absolutely horrible . We sat at the bar and we asked what the seasonal beers were and we were basically handed a menu and had to wait 30 minutes to order a beer then even longer for our food. Remind you it was a Sunday so maybe ten others at the bar!!!! I've been a server bartender for 12 years, tips equal money which means you must provide good service ...... our bartender was absolutely horrible the food was ok we got fish and chips, shrimp poppers, and chicken strips 4/10 on food sorry first time I didn't tip but service sucked ! Would had ordered more beer if she ever asked if we wanted something or refilled our water I didn't know it took two hours for a server to ask if we needed something. We won't be back and we won't recommend this place. This is the condensed review.
The food is weak! The shrimp they want to charge you more for but why? Lol they up charge you like you are getting five shrimp when it's baby shrimp and maybe 4 pieces at that! Nothing to write home about the slaw tasted good but then again tasted like kfc. The fries were cold and so were the onion rings. Again this is a modest review, but stay away!

Was my home pub until Si decided that explicit lyric songs are no longer acceptable on the juke box of a 21+ establishment...don't waste your time coming here..go see Ashley @J Clyde's or hit "The Butler"
Nothing worse than having scrambled eggs with egg whites that are not cooked.  If you eat here make sure you tell then exactly how you want you food cooked.

This one is not as good as the one in Voorhees or the one in PA that we frequent.  Slow service on a very quiet Wed night.  The place was empty  around 4:30 pm and we waited for a server for longer than we  should have. No one at the front door. A few servers looked our way and kept on walking. 
Food was decent-service no so much. I will stick to the one in Voorhees.

I had been looking forward to trying Dan Dan for AGES. I finally broke down and ordered. I'm giving two stars solely because the potstickers were great. I ordered the signature Dan Dan noodles, Shrimp Lo Mein, Scallion Pancakes, and potstickers. The Lo Mein was worse than Baltimore Chinese take out. The Dan Dan noodles didn't even nearly come close to what's being offered across town at Bing Bing dim sum. The pot stickers were great. I won't be patronizing this place again.

I've tried. I've tried several times. It seems others have too. Hopefully someone is looking at the reviews.

Without a doubt Noble Hops is one of the coolest (and few) outdoor spots in the OV for a good entertainment spot. We have been really big foodies coming from a huge metropolitan area. However, there are a few things I would like to review about this place that should be considered for improvements. Their food. Oh my gosh. We have been here so many times and have tried so many different things on the menu. But their food is disgusting and overpriced.
Let's discuss those Pork Belly Sliders... I think they just drench a bottom bun with pork belly fat and then put the saddest excuse for pork belly in the bun.. Then there is avocado which looks like a dog ate tuna and grass all day.. May I suggest if you're going to charge $7 for two sliders that your kitchen delivers quality pulled pork/belly with sliced avocados. The only way to even stomach one of those was the arugula.
Speaking of the price, $9 for two loafs of bread is a tad ridiculous as well. Don't get me wrong, it's delicious, but by the time it hits the table, it's lukewarm and the cheese tastes like Velveeta. Just like the Mac N Cheese ($8). Great idea with the crumbs, but please change that cheese. It may be house made but it tastes like Cracker Barrel ($2) or Velveeta ($3)... 

Thankfully most of your wait staff who have waited on us have all taken care of us.. We have only sent back the pork belly sliders, because, well, that was the final straw for us... There's a few awkward personalities but it will come with time in the industry.

The biggest issue is the price and food. Until we find out that those things have changed, we will not be returning, nor will we be recommending it.

Visited the Café for breakfast this AM. The service was mediocre, Neil just has too many tables. The food was okay after a long wait however my omelet was the worst I've have in years. The Café used to be the best place for breakfast but sure has slipped lately. We've been loyal customers for nearly 20 years.
Serious organizational issues. Several people had their orders skipped and people waiting just gave up because their planes were about to leave.

TL/DR: Food smelled great! Wish it were better run so I could have actually tried what I ordered :(

I had heard wonderful things about this new brunch location in downtown, but had been traveling and out of town a lot this spring / summer and unable to try it. I was SO thrilled to have a free Saturday at home to enjoy my favorites: a nice long walk around downtown, get in a work out, a solid brunch, and errands. 

I was so excited (& hungry!!) when I ordered -- I decided to keep it classic and go with "The OG" sandwich. It was a beautiful day today, so I asked the young lady who took my order if I could wait and sit at the tables outside on the sidewalk. She said of course, so I took my little table sign to help them deliver my order and sat outside at the corner table -- just outside the door and in clear view of the inside / counter area. 

And I waited. (Didn't alarm me, because I thought 'hey, it's brunch, it's not fast food'. 

And waited some more.)

And saw people who came in after me leave. So finally, 31 minutes after placing my order, I wandered back in to ask how much longer it might be. I stood around for awhile, as no one seemed interested in asking if I might need some help, despite the look on my face that I can only imaging clearly said "I'm confused can someone help me?" 

There was another young lady working the register at that moment, and when I finally got the attention of her and the young lady who had taken my order, I hadn't even gotten through my sentence of asking when my order might be up before they were offering phrases like:

"Oh, we didn't know where you had went and couldn't find you" (Ummmm, I was 5 feet outside the door, right in that giant window, holding my table sign, exactly where I told you I was going when I placed my order)

"Oh, we didn't have any orders up from the kitchen so we thought you already had your food" (So, wait, now I'm confused. The kitchen never made my food either? That's another problem.... but which is it?? You couldn't find me when you looked, OR you saw me sitting there and assumed I already had food??) 

They offered to get my order in again, but by this time I didn't have any more time to wait before my appt. Then there was the half-hearted offer "I guess I can give you you money back?" (even included a shrug) 

At this point I am beyond frustrated, and just want to leave. So I explained that their explanations made no sense and contradicted each other, and walked out. 

I genuinely think this is a place with promise based on the menu, and we need more fun options downtown. However, I hate seeing downtown business fail, and it's hard enough to stay open for establishments with GOOD service, that I'd hate to see one go down because of silly avoidable stuff like this. 

And I was really looking forward to that biscuit too....

They don't let you pay the bill by splitting it with different credit cards. Not a good idea in 2018. Fish and chips: fish fried dark brown and not light at all but heavy and greasy. I did like the crunchy snacks they give gratis.

Very disappointed! The best perk with this "resort" is the beach, but good news is that you can stay in a less expensive motel and still use the beach area activities. We pay a resort fee and then they nickel and dime you to death, wanting to charge you for front row beach chairs (which we were told were included) plus they have only 1 working elevator and the wait is quite long with 7 floors using it. I could go on but I think this is enough to give you the idea of what kind of "destination resort" this is. A big thumbs down

I really expected better from this place based on the reviews. It is located right off of Bourbon St.. We were seated almost right away which was a plus - but it all went downhill from there. Our waitress was sweet enough - but the food came out and it was very clear that this restaurant pre-prepares their dishes. The foot came out super quick - as if it was just sitting and waiting to be picked up and served. I ordered the shrimp platter - it wasn't warm at all. My girlfriend ordered the special - which was Red fish with some sort of topping. Hers was also cold and tasted horrible. We just ate what we could and asked for the check - and surprise surprise her dish was $30 (it wasn't on the menu) and my meal had an upcharge of $6 because there was a crawfish cream topping on my French fries (of course neither price was disclosed by our server). Instead of complaining we just paid and got out of there. Go there if you want a subpar meal - but be prepared to pay the price of a premium meal when the check comes.

The food there was sub par. The chicken teriyaki felt like a microwaved chicken, the sushi that my school sells tasted better then there rolls. The service was not great as well. And to top it all off they are very overpriced. Would NOT recommend!
They would not take our order over the phone even though we were one hour away and in a hurry. Great food. Terrible service.

I made this recommendation to colleagues at work. The reason I did so is because I had a good experience personally a few nights before. Fast forward to today. I did phone order for two orders of Avocado Hummus with an extra order of chips. So that should be Hummus with chips, hummus with chips and then a side/extra order of chips. Right?  Wrong!!!
Well I pick up the food (15 minutes away from work 30 minutes total) and get back to work and it's one container of chips. I call and inquire and the staff says all the chips were in one container. First, it was two separate orders so people are not sitting in a circle sharing chips. Second,  no one asked for it to be in one container and third, the chips were pretty much crumbs and broken up. My colleagues and I shouldn't be eating Hummus and chips with a spoon. Unbelievable!!
Thanks for showing my colleagues I shouldn't be making lunch recommendations.  Smh

The staff is phenomenal and the place is clean but Drs seem sub-par. Dr today diagnosed my broken toe as not being broken because it "didn't look broke". She didn't refer to xrays.... this was her just looking at my toe.

Food is probably good, but I wouldn't know because after an hour of waiting we had heard nothing from the restaurant. We called to ask what was going on and Brett answered to and said there was no driver, when asked why he didn't call to let us know they couldn't fulfill the order, he said "are you serious" and proceed to talk over top of us. He hung up abruptly and cancelled the order without asking. 

When I called back he said he cancelled it because we complained and didn't call because they "dont have a receptionist to call people every 2 minutes". I told Brett that I didn't want a call every two minutes but after an hour I'd expected to know why they couldn't let us know the driver wasn't there yet. 

I informed Brett that I'd be leaving a review and they lost a customer. He told me he'd delete it because he'd tell them "what happened". Well Brett your customer service stinks. I didn't want a call every two minutes I just wanted to get my food in a reasonable amount of time and expected to be informed if you couldn't do that. 

There's enough breakfast sandwiches in the city, I'll be going elsewhere next time. Good luck.

Their pizzas are way too overpriced. $52 for 2 large pizzas is ridiculous. I mean the taste is definitely better than most pizza places but not worth $52. I was disappointed in the slim choices on the menu as well. I wish they would lower the price of their pizzas.

A disappointing experience. The food was bland. Sticky rice had the consistency of a hockey puck. First visit to this restaurant since their move to Midtown. I don't know if there is new ownership, a new chef, or both, but Cafe de Thai isn't as good as it was at the old location. We won't be back.

I am yet to find proper words to describe the horrible experience at this place. 
I had my LASIK done I Dallas a few years back. And when I moved Philly area I thought j would get the same service. 
Dr. Cho was hesitant to do an "enhancement " surgery as I wasn't "qualified" and because according to her they use more modern equipment than than at the LASIK institute in Dallas and she didn't want to be liable for an operation she didn't initiate. 
As a patient you must go to a LASIK Vision institute for annual check up. Dr Cho was not pleased with that and insisted I should go back to Dallas. However, she did two annual check ups and on the third, she walked in to the room and says, " aren't you the patient I said I don't want to see again?" 
She then says she needs to study my file and walks out. Comes back and says "everything is good.But you need cataract surgery when you get older.... like when you are 70."
At this point she's walking me out of the office after 30 seconds. Her attitude was demeaning and unprofessional. 
I'm yet to follow with the corporate office and counsel.

I don't understand what's the hype about this restaurant! And l went a couple of times to see if I change my mind.
The bar drinks is right in front of the entrance when you step in and the drinks are poorly made.
The food is nasty, greasy and not well presented.
The waiter's will hurry you out! Keep in check everything I said above when you go.

This will probably be my last time going to this restaurant. Overall it just wasn't a good experience. The only reason we went was to use our coupon that the waitress told us wouldn't work at the keystone location. Gosh! Anyway, when we walked in we were seated the restaurant was freezing. We ordered our food and I got the orange chicken. When the food came out, it was SO COLD. The food was so cold I took the survey after our dining experience to let cooperate know how bad our experience was. The server was nice and was able to redo our food but I was so shocked that the manager didn't come out and apologize and even discount our drinks or something off the ticket. It wasn't really good customer service. 

Pros 
Server was nice 
I like how dim the environment is 


Cons 
Cold food 
Not really good, no love in the food 
Cold restaurant

*This review is based on experience not food*

There is no changing table in the bathroom which was fine so I made the best of it on booth seat. I quickly gathered my stuff and made sure I cleaned up after myself. A bartender came up behind me and made a side comment that there was a place for that then walked off to the back. I tried asking where it was since I didn't see it on first glance. So I waited for him to return so I would know better next time. I guess he wasn't expecting me to still be there so when I pressed him again he said the bathroom. I informed him there was no changing table so where in the bathroom and he mentioned the bathroom counter?! I certainly saw that tiny counter and informed him it was extremely wet so I couldn't. I attempted to show him I cleaned up after myself. But he rudely walked off again. Do not engage in a conversation if you don't want to see it through. 

Additionally, it's fine if you don't want people changing their kids inside the dining area. I'm okay with that but you should install a changing table inside the bathroom. More importantly, please know that most parents are doing the best they can with the resources they have. They certainly don't need rude criticism from someone who doesn't know what they're talking about.

Eh. Seating for two was in a cute, little, cozy spot. Ordered beans and rice- food came without utensils sms bc of our secluded location, I had to wait awhile to eat. Rice was cold and the beans and little sausage on the side was reminiscent of smart I would make when I was a kid just starting out in the kitchen. Needless to say, I was not impressed.
