I went there once to eat a cheese steak. The food seemed fine. A short while later, however, the place was closed for health violations!!! You won't see me going there again!!! Anybody interested in going there should think twice. Do you really want to risk your health over a meal?

Read more about it here: http://www.philly.com/philly/health/special_reports/clean-plates/20160708_Phila__eateries_shut_for_rodents__lack_of_food_safety_smarts.html?arc404=true&mobi=true

It mentions cockroaches, both dead and live ones, mouse droppings, and flies, among others... Do you really think people making such a mess have a spotless kitchen now???

I didn't actually eat here but I tried to. We ordered our food and drinks and the employee informed us that the meal and drinks were buy one get one free or 50% off or something. It was still kinda expensive for just 2 adults and a kid but that didn't really matter to us. After we sat down the cashier came up to us and said that she made a mistake ringing the meals up and that the wings weren't a combo.  We told her NBD we'll just get the wings with a side of fries with no soup. She then said she had to take off the coupon off that she had offered and she needed to charge us more. We asked for a refund and left. I'm sorry but if you ring someone up and make a mistake and charge them less than what it should be because you offer a discount then you shouldn't go back to the customer to get more money. It's too bad because I really like boba tea but I won't eat here just because of the poor service.

The service is really bad. It's looks like the kitchen run by bunch of thugs. Somehow they also for got how to count cause the order was shorted. Waited 30-45 minutes on a order called several times to place before  but had to a walking.  That what get to wanting to buy Wingstop. It's sure last ever stop in HERE.

Been using Republic Services since I moved into my house in February 2016. Occasional missed pickup but no real problems. My last invoice is now 130% higher than the last one. I called to get an explanation because an increase of nearly $100 for the same service must be a mistake right? Well the first explanation was we increased the rate in the area period so I moved up to a supervisor and am told I can get a "promotional" rate which is basically what I was paying now. So he says my account updated and that's that. But then I get an email saying my payment is scheduled at the higher rate, so I call again. The first operator put me on hold to review the notes and then pushed me to someone else (always a good sign). There I was told that number he told you was only for trash so your bill should only be 60% higher instead of 130%. I asked them to review my previous phone calls and was told they would get back to me in a day or so. So in that time I called a different trash company that has a flat rate for the same service cheaper than what I was paying so I signed up with them. I call Republic back to cancel my service which should be simple seems like people cancel their service all the time based on my street. I'm told I have to call back on the 20th of the next month to square away my account, wait a minute so you're telling me to let my bill for the next service period go delinquent and call back to make sure I get my late fee removed and can pay my bill to get my bins picked up which is somehow $48. I will make sure to tell my neighbors to keep an eye on their bills since Republic is a predatory business that relies on people not paying attention to their rate changes. Hopefully I don't need to update this review in a month to say my billing is all screwed up because I followed their instructions.

Menu says Sweet Iced Tea and Iced Tea. So I ordered Iced Tea. Response "we don't have unsweetened tea. I responded that the menu says you have it. She responded "we don't have unsweetened tea...  seems the 2nd tea canister is filled with coffee...  and they do t have Senior prices!!

Worst Chinese food I had in my whole life. Ordered beef and brocolli.  Beef undercooked veggies raw. Obviously the work not hot enough. They must try to save on gas bill.  Any mom and pop store on any local corner in north, south, or west philly has to be better.

Used to be a regular here and then moved away from the area. Walked in today at 5:44 and took a seat at a not so busy bar. I waited while the emo bartender stood and talked to other waitstaff who were just standing around. Finally, I had waited long enough and got up and left. Told the hostess on the way out how service had declined. She just smiled politely. If this was my business I'd be furious!

Just had a HORRIBLE customer service experience at Le's Baguette. I live around the corner and probably order from them at least twice a month. Today I called on my way home from work and placed a to-go order. The man answering the phone was quite rude, and didn't sound like any of the employees I'd dealt with in the past. He tells me it will take 25 minutes, which is fine. I get there in about 20 minutes and when I walk in there's a younger guy preparing food and then an older man tells me he will be with me in a minute. The older man comes to the register and asks if he can help me. I tell him I called in an order for Marisa. The younger guy starts looking at his tickets and goes "Michelle?" I say no, Marisa, and tell him what the order was. He and the older man continue to look at tickets and paper slips. I tell them I called about 20 min ago. The young guy says he didn't get any orders except for Michelle's. What tipped this interaction over the edge is that the older woman behind the counter SAYS I called the WRONG NUMBER! Not "we're so sorry we will start making it right now," or "just give us a minute to finish this larger order and we will look again," but "you called the wrong number." I most certainly did NOT call the wrong number as evidenced by the below photo. I will be avoiding this place until they learn some decent customer service.

Overall disappointing - ordered a green chili cheese burger meal. Cost was $16. Burger was very greasy and tasted salty. I went through 4 napkins (they only give you 1). Fries were good, fresh cut and had a good taste. I expected more for the $. Go to Blake's, you will get a better tasting burger for half the cost

The store is nasty.  Sometimes i wonder if they actual sweep the floor prior to mopping. 
The restroom always seem to smell like urine.
The walls surrounding the toilet need to be sprayed with disinfectant.  If men are standing up in front of the toilet,  chances are they will miss at first and hit the wall. 
Finally,  why are there always gnats flying around? Is the trash properly disposed of regularly?

Called in an order and the food was ice cold and they refused to make me a new sandwich and the bartender at night there is very rude I don't want her to serve me ever again very disappointed by her lousy service
Horrible service and very disrespectful.  The house was rude people were mean I'm usually a very good tipper they don't deserve my money or my business. Stay away, bad place.
Would not fulfill takeout order.  Or cancel/refund after stating there kitchen was closed an hour before the restaurant closed. There explanation was to call "GRUBHUB"

Horrible service!! 
Jambalaya was salty 
Shrimp po boy was decent but the bread was really hard instead of soft which made it hard to eat. 
Server would walk away before letting us even finish our sentence multiple times even we addressed it. After a while we felt ignored on purpose. 
Would never go back here because there's plenty of other delicious options around...

As a local this place is very overrated. I've Tried it at least 4 times on the advice of tourists and they've failed miserably.  The oysters were tasty like other spots the seafood wasn't fresh tasting.  Honestly this spot is s TOURIST TRAP and I doubt locals go here.  If your a visitor try the website where Nola eats for much better restaurants in the city
I always treat fast food workers with extra respect for what they do with little pay. Here it was a bunch of disrespectful kids, and a shift lead with the attitude of a 14 year old punk.

I bought two original chicken sandwiches and a spicy and crispy chicken.  Im not kidding my daughter bit into her original chicken sandwich and it was full of hair.  It looked like someone brushed their hair and put it in the sandwich.  The chicken in the other two was hard and chewy.  I went back and the  cashier took off running to the back for the manager this was at the drive through.  It seemed like she knew why i was there.  Manager gave me my money back and claimed she didnt know who cooked this and offered me a new meal.  I said no thank you.  I will never go back there.  The thought and the site of it is so disgusting.

Very disappointing!    I had the veggie skillet !  .   Overcooked scrambled eggs raw cold veggies sitting on top of bed of bland under cooked home fries.  I cannot figure out why you'd ever serve hot food on top of raw food?   

Making matters worse was the fact that my waitress had a very bad attitude and was annoyed when I replied to her question everything was okay.  Why ask if you don't want potentially negative feedback?

I would  sadly say my over all experience  was very, very disappointing !!!

Gave the place a second chance on a beautiful May Day.  Our server promptly came to our table took our drink order.  I was hopeful.  Drinks came out and we placed our food order.  Calamari was chewy.      Server old us that the dressing was on the bottom of the Chicken Caesar salad.  No it was not.  Pooh boy sandwich lacked any flavor.  Don't waste your time on your fries.  Our server disappeared and did not really pay attention to us at all.  The place could be a gold mine right on the creek.  I am surprised they are still opened.

Came here for the second time and sat outside on a reservation. The atmosphere and view is great, and the food was fantastic. My complaint stems from the service. Our server started off ok, but when we told him we were only ordering food and weren't going to order drinks with our meal he made a snide remark about it. He came back because I think he realized he was wrong, but the remainder of the meal was very uncomfortable. Some of our guests came for the first time and he didn't go over any options on the sides for the entrees, so they were stuck with whatever the meal came with. When I paid the tab he literally hovered over me and waited to see what kind of tip he was getting.

I wish I didn't have to write this review. I have gone to Venus on and off for 1 year since its very close to my house. When I first started going they were good. Everyone was nice, prices competitive, and they have a good selection of colors and pretty on point with new techniques. Plus they offer wine and the massage chairs are awesome. 

Everything changed the last few times I have gone. I got a full set of acrylic, the shape was not really like the picture I showed the lady but they were still nice.

Fast forward to my first fill after that new full set.... went in on a Wednesday that Friday one nail had already popped off. I went in they reapplied and I was on my way. Then that Sunday another nail popped off and I had to go back for them to reapply. 

I have been getting my nails done since I was 14 at the same length and I have never had my nails come off just like that. I have an office job so I am not doing a whole lot but typing and on the phone so I was shocked.

The last time I went in I asked the manager why my nails were coming off every two days and he said its probably that I am being too hard on them....ummm sir my nail popped off when I was typing, hardly what I would call hard labor. 

Then he proceeded to tell me its the length....again...I've been betting my nails really long for years and years and no that is not the case. 

Then when he finally had the girl who did my nails fix the broken one she tried telling me that I needed a new set and that's why they kept popping off.....ummmm I showed her my nails underneath and told her this is my first fill since my brand new full set so no that was not why. She looked annoyed that I caught her trying to lie. I do not appreciate them blaming me and straight trying to lie to my face like this is the first time I got my nails done. 
Its either because your products are cheaper now OR the tech's skills were not up to par OR both. I am not trying to be in your salon every two days to fix broken nails. Own up to your short comings. 
I would rather go to Aria Nail Bar in Brandon or Reina's Beauty Bar also in Brandon even if i have to drive further out.

This place is filthy dirty. Half the machines and dryers are broken with out of order signs on them. The only perk is that it's cheap, but I'm not even sure ya worth it. The cost is $1.75/wash and 0.25 for 15 mins of dry time. It's small and cramped and doesn't have a lot of folding area. I've been to 4 different laundromats here and this is my least favorite.

Worst restaurant choice we chose all week. Be ready to wait 45 minutes to get over priced "cold" food and don't expect to get good service. We walked out without eating our meal. They didn't charge us for the food but did charge us for two drinks that I would have also comped but the manager was an idiot. Bourbon House on Bourbon Street is much better.

Literally some of the worst food you'll eat in New Orleans, its a damn shame. Marcus, one of the waiters, is a very cool down to earth guy, but not even he could save this place. Perfect perch to view bourbon street debauchery but other than that save yourself the cash and buy some street food. you'll save time, because this place is impossibly slow, and save your tastebuds the disappointment.

I used to really like this place but it has gone down hill since then. Currently their gyro/rice/soda combo is $12. Considering that they don't make their own gyro meat and the inadequate seating, this is really high. For this price, I can go to a really nice restaurant in Philly where the food is made in house and it's delicious. 

You can go to Semos and kabob on wheels to get the gyro/rice/soda combo for less than $10 and the taste is the same plus they give you a lot more food.

My recommendation would be to skip this overly expensive place and go somewhere else because price per quality is very high.
Stick with the Pho. Because the *inedible* chicken lo mein comes in what can only be described as oil soup. No refund as it's their "sauce"

What ever you do DO NOT BUY THE GOOF PROOF! It is a complete scam. They tell you it's the best deal around and anything that happens to your furniture will be taken care of no problem. That was a lie. 11 days after my reported vomit on the couch they finally were able to have somebody come out and clean it, but since I had already cleaned it fairly well they wouldn't touch it. They said I should have left it as is until they got there and they would have taken care of it. Biggest waste of $199 in my life. Couch is comfortable but the customer service was horrendous at best.

I took my wife, our son and his wife and three other people to 
Valley      
Tavern to celebrate my grandson's birthday.  The location is fine and the ambiance is what you would expect.  However,the food was simply bad.   I took  my first bite of mashed potatos and they were cold, and it was all downhill from there.  I am giving a two rating  because the service was good.  I am not going to go into specify details, however,if you want decent food, go somewhere else.

Worst Chilli's ever.
It seems to be a management and training problem.
No host. The waiters have to assign seating and do a poor job.
While waiting to be seated, I saw 4-5 tables with dirty dishes.

There was a waiter wearing gym clothes (including shorts)

After waiting for 5 minutes to be seated, tried unsuccessfully to speak to a manager.

I decided to leave at that point.

It's a new Chilli's and they have customers. But as word gets out they will start to lose clientele.

Every other location for pasteur(castledowns/millwoods) is good, they have good service and food. Kingsway location has garbage service. You gotta ask them for water not once, not twice but 10 times before they get the idea that you NEED water. The noodles at kingsway location is overcooked would recommend other locations. Would not recommend kingsway pasteur

Spoke with Leslie who answered the phone at the main number listed.  I wanted to schedule a wash/blow dry and then said that I'd get a treatment.  She informed me there were two separate charges $45.00 treatment and then for the wash and blow dry it would be another 45.00 to equal $90.00.  I clarified with her in great detail that I have received treatments in the past and the wash and blow dry were included to equal $45.00 for all and then I tipped 20%.  She said others were charging incorrectly in the past (years??) and the charges are separate and would be that high or higher depending on what level a stylist is at.  Really?? If so, get with reality.

Hi I remember every time I went out to dinner and was bum rushed out of my seat as soon as I paid my bill because "the next customers were waiting" - OH WAIT no I don't bc I've never been to Bufad before tonight.  And I'll never go again. You don't make reservations on Saturday night to enjoy a nice meal with your friends only to be asked to leave as soon as you've paid the bill.  Some people care about customer loyalty and retaining business, and Bufad is not run by some people.  What a pissy end to a great night.

I'm usually pretty generous guy when it comes to understanding that stuff goes wrong in restaurants. However the experience I had today was way less-than-stellar. My wife and I were having the two for 20special. The appetizers came through and they were wonderful. We had the potstickers and loaded fries. I ordered the Cajun chicken with fried shrimp and my wife had the Cobb salad with chicken. In addition we both decided to have some soup. I opted for the French onion she had the tomato basil.
My soup tasted like week beef broth with some soggy bread and cheese thrown on top - there was absolutely no onion flavor at all. I complained to the manager and she was very nice and took it off the bill. She tried it and agreed with me on the flavor. When my entree came it looked very nice.  But looks can be deceiving. The fried crispy shrimp still had the shell on underneath the breading, the mashed potatoes were instant mashed potatoes or what the manager called pre-prepared. The broccoli on the dish had freezer burn and I didn't even try the chicken. All in all a poor experience.

HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE! We went in at 6 and they RUDELY told us they cannot do basic manicures and pedicures anymore, even though there weren't that many people there and they close at 8. As we were leaving we saw a white lady being seated and helped, even though they just told me (a Hispanic) that there wasn't any more room that day. P.s: I would have given them 0 stars, but that wasn't an option.

Talk about overrated.  Good local reviews and James Beard Award encouraged me to try it.  I expected the Sonoran hot dog to be special, or at least fairly good.  I have had them elsewhere and love them.  This was poor.  Virtually tasteless, and I couldn't figure out what the topping even was. The place is like a cafeteria where you order at a window, and pick up at another window.  Then you seat yourself and look to find a clean table.   Bottom line, I would not eat another one if you handed it to me for free.

We were one of the first people in to eat dinner tonight. We had a reservation. We were seated, very nice hostess. Our server was extremely nice. However as he first approached us the first words were I'm so sorry but I need to move you to a different table, we are expecting a party of 6 and need this table. No problem. We moved to a different table. He was very apologetic. No big deal. Offered us free dessert for being inconvenienced. Not that we were concerned about anything free. Cocktails were very good. We placed out appetizer which was the BBQ Shrimp, now usually BBQ has some slight grilled appearance. Well I believe we got boiled shrimp. The sauce it was in was very good. I ordered a 11oz fillet my husband got a strip steak. We ordered the creamed spinach, brussel sprouts and the mushrooms and onions. Well dinner comes out the fillet was well done, however I ordered it medium. All the sides were cold my husband's strip was very good. We let our server know. Poor guy was mortified and said yea it looked overcooked when I picked it up in the kitchen. They did take it back and said it will be a minute. I'm going to grab someone else's and bring it right out....well 20 minutes later a new fillet came. However my husband was finished. I wasn't going to have him eat his food cold as the side dishes were cold so nothing like a hot steak with cold sides. Yummy right. My new gristle fillet arrived, dinner was done lol, well it is in a bag cut up for my Golden Retrievers compliments of Ruth Chris's. They did compensate our check but that really again was not the point. We usually go to Del Friscos where there's never a issue. Moral of the story is. I can't say we will be visiting Ruth Chris anytime if ever. However the server was a great guy. Felt bad for him but of course we took care of him.

I travel a lot for work and have used enterprise a lot for car rentals, but after this experience I'll never use them again.  Getting this location to call you back when they say they will to resolve a problem is a great exercise in futility.

Rented a car today for work travel.  Something wasn't working properly in it, so they were going to get me a new vehicle instead. Great. I let one of the employees know my suitcase was still in the first car and asked if he could move it to the new car they were giving me, he said no problem and that he would.

Obviously,  based on this one star review, they did not do that.  After driving two hours to my hotel, I open the trunk to see that it's not there.  I give them a call.  The store manager assures me that she'll give me a call back once she figures out how to overnight it to me.  She never called me back. 

I end up calling their escalation center which tells me they'll notify the area manager immediately and that that manager would give me a call. Another hour goes by and I'm worried that there's no resolution to this or plan of action before they close.

I call the store again.  A male employee picks up and tells me the post office is closed. There's nothing they can do. I have my work laptop and medicine I need to take daily in there. I've told them this but there's no sense of urgency or care from them.  I know for a fact though that several FedEx locations are open for several more hours if they bothered to care that I'm unable to work tomorrow and that I need my medicine, but he did not say they would ship me my suitcase or give me anything resembling an answer. He tells me he's looking into it and would give me a call back in a few minutes. It's currently an hour after they closed and I have not received anything. I called a half hour ago and of course cannot get through because the store is closed.

I still don't know if they are going to send my suitcase to me. They never bothered to collect the information needed to do anything. If they would have just told me they couldn't  ship it out I would have driven back to get it, but they just left me without any answers,  saying they'd call me back THREE TIMES, and not doing anything and now it is too late.I highly doubt they'll try to make any sort of amends. This place sucks and doesn't care about fixing their mistakes.

I was happy with our stay until the hotel didn't accept our 50 dollar gift card.  The gift card is two years old, and the hotel told us they can't accept it because of this, that we'll have to call corporate.  It was a wedding gift.  We don't have the opportunity to stay at the Hyatt so often, this was the time to use it.  Who knows if after jumping through hoops the gift card will be approved.  When you do this to your customers they feel scammed.  That was $50, gone.

Pillows are all one type, tall and stiff. Most hotels usually have a mix, in order to accommodate different guests.
Housekeeping neglects things. Previous guest's coffee grounds left in machine. Missing light bulbs, leaving a bare socket that could pose a safety hazard. Bath mat not replaced.
When the in-room coffee and cups are used, these items are not replaced when room is serviced.
Manager points out to guests that the breakfast is merely COMPLIMENTARY, not covered by the cost of their room and should be satisfied. Manager complains to guests that some waste food. Bread and pastry items are stale. Fruit is very over ripe and sausage tastes awful.
Manager complains to guests about those that take the shampoo, after staying just a few hours.
This place is adequate for a night's stay and the cost is reasonable. Just don't expect it to be a flawless visit.

At first everything was great, friendly and security was always doing their job. but this place is stressful. First off I moved in April, 6 fake fire alarms having to climb down stairs with my new pup. then they give you a sticker to park your car in the garage, well i had my sticker on and good thing that i needed to drive my car else it would of been towed!... due to "they could not see the sticker" now I also got in trouble and my key deleted from the system to enter my own apartment that i pay a lot for because I had was not able to walk downstairs cause i was not mobile and able to leave my apartment and had a friend quickly use to key. that i had already called downstairs to let them know the guest was coming. I am very stressed out wit this place. I keep adding cause so many awful things has happened. monday june 11th I went into the office to ask a few questions regarding my carpet, cabinets, and blinds to see how the status was on that and cherylll who i have her be rude to me before was in there she was having attitude before I even spoke, as i was speaking she has another resident come in to address some things to, I was not finished with my concerns and i waitied. so as i had finished up my questions i walked out and all i hear is with extreme intense attitude and rude yelling " thank you have a great day you DONT HAVE TO BE RUDE" Al the mantence guy was there in the beginning and also right in the front desk heard the whole thing. I cried my anxiety is so high from this unnessary attack she has done. this is not the first time she has shown to be hostile. I fear for my life when going in there because she always stares me down I am not comfortable living here let alone walking down there to address my problems that i need done in my apartment.

My husband and I stopped in to buy something for a pot luck dinner we were attending. We bought an Italian cream tart topped with apple slices. Our thought? How could we go wrong? OUR MISTAKE. The tart held barely an  eighth of an inch of cream and the rest was VERY DRY pastry.
Awful. Varallo Bros. is resting on it's old reputation which is no longer deserved. Never again. There are too many excellent bakeries around to settle for such terrible product.

Bland basic food, crap service. Was rushed with check multiple times halfway thru dinner even though we were there for barely 30 minutes and place was only half full. Looking at other reviews, unsurprised that most complains are about service

Yuck, yuck, yuck!!! I ordered the chicken, which was delicious; however, it was paired with very salty greens and pickled veggies. That combination alone is a terrible food pairing! The chicken should be paired with a better side dish like roasted cauliflower, cauliflower purée, or brussel sprouts! As I was eating the pickled veggies, I clearly got one that was rancid, which shouldn't happen with the pickling process, but somehow something went terribly wrong. The vegetable had clearly not been pickled correctly or had already gone bad before it had been pickled so it tasted god awful!! As soon as my boyfriend saw my face he knew something was wrong!! However, the napkins were cloth, so I had nothing to spit the vegetable out in!! I would have done anything for a paper napkin or paper towel or a sugar packet!! It was the absolute worst tasting thing EVER!! I paid for eating that rancid pickled vegetable ALL NIGHT LONG! I kept burping up the gross taste and living on the toilet!!! For $150+ meal I should have enjoyed every freaking bite and left satisfied, instead, I regretted dining here all night long!!! It made enjoying the show at the Ryman tough bc I kept tasting the gross food and I kept worrying I'd have to get up to use the restroom. I suggest you avoid the pickled veggies here at all cost (as an "appetizer" and with your mea)!!

So you're in town staying at a downtown hotel, skipped lunch, and decide that a mid afternoon pizza will tide you over until a late dinner.  Luckily, one restaurant has provided not one, but two brochures under your door, and that organization would be Taste of Italy.  I search my trusty Yelp and see a bunch of other crummy reviews, but as I recall from "Wedding Crashers," "It's pizza baby, it's good no matter what,"  So I order and am advised of a 45-60 minute wait because Gasparilla is going on.

At 65 minutes, the trusty delivery guy appears at our hotel room.  Immediately I think, this place is old school-he didn't keep the pizza in one of those pizza warmers that appeared in the 80s and they're close so it's hot.

Not so.  Not only was it cold, but not really crappy tasting.  Way too garlicky and weak on toppings.

Within a few hours the revenge of this pizza struck with a feeling like a day after hangover.  That stuck with me the entire next day.

Educate yourself.  Maybe their eat in is ok, but if you are downtown and want pizza ordered to your room, don't call this place.

don't send your dog here....
they're dog killers...
a friend of mine took her dog here and he died due to negligence.....
justice will prevail...
#justiceforblue
Service sucked! Waited FOREVER for just water. Bread came about 15 minutes later. Italian food? What a joke! Tasted like they dumped Ragu on some overly cooked spaghetti. Never coming back!

I have moved here two months ago . There is something wrong with my upstairs neighbor floors, sound like they are walking on beams, like the floor can possibly cave in. People come to my place and ask what's that noise . I've been sleeping on my couch since I moved in so I don't get woke in the morning but the issue is within my entire apartment . I pay extra for this "upgraded" apartment but have had a horrible experience since before I moved in . I contacted the leasing office and let them hear a video and they agreed the noise wasn't normal , but still no help. They said they would fix it by nailing down the floors but it's been two months. It took them one month to fix a broken mirror in my bathroom that I didn't know about until I moved in. I've been trying to contact Morgan properties to help get this fixed but it's hard. I wouldn't suggest this place
Absurd pricing and uninspiring product matched with baristas bearing minimal craft.

do not buy from this place. they took advantage of my father, a retired navy veteran, they scammed him out of a lot of money & did some illegal, immoral, shady things. we are suing.....elder abuse is not going to be tolerated. do not trust them. the salesman, joe, should be ashamed of himself. 
zero stars!!!

Worst hotel experience I've ever had.  I drove in from Memphis and valeted at about 10:00pm.  The next morning, it took them 45 minutes to find my car.  They finally pulled it around and 1000 feet after pulling off the back bumper basically fell off.  I immediately came back.  The manager immediately denied the possibility it was them.  After three weeks "investigating,". They denied liability and accused me of wrecking after I pulled out.

I'm filing suit tomorrow

Top notch service!!!

pizza & cheesesteak were both decent but
crab fries were expensive & inedible. undercooked, caked with old bay, no salt, and charged extra for a side of old coagulated rancid cheese globs and they forgot to give me the american cheese sauce that comes with them. they don't deliver over 3 miles so i had to go pick it up at 11:30 pm. got home after they were closed. called today as soon as they opened for a refund & they refused since it is the next day. 
not worth $35 & the aggravation. yes. $35 for one pizza, one cheesesteak and one order of bad bad fries. and zero customer service skills. 
SUPERVISOR BLASE CALLED ME BACK. ALSO REFUSED TO REFUND ME BECAUSE IT WAS THE NEXT DAY. HE SAID WHAT DO YOU DO THAT YOU NEED YOUR $7.99 BACK? IT IS YOUR FAULT SUNCE YOU DID NOT COME IN THE 20 MIN DELIVERY QUOTE TIME. AND MY FAVORITE NO I DONT WANT TO KEEP YOU AS A CUSTOMER YOU ARE YELLING AT ME LIKE WE ARE IN A RELATIONSHIP! HAHA I GUESS HIS WOMEN ARE DISSATISFIED LIKE HIS CUSTOMERS
Anyone who believes in the Constitution and the Bill of Rights should boycott all Dick's stores!

They snaked the line to the tub, as all the previous plumbers had done, and the problem came back, as it always does. They did suggest using a camera to find the problem. The cost of a camera went from "starting at $800" to $250 in a short period of time, but I cannot convince them to put it in writing before they do the job. They also didn't know where the cleanout was, even though it sticks several inches out of the ground.
The movie cut out 5 times and they refused giving us full refunds. Ruined the movie theatre experience and atrocious customer service. I would highly recommend going to any other theatre.

Wow, I can't believe this is a Hyatt. It felt way more like an old motel. The price does not at all match the product. Felt cheap, slightly dingy, when we asked for clean towels because our room wasn't serviced on the first nights stay, they brought us 7 hand towels...hand towels. It would have been comical if my husband wasn't getting out of the shower trying to dry off with(and I repeat) Hand Towels.  Staff was fine and location was good but the actual room was overall...gross. Sad. We won't be staying here again.

Stayed one night for Army-Navy game this pst Saturday. Booked a non-smoking room because my girlfriend is sensitive to the smell of cigarettes. We checked in late, around 9, and someone had clearly smoked in the room. It REEKED of smoke. Not only that, we found multiple cigarette burns on the comforter! 

So the cleaning people didn't notice the comforter, did they even change the sheets? We went down to request another room and they had none. So we asked for another comforter and they had no spares. I asked if we would receive a discount and was told to contact the manager on Monday. We did, and they were no help. They tried to argue with me and tell me that even though I had evidence it hadn't been cleaned, that it had been cleaned properly. Wouldn't offer a discount, or a refund, or anything. The manager was EXTREMELY rude to me.
Just went and got a box of chicken to go. Got home and there was no breast. Just wings, legs, and thighs. Very disappointing.
This was my favorite place. Very nice staff and decent food for the price, especially the wings! My last order was delivered with mouse feces on the box.

Unaware that Charlie sold out. Glad he puts his wife first! The cook was complaining about his work hours very loudly in front of customers. Not the first tome we've had to listen to him complain. Then the cook proceeds to make so much noise banging on the grill the only other couple had to ask the waitress to get him to stop. Seriously it was obnoxiously loud. We got our lunch and also got to enjoy strings of plastic meat wrappings in our sandwiches. To us the place is dead since Charlie is no longer there. This was our last trip. No wonder there were only two couples eating there at 1230 on a Saturday. We will not be back!!!!!!!!!! Dont go there.

Field House was ok I suppose. They had a great beer selection on their menu... but not much of it was actually available. There has to be a way to update this or at least cross things off. I ran through 5 things that they didn't even have available. Also it was pretty pricey but I guess that is to be expected considering it is connected to a hotel and a convention center. It was like a poor man's Hard Rock even though Hard Rock is right across the street. I've had better, I wouldn't have even gone here if it wasn't for a work function being held there.

Short version:
- Rents out vehicles with active recalls that haven't been fixed!!! 
- Poor customer service when there are issues (that are caused by them)!!!

Long version: 
Enterprise gave me a rental that had an active recall on it that for an issue that had not been fixed. I went on a trip 7 hours away from my home and 2 hours into it, I got a call from Enterprise telling me I had to switch my vehicle at the nearest location. I went to the location they told me to and they didn't have a car for me to switch to. I left. I was called again and told to go back and switch my car. I went back and switched my car. In doing so, I left my ez pass there (2 hours away from my home). I was told that it cannot be shipped to me. Since this all stemmed from them having given me a bad rental to begin with, they offered to get it shipped. One week later, I'm still waiting for it, getting no proactive follow up and the run around when I try to follow up. Highly suspect of the representatives' schedules - they are conveniently "out" or have "left the office" when there's something that needs follow up. 

Never had issues with Hertz or Alamo and prices are comparable - will be using them from now on.

My friend and I rented Jet Ski's there over the weekend. We went out in the bay and the jet skiing was very fun until my friends engine gave out. I went back in to notify the attendants about my friend and they took my jet ski. (They only have 2) To go tow my friends jet ski back in. My friend let me know my jet ski nearly stopped working during the rescue. When my friend returned we asked the woman running the stand to see if we could get our money back. She told us that we were out there for nearly an hour and she couldn't. No apologies for the faulty jet ski. We insisted on  a refund and she said the best she could do was give us half off which we accepted. When I checked my card statement I was fully charged for the rental still. I would recommend never using this company. They have limited jet skis and they seem to not work. Also the customer service was very poor. Couldn't believe there wasn't one I'm sorry that happened to come from them. Terrible experience all around.

The falafel balls were super salty.  I question handling of the food as well. 
The guy used tongs to grab my food but I didn't see gloves anywhere in sight.  I won't be returning...

If I could give this place 0stars I would DO NOT GO HERE staff is aggressively rude and will arrest you if you attempt to have fun in their bar... rly weird and embarrassing TRUST ME DO NOT GO manager has a tiny tiny pr*ck and takes it out on everyone around him

I'm really disappointed in the new menu. There is no option to substitute chicken for beef and paying $3 extra for fries seems cheesy to me. Our favorite entrees were the chicken pot pie and spicy chicken wrap. We won't be back until there's more for people who don't eat red meat and aren't big on tacos.

So we decided to try out Ninja and branch out! We were a little disappointed to say the least. We were sat immediately but once sat it went downhill for sure. We sat for 15 min without a server taking our drink or food order. We then waited another hour before our food came. It was missing two sushi rolls  and rice. They also brought the wrong roll out. We didn't get a chance to tell them this though because they didn't come back to check on us for another 20 min. They did bring the right food once we mentioned it but overall our experience lacked. Hope your experience will be better if you try here!

What a horrendous experience at Monster Pets. My roommate and I were looking to buy some fish for our first fish tank. At first, the workers told us to only use spring water for the fish tank - I later looked this up (AFTER we had set up the tank) and apparently spring water is the worst water to use for fish. Additionally, the workers gave us species of fish that we're not compatible together - one of the fish started eating the other fish. The fish that they also gave us had ich on them, which then spread instantly to all of the other fish. All in all, 12 our of 15 fish that we initially purchased are dead (it's been 2 weeks). Such a traumatic experience.

Worse service to date. Staff rude. One poor old guy was stood at the counter for a good 8 minutes before anyone asked him what he wanted. They had put cheese on his food and he had asked for no cheese. We were given the wrong food and that same tray of food went to three different places before it found the right one. 
Terrible visit. 
Also the guy taking the orders kept spitting onto a paper cup, then throwing it away.... (I guess I should be grateful that he did throw it away). I couldn't even bring myself to drink my coffee as it turned my stomach over. 
Needs a serious change in management.

Soooo I'm at the famous Neyow's.  I will be kind and gracious because I'm sitting here stunned, half full, and half tipsy.  The positive: the fried chicken wings are absolutely delicious.  Period. Like there has not been a piece of fried chicken that has been perfect to pass my lips since my dear Aunt Doris passed away.  This chicken is bomb!  Now for EVERYTHING else:  I ordered the seafood combo platter. You choose ur own two seafood items. I chose the stuffed crab and the bbq shrimp. The bbq shrimp were so fresh and so flavorful. The only thing missing was a lil kick of heat.  I love spicy food. But still.  They were so good!  The 'stuffed' crab was a glob if crab mush. I'm sorry guys. This stuff is literally the stuff you put on top of a lobster and broil it til it gets the crispy top layer with the lobster or whatever underneath. This was missing the key component- it's vessel.  This place has stars coming here. I'm so confused as to WHY?!   The string beans are canned, the okra could use some seasoning. My friend ordered the potato salad.  She thought it was mashed potatoes. Sigh. The last and final nail intge coffin: the Mac and cheese. It looks and tastes like boxed mac n cheese. So disappointing.  

Verdict: I will not go back.  Way too many other really good places to eat in NO.

Ribs are good but the side portions are super small and the instant potatoes are horrible for the cost of what it is to eat here you should at least get real potatoes there literally like 2 bucks for 10 lbs.  although the ribs are good I won't be back as everything else is lack luster

I've been going here for 10 years, so when I needed a new tire after getting a flat I came here without giving it a second thought. I purchased the road hazard warranty on it, since I had just replaced all four tires a month or two prior to this. I just got another flat and called to ask for the DOT number on the tire so I would know if this was the one covered or not. 

George told me they don't keep track of those and I'd have to bring it in to check. I explained "bringing it in" would be difficult since I had a flat and asked how he was going to check so I could do it myself. He then explained he was going to check the date on the tire because they don't keep tires older than 2017 in stock. I explained all of my tires were new and again asked how he was going to determine which tire was covered. "You'll just have to bring it in." 

After a painfully long conversation that was going nowhere, it was obvious my only two options were to tow my car to Best One and, from the sound of it, get told to buy a new tire because I can't prove which tire is which, or forego my warranty and buy a new tire from someone else. I chose the latter, and will continue to choose the latter from now on.
6 sales associates standing around doing nothing even when people are waiting in line. This is exactly why retail box stores are dying. Save your money and order on Amazon, terrible customer service.

This was our third visit. The first two visits were quite good. This morning however was a different matter. We ordered three items. The cauliflower salad, the bacon bleu cheese hashbrowns and the BLT and AE breakfast sandwich. The total wait time for our food was 52 minutes. I know this because I looked at my watch when we first sat down which still had a timer running from our recent bike trip. The cauliflower salad came up about 15 minutes after our order but sat out on the pick up line until the other food items were finally delivered.  The only fresh item was the hashbrowns,  which were pipping hot. But since the salad set out at room temperature for 45 minutes it was also room temperature/ slightly warm . My breakfast sandwich obviously had been prepared and also sat either on the service window or in the kitchen for quite some time because the toast was soft/soggy, the egg had obviously been cooked way in advance and the overall sandwich was also room temperature.  The worst insult is the fact that the kitchen staff put the breakfast sandwich on a piping hot plate...I guess to try and fool me into thinking that it was fresh, which is an absurd  attempt to cover their lack of coordination in the kitchen. 

There is way too much competition in St. Petersburg to tolerate this kind of treatment. We definitely will not be back for a fourth visit.

Stay away !! 
Danger !!
Read this !!
I do live in the aria and eat there often at least 2 times a week ! Not anymore now .
They start nice about a year ago - blowing out the competition from the aria by giving 
50% Off - that's cool .
  the QUALITY of the food is growing down and down with time , 
Now it is really bad ! Old ! Smell 
Definitely not sushi fish suppose to be .

I don't mind pay for food - but in the past 2-3 visit I got stomach problems and food poisoning .
Never had such a bad sushi 
If they won't improve immediately, the will be out of business very soon !

Charge more if you want , but keep the quality if the food and fish the way it supposed to be .

I don't know what's going on with this Dominos but  their service has gone downhill in the last 30 days! They used to be quick.  My pizza would be here within 30 minutes or so.  Tonight I'm sitting here waiting on my pizza and it's been an hour and 40 minutes. I called the store to find out what's going on and they said my driver went back to the store with my pizza!!!!  They claim he was here but didn't know what to do!?!?   This driver clearly didn't want to do his job because there are instructions written on how to get exActly to me. Plus for the store to not call me when they didn't deliver my pizza even though they marked it on the app that it was delivered.  Super disappointed in this service!!?  I would cancel but at this point I'm starving.  
This place is now dead to me.

I ordered my food online, just wings and macaroni and they waited until I got to the store to pick up my food to tell me that they sold out of macaroni. I had to chose another item, something I did not want to do because I never had their macaroni so my mouth was definitely set on it. We got to the location at about 8:00pm and we left out at 8:50 just waiting on my potato wedges. 

Another time I been to this location and nobody came out to seat us so we eventually left the store. 

I always hesitate on going to this location due to their Google reviews. But I gave today a shot and came out as an unhappy customer.

Ordered 2 cheese dogs, 1 plain hot dog & fries =$21.16. Waited nearly 8/9 minutes for 3 hot dogs with my 3 children (under age 6).
Brought it home, had 3 plain dogs and disappointed kids. 
There was one other person waiting for their order. 
Paid extra for something not received. If you have time to go here and remove everything from the take out bag and check it, then you're fine, but if you expect to receive what you paid for and be out, then go elsewhere!

Was there today for their brunch buffet.  Can't say that much was worth the price or drive.
While there were a number of inviting options on the buffet, very little of it was up to the standard I would expect after having had good food and service in Indianapolis.  The English Muffin on the Eggs Benedict was hard as a rock.  The shrimp were very nice, however, the only cocktail sauce option was heavy with horseradish - should have a milder option available. Nothing on the desert table was labeled, so it was a mystery what you took.
The service was fair at best and, being a buffet, I feel it is inappropriate to automatically add a 20% gratuity.

I stayed at the Sheraton New Orleans in September 2018.
There were feces from a previous occupant on my shower curtain and I had to request to have the curtain changed 4 times over two days before that change was made. The issue is disgusting, but the fact that it took so long to resolve is what I found inexcusable.
Upon checking out, I was informed that I had already been checked out and billed for the first two nights of my stay, without my knowledge and using the card I had left on file. As I result I was not able to make any changes to that bill at that time, or subsequently.
Hotel staff were kind and helpful- management seemed to be the problem. The hotel management was extremely disorganized and slow to respond. I was told their "system was down" when checking in and checking out.
Overall the hotel was dated, muggy, smelled of mildew, and was not especially clean. There were issues with water pressure and the bed weirdly did not have a fitted sheet, so the small topsheet that was used instead kept coming untucked and exposing a pretty foul mattress. Even had the checkout system not been shady and had there not been the poop-shower curtain issue I would not stay here again.

The first night we stayed here the fire alarm went off for an extended period multiple times. At 7 AM the next morning they started trying to fix said alarm and set it of every 20-30 minutes while working on it. When I called the front desk to find out what was going on I received a rude and hostile response with zero apology for the bad night. 

The next night we checked and the alarm was fixed so we counted on a better nights sleep. However the people in the room next door got up at 6:30 am and proceeded to have phone calls and conversation. The walls are so thin we could hear every word. 

This is possibly the worst stay I have ever had in New Orleans. Pick any place else.

Took my cat there a week before Christmas because he was having terrible breathing problems,  The dr. looked at him told me how beautiful he cat was what great teeth he had and sent me home saying he would be better by Christmas.  No meds no anything.  Well, with the long Christmas weekend coming up I called and told them Bijou wasn't getting better they gave me antibiotics.  After Christmas he still wasn;t better and when I called they said more antibiotics,  When I got there to pick up those meds they suddenly were out of antibiotics and told me to give the 3 week old meds to the cat.  When I asked the efficacy of that she became very rude and told me it was dr. orders.  Bijou was still not better so they give me new antibiotics,  When I called and said he was bleeding from the nose they said it was normal.  I got scared and took Bijou to another Dr. where they diagnosed him with cancer and he was dead 1 1/2 days later.  Bijou would have passed anyway but had there been a correct diagnosis had they been competent Bijou I think would have suffered less and I would have been better prepared.  I would never recommend this clinic for any animal needs.  They somehow deleted my last post about this but for as long as they delete I will repost.

Came here because it was a short walk from the conference center, across the street actually.  Chose an outside seating and despite sitting down waiting 15 min for someone to greet me and take my drink order I was eager to try the food.  The flounder roulande and Rockefeller oysters we delicious bit the gumbo fell way short of satisfactory.  Given a low rating because they ghosted me for 15 min  a possible return as there are items I wouldn't mind trying minus the gumbo.

Although the pizza was pretty good I got ripped off by some weird looking black gender weird stuff when I confronted them if you don't know how to explain why I was extra five dollars this place sucks I'm never

Called 20 min before closing and asked to pick up. They ducked my call for 10 minutes then said it was too late. Lol. Only decent thing is gyoza; everything else is standard if not subpar. Also got food poisoning from the chicken katsu one time. Eat at your own risk! :)

Showed up at 8:30 AM. Having barely been open a few hours the store looked like it had been through a holiday rush - disgusting bathrooms, overflowing trash cans, a sticky dirty floor. Truly embarrassing if I was the owner. It's as though the previous night's crew just closed up shop and the morning crew came in and also did absolutely nothing. Small things go a long way - clean your store.
The cashier charge me for two meals and when I ask for a refund she refused to give it to me. Another employee had to do it it was very unprofessional I will not return to this location.

Ugh, this was kind of the worst. Giving it an extra star because the staff / brow experts were nice. But my brows were destroyed. If tiny thin 90s brows that barely resemble distant cousins (never mind sisters), then this is your spot. I've had fabulous experiences at other Benefit Brow Bars. But now my poor destroyed brows are still recovering (months later) from my experience here. So yeah, worst brow experience of my entire life. In sum, be super careful about which "brow expert" you see here or suffer the consequences.

Wife loves seafood ordered the clam chowder and pound of crab legs.  I am allergic to shell fish so always leery of the fried food with the common oil so I wanted to order a macaroni and cheese and slaw. Bar tender who was serving us made a big deal of ordering of the kids menu, have to ask a manager "for an adult to order of the kids menu" I told him I was allergic and he continued to be a jerk so we closed and left seriously either he needs to go or the manager who makes him feel so powerless he can't make those decisions.

You can no longer tip via credit card here now since the business doesn't want to pay to file taxes for the tips,  which is extremely inconvenient for not only customers who wish to tip but don't have cash,  but also the employees who are undoubtedly losing money since quite a bit of their income is from tips,  which is why the company is able to pay them $10 an hour. I don't see this going well for this company.
*Edited
Erica the owner has responded saying they do accept credit card tips, so either she decided to not follow through or she is not telling the truth because I was told by a now former employee that she announced just days ago they would no longer accept credit card tips.

We have been here for almost 2 hours and no food.  The waitress will not even come to our table now because it's been so long.  It's RIDICULOUS!  I understand your busy but why can't you acknowledge the fact we ordered over an hour ago?


#piss&hungry

First and last time I will ever be going to this restaurant!!!! The staff were incredibly rude, not listening or paying attention to what I ordered and they also did not give me what I paid for. They only gave me 2 sauces even when I ordered a lot of food, we waited for a long period of time.

Pet fee is outrageous,  rude front desk receptionist Fatima laughed at my concern for the $25.00 a piece per night pet fee tv had a busted speaker breakfast? Lol no if you wany juice and cereal then they have that. Very clean rooms though. Bed sucked pillows were fair. And they advertise free WiFi but it doesnt work half of the time.

I had ordered pizza for delivery twice in the past, and didn't understand the bad service reviews. I do now.  After an hour and a half waiting, I called, and spoke to a rude person who literally hung up on me.  No apology, no compensation.  Eventually, the cold soggy pizza arrived.  Feel bad for the delivery person, as he got no tip and advice to find another job.

We might have caught the bad crew, but other than that don't waste your time or money. 
1)cold fries
2)cold burger
3) very little shrimp on shrimp on bun,also cold(picture is what we got from the counter)
Only one employee acknowledged us.
First and last time for everything!!!

This was a horrible experience, checked in and went to room hotel worker was on his laptop in our room. Hotel smells and needs updating, paid 800.00 for 2 nights including valet. Worst hotel I have stayed at in 30 years, embarrassing just to stay their.

Your bouncer tonight (technically the night of 1/10) is a jackass. I'm a citizen of Nashville...going on 3 years and he wouldn't let me in to your establishment because he said that my ID was fake. I will be 25 in 2 months.  I've been to your bar almost  every weekend since this space first opened. I have no reason to have a fake ID. He was an absolute ass and he belittled me in front of the group that I was with as if I were an 15 year old child trying to get into a bar. I've been a frequent visitor here on the weekends ever since this venue opened, but that will no longer happen. A venue that has such negative employees doesn't deserve any Nashville natives or tourists' business. This was my go-to recommendation for friends that were coming in to town, but I'll be sure to recommend another venue from here on out since you're employees are so rude. Don't treat your locals like crap.

Wow. I have never been so disappointed in a restaurant. We arrived on a whim and were excited to try a new place. We came on a Saturday afternoon around 3pm. The resturaunt was not crowded at all yet we had terrible service. 

We ordered bruschetta and the bread came out completely charred. I was in disbelief they even brought it out like that. We sent it back and got new bread. Then we ordered chicken which came out completely pink, sent it back and it was as tough as a hockey puck. We ordered a salmon entree and they brought out a salad, with no salmon. We also ordered a pizza which was utterly disgusting. Completely undercooked. 

The ambiance is the only thing keeping this place afloat. Unfortunately the manager didn't address any of the issues with our meal. If you're looking for a nice place for a family dinner this is not the place to go.

Our first time coming here was great, my 2nd time coming here which was today was terrible. Ordered around 8pm tonight and the restaurant was dead however it took almost 35-40 mins just to come to us. Then when the food arrives they bring one tray which one of my parties food came and the steak was not even cooked correctly and then my food had the wrong type of Wing sauce . Which took an additional 15 mins. The waiter was non existent, and the manager Mike really was trying to make up for the mistake on the behalf on the kitchen but at this time I'm annoyed and it was too late. However he came back and comped the entire meal plus made duplicates of the food for us to have dinner for tomorrow which was nice however I probably won't come back to this establishment for a very long time or ever again. Mike the manager was great though, very friendly guy

RUDE, RUDE, RUDE. I went there for my birthday lunch with a friend. I was seated and given a menu, I asked if I could order appetizers while waiting on my friend. The lady indicated she didn't speak English and motioned to the lady at the register. Well, the lady stayed at the register. I might add I was only one of 3 tables at the time. I again asked if I could have hot tea and again was motioned to the register lady. Long story short, a group of 3 Asian young men came in speaking an Asian language. The lady that wouldn't/couldn't wait on me started up a conversation with them, took their drink order and then proceeded to take their food order all the while I sat there with a glass of water. No movement from the register lady. I walked out! How incredibly rude to over look a customer and then wait on others that are clearly not of your ethnicity. If it was turned around and an Asian customer was ignored by a white waitress there would be an outrage!. I'm over discrimination by everyone! Enough already! But I won't ever try this prejudice restaurant again, hope they go under!

Worst service I've ever used !!!!!!! 
Worked on my starter 10 hrs , gave me a huge bill for $1500 just changing the starter ( parts and labor ). 
At the time of paying , they told me I can pay only $500 CC and the rest of the amount cash. Asked them to split the payment in 3 amounts and use the CC ?! That's when their manager started yelling at me - "don't teach me how to do business " !!! 
Worst place !!! Avoid them !!! Don't even waste your time and money !

Mother's Day later afternoon lunch. Not too crowded, easy parking access, friendly greetings, quickly seated as the restaurant was not overwhelming busy, nice open atmosphere, nice mix of modern and renovation of a nasty and dank older establishment. 

Looking for gluten free options. 

Bench seat comfortable, stand alone chairs too narrow for some wide-in-the-beam as myself. Yes-- I have a wide berth at 5-10 215 lbs but any tonnage and I would be left with chair imprints on the hips. (Maybe time for the the vegan diet.)

Waitstaff: think Trump White House on day 100. Lots running around looking smart but nothing getting accomplished-- at least at our table. After a six-minute wait, I asked for table assistance and in pops our server who immediately tells us he is not our server but can get us set up with water and wares. He explains the concept of a helpful team staff -- which we took to mean our service would be timely and efficient. 

The waiter explained the specials and offered a sample of one. We ordered drinks, appetizers and water. Waiter disappears then reappears with news that he was just informed there are no samples allowed (so scratch the special off the list). 

Appetizers and drinks arrive, most excellent taste, perfect. No gluten free beers available. (Suggestion-- try Greens or Glutenberg) 

Ready to order?  I'll have the quinoa salad, roasted red peppers etc. Can you please add chicken to that? Hmmm--sorry we can only add the grilled chicken to ........ (I didn't realize that grilled chicken was so picky as to where is lays) 

My son ordered a burger (gluten free-- no bun available. Unbelievable that a Musk, whom has a sibling that can send a rocket into space, battery power a car, yet inconceivably may not be aware of Udi's, or better yet Native Bread from Indiana).  

In my best epicurean descriptive terminology, the meals were extremely good and tasty, however getting a re-fill on the Arnold Palmer was as stressful as approaching Amen Corner at the Masters. The anticipation of a refreshing drink only to be soiled by the hustle of team waitstaff hustling to everyone but the woman dying of dehydration at table number 4. 

So the next time you are in search of mid-afternoon, tasty, semi-gluten free meal with slow and inefficient service, stop in at the Next Door Eatery but my suggestion is to pack you patience and bring your own drinks.

Not quite sure what all the hype is about. The Yakitori is not authentic as it is clearly fried, not grilled on charcoal and has incorrect sauce. Many of the items I received were cold and/or over cooked. The Octopus was rubbery and the katsu was dry and too salty. As someone who has extensively traveled throughout Japan I can say that this was a major disappointment!

This place is average at best. The Pho noodles are wrong, the broth is weak, the vermicelli is dry. really no redeeming qualities. For a more authentic experience there are so many other places that are so much better. This is the Mcdonalds of Pho......

I only go to this store if I absolutely have to.  Occasionally I will step in to see if it looks any better or if they got new management.  But yeah 3 years now and the store always looks junkie.  No merchandising skills at all....just throw it on a hanger or toss it on a shelf.  Really quite disappointing, you can still have a store that is closeouts and have it look good...just takes some pride in your work.  You can never find help if you need it here and no matter what there is always a line at the register.
Bad service. Worse food. Stale environment (and by that I mean that it actually has a stale smell when you walk in). Dirty patio.  Won't be back.

I used to enjoy eating at Tonellis with my family and friends. Over the years we met so many friendly faces and it seems like Tonellis can not keep a good staff, besides a select few. There is always new management. THIS TIME IT IS THE WORST. Very rude and arrogant. Just a few weeks ago one of the new male managers was confronted at this bar by a customer, and completly handled it like a child and not someone running a bussiness. 
The food is ok now, but priced high for the quality and portion. Somedays the nachos are hot, sometimes we eat cold dried up cheese. Safe to say we will no longer spend our nights or money at Tonellis. Too bad they cant turn back time about 6 years ago. Sure will miss the Wonder pie.

Me and my husband went yesterday for pedicures.  We were greeted as soon as we walked and the shop is super clean.  The problem we had neither of them used the tool to remove the tool to remove the rough skin on the bottom of the feet. They need to spend more attention to detail instead of talking.

We stopped in Saturday, early evening, and had two beers.  The beers were tasty.  However, the rest of the experience was not good.  The bartender dudes were gruff and not welcoming.  The tasting room lacked warmth/character/local flavor, very sterile/bland, not fun to hang out at.  No games of any kind that we could see.  Lastly, the music being played in there sucked complete ass (techno/indie/emo pop?).  Couldn't wait to leave, won't be back.

We have been to this establishnent a few times in the past and, have had pleasant experiences and good service. The trivia nights are rather interesting entertainment. Our experience last night was far from any in the past. Upon entering there were several tables available but all of them were dirty.  We chose the least dirty table and had to ask our server to clean it. We ordered a couple beers and the nacho platter. The wait was long though many customers had left... I couldn't spot our server, Karina, anywhere. Finally perhaps 30 minutes later she comes out from the back of the establishment glances at our table and realizes we were still waiting for our order. Thereafter she brings the nacho platter which looked like it had been placed in an oven to keep warm...the beans were dried out and crispy.. And the tortilla chips burnt. It looked nothing like the same orders we had seen come out to surrounding tables. We wished for the server who was taking care of customers on the patio. She was hustling the entire time meanwhile ours was inattentive and nowhere to be found. When the bill came it was wrong.. We were charged for 3 Heatwaves and 1 desert blonde when it was 2 Heatwaves and 2 desert blondes. The heatwaves were 50 cents more but we figured it would take forever to get that fixed so we paid the amount as shown on the bill. And Karinas tip was reflective of her service.  Overall it seems the place doesnt seem as well kept...dirty floors, peeling paint on the walls, hoses from the equipment leaking onto the floor.  Perhaps management is more focused on the second location and taking this one for granted??
I sat outside.  There are 8 tables and 2 waiters.  It took 15 minutes to get a menu and 45 to get a sandwich. The pastrami was passable.

Been here over five years and now I must say the quality of the sushi have gone down hill! Brought take out today and few things which were bad: 1. Spider roll were smaller than usual and had no soft shell crab legs sticking out. 2. Avocado were getting bad as they are turning dark. (No ideal why would they use this) So being a loyal customer for years i call them back to tell them how bad it was and the response i get is sometime the crab legs are shorter. What a bunch of crap, i have posted a pic of the dragon rolls and clearly there are no legs on them. Never will i go back to this sushi place.

This place is fun if you're 22 years old and would still enjoy going to a frat house. If you go for any sort of game without getting a table you'll spend most of your time getting bumped into and trying to navigate through the ridiculously narrow walkway right next to the bar. Last time I was there it took about 20 minutes to get a drink while standing at he bar. Bartender was clearly drunk and overpouring every drink. Maybe not always a bad thing but definitely not a good experience. Too crowded, too expensive, and poor service. You're better off finding somewhere else to go.

I tired this place for the first time yesterday and I can easily say that I probably won't ever go back. Although most of the waitresses were welcoming the bar waitress was entertaining her friends instead of working. I waited almost 10 minutes before even being acknowledged by the bar waitress. The wings that I received were charred. Overall not a good experience and not a place i would recommend.

Purchased a car from this location back in October. I used the Honda finance company for a car loan. I specifically asked if I could make car payments at this location and was told yes. Again, confirmed that I could make payments because I don't do online banking and prefer to interact in person. Was told today while trying to make a payment they don't accept payments in the store.  Thanks for lying straight to my face AutoNation Honda!

All in all 'meh' food with 'meh' service to match - so at the very least consistent.

This relates to the recently opened restaurant on the north side (st.Albert Trail & 137 ave)
Started with a Cajun Ceaser, rather bland, watered down, not much flavour, would not recommend. 

Ordered the Buttermilk Chicken which was dry, over cooked and tough.  Would also not recommend.  Mentioned to server, who just smiled and said ok.  The Cherry Coke Ribs were ok, not great, but ok.

All the appetizers and entree's arrived at the same time.  The best part of the the meal was the Alligator skewer, very good but pricey for size.

The pecan pie was tasty, not overly sweet, great crust.

The reason I never responded to Natalie's messages she sent to me after I posted my review was because she NEVER addressed any of the incredible rude things she said to me on the phone that day. But instead just told me I was overreacting, never apologized for what she said, never addressed what she said and she just turned everything around on me being at fault. Never addressed why she said the rude things such as "it sounds like you care more about your flight than your dog" Why would I want to bring my dog back to someplace that can't handle emergency situations? If you knew that I was on my way to the airport why did you demand that I come pick my dog up? why not handle the situation. BTW... she did not call the person who came and picked up my dog. I called that person when they were at work and I was crying upset and they had to leave work on their lunch break to come get Emma. The person who came and got Emma was not listed as an emergency contact as when I filled that information out in 2012 I didn't even know that person. AGAIN, she is making stuff up to try to make herself look good. ALSO, regarding the cone-- I NEVER REFUSED TO GIVE MY DOG A CONE. The vet did not say that- I was there yesterday and I actually talked to him about it. I also DID give you a cone... which you clearly ignored that and are making things up about me. My dog did not like the black cone they gave her, she was given a different type of cone- which I LITERALLY HANDED TO NATALIE AND WAS TRYING TO TELL HER ABOUT EVERYTHING WHEN SHE BLEW ME OFF AND TOLD ME TO JUST WRITE EVERYTHING DOWN ON THE PAPER. This is why I never responded to your rude emails. You are literally MAKING things up and NEVER apologized for telling me that I care more about my flight than I do about my dog. That's appalling and if you KNEW anything about me, you would know I care deeply about my dog and my ENTIRE trip was me stressing and crying about my dog and the way you treated me. TERRIBLE. TERRIBLE. TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. You just don't talk to customers that way- and then turn around and blame them for everything and LIE about certain things. I never REFUSED my dog any type of care. That's literally pathetic that you are trying to turn this around on me and make that stuff up. I'LL NEVER BE BACK.

The bowls are good but the staff are so slow making bowls. I waited over 20 minutes for a bowl today when only one other person was there. The staff was just joking around and messed up my order. When I told them I had been there for 20 min and asked how much longer it would be they gave ME an attitude. -- the bowl tasted like it was missing something and now I know why.. I am halfway through and found a huge scoop of unblended açaí. I won't be back.
Overpriced... The food isn't even that good... The staff were nice, but their hospitality certainly was not worth the cost.

I was so excited to try this new donut shop near our house! My daughter and I went in about 9am on a Thursday. The shop was clean and the staff was friendly, welcoming and helpful. HOWEVER, after purchasing 2 dozen donuts and coming home to actually eat them I was totally DISAPPOINTED. The donuts have good flavor but the minute you bite into a maple or chocolate "glazed" donut every bit of frosting falls off. It's completely crumbly and you end up with plain dry donuts to eat. And a pile of dried frosting to eat separately. With a bill of $30 after tipping the girl this was definitely not worth what i paid. I'm all about supporting local family businesses but this was not a good donut experience at all!

So our food was wonderful, but my son who just had a bday didn't get a bday cake or song, plus the mens bathroom was destroyed!!

 My son tried to use the bathroom had to sacrifice his undies because the design of the bathroom literally soiled his pants, lid broken. The toilets were all dirty, even my kid thought the bathroom was disgusting and stinky.  Brought the whole experience down.  What is this a gas station??????

Isn't this a violation?  If the toilet is gross people can get sick so easily, with eating right after all that pollution.  You need to fix that toilet Red Robin, don't wait anymore.  I will think twice before going back again!

Was greated nicely and the service was great but the food was over priced and average. My wife said that's the most she has spent on chicken, basil & portobello and the worst she has had very bland. I had the Fisherman's Platter which was good but everything is deep fat fried and the serving was made big just to get the price out of you.  I hope you like fries. There are better places close by. Please try Shells better and cheaper

I have now stopped into this restaurant in the middle of the day three different times over the past two weeks. Each time, the manager was either on her cell phone or not paying attention to customers that had entered the store. After waiting over four minutes for her to finish whatever she was doing on her cell phone, she finally acknowledged the two customers waiting. Obviously, customer service isn't a strong value at this Subway.
Business don't own up to their BS. I was sold old turkey on my Sub today. If you been around 40 years then you know better than serving trash like this.

Horrible experience with owner - think his name is Jimmy and he seemed really proud of being a complete jerk.  Normally i wouldn't care as my experience isn't nearly as bad as the others I've reviewed but just had to as I also am wondering how this place is still open for business - someone better call the BBB.  Stopped by to buy some plants and  i asked him a simple question in the parking lot about one of his carts he was pushing around and he snapped for no reason - looked like he was pushing the cart in my car so i jokingly asked if it got away from him or was it intentionally - First he had his ear buds in so couldn't hear me and when i asked again - he was very condescending and said "why does it matter"?  Just started a shouting match in the middle of the parking lot for no reason.  Other customers were in disbelief.  I asked if he worked there and he proudly said " I am the owner".  lol.  Anyways, after that encounter i had no interest in giving this guy a penny so we got back in the car and left.  Immediately we wondered if he was just having a bad day or this was the norm - folks, check out the comments on Google, Yelp and Facebook - this guy has a serious issue with abuse and might physically hurt someone if he hasn't already.  Gotta wonder though how he's still in business? I encourage everyone to keep posting their negative experiences to bring some visibility and get this guy kicked out of business!

Terrible service!  I order the pork porterhouse which was the special of the day. It came out cold and undercooked so I sent it back. By the time my meal returned the other 3 guests had completed completed their meals. MOD could not have been more helpless. 
I won't be back. BAM!

Its been a long time since this place has been the popular fun-loving Mexican restaurant we all once knew.  This restaurant is located at the front of my neighborhood & it's the place that hosted all of my family's birthdays and graduation celebrations. Unfortunately things have dramatically changed for the worse- raised prices on the menu, noticeably under staffed, and inevitably the drop in volume of customers. Earlier tonight my boyfriend and I wanted chips & salsa- when I walked in no one was there to greet me, I had to walk into the next room to find the owner leaned back watching tv with another server, asked me to repeat my order three times then still got it wrong, luckily I checked my bag before I left, I had ordered a large queso and I have to pay an additional 5 dollars for large chips to go with it! As if I wanted the queso without chips!! The entire time as the server is walking in & out of the kitchen clearly confused over my very simply order, the owner is just hanging out watching tv. Utter disappointment!! This restaurant is an utter disappointment!!! Next time I will absolutely travel 15 minutes to El Paso rather then right up the street to El Mesquite.

This past Sunday I'm driving my horse trailer on the highway and one of the 4 tires shreds. There are very few tire places open on Sunday, but this is where they get 1 star. They're open and I bring in the tire for replacement.  Now I'm worried about the remaining 3 tires on my trailer because they're all about 13 years old and are likely going to have similar problems.
