Since this store was good to us on Sunday, I bring the other 3 tires to them for replacement.  I'm the first person there at 7 am when they open.  I leave the tires and just tell them I need them by the afternoon, around 3.  I show up at 4 pm and the tires were in the same place I left them that morning, not even touched.

The employee starts giving me excuses about why they had not been done yet, i.e. We're short handed, we got busy, etc.  I might buy that B.S. if I had brought the tires in later in the morning, but not when I was the first one in the store that morning.  

Do yourself a favor, go to any other store than this one.  Very frustrating.

I'm posting this review because I am sitting in my car listening to a person with a beautiful voice sing outside the front doors & the store security guard came outside and started yelling at her, he was so rude and made a big point about it being his job to chase her off. It makes me think this place cares more about profits than the community which is not something I'm spending my dollar to support. Aside from that factor Robért Fresh Market has sky high prices for a less than desirable selection of food. I don't eat meat or dairy so fruit & veggies are a big staple of mine and theirs are just not a fair price. I'm disappointed since this is a new grocery store in my neighborhood. I don't recommend going here, ever, unless you're in a pinch.

On a positive note, the Baconator Fries are delicious. Good thing, since it's the only thing I'm eating. 

I'm so aggravated. I places an order on Door Dash. The total came to $18. You'd think for &18 they could got the THREE items right, right? Nope. Apparently not. 

I ordered the Taco Salad... no chili or chips!! Seriously? Without those two things, it's just lettuce with tomatoes and cheese. Oh and salsa. GROSS. 

I ordered a Frosty... it's missing, too. 

And not a napkin to be seen. 

I quit, Wendy. Get it together.

This Missouri /clearwater gym has not complied with my requests to stop billing me for the $260 monthly personal trainings.... I have since 9/20 requested to stop billing me directly had to speak with Austin who said he would stop billing me the first time as I explained we had over 15 visits on account. I then noticed it was charged again to my October statement and he basically said oh well you will lose all those workouts. As he knew my daughter had no way of making it to these workouts and I explained again to stop charging me  I didn't care about the lost workouts. Now I am seeing again another November charge to my credit card for additional $260! I am warning you all don't sign up for anything there it's high pressure and they never take the charges off. I will be calling American Express to get my payments back.

I'm not sure if they just opened because if so it might explain the lack of service.  
I got a sampler platter.  It could have been all fried together is an excess of grease so there was not much flavor to anything.  The best part was the wings that the wings were okay.  The chips would have been great if the grease was not dripping off.  
The service was slow and bland. The entire experience was bad.
The restaurant itself looked nice enough it's a shame the food or service was bad.

Just to let you know called a different Plummer quoted me 185.00 plus tax no show up fee asked him to do the the job did it no problems with the siding so I feel that in good faith I should have my 79.00 refunded in good faith .

I went in and Amanda and Lauren were having extremely rude attitudes and had very fake forced smiles. I am not coming to this location anymore and am going to tell my family and friends not to go because I felt a very bad vibe in the store. Lauren rolled her eyes at me in the corner of the store and it was super awkward I felt like I did something to her personally. at least now I have to force myself to not eat as much ice cream

Hold on to your seats, your in for a bumpy ride. This dining establishment requires to have well above average hearing because it sounds like concert hall in here. With it being so noisy it may in fact be the reason the servers don't listen to your order.  I asked for a plate, super burrito with the green chili (verde sauce) and cheese.  He heard the cheese but it was missing the sauce. On top of that, probably for the best, missed the order of the chili relleno.  It probably would of been as odd and bland as the burrito. I'm a connoisseur when it comes to burritos, the chicken was unseasoned and the steak was burned. That right there is enough to make any dish taste poor. 
Their beans are all liquified and taste like the bottom of a barrel of retried beans.  
It came with the traditional lettuce, sour cream and a thick unevenly cut tomato, which probably could attest to the best part of the meal. I wish I could of told the young man who was "waiting" on me but after he took my order and placed it, never saw him again.  Another young man brought the plate out 5 minutes after ordering and another young lady dropped off the check, saying this I believe is yours and walked away.  Which is what I would if I were you when thinking about coming here. It's exactly the way it was when they first opened and until things change I won't give a shot at any special dishes they may have

This was my first time here and I heard good things, so I wanted to give it a try.  The first thing - you gotta follow the procedures - something I knew nothing about!!  So, here is my tip - come in - get a number - come over to the wall where they take orders and wait for them to call your number (I didn't follow the ordering procedure and lost 10 minutes looking around and feeling lost..LOL).  Finally, one guy behind the counter took pity on me and told me what to do!  My fellow patrons didn't offer assistance-no fault on them - they were interested in their orders...So be prepared to come into a crowded place ready to take your place in line.

The seafood is plentiful and fairly priced.  I got the flounder/ whiting platters. You can tell that the fish was previously frozen and was a ok - but I like to have options of fresher seafood.  Taste was ok - nothing great.  I will come back to try the crabs and hopefully the customer service will be better as well.

My friend took me to this place a few months back and I had a great time, so this weekend another friend of mine was looking for a fun time in Philly. I told her about The Plough and the Stars and spoke very highly of it. A group of us went and once we got there we ordered a round of drinks, I ordered a bottle of beer and as I took my first sip I felt something sharp on my lip and cut my thumb to find a small piece of glass in my skin. The whole bottle had shattered glass sticking to it. So I went back to the bar and kindly (I was really upset, but I understand accidents happen) told the bartender there were pieces of glass on my bottle and I had cut my lip and thumb, his response was "Okay? What do you want me to do? Do you need a bandaid?" As If I was gonna walk around with a bandaid on my lip!! All I wanted was to make them aware and to get a different bottle so I don't DIGEST PIECES OF GLASS! Instead I recieved a sarcastic response. Not even an apology. I was so angry by his response we ended up leaving and for this employee's lack of customer service I will no longer go back to this bar or refer this bar to friends. I recommend customer service inservices to all of the employee's there, as they are not very friendly!

IF YOU KNOW ANYONE WITH A DISABILITY, DO NOT TAKE THEM HERE. Took my beautiful mom out to dinner tonight after sharing a glass of wine at my home. The manager at 1895 wouldn't serve her because they accused her of being intoxicated and humiliated her in front of everyone. She has Meige's caused by Blepharospams in her eyes and has a hard time keeping them open, any time of the day. Spreading the word every way I can.

No. Nothing about this was good, except the fries, which were only just OK.  First, the name, "Graze". This seems... misleading to me. Walking in, I had the impression (from the name) that they served burgers made from some nice, grass-fed, free roaming, happy cows. Ok that's a bit of an exaggeration, but grass-fed at least. The name makes its sound like that's their whole thing. Well it is their thing, but only if you remember to ask and are willing to pay extra on top of an already hefty price (that doesn't include fries). My non-grass-fed burger (I didn't realize I had to ask until after I had already ordered) was... strange. Juicy, yes. Tasty, no. It was not seasoned well (or possibly at all), and was pressed until it had strange, thin & crispy edges. The thick brioche bun was sweet (yes I know brioche is supposed to be slightly sweet, but yuck on a burger!) and grossly overpowering to the rest of the burger. If only I could have washed it down with a refreshing, cold soda. Unfortunately, ALL of their Maine Root sodas were awful. TERRIBLY AWFUL. I sampled every flavor and couldn't find a single one I even wanted to swallow a sip of, and finally just opted for some black tea. Yes, it was that bad. Perhaps I just don't have the same tastebuds as others. That said, I was there with a coworker who had the exact same experience, burgers, fries, sodas and all. The only "premium" thing about these burgers is the price. I think I'll just wait for Habit to open.

Wish I could post a negative review :(  I have left several messages trying to schedule a pedicure.  No one has returned my call. I have visited the salon before and had a positive experience; not sure what happened.  Obviously, taking my business elsewhere.

Simply put the service was bad. Guy at the register was not welcoming and not helpful with prices and such. Once we paid for our ice cream the girl who helped us wasn't nice at all. Felt rushed and there wasn't even anyone else waiting to get ice cream. 
The ice cream was worse. Tasted chewy and the flavors were off. The mint tasted like gum. Also I found a hair on the almond flavored one. Probably from the girl helping us as she had her hair loosely tied.
No Stars the worst customer service I have ever dealt with the worst I don't care what their food would taste like the customer service was so bad I will never eat there again.

really disappointed.   Lobster bisque was missing the lobster.  Not one morsel.   Prime Rib sandwich was more like sliced roast beef.   chicken sandwich was OK.  We would have ordered another round of drinks but did not see the waitress.  By the time she came we were past the point of wanting another round.   Hostess friendly.

Sign outside of door advertising $5 margaritas for cinco de mayo. Get the bill and was charged $10 for a margarita. The server got the manager who stated "That is only if you have a wristband for the bar crawl and only after 4pm." I walked with the manager to the sign where it gave no indication of a bar crawl or only after 4pm. The manager would not honor the $5 margarita and walked away in the middle of talking to me. I will 100% not be going back, as they were false advertising to get people in to the bar and then rude when asked about it.

I've had Taco bus for lunch a few times in the past and decided to try out some of their seafood options. I ordered a shrimp quesadilla and was excited to give it a try. When I opened my styrofoam container I was shocked and appalled! The quesadilla was soggy, wet and disgusting! I could not eat it and didn't have enough time to return it. A waste of $10. I just picked out the shrimp and that was lunch!

We rolled in right at 9:00pm after catching a movie at the mall with the kids and were seated immediately. It was pretty much downhill from there. 

Essentially our waitress was more concerned with closing than serving our family (my wife and two boys). We had to flag her down three different times and had to request service from another waitress near by to get refills on drinks (we only had one refill through our entire meal/experience). 

There was another family a table over that was being served by the same waitress (the only other table in the entire section) and they were just as upset as we were because they were fussing about her the whole time as well (they were not exactly whispering about it when they left). 

Aside from the young lady leaving us flagging down ANYONE we could make eye contact with for basic service, the rest of the experience was on par with Copeland's. The food was tasty and prompt, despite the other complaints, she delivered the food in a timely manner. 

In closing, We had a bad experience solely due to service. I expressed my dissatisfaction on the receipt but tipped as normal because we don't believe in messing with anyone's money even if they fell short or had a bad bight.
Just awful food, takes forever. Bartenders are cool though if you're just going to drink.
DONT DO ANY BUSINESS WITH THESE PEOPLE! No one works in service, sales feeds you a tons of lies for a sale and the GM will avoid you by all costs.

I have never had an issue with Panda Express until this visit. The staff lacks majorly in the communication department- Josh (the man who served us) was very rude and unprofessional, and he even argued with other employees with customers all around. He got many customers orders wrong, which I understand every once in a while, but seeing multiple orders wrong in one 30 minute visit is a little concerning. When we initially walked in, we waited 8 minutes to be served with only one customer ahead of us. Then after our food was made, I stood at the register waiting for 5 minutes just to pay. When we asked to pay, he became very agitated and hastily said sure. It made my boyfriend and I very uncomfortable and we will definitely not be returning. Also, my orange chicken had a strange gray spot and tasted off. Maybe come to this location for entertainment, but definitely not food.

This morning, 9/17/2018 at about 8:40 am, I visited this sorry excuse for a restaurant.  They have lousy service with NO counter help.  There was a line of 4 people behind me waiting.  When I was finally waited on, the counter-help person didn't even complete the checkout.  She simply walked away.  The manager on duty finally saw the line, completed my order and waited on the other people in line.  The counter-help person went back to mopping the floors.

This is not the first time this has happened, I have witnessed people simply giving up while waiting for someone to take their order and have walked out.

This restaurant should be concerned with their poor quality of service and the lack of revenue if this practice keeps up.

I, for one, will not be giving this restaurant any more of my money.

Rick F.

Still waiting for our pizza it's been over 2 hours. Ordered through grub hub, so ALL they had to do was make them pizza. Called multiple times and hung up on. They told us now they can't find our ticket. After two hours. Voodoo is going on, which we understand produces delays, but we are so sleepy and hungry. Absolutely absurd. Really poor customer service.

I went into this store for the first time last week. I paid $120 for a cute top. I was shopping online the next week and came across the same shirt for $89 from the brand's website!!! This place marks up clothing so much it's ridiculous. I won't be back.

These guys really suck! The manager is rude to the extreme. They had a deal that they would give out free cheesesteaks to ticket holders whenever the Penn Basketball team scored 100 points or more. They reneged when the team beat Stockton State 112-63 earlier, despite a banner prominently advertisting the promotion. The manager threw quite a rant about the whole thing.

Be very skeptical of these people.

I have been a customer for probably 15 years or so. I recently upgraded to a new iphone. I was scammed into buying an additional iphone for only an extra "$30" a month. I was told this was their "buy one get one free" promotion.  There was no promotion whatsoever! Not 1,but 2, different employees( 1 cheeseball named Benjamin) assured me my bill would only go up an extra "$30", it most certainly did go up $30 plus an additional $45 a month! I have tried and called to talk to a manager and nobody seems to care one bit! Typical crappy customer service that most companies give these days because they can!

Do not recommend the pulled pork bbq sandwich. It seemed to be unseasoned pork with some bbq sauce on it and was disappointing to find in a place called "The Bar-B-Que Place".
Atmosphere and service were good. Staff was pleasant. Surroundings were pleasant. Fried cheese fritters were good. If you are looking for good bbq, look elsewhere.

If you're into really salty over cooked wings then this is the place for you! I guess when you're swilling Bud Light by the pitcher with your bros it doesn't matter that every wing sauce they have is salty AF. I'm sure that's the point. So many better places to get quality pub grub and beer in the area to return to BWW.

Disappointed. Took 30 mins to get my food. And theres only 2 other guests here. Prices online did not match the prices on their menu. They are WAY too over priced here. I got the crab salad roll and was going to order the green tea cheesecake but its almost $7 just for one slice.... the crab salad roll was good but not worth the wait or price. They need to improve wait time, prices need to match and they should re-evaluate menu pricing. Not exactly 5 star dining restaurant therefore it shouldnt be hollywood prices...
Their food is the saltiest from soup and entrees to crab rangoons.... I would stick with Cate Zone or King Doh.

I'm here right now as I'm writing this review. Food was good but the server (Samuel H ) was NOT GOOD at all!!first we waited for 15 min just to put in our order then he doesn't welcome us properly till the second time he came that he finally introduced himself. After that I never saw him again he never came to check if we needed anything for we like our food NOTHING!!!! But SAMUEL was checking on all the other tables around him checking if they needed anything and ignoring us. I had to tell my busser for refills and to bring my check and had a female busser to charge my card. I don't know if he maybe doesn't like Latinos but ( sorry he just now came to ask if we needed anything else after someone else took care of us. What a joke!!!) so yeah never coming back again. Just because of the server Samuel H. thank you for making my family vacation one that I will never forget.

Went in to experience their Sunday brunch. It was all downhill from there.

When we arrived, we were told to sit anywhere we pleased. Nobody ever came to ask for our order. I had to go over to the bar to put it in. That person said I should let someone else know. When I spoke to the second person, she passed the information back to the first (same person at bar I had just spoken to). Supposedly, the first person did not notice when I entered the establishment. However, the beverages requested in my ordered were served in a reasonable timeframe.

When we got to the buffet, there were plastic utensils, along with normal plates. This eventually changed to plastic plates over the course of the visit.

One key item was missing from the buffet: scrambled eggs. Everything indicated it was there, even at the buffet itself. However, no scrambled eggs were to be found. My dining mate asked the person who brought out the food for scrambled eggs, and they were never brought out. The rest of the buffet food was eggs benedict, shrimp grits, bacon, sausage, French toast, pancakes, breakfast potatoes (home fries), yogurt, cheesesteak, two kinds of mac and cheese, and soft pretzels.

The best part of my meal was the orange juice.

When we got the check, it turned out that Bootleggers adds in a gratuity for the buffet in the neighborhood of 25 percent, no matter what the size of your party is.

The people at the table beside us asked for the manager, who defended the lack of eggs by saying people had to ask for them. One of the people cited asking the cook who said that there were no eggs for the day. (Remember my earlier comment about their never coming out when my dining mate inquired?) The manager then mentioned that the people should have complained earlier, saying that they had waited until they had finished eating to complain. However, she then offered a round of drinks to the table, which the people refused. There was no offer whatsoever to lower the bill. Rude manager and poor customer service.

I could never recommend anyone visit this establishment.

I gave them one star because 0 was not available. I ordered tires for my Jeep 2 months ago. Curt I believe the salesman's name was. At the time he said he would call when they came in, should be about 4 days. After a week I called him and he said "they are on backorder, I'll call Cooper and see how long they will be and call you back". Well that was 2 months ago. I'm starting to think they don't want to sell me tires.

Waited for 45m after ordering brunch. It was not busy and at least 3 tables that were sat after us received their food. Brought us another table's check 10 minutes into our wait. Brought us 1 drink after we ordered 3. It was illegitimate chaos...walked out after paying for 1 drink and coffee (which should have been free). Complete joke.

I was here last weekend and have been coming to this Starbucks for years now. The quality of the drinks, the building upkeep, and staff has gone extremely sour. The building is covered in weeds and just looks kind of abandoned. My drink had to be made almost 3x because it was made wrong (all I asked for was a French vanilla latte). First I received an iced coffee, then a regular latte, and finally he opened the window told me the price of my latte (which was way less than usual) so I double checked and said "that is for the French vanilla latte, correct?" The response that I received was "OHH, you wanted a French vanilla latte??". At that point I said "never mind" and then received an "OH MY GOD, really?!?!" as funny as it sounds, it was not funny when I was waiting in line for so long for a coffee. Maybe if I was in a better mood that day I would have taken it lighter but I still feel as though this whole situation could have been handled better.

I had a bedroom set delivered and two of the pieces has slight damage. They sent out a repairman who damaged the chest so bad, it had to be replaced. He also used spray paint to cover two white seams going down the sides of the chest and used no protection from over spray and now I have two 6 inch by 4 foot strips of over spray on my wall and baseboards as well as on a floor lamp. It has been two weeks since this damaged occurred and still no solution to the problem. Art Van is dragging their feet with this issue. They offered to send out their handyman but I will not allow them to send another person into my home to damage it further. I have sent in a bid from my own qualified painter and they haven't responded. Terrible customer service. Do not buy from this company.

Extremely disappointed.  The sushi was blah.  No flavor, just slapped together and falling apart. Service was awkward and food was slow.  Our daughter had to wait for her kids meal to come out for 15 minutes after the rest of the food arrived.  Will never go back.  Overpriced and overrated.  I've had better from national chains that prepare pre-cooked meals from frozen in microwaves.

. When presented with our drinks we were given no straws to drink out of our glasses. I order French onion which was ok and a burger that was alright my girlfriend however got a chicken wrap with instead of ranch Cesar when she ate it the dressing tasted so weird we couldn't determine if it was ranch or Cesar because of it's weird taste then once we got home she threw up and got sick. Definitely do not recommend this place.

By far, the worst Indian restaurant I've ever eaten at. In general, I like Indian food. I went with my family during the weekend for the lunch buffet only to be completely disappointed. To start with, there was no good food options. Yes, at a "buffet." There were rices and sides but no good options if you eat meat.  They had Tandoori chicken...but...the first piece I got was colorful outside and completely raw inside (rare if we would be talking about a steak). The second piece I tried was blah, no flavor. Another meat option was a butter chicken but was also dry and with lack of flavor. They kept filling up the trays with veggies and rices but no real options to taste. I was there waiting for about 45 minutes but the meat dishes never came out.   I have eaten several times at Indian restaurants for both buffet and ordering from regular menu with fantastic options. How does Haveli ought to call this a lunch buffet when there's no food?! Unbelievable. It was probably 12:30pm when I was there so it was a good time to get lunch, no excuses to not have food. I was hungry when I left. One thing is being cheap but this was an extreme. I will not go back, for sure.

The management is terrible! We were told 1/2 hour wait, then told the waiter went on break and we would be seated soon. Then, another 25 minutes we were told that there was a large party that came first so after they ordered we would be seated. Then we're told that members of some "club" get seated before noon club members.... yeah we left. What absolutely lousy treatment of customers.  Do not go to Bubba Gump in New Orleans

The food was horribly cooked!The rice was burnt! And the chicken was very dry! It was not an appetizing experience! Our food had no taste to it and it was overall unpleasant. I do not recommend this place and especially their food delivery qualities! I would never order from here ever again.

Yet another business that will close in Smyrna due to lack of leadership. Got a burrito,  half chicken,  half steak... Chicken cold,  steak lukewarm. 

Lackluster burrito.  I would have been better at taco bell.

Terrible.   There are no other words to describe this restaurant.


My chicken curry looked, smelled, and tasted like it came from the bathroom toilet.

Customer Please Read!!! 
This has been my go to place for years when it comes to my oil change and car wash. 
Sad to say no longer. 
On March 13,  2018 at 11:54 am our car care relationship ended. The next morning when I walked to the passenger side I had a dent. I called the manager on duty. Reported the problem to him. He told me he would review the cameras. When I took my Terrain for him to look at he stated he look at the cameras and there was no way it happened there. He then ask me if I got it washed there? I told him yes.  He turns around and tell me I thought you said it wasn't washed here. I stop talking and just looked him. From that question he let me know he never reviewed the cameras nor did he look up my receipt. Which I gave him all information when I called.
Once he seen my face change. He stated he had 18 cameras. That's a lot of work to go through. He told me because it was private property I would need to file a report with the sheriff office. 
I let him know I know it happened there because after there I went home to my driveway then to work. At my job my Terrain is on camera parked alone my entire shift. I also told him this was also the very first time they didn't come in to try to sell me something that needed to be corrected on my car from their inspection they normally do. I knew they would try to sell me windshield wipers because mines had the rubber part that badly needed to be replaced. Manager tells me oh the computer automatically fills that in. Me...Oh really?? 
I was a loyal customer. All I want is this dent out. That's all. Next letter to BBB.

A few of my mirrors were also broken. I notice that everyone else who reviewed this company gave it five stars so perhaps I wasn't treated the same as them. Also I assume that most people don't have a lot of mirrors to move. I was impressed by the guy who spoke to me before I had the actual move done as he is from Kentucky and expected him to show up. When I told him that we would finally meet he never told me that he wouldn't show up. When the two movers showed up I was terribly disappointed as I expected to meet him. I like to deal with anyone who I like over the phone. Apparently I am the only person who wasn't satisfied with my service but when the truck needed a jump that held up everything. I realize that setbacks might occur but I thought that it should have been avoided. Nothing was on schedule and the guys weren't apologetic although they weren't rude either. Young people usually don't behave responsibly as we did when I grew up.

Absolutely horrible service! We waited over an hour for multiple people (same size groups) were seated before us. The hostess is certainly not trained in customer service and does not know how to do her job! I rarely write reviews like this but it was very necessary in this case. We come to St Pete Beach often and we will never try Snappers again after such a horrible experience. The hostess's nonchalant attitude was the worst part. No apology they could care less. This represents the worst customer service and we won't be returning

Over rated!!! What a sham they call them-self the best dumping and egg rolls!! I think how they got so many good review was to hand out a little yellow voucher for a "come back free meal" if you give them a review!! I am just not that kind of people looking for bad free meals. 

Truffle fries are good and always good(else where)!
Fried dumplings are unique with unusual filling but not like heavenly good, and be honest the fillings were dry and tasteless and the skin was so thick! A good dumpling should have very thin skin just like those Michelin star restaurants.

The mac n cheese spring roll was the worst, dry and no flavor and heavy, had a bite and wasted the rest. 

I ordered the sampler platter which comes with 5 dry dumpling+the mac n cheese roll+truffle fries, paid with card and cost me $19. For that price i am looking for something heavenly delicious!! But i am sorry you guys are good at marketing but not cook! Any asian restaurants server better fried dumpling for cheaper price.

be wary of drunk bartenders. both on and off duty. delilia or delia i think her name is, is kind of a loud-mouthed skank when drunk and just obnoxious as can be when not. they all over serve and pour way too heavy. a friend of mine had to be carried out of the bar last weekend. seems to be all about their tips and pushing the expensive hard liquor and shots. definitely not a nice place to take a date or a family.

The service was very slow and nobody's food at the table was warm and they sat as at a table and the wrong server came and took our order and then the correct server came and we had to completely reorder and did I mention that our have no flavor or warmth. Sry for a bad review.
Pat is the worse server ever!  Sat down and he had an attitude from the get go.    Said  "Im busy".....  this was my first time there... and will be my last.

Terrible service and the food yuck!

I ordered the Asian Delight for $12.95 tax was added later.  The meal was drowned in runny and watery red sauce.  Overwhelmed with sugar!  So, I contacted the restaurant to request a different meal; they became out raged and began talking in a foreign Asian language. As I waited on the phone and listened in disbelief, they tried to force me to keep the food.  They were very rude and not receptive to the fact that I could not eat that sugary soupy food mix. I attempted to be reasonable and asked for a refund or either another meal.  The owners kept arguing amongst themselves, I couldn't understand it.  Finally, I couldn't take it anymore and just told them either replace the meal or give me a refund.  They agreed to finally give me a refund and allowed me to change the meal.  About an hour later they decided to deliver the food to my hotel.  Needless to say, I took my money and will not use them ever again!
Horrible service from DEVON.  Employee 507259.  Basically said he's a "know it all bc he's a cashier."
Place is smoked filled and staff is rude. Food is decent but not great. Some of the people there are nice while others are quite rude. Bathrooms are dirty and stink

Worst pizza I've ever had !!! Like cardboard, hard and crispy, served on a tin like frozen grocery pizza- didn't open box till we got home . Buyer beware!!! Check your merchandise before you leave.  It was so bad, we ordered another one from a different company - a waste of 16$. Will not return :(

We had family come down and wanted to go out for brunch their last day in town. We researched and found that Casa Blanca had endless mimosas, brunch and menudo. We bring our family and find out the menu described online is an old special they had. So their online menu is not updated, they don't offer brunch, don't have endless mimosas or menudo. Had we known before sitting down, we would have found a different restaurant. Now what we did order, actually still wasn't great.

It's probably not every location, but this one has the worst service I've seen at any place I've ever been to. I have two stories to tell about this place. 

First story: A few friends and I were driving by and decided to walk in to order a pizza, and when we walked in we were all greeted and told that somebody would be with us shortly, so of course, we waited patiently. After about 15 minutes, nobody had bothered to help us, even though everybody working had repeatedly glanced over at us throughout the 15 minutes we had been waiting there. I went to the corner of the counter and looked around the corner, and two employees were standing there on their phones, not doing anything. We waited for a total of 25 minutes at the counter before we were disgusted with the employees and the "service" they weren't providing, so we didn't say a word and just left the store. 

ADVICE: Never walk in to place an order. Put it in online, and at most do carry out.

Second story: This was only a week or so ago. I ordered a pizza online to be delivered to my work. I'm not sure if you're familiar with the layout of the Domino's app, but when you're placing an order for delivery, it has you select what type of place you're delivering it to (Household, Business, etc.). I selected business, put my business's name, and the business's address... the two things they have you fill out. After being out for delivery for about 25 minutes (it's only 5 minutes away from my work), an employee named David came in and was extremely rude. He walked in, asked if I had ordered the pizza, and said something along the lines of "Next time you should put your business's name on it so I know where to go, because you made it really hard for me. It was a waste of my time for me to drive around that long just because you didn't bother to put it on the receipt." This fired me up, so I proved to him on my email receipt that I had put the name and address. His only comment to me after that was "Well look at what I have. See, it doesn't say it here." and I tried to explain that I don't make the receipts given to him. After everything, I still tipped him... and he just took it and walked out the front doors.

This was a BAD  first choice hotel coming in to the French Quarter Festival from out of state.

When walking into the hotel the lady behind the counter said sorry about your luck when reservation was canceled by a third party and hotel staff couldn't care less since there were no available rooms.

The staff was not helpful at all and didn't offer to call or offer hotel suggestions. I will say an associate said talk to this guy at another hotel down the street and pretended they had rooms, but after 8blocks found out they didn't.

Finally found room at International Hotel on Camp street. Prices are reasonable and staff was amazing and professional. I suggest to stay away from B on Canal as they just want to make a buck.

I wish I could write a positive review of this dentist, as he came into the beautifully appointed waiting room to greet me, a first-time customer, then sat down with me to discuss my general oral health prior to conducting an examination. The staff were also very pleasant. However, despite their welcoming demeanor, I had an uneasy feeling about this clinic from the start, as when I initially called to book an appointment, they told me that my brand new insurance was co-insurance, and that I would therefore have to check with my employer as to who the secondary insurer was. This turned out to be completely erroneous, as when I asked my human resources department about it, I confirmed that, as I'd thought, there was only one insurer providing coverage. My employer warned me to beware of this dentist and in fact advised me to go to another. But after having spent close to an hour on the phone trying to set up an appointment for a cleaning, I decided to proceed, and I booked a comprehensive set of X-rays prior to the cleaning, a preventive service that my insurance completely covered. 
I am sorry I did. 
When I arrived, I spent 20 minutes filling out a sheaf of paperwork, all of it essentially attesting to my responsibility for payment should my insurance not cover the procedure. I signed the paperwork but stated that, should the dentist recommend any procedure not covered by my insurance, I wanted to be informed of it first. I then had the X-rays.
The digital X-ray machine was not working that day, so only bite-wing X-rays could be taken, I was told, and the hygienist had to take two X-rays of one side, as she bungled the first. I asked if, upon my next visit, the remaining X-rays would be covered by my insurance, since they were supposed to have been included in the first visit, and she said yes. However, before I checked out of the office, I was asked to sign yet another paper stating my financial responsibility should my insurer not pay, only this one didn't have anything on it other than a place for my signature. I asked what I was signing and was told that it was standard procedure. The staff's attitude by this point was still pleasant and welcoming but decidedly intent on getting me to sign the form, which I now believe may have been a permission form for the dentist to perform services beyond those covered by my insurance upon my return visit for the cleaning. Since I was running late and because I felt pressured to do so, I reluctantly signed the form, but re-stated my position that I did not want to undergo any services not covered by my insurance. I then asked the hygienist for the third time for the sample of sensitive toothpaste Dr. Davis had recommended during the exam, but she told me that instead of the brand he had mentioned, all they had was an OTC sample -- a brand I could buy at any pharmacy for a dollar. She asked if I instead wanted to buy the brand the doctor had recommended--at $17 a tube -- and when I answered that I did not, she reluctantly handed me the OTC sample. 
Three days later, I received a call from the office staff telling me that my scheduled cleaning would not be covered by my insurance because I needed a so-called "extended" cleaning, rather than the basic cleaning I had originally scheduled. When I explained that this is not what I wanted, the staff member, Stephanie, insisted that because Dr. Davis had "diagnosed" me as needing this extended procedure (note that I had asked Dr. Davis during the exam to rate the health of my teeth on a scale of one to ten, with ten being the best, and he had told me they rated 8.5), I would have to pay $99 out of pocket. It was only after I strongly objected that she agreed to revisit the matter with Dr. Davis.
Later that day, I received another call from Stephanie, who, to my astonishment, repeated Dr. Davis's position that I must have the extended cleaning. I then asked if the basic part of the procedure could be covered by my insurance while I picked up the difference. However, Stephanie said that in addition to charging me $99, the office would also be charging my insurance another $95 for the basic service! At this point, I knew that I should have listened to my gut and to my HR office, as it was clear that they were attempting to double bill me. 
If I weren't so disgusted, I'd have to laugh, as not only was their mercenary focus obvious from the start, but their price, $95 for a basic cleaning (I only paid $75 in California, one of the most expensive markets in the country), was already outrageous. Not only that, but as a first-time patient, you'd think they might have offered me a special deal--maybe that tube of toothpaste (?)--as an incentive. 
Long story short, I told Stephanie that I would not be in for the cleaning or any other service from Dr. Davis, requested that she ensure my insurance not be billed for a comprehensive set of X-rays, had her send those X-rays to me, and filed a grievance with my insurer.

Started with Oysters that were not cold or cleaned well.  A margarita made with cheap mix... not sure how you can mess up a margarita.  Crab cake was the only good thing because the calamari tasted like they had been done in Old grease.. we didn't go any further because we feel if you can't get the appetizers right why would We spend more money.  Not a repeat place and a big disappointment....

Would love to give zero stars. They had their doors locked by 5:20. Looked at me outside and didn't even bother to come to the door. Not worth my time or money especially since you have to find parking.

I have used this post office for years and found it to be about par with the rest of them. That is until I rented a post office box in December 2017 for business purposes. I was quite suspect at the lack of business mail arriving in the box and that I continued to receive mail addressed to other businesses and other persons. March 1st I sent out thousands of dollars in invoices to customers, many of which were "paid that day" but I never received. One by one the customers began to tell me that I had given them the wrong address. One customer mailed me the returned payment envelope which had official usps stickers on it stating that the envelope could not be delivered to that box since that business (MY BUSINESS) was not authorized. Yet I continue to receive junk mail for the other 'businesses" that used to have the box!
I brought the envelope into the post office and informed the clerk of my concern. After about ten minutes she returned and said my business name was listed correctly on my application but NOT on the box itself so the clerks that "actually pay attention" will not place the mail into the box. Those that don't will put ANYTHING with that address in the box. WHAT!?!?
What have I been paying for the last 3 months?
If you have a business and NEED to receive payments via snail mail, DO NOT USE THIS POST OFFICE!!!

Came into town on a Friday night for my bachelorette party weekend. Our hotel was near this particular Willie's Chicken shack so we decided to stop in. I have been to other Willie's on Bourbon and the chicken was amazing, however, this Willie's on Canal, not so much! First, we encountered the RUDE lady at the register. We had a large party so all of us fitting in was challenging. She apparently was aggravated, and insisted that we "move out of the way!" When I explained to her that we are all together and it was difficult for us to move since the restaurant is so small, she insisted again "well y'all need to move, we have other registers!" I was appalled to say the least! Now on to the food...so we ordered chicken and side of red beans and rice. The chicken was over cooked, almost burned and the red beans and rice were flavorless and not fresh.  I was very disappointed in the service and the food. Needless to say, I will not be returning nor will I recommend. I gave it 2 stars because the other lady at one of the other registers was very nice and accommodating. I wish I had of looked for the names however I did not.

I came here after a movie with my friend because it was the only nail salon that was still open. I decided I was going to get a pedicure and they sat me down in one of their chairs. The chair was already filled out water which made me wonder if someone had previously used it. I put my feet into the water like the nail lady said and the water was cold and from my last pedicure experiences I knew that the water was not supposed to be cold. I had on some toe nail polish hat I did myself and she started to remove it. She was doing fine until I noticed that she wasn't taking the time to get it all off. I was confused but I thought that she might remove the rest of it before she started painting my toes. She continued on with the regular pedicure routine which was fine. But then when she got to paining them she never took the rest of the nail polish off and then she put the base coat on. She didn't even wait for the base coat to dry before putting the color on. Then she went to put the color on my toes and it was going fine but then I noticed she wasn't getting into the sides of my nails and she was only doing the middle of my nail. So my old nail polish was showing and the new polish that she was putting on wasn't even covering all of my nail. She left to go get a tool and then I looked at my nails and they were painted poorly. My cuticles were flooded with polish, my full nail wasn't even covered with polish and the strokes were uneven and the polish wasn't straight at the top and the line was jagged. She toke some nail polish remover and tried to get some of it off my skin but she only did one nail and it was still all over all my other cuticles and skin too. She then put the top coat on and I could feel it going on to my skin and all my nails looked terrible! I looked at my friends nails and they were sheer with not enough coats and the nail polish was all over her cuticles too! She said that she would never go there again and I agree. The price is not worth the quality and the performance of the nail lady.

The Cuban restaurant. 
Giraldilla on Hanley Tampa FL
Service was horrible 
Food raw chicken pork 
Plantains horrible 
I feel sick to my stomach 
No manager on duty to complain. The worst restaurant I have ever been in my life. They should closed the place 
Dirty place 
Uncooked food
I feel poison
I want to sue this place.

Just came into your establishment, hostess acted like she wanted to be anywhere but there judging by her attitude. I sat for 8 mins without an acknowledgment, nothing. It was not busy at all. Guess no one wants to make money on a Saturday afternoon! So, I left. Solid 1 Star. Your food is good but, customer service at this location has always been piss poor. I'll go to the Magazine location from now on.
horrible service kicks us out for buying food outrageous ageism against teens furious at this mcdonalds. love alex watkins great guy and employee

Don't bother, the food is extremely forgettable. We went to try their wings since "wings" are in their name, but they were extremely average, something along the lines of what you'd get at a dive bar that happens to serve some food, not even close to what I'd expect from a place that specializes in it.

The staff was nice and the service was good, but with the food so mediocre and it's not inexpensive either, we won't return.

Wondering what passes for decent pizza around here that this place has all these stars. We got a XL large pepperoni and ham pizza and it was subpar. A family of 4 got 2 slices each and it was gone. Crust is cardboard, sauce is average, and the ham was diced into such little specs that at first I thought they had missed it. If you are in the area it was fine, but don't go out of your way for it is my recommendation.

Don't bother ordering here, though the food and coffee is nice they have a terrible management. Called in and Ordered some Burritos and coffee and when I got there, they don't even have the order in their system and took like ever to give me the breakfast. They took like half hour just got get me 2 caramel latte's which I call them and ordered on phone like an hour back so frustrating

We wanted to give a local neighborhood restaurant a chance. We ordered the smoked salmon salad salad and the avocado salad without chicken (forgot the name. ). We also ordered a side of crackers because that did not come with the salad. The crackers were completely stale and very salty. They brought us fresh crackers which were crispy, but also very salty. The salads have yogurt-based dressing, which in itself is fine, but there was absolutely no flavor whatsoever to the salad dressing. The smoked chicken had smoke flavor but also had no seasoning of any other kind. Really a boring salad. The portions were plentiful. The drink cups were very small and had to be refilled. Our waitress brought a warm Diet Coke and then later asked if we wanted a cup of ice with it. Probably won't be coming back.

You know how when you go to Dunkin' Donuts and you ask for a little bit of cream or a little bit of sugar, they put WAY too much in there? Yeah, well that's this place. I got drinks there two days in a row, first day I ordered iced black coffee, they put about 5 pumps of vanilla and sugar into it - totally sucked. Then the next day I got cold brew coffee with LIGHT sweet cream. It looked like a cup or cream with a splash of coffee. It's a shame too, because their cold brew is good. Idk why they feel the need to dump a gallon of full fat cream into it. This place also runs out of almost every breakfast item daily. Do yourself a favor and skip this place! BOO!!

This rating is for the car wash only. The car wash is TERRIBLE... for one, the soap hoses are always broken so you never really get the foam bath, etc. The "spot free rinse" is hardly spot free. If you don't immediately go and hand dry your car, it will look terrible with all water spots. And the car dryer never actually drys your car.

Disappointed. I wish the city or whoever regulates this would only allow local artists and crafters to set up here. Way too much touristy crap. I don't need/want knock off sunglasses, cheap bags or tee shirts. Would love locally crafted items. I hope I see a shift to this when I return. On the plus side the seatless toilets were clean!

I'm disappointed every time I go to this place. I wanted to like it, I've tried multiple times thinking it would get better, but no. There may be positive aspects of this place that I don't know, I'll just cover the problems I've had so far.

1) I was overcharged on my first visit. I had to go back through all the items myself to figure out what went wrong. There didn't seem to be an easy way to refund my money so I had to accept an additional item. Not the end of the world but not a good first experience, customer service was definitely lacking.

2) High pressure to tipping. This place uses a few high pressure tipping strategies, seems weird considering its just a juice bar in Delaware. I self served some juices from the refrigerator at the front, when I paid with my card I was prompted on the screen to leave a 10,15,or 20% tip, the cashier kept asking me to make a selection. Granted, there is probably a way to not leave a tip on the screen but you shouldn't even be prompted on self serve items. Additionally, they have a tip container at the register, I get that, makes sense. The weird part is, they keep the container filled with a large amount of cash, obviously indicating that you should leave a large cash tip (because everyone else is right?) I was there first thing in the morning and there was a full container of cash, obviously it's part of the strategy. Wouldn't be as much of an issue if the service wasn't so bad.   

3) The customer service is bad, feels unwelcoming, buying something seems like a hardship. Granted, I've only dealt with the person who's always working the cash register, but from my experience, other reviews, and talking to people I know - this is a major issue.    

4) No nutritional information. There is no nutritional information labels on any of the pre made items. There are calorie numbers on the website only for smoothies and bowls, but still not a full nutritional breakdown. Considering this place is supposed to be "healthy" I would like to know the exact information for any of the items I buy. 

5) Consistency. There is no consistency at this place. I've bought toast 3 times, one was good, the other two were so bad I threw them out. I've also bought jucies that have been completely different on separate occasions. I had a charcoal lemonade the other day (probably the 4th one I've had so far) and it was so thick with charcoal I had to throw it out. You never know what you're going to get here. Ill include some pictures of the toasts. The owner drank a sample of one of the juices while I was there and said something along the lines of "this wasn't made right".

6) Online ordering. The online ordering app doesn't include the pre made juices, so you have to do a separate transition when you get to the store.  The app also gives to 0 information about what you are ordering, no description or anything, you either have to know what you want already, or bounce back and forth from the website to the app. Of the 4 orders I have picked up, only 1 was on time.

7) Price. Considering all the downfalls, the low quality and bad service does not justify the high prices.


Overall this wasn't just a bad experience, it's constiant bad service and low quailty. If this place doesn't make some major changes it won't last once people are past the "excitement" of a new store. No one wants to spend $6.50 on toast they have to throw out, or $9 on juice they can't drink.

Came here once for a dinner with friends. They had a price advertised on the board outside for one of their specials that my friends and I wanted to get. We were apparently a few minutes too late as they would not honor that price. They also took incredibly long to get us our food despite us being one of two seated tables in the entire place. We watched as countless orders of to go were placed and filled while we sat hungry and annoyed. When we confronted the staff about it they just apologized and said things take a while there. Honestly the food was decent but not good enough to overcome the horrible service. I'm usually pretty understanding but this experience was just bizarre. I just can't wrap my head around making to go orders and sending them out while you have people sitting in your restaurant waiting for food.

Our room smelled like mildew / mold, and the pillows were awful. The bed was comfortable, but the lumpy pillows were just so brutal that they ruined our nights sleep. We paid extra to be in the main building so our view wasn't of the main building and the side road, but instead our view was just of another building and a different road. I asked specifically if our view would be facing the ocean, before I paid the extra money. That was a bummer and a waste of money. There were a few positives worth mentioning, though not enough to ever stay here again: The staff were friendly, every single one of them that we met. The pool was well maintained and had a nice ambiance at night. The music over the outdoor speakers added to that nice ambiance as well. The hotel would be nice to visit, but I wouldn't want to stay overnight again.

This is why I will never be back 
1.  Called and was told I would be seated right away. Got here and waited 20 minutes. 
2. Once seated, waited 10 minutes before my husband had to flag someone down. 
3. Meanwhile a table was sat and was greeted within seconds. 
4. Communication was blamed but when greeted the server actually seemed annoyed. 
5.  One of the runners dropped off Food and asked how we were and when we said not really. Didn't seem to care, why ask. 
6. Food is taking a really long time. Table next me already done. 
7. Finally called a manager. 
8. My Brussels were burned. Great! 
9. Okay, kudos to Angela who made things so much better!! 
Glad this night is done. :( happy Father's Day

When I first stopped by, I had a great experience with Charlie. He knew the product well and shared that information nicely. I returned a few weeks later to take another look because I was seriously considering the vehicle. Charlie was busy with another sale. Charlie passed me to Jim, which is not that uncommon. However, Charlie, in the 3+ hours I was there, maybe said 2 words to me. Jim was ok. Clearly he was not as comfortable but he was nice. My issue is with the final sales process. The presentation of the numbers, the inability to provide a solid monthly payment before moving to financing, the finance guy explained little, and lastly the tone, demeanor etc from Sales Management was very poor. 

After the sale, I received an email from Charlie asking me how I liked the vehicle. However, Charlie, in my eyes, did not sell me the vehicle. There was an accessory I was promised. Since Charlie did not sell me the vehicle, when I asked about it, he knew nothing. That is poor. After I discussed it with management, I had a time to show up and put it in. However, when I arrived at the scheduled time, the manager was not there and Jim did not know I was coming. 

I have purchased 4 new vehicles in the recent past. This experience was clearly below the others.

This place went downhill fast.  I have been going here for a long time, but the last delivery i got was terrible.  The mozzarella sticks have always been some of the best i have had, the last  ones were soggy and not fully cooked.

The buffalo fries were also soggy and not properly cooked, who wants soggy fries?  Also, the tool 1.5 hours to arrive.


This is a huge disappointment because they used to be go to for takeout food.  I don't know if they changed management, but this was very poor service. 

Shame on you Cosmi's, you used to be cool!

Very disappointed to find out my girl  is no longer there. My family lives in west Philly, and I live in jersey so the commute is extremely worth it for me. I was going to get my eyebrow wax at least but the eyebrow room was disgusting! Rat poop was everywhere behind the little corner, gross! Gross! Gross! Won't be coming back anymore .

Breakfast was not very good and overpriced. Service was slow and they forgot toast and didn't refresh coffee. Add to that the loud country music blaring overhead and it made for a pretty unpleasant experience.

What a disaster!  Based on other reviews and my son's former experiences I'm sure this was an off night for the restaurant but our first visit (6 of us for a birthday dinner) was a disaster.  We were informed by our waiter that food would be "slightly" slower than normal to come out.  In fact, our meals took an hour to arrive and when they did my wife's steak was cooked very rare, not the medium she ordered and mine was cold.  I don't mean it wasn't hot, it was COLD!  I've never had that happen before.  Anyway, half of us had to send our meals back to be redone, the other three got to eat while we waited.  Another hour later after continually being told "just a little longer", no meals!  They finally told us that there would be no charge and they would give us our food as take out.  We waited another 15 minutes for that.  Two and a half hours in this place and then three of us left without eating!  Crazy.  Our waiter was pretty embarrassed and apologetic but I didn't get the impression that the managers had any control over things.  While we waited we saw managers speaking with patrons at other tables; I can only guess dealing with similar issues.  They'd have been better letting us know right away that things were out of control and then we could have found somewhere else to enjoy a meal.  My suggestion for others is that if they tell you they're having trouble getting food out on time, leave.
You used to have way cooler stuff. Disappointing. I'm not impressed with the selection and for that price you're better off going somewhere else.

If I could give tonight's rating no stars I would. Horrible! Horrible service. My daughter placed an order at 8:00PM and the pizza tracker said the order was here at 9:20. We're waiting and waiting .... looking out the window ...standing by the door and nothing. I called 10 minutes later and was told that they were booked, the tracker was incorrect and to be patient .The driver Patrick was supposedly out delivering orders. Now, I live 6 minutes away , I don't drive and can't for the life of me understand why it's been over an hour since the driver was making deliveries and I still don't have my order. Who I'm assuming is the manager insulted us by offering to give us free bread as a consolation with our next order. Really? I spend $42.90 and that's the best he could say??? Anyway, my daughter called back to see what was going on at 11:20 PM and was told that the driver called but my daughter didn't pick up the phone ( which is an absolute lie)so the order was still sitting in the van and we could either wait another two hours for the next available driver , get a store credit , or have what I paid refunded back to my account. This place does not have to ever worry about me placing an order with them again. Ever!!!

Apple has failed me again!  I made an appointment with the geniuses at the local Apple store to fix a problem with my phone after downloading the new software update. The new update drains the battery in less than 20 minutes. When I explained this to my local genius, Heidi, her go to answer was, "I need a new battery." After checking the health of my battery this was not the issue. I explained that I've been having this problem only after downloading the new update. Heidi's reply, "that's not possible, it's the battery." I tried asking her some more questions regarding the update and she asked me "to stop interrupting her." I've been to this Apple store many times and Heidi was by far the least helpful and rudest person I have ever encountered at Apple. I think my time with Apple products is done. Upon problem after problem with the updates and now the rude costumer service, I'm seeing Apple does not fix problems nor do their employees offer any solutions.
Sick of such long lines. Hire more help and stop understaffing the place! I shouldn't have to wait 16 minutes for an iced coffee!

One of the worst experiences ive ever had at a food establishment. The wait is ridiculously long, and in fact as Im writing this review the clock has been ticking at 15 minutes. Typically i would've just gone away but I already paid, they gave me the wrong food and im just attempting to correct the issue. 

I will NEVER come back here!

Terrible service on their take out option via UberEats. I ordered 2 appetizers and 2 entrees. When the driver got here, only the appetizers were delivered. Called the restaurant and the lady said she would make the entrees but that I'd have to come get them as she couldn't pay the Uber driver. The driver was nice enough to go back at his cost to get the food and when he returned, only one of the entrees had been made. While I have enjoyed the food from the restaurant previously, I probably won't return to them after this experience.
Gross hotel, didn't even have rooms keys. Posted some pics instead of describing how shitty this place was. We didn't even stay, left after being there for 10 minutes.

THE STAFF WAS SUPER RUDE! 
They did not acknowledge our presence when we walked in... NEVER asked "can I help you?"
They basically never uttered one word. 
Except the price of my purchase and practically threw my bag at me. 
Gross really!!

I opened a savings and checking account at GNCU about 4 months ago, then I closed both accounts because of how terrible they are.  Primary reason for selecting GNCU was because of the Saturday hours.  Very sad.  A credit union is supposed to be a financial institution with the interest of the customers in mind but this one acts like a big bank concerned only with their financial gain by gouging its customers with astronomical fees combined with terrible customer service.  You will truly do better going to one of the big banks instead of doing business with GNCU.

     I was not receiving statements for my accounts and was advised it was because of a glitch in the system.
     When account was opened, I specified any transactions that exceeded available funds should be declined so the account will not be overdrawn.  However, my checking account was overdrawn by $26 as I lost track of balance by not receiving statements.  Asked how this could be and I was informed it was because of a glitch in their system.
     Then I was informed I was supposed to be charged a $35 fee for the overdraft but somehow my account was not charged that fee as a glitch in the system worked in my favor.  When I questioned the fee, I was lied to and advised that is a mandatory $35 fee required by federal regulation.
     While I was at the branch addressing the above, the teller appeared annoyed that I was interrupting her personal activities.  She had her purse, cell phone, a personal check and some other personal items on the counter.  While I was trying to make a deposit and determine why I was not receiving statements, she grabbed my ID and card with account number on it, left my money on the counter and walked away without saying anything.  Rude and most likely policy violation leaving money unattended and unsecured. I deposited $100 to rectify the negative $26.
     Subsequently deposited $700 then after a few days learned my debit card was no longer active.  Returned to the branch and was told it must have been a glitch in their system.  Asked to re-activate and was told  that could not be done and a new card would need to be ordered.
     Nevermind, the glitches in your system convinced me to close my accounts right then.  Good bye forever GNCU.

Horrible food. Horrible service. Don't waste your time here. We originally came for Brophy Bros next door, but the wait was an hour and a half and that wasn't going to be possible with a toddler. So we decided to come here. 

Food was bland, flavorless. I ordered the grilled lobster, it was rubbery and hard to cut. Vegetables on the side were not cooked, carrots we're raw and hard. Husband ordered the halabit, that was flavorless and the side slaw and rice was just plain nasty. We asked for lemon on the side, took about ten minutes to receive come to find it had pieces of wet napkin on it. Clam chowder was soupy, was not "award winning". 
Do yourself a favor and don't come here and wait the hour and a half at Brophy Bros. Giving it one star only for the location only.

The ambience is lovely and our server was very attentive and pleasant.  The dressing in the Caesar's salad was on the sour side and my steak was overdone. I asked for a little pink in the middle and it was cooked to a point of dryness.  Overseasoned also.  The fingerling potatoes were just okay--tasted like perfume; creamed spinach and cheese cake were good.  Maybe I was expecting more from this restaurant; it was just okay, not outstanding.

The location is probably the best part of the hotel. I would not stay at this location due to the customer service of this establishment!! I spoke with a representative to get room service and she was bothered by me placing an order! I asked what her name was due to her being super unfriendly. I then called back to guest services and asked to speak to a manager and lucky enough I got her and she wouldn't transfer me until I told her the reason why I needed to speak to manager which is very unprofessional. I then got across to the "manager" who then was very unhelpful and unapologetic. He then told me they didn't have an employee that goes by that name. Meaning the employee lied to me when asking her name. The manager stated he has been on duty and didn't think there has been any customer service issues. Basically nothing was solved but something so simple will make me never come back to this hotel. Customer service and a genuine apology goes a LONG way.

Oops. Uncle Bill's renege on buy 10 get 1 free.  Boo.  Now it is but 12 get 1 free.  Too bad a trusted brand like Uncle Bill's now is resorting to changing rewards programs without notice.  Anytime a company changes rewards programs is usually a result of increased competition.  If I had to guess pet people and pet smart are putting pressure on Uncle Bill's and in order to stop the financial loss, Uncle Bill's is changing the customer rewards program .

This particular Taco Bell will purposefully mess up your order out of what feels like spite, which is very strange and malicious coming from people I've otherwise never met. Last night I asked for a beefy five layer burrito with beans substituted for beef and I got a tortilla filled with only beef.... It wasn't even the item I ordered, just a whole lot of the only thing I didn't want. I know multiple other people who have had similar experiences. I can't comprehend the level of bitterness that comes with purposely sucking at your job.

Atmosphere is nice. menu is too small, in fact it is tiny. Food is average, I have had much better steaks at Texas Roadhouse at a fraction of the cost. Overpaid for a dry aged ribeye, which was very dry and chewy. Neither myself or my friend were impressed the slightest. Really at a loss to understand why this restaurant is rated so high. I guess you are paying a premium so that you can say "we ate at Elmo's".  I Will never recommend to anyone for any reason.  Ps... the navy bean soup was quite good. Also toilet flooded into dining area as we were seated next to restrooms, causing another customer to nearly slip.

Their sandwiches are hardly worth the shitty attitude of the owner and servers. I once called for pick up a half hour before they close (which is rather earlier for a place that only serves lunch) and they said it was too close to closing time. They honestly just could not be bothered to make a sandwich, when they're a deli and sandwich shop? Serious go to philly's phamous or Rich's deli instead. I don't even know how they stay open? Which I guess is the joke of it all because they're hardly ever open. It's been suggested to be a front. They also boot and tow cars constantly. They're just generally pretty shitty people, and pretty shitty for the community and make pretty mediocre sandwiches. Some people like their veggie wraps? But why go to a deli for a veggie wrap? Save yourself the trouble and just don't go there. 
I also have a friend in the area who has noted they have a serious vermin issue which isn't surprising consider the shape of that shop.

My friend and I had a long day and decided to go over to this Winery, we had been before and it was great. We had privacy and enjoyed eachother company and the wine was fantastic. 
When we walk up we see a lady sitting on the porch, thought she was just a guest, she didn't greet us so we assumed she wasn't an employee. We walk in and no one was inside. She then walks in and says "what can I do for you we close in about an hour" it was 6:30. It says they close at 8 but we didn't question her. We told her we wanted to do some tastings and get a couple bottles. 
She sits us outside and said "got your Groupon?" We responded "no? Should we?" From my knowledge Groupon isn't exactly advertised from a business. So anyway we of course get the Groupon. It included 2 bottles of wine and the cheese spread and whatever else. So we decided on that. Now on to the tastings. 
She clearly knew only a small amount of Information about the wine we were tasting. But we were just trying to have a good time. She blabbed and blabbed forever. Made us laugh. So that was done. We decided we wanted to get a bottle of the '50 shades, for sure and then maybe another semi sweet. She then tells us we had to pick one up at another date but just pay for it today? Unbelievably confusing. But she thought we wanted 2 of the 50 shades and she only had one. Whatever, simple communication. 
She takes my card and tells us to use the Groupon later? It happened so fast we we're so confused. We just bought the Groupon. She gives us a bag of the 2 bottles unopened and goes back Inside? Oh and she took our crackers. So I went in and said we need to void this because we just bought the Groupon and we want to use this. 
She she called someone and did the void, then we assume she's knew? She she did the void. Done. 
She goes back inside. Well our Groupon included snacks.....? I physically had to go find a wine opener, ask her about glasses. Then when we mentioned the cheese she made a noise like she was so annoyed. 
She brought a huge bag of cheese to our table. Had a pen in her hand and grabbed 2 blocks of cheese... So gross. Unsanitary. Then sits down talking about how their have been 4 previous managers. And the owner has no clue what he's doing and the place needs her major help? We've been there before and never thought anything negative. The building and inside is so beautiful! She then makes the 'jerking off gesture and says "Mark can go suck it!" 

I mean literally the absolute worst service ever. 

To finish, it was 15min till close 2 people walk in and she gave them the look like they are closed. They said "is it to late", she said, "tomorrow please?" 

My friend said "what if they wanted a bottle?" she then said "no they for sure wanted to do tastings and that takes to long" 

What the heck, her name is Natalie,  Kershawrose17@outlook.com

This place was recommended by one of my co workers so I decided to give It a try. First off the delivery time was was amazing but here's why. I ordered spicy shrimp fried rice after confirming that the restaurant offered It. I didn't receive spicy shrimp fried rice at all. The rice I received was old and stuck to the container. I was so upset receiving the old, hard rice. One time was good enough for me, I will not eat here again!

This place isn't quite what it used to be. Last night (12/14/18) we showed up somewhere between 9:00 and 9:30 pm, later than we usually eat but I had just purchased a new vehicle so we went to eat late. When we showed up the hostess was too busy in conversation with what we thought was just a friend to help us at first. Turns out the girl that was laying across the front bench in the waiting area, with a bowl full of mashed potatoes was actually an employee that had recently got off work. Next, 3 more employees (2 of which were off shift and 1 that was supposed to be working) come and started loudly talking and continue ignoring us while speaking very inappropriately and crudely. We were very hungry which is why we didn't leave at this point. We finally got to sit down and our waitress, Holly, was wonderful, she was the only waitress we saw, raving from table to table to help patrons. Over the next 10 minutes we watched the same employees that were supposed to be off their shift run back and forth from outside to the kitchen, and the same girl with the mashed potatoes walk around with her bowl of mashed potatoes, being extremely obnoxious. I'm not sure where management was last night, but clearly these employees were not afraid to be as rude and annoying as possible. Not to mention, when we finally did get our food, the quality of it just wasn't great(I'm sure the kitchen staff was distracted by all the people constantly running and giggling in and out of the kitchen).

Don't order the pasta - they won't be able to handle it. Skip to last bullet for TLDR.

- Came for a birthday dinner with a party of 12 and a reservation made two weeks prior. Received a call one day before saying that their policy is a maximum capacity of 6 per table, and with how close we were to the date, we settled for two parties of 6 awkwardly sitting at separate tables.
- Arrived at 6:30p with orders taken promptly at 6:45p. One party received their food at 7:30p and ate their full meals entirely, while the other had to wait another 30 minutes. Overall, waited nearly 1.5 hours.
- Went up to ask waitress to see how much longer it would take, and we were told it was being plated and it shouldn't be much longer. Waited a bit longer. 4 of us at the table received our food, 2 of us waited a little more.
- It was frustrating because we had already been asked to be seated separately as a party, and then we basically were served as separate parties and ate at different times.
- Not big on complaining at establishments, but we thought we would do it this time to express to the management team our frustration. When we spoke to the manager, she had apologized but went into all of the intricacies of why it took as long as it did: they only had one chef, our bills were provided to the chef separately - the chef makes orders by the bills and another table had everyone order pasta and the bill had been slipped in between our two tables' bills, and that we didn't get our food cold, so they had no reason to do anything more for us. She told us three times that they weren't a fast food restaurant and that, unexpectedly, everyone in the restaurant had ordered pasta and that was why it took so long. There was nothing she could do for us but offer dessert on the house. She also wanted us to know that they had a small selection of pasta on the menu to avoid these situations, and yet, here we were in the situation. When asked if she could provide any sort of compensation for the experience, she said that we got our pasta hot so there was no reason for them to, albeit 1.5 hours later. She said she would call the owner and talk to him, but she said he was going to say the exact say thing she had said and wasn't going to offer anything. She told us twice.
- Not sure if she thought we were 17 or something, but definitely talked down to us. She really wanted us to know that they weren't a fast food restaurant. Felt like I was being lectured by a stranger.
- TLDR: If you decide to come here for dinner, check in with the other tables in the restaurant to make sure that they aren't ordering pasta, or else you'll probably wait 1.5 hours. Bring up the wait time with the manager if you feel like being shit on and are a sadomasochistic and enjoy it when the chef/owner/husband of the manager comes out to glare at you for the rest of your stay there. We tried our best to be civil but it felt uncomfortable because it seemed it was more important to her to explain to us why we were wrong for feeling the way we felt. Super cool. Suggestion to the restaurant: have a banner that says, 'Although we are an Italian bistro, we don't recommend the pasta if everyone else is getting it.'

I won't be coming back. The green curry was very sub par and they had surprisingly small portions for what was charged. The service was very slow.
Someone in our group ordered green curry but with tofu instead of chicken, which I had ordered. His dish came out as a thin brown ish broth, clearly missing the coconut milk. When he pointed it out to the waiter, he said that it was green curry and that mine was actually green because the chicken makes the color change. The stones on this guy...
There are MUCH better Thai restaurants in Reno.

Didn't even dine here after being treated so rudely by the hostess. We walked in and didn't know whether we needed to wait to be seated or not in the absence of any signage. The hostess approached us and was extremely abrupt and rude. This was very unfortunate as this restaurant was highly recommended.

First of all, when my dog was finished getting a haircut I did not receive a call to come get him.
