I returned to Pet Smart 3.5 hours after I dropped him off just to check on his status and the groomer said "He's done, did I not call you?" She hadn't.  Second and worst of all, my dog contracted Folliculitis, a bacterial infection of the skin. After taking him to the vet we were informed that he most likely got the infection from the trip to Pet Smart. I don't know if they don't clean their equipment or what ,but I will not be returning. Oh also he had a small cut on him when I got him back from them, so I don't even know if the groomers are trained to cut hair properly.

Get it together Smashburger. Your lines are unreasonable. It's routinely a 20+-minute wait just to place an order almost every time we visit during lunch hours. You only ever have 1 cashier taking orders. Speed up your ordering process. Employ more workers. Train your staff or update your technology. Whatever it is you need to do, do it. Other Smashburger locations don't take this long.
Late getting in & happy to find somewhere open but not accustomed to fights & bartender locking it down for 10 min for safety.

I was excited to visit this place due to their instagram posts. The pictures are amazing and I had been craving the cheesesteaks. However, it was really a big disappointment. The food is bland at best and the customer service is subpar. People here look like they're in jail. Just an overrated place overall. Save your money and visit a true cheesesteak place in south philly :)

The quality of these cheesesteaks is just pathetic. You can find more flavorful ones at wawa for half the price... yeah, horrible, super overrated place. Maybe they pay some people to post positive reviews because I don't see how anyone would ever give them over 2 stars :/

I used to really like this place, but the value has really gone down. The menu prices are on the high end for this kind of restaurant so you figure the extras will come with it. Not anymore. 
I ordered the fish and when it was served I was told they don't have malt vinegar - they don't ever offer it. I was given a 1oz sealed cup of tarter sauce, but when I later asked for another I was told they charge 50 cents for each one. Seriously? I doubt I'll be stopping in again.

So i have eaten at this establishment multiple times, let me just say that. Never have I had a complaint about food or service till now. Sunday evening 10/28/18; a friend and I decided to dine here for the evening, we always sit at the bar. 
Upon arrival we seated ourselves and it takes the bartender some time to ask us anything. It was not a busy night but she was so engulfed in a conversation with people across the bar that she took a long time to say anything to us. Once I gave her our drink choices, she took a long time to bring the drinks over. She decided it was more important to help the waiter "fish" something out of a glass of wine with a straw for 10 mins (after fishing this lint/hair/or what ever) they put the glasses of wine on a serving dish to take to a customer that was seated in the dining room. (I could not believe my eyes). Seeing this should have been my indication that tonight was not gonna be a good night!!! So now that we have our drinks and she has told us about the specials... we are ready to order. I ordered filet mignon and my date ordered the salmon. So the food is beautifully presented but my steak had a "gorgonzola dolce" melted on it.. This gorgonzola cheese was very pungent and strong! So strong, you needed to eat something after for a while to get the taste out your mouth. I tasted it and did not like it. My date said his salmon was under cooked also. So the bartender took the food and said " i will have them make you a steak without the cheese". So now the food comes back in 7 mins... We were all shocked that the food was done so quickly!! Even the bartender was shocked!! So i tasted my potatoes and veggies on the plate. Guess what, they gave me the same veggies, potatoes and steak but on a new plate!!! The only difference is they put a sauce over it to hide the pungent cheese taste...  I still tasted the very "strong cheese" on the food and now I'm pissed. So what they did was take my steak to the back..... wiped it off... hoping they got this melted nasty strong cheese flavor off.... and gave it back!!! I still saw the knife mark where i cut it previously!!! I could have wiped it myself if i had known that was what they were gonna do... (which i attempted before giving it back) So now I give it back and I'm super pissed and fuming about this "fast one" that they attempted to pull... The manager comes over again and says "I will have them make you a brand new steak!! They took this steak and tried to just get the cheese off but clearly that didn't work!!" Who says that!!! I looked at this man as if he had two heads at this point.. He attempted to have me order something but i was so pissed i wanted nothing to do with this place now and he knows it. What shocked me even more was the fact that he never attempted to remedy the situation. He could have said "oh have another glass of wine on us" or " your next round is on us for the inconvenience"... NOPE nothing... instead he said "we will take this steak off the bill.. I'm looking like.. hell yeah you will take it off.. I'm not paying for that. As i said, I have been here many times and this was a very bad experience that i didn't think would ever happen at this place because it's always a good time. I go out to eat probably twice a week at some of the best places in and outside the city; I usually don't have things like this happen at places i choose to frequent on a regular basis.. Now i have to find another place to have my Sunday dinners.
Best spray tan ever!!..NOT. The girl didn't even know which way I stand first when I use the machine..Happy birthday to me! Thanks for never calling me back:)

DIRTY!! Came with my husband and kids, once we got to our seats they were filthy! Popcorn all over the seats and a spilled drink on the chair. The staff didn't even care (16 yr olds just hanging out pretty much).

Came in with some friends to check out this restaurant that promises a "casual setting but upscale dinning" experience. After reading about them on their website and the reviews on Yelp, I was very excited to visit Madfish. When we arrived on a Friday night, around 8:30pm, there was a wait for a table, but that is usually a good sign so it didn't bother me. I was excited to try their food.  

We were seated at a booth under the speaker system. The music was confusing to say the least. At first they were playing hardcore opera, then it changed to Christmas songs. It was March, so I didn't understand why they were playing Jingle Bells. We asked the waiter and he said he also had no idea. Anyway, I tried to zone the music out and ordered a bottle of wine. The waiter took a long time to come and take care of us. He didn't explain the menu, or give us his name, or check on us throughout the dinner. I felt we were forgotten most of time because everything took a really long time to come to the table, even the bottles of red wine ($38 each) we ordered. 

We started off with some appetizers: The flash fried brussel sprouts ($8) with ponzu sauce and crispy onions straws. Unfortunately, the sprouts were falling apart and swimming in what appeared to be a dark broth. They were very salty and overall not appealing.  They were also served without the onion straws, and the server failed to notice. The baked goat cheese platter ($9) served with caramelized onions and crostini toasts was very simple and lacked presentation, but at least it was served warm. 

For dinner, we ordered a couple of dishes from the daily specials and regular menu.  Let me start with the beef Wellington ($45), which I was very excited to try. While the meat temperature was perfect, it lacked flavor. The foie gras between the steak and the pastry dough was very dry and flaky, and so I had a hard time enjoying it. The Chilean sea bass ($40) served with leeks and some baby shrimps was a generous portion of fish, but the texture was a bit gooey. I did not enjoy this dish either. The lobster crusted grouper ($30) with hollandaise was average. The tiny pieces of lobster were coated in what seemed like breadcrumbs, which was not expected. The fish had a good flavor but the crust was not as good. I was not feeling the thick creamy sauce. 

Overall, the service was less than average and the food was less than enjoyable. An expensive tab for unpleasant food.  I came with high hopes of a great dinner and I was deeply disappointed that I did not have the same experience as other Yelpers did. Unfortunately on this night, they were completely off with the food, the ambiance, and the service.  And I wouldn't blame it on the place being busy, because by the time we left the place was almost empty.

This doesn't even taste like how taco bus is supposed to taste, don't waste your time going here, parking sucks, you'll have 20 people ask you for money along the walk, the employees are rude, the food fucking sucks, So just go to the one on Hillsborough because that's what taco bus really is. I don't know if this is somebody else's franchise but the owner should take it because they're literally ruining their name ‍

The food itself was not bad however the overall restaurant experience was unpleasant . The waiter was beyond rude and when I told him my food restrictions for being pregnant he brushed it off like I was an inconvenience . We got many different appetizers for our group but very restrictive menu most of which was raw.

Way over priced with almost none service. I do like their concept, a modern Asian restaurant with some of the most beloved Japanese, Korean, and Chinese dishes. The food is good but doesn't match the price. My take of restaurant is you can mark your price high but make sure the food, service, and the environment match the price. We won't come back because there are at least three Asian restaurants have similar quality of food, with much better service and price. So why bother.

Charming looking place, but food and service are just so so. Pancakes were on the dry side with not much flavor. Potatoes were ice cold. Guessing they are pre-prepared and sitting around? They ran out of "fresh squeezed" OJ by 930A.  Food came out in dribs and drabs and had to chase someone down to get my toast. Unfortunately the place is also overrun with flies (at least on the morning we were there) which is pretty unappealing. We wouldn't go out of our way to come back, which is unfortunate because the place does have potential.
Really nothing special about this restaurant! Over priced and food was just average. If you can,go to Sparks Coffee Shop on Oddie Blvd.

Should've knew when it was completely dead on a Friday night to walk right back out. DONT GO TO THE LADY AT TABLE 5. She told me the price once there was acrylic on one hand and they were "too long". Let's not talk about all the cuts I received from all the DIRTY files, sander bits etc. then proceeded to burn the cuts with everything possible knowing there's cuts. First time ever going here and never again. Everyone is rude at this place and workers are sitting around on their phones and then want to get an attitude because they have to get up and do their job.

Where do I begin?
Still reeling from celebrating Cinco De Mayo this past weekend... my palette desperately craved Mexican food. While in the area I decided to stop in for a quick lunch. I was immediately confused because there were 4 doors to the place. Which one was locked? Which one was open? Eenie! Meanie! Miney! Mo! Which way do I go? Finally I choose one and go for it! The bar area was cluttered with dishes but there was no one there. Hmmm. Being that this was my first visit I didn't know if I could seat myself or if I should wait. Finally a gentleman acknowledged me and stated that I could sit wherever! Great! The decor is old, and outdated. The tables are lined with green, plastic cloths. You know the kind that stick to the surface when you remove them? There's a small kitchen area that is visible to patrons. The counter in front of the kitchen was piled high with pre-filled baskets of chips and containers of salsa. Maybe they expected a rush! Who knows! Anyhoo, after browsing the menu I settled on a tamale plate. While waiting the server brought over chips and salsa. Ps. Doritos taste better! The salsa was plain and lacked flavor. It reminded me of ketchup in a bottle! The entree arrived and consisted of a meat filled tamale, rice and beans. The tamale was extremely doughy. The beans were nothing to write home about and I'm still questioning the rice. I paid the check, left a tip along with a full plate of food and an upset stomach.

Horrible. This is the 2nd time I have been to this salon 1st time was ok, I believe in 2nd chances. Nightmare my nails are filed all different lengths not to mention the dried glue or whatever they use for the fills and the gel manicure I thought things couldn't get worse uneven color with gel? Do not go here I don't know when the pictures are from but they must be from 1 nail technician. I see everyone waiting for this 1 person who I think is the owner and at know time she offer to help which is BAD business.  Being nails are so expensive it should be done right

ALERT ALERT ALERT!!!

If you  do not intend to get your property  STOLEN by the DESPICABLE STAFF, talk to a manager who would COVER UP for their trail, be THROWN OUT of the hotel due to RACISM, enjoy an Oscar award winning LYING, BULLSHITTING, ACTING show from the staff members, then STAY AWAY from this hotel.

I'm a Marriott platinum elite member, but I will NEVER EVER stay in Marriott again. This is by far the most HORRENDOUS hotel experience I've ever had in my life. 

Based on my trust with Marriott (before this incidence happened), I followed Amy Klesaris's (one of the receptionists) word to ship  packages worth more than 4000 dollars to the hotel. However, when we got to the hotel, Amy was not there and the staff said that they DID NOT receive any package. We contacted our carrier the very next day and the agent checked the record which says Amy signed off the package, hence we decided to talk to Shakeema, a manager at this hotel, about the matter. To our surprise, while Shakeema was trying to comfort us with her FAKE ASS attitude, she called Amy and told her to HIDE the package and DO NOT SHOW UP at work today, on top of that, she even called the police to EXPEL us from the property when it was pouring outside. We tried to negotiate with the police and asked them to watch the surveillance camera footage, but they REFUSED our request and claimed that it was RIGHTEOUS for the manager to PROTECT the hotel (from exposing their DIRTY BUSINESS???).

They have a lot to work out.  I believe the staff is a little overwhelmed with the volume of people that are attempting to eat at this establishment.  The hostess doesn't appear to have a system for taking names as people come and go and sit before others.  I'd like not to think they are sitting Asians before others but it almost seems that way.  There seems to be no leadership.  The hostess cannot grasp the simple fact of sitting more than two people. We came with a party of four, two adults and two children.  There was plenty of opportunity to just accommodate other parties the size of ours by pushing two tables together to accommodate a party of four people.  That being said if you are just two people coming to eat you'll be sat rather quickly.

We ordered a number of other dishes. Shrimp fried rice, dumplings and few other things on the menu. 
I'll say this. The food very delicious.  The wait staff was very attentive and helpful with us selecting food off the menu and even gave us some recommendations.  The price was a little high for me. I don't think a fried rice plate should cost $12.  Comparing it to my local restaurant which is about half the cost.  

Now the other stuff.  The decor was cool. Very trendy.  A lot to look at.  Seating available at the sushi bar, table service and patio area.  Unfortunately the weather turned chilly and we refused the patio seating.

First visit wasn't what I expected.  Like I said in the beginning they have a lot to work out.  I did enjoy the food so I'll be back for that; hopefully they have some order next time around.

Starving as I was it makes this review that much sweeter....I even laughed as I begged for silverware to the one of TWO bartenders. I didn't even mind the hair that wasn't mine cause I was STARVING!!!!!
I won't come back here again. For the simple fact that I had hair in my food, had to beg for napkins and silverware, and everyone at the bar had the same complaint. So JUST SAY NO!!!!!

You know they say, most people only post reviews when they have bad experiences. Well that's true, sometimes anyway. 
I honestly only went here because Southern V was classed today. I looked at the menu online and saw they had breakfast tacos. Cool. $8? Cool too. I was under the assumption that these would be some fully loaded tacos. Cool. 
If you've ever been to Southern V, you're aware of their prices but you don't complain because the food is FILLING and good. 

Got to Vege-licious and placed my order. I had a phone conversation, listened to an EP, and then went back inside to see what was going on. I didn't get my food til about 35 mins after I placed my order. Then to add insult to injury, he hands me this small bag! I'm like two tacos fit in here with home fries. I get to my car and open the box and minus the bite, this is what I spent $10 on. I'm still hungry. Thought it was tasty, it was a little over seasoned, possibly a little too much salt. 

I will not go back. I don't feel like I get a bang for my buck. Especially true vegans know that when we're hungry, we can eat. And these small tacos for $4 a piece was not a good move.

Update: the owner replied and said "everyone don't want large entrees". Keep in mind, the tacos aren't in a section stating small portion or light portion. If this is the case, revise your menu and don't charge $4 a taco for nothing but a tortilla feature toppings.
The food was alright, the waitress spilled Grease on my DAM CHURCH PANTS, and the food took so long to come out.

Visited with our 2 kids and brought kids food with us as my kids have allergies.. while we were feeding our kids they confronted us threatening that we will be asked to leave for bringing outside food despite repeated explaining that its kids food. We had ordered $100 worth for adults. Clearly this place is not kids friendly..  avoid like plague. We always carry home cooked food for our kids and have never been asked to leave ever!!

Two visits so far. Terrific building, location, and set up... fast, attentive, and friendly service... and the pulled pork was pretty damn good.  Everything else was a letdown: dry & flavorless burnt ends, warm-ish beer, weak slaw, and pork belly just too greasy to really enjoy.  I also suspect that Dr. BBQ is probably not even a real doctor.
I'll give it a few more weeks and try one last time.

Today was my second visit to the cafe. First experience was terrible but it was very soon after their grand opening so I thought maybe they would work out the kinks ...nope.

Atmosphere: very nice decor but a terrible set up/ layout. They only have seating for maybe 20 people (2-3 tables and a small counter) in the cafe. We ended up eating in the car. Not sure why they don't take advantage of some of the open spaces to maximize seating. There is an odd counter next to the line where you can sit and get served but it's tiny and awkward as it is right next to the line.

Service: there was a family of four in front of us and they ordered several items so it took a while to be served. We waited about 8-10 mins just to place our order (not too bad). When we started to order, the lady walked away to start gathering the order ..kind of odd since we were still in the process of placing the order. A line had gathered behind us that wrapped around the staircase. I am not sure why but our order took forever (2 drinks, 2 breakfast sandwiches). They need a better system or more hands to help. Also, they make no apologies for the slow service.

Food: We ordered 2 breakfast sandwiches that were very greasy and lacking taste. The vanilla latte was good but the regular coffee was 'lumpy' and was not drinkable. My daughter got a chocolate frosted donut that looks delicious but it was awful ..very bland, tasteless.

Would not recommend this place

The ladies locker room ALWSYS stinks, the Hot tub, Aways smelly and dirty around  the edges. pool smells and dirty, bathrooms dirty.over all 2**. Aways call if your interested in just relaxing by the pool and hot tub to make sure it's working.

I come to this green line about 3 times a week with a large group of my vegan friends. We very much enjoy the food and coffee love the close location to the URBN design center where we are students. I have never left a yelp review in my life, but I downloaded the app because I felt so strongly about a particularly rude employee who baffles me each time. This man works thursdays and fridays and doesn't wear a name tag. Each and every time he rings me and my friends up he is rude and makes uncomfortable commentary. Each and every time I am rung up he makes a notion that he is expecting some sort of tip. I have no problem tipping baristas for good customer service, but this man has never once deserved a tip. Today, I threw some spare change into the tip jar to rid of it from my wallet, and he gives a disgusted stare into the jar and said "did you really just put a penny in there?". When the sandwiches were ready, he slammed the sandwiches down on the counter without saying a word. This is a very uncomfortable confrontation that I simply did not deserve. One of my best friends and very loyal customers also had a very unfortunate encounter with this employee. Because my friend did not tip this employee, he took it upon himself not to cut his sandwich out of spite. My friend went up, asked kindly for him to cut his sandwich, to which he responded "no." My friend asked for a knife. He then slammed the gigantic kitchen knife down on the counter and blatantly stated"do you want to wash the dishes too?". Encounters like these happen each and every time me or my friends communicate with this employee. This guy needs a serious attitude check or a stern talking to.

They are liars and have terrible customer service! I walked in and asked if they know how to do a nail design I seen on Instagram. The women said yes. I proceed to get my nails done and attempted to show the nail tech the photo. She then mushed my phone away and said wait until I do your nails to show me the design! I said what? Okay! All in all she was rude, didn't listen, and expected me to pay full price; and professional prices for amateur work! This is the worst nail salon in Tampa!!!!!!!!

My husband and I had an appointment scheduled yesterday between 2:00 and 4:00 PM.  After waiting until 5:00PM, no one came and we did  not even get a phone call (or an apology).  Obviously they don't want or need our business.

Why are you standing in a line on a sidewalk covered in suspicious fluids? Why are you waiting for an hour to go into restaurant that is decorated like an overwrought TGI Fridays? The grilled oysters are really good but aren't they really good pretty much everywhere that serves oysters in NO?
No clean tables, Service takes forever,  still waiting on a refill. WOW think it would be different during Gretna Fest
Called to find out 2 basic things, price and what's included... receptionist wanted my phone number for someone to call me back. Obviously a mating scheme. Should be info readily available.

Went for late Saturday breakfast only bec our first choice had long wait. Not sure what they ate trying to be, but clearly it's not working. Only 2 other customers and our two breakfast items  had longer than expected wait. Menu limited. Our breakfast was over $20. 
Sorry won't be back. Many better options in area!

Came in with a friend that had never been. Waitress refused to speak to me in English. I don't speak any Spanish. We ended up not getting food at all because they were so rude and dismissive. The music was so loud at 1:00pm on a Sunday it was like a club on sat night. Won't be back...

Staff are friendly. Music is great if you are several streets over. Unfortunately not everyone is a senior citizen with extensive hearing loss. This is a bar for people not from St. Louis who have no idea where to go in Soulard.

Was not very impressed with this restaurant, unfortunately. The sushi itself is delicious. I enjoyed every appetizer and roll I ordered. But the service wasn't very good. Everything from ordering to the food coming out took long and things were forgotten. The bill was so messed up that the waitress sat at our booth and went down each item one by one to explain the mistakes. It was confusing and time consuming to deal with.

I also wasn't a fan of the inside. I felt like I was sitting under heating lamps. It was really bright inside. I just felt uncomfortable.

Overall not my favorite place. It's unfortunate because the food really was good. Maybe one day their will be a more positive update.
Last night the security shoved three girls to the floor. When TPD showed up they were no help. It was like watching a rape victim get publicly humiliated. I 100% will never return to this shit hole.

My friend and I attended Noto last Friday night. I really don't see the "hype" over this place!! It was so crowed, they need to do crowed control! Everyone kept bumping into us. The staff was extremely rude. And we were sitting at a table and one of the "table girls" literally shoved me because I was in her "way"??? Overall my friend and I will not be going back to Noto.

So I just walked out of the Cremery. It was a negative experience.  I order a shake. The cashier coughs (I'm notpositive if she coughed into her hand) I was shocked she turned around the preceded to scoop out icecream for the shake with no gloves. Another employees is helpful and proceeds to get my donut,but boxed the wrong one.I'm glad I noticed and asked if she had gotten the right donut. She used the wrong receipt,but was nice and trying to be helpful. She drops it of on the counter in front of me and walks away. The other sales person is polite and helpful and I ask her if the shake comes with whip cream. She goes and makes a scoop of what I guess is "whipped" creme and Plotz it on the shake. The shape filled to the rim and with not cover proceeds to drips all over as I walk away.i also brought a donut and them noticed something bigger than a fruit fly flying around. The donuts are uncovered. I think the food at Founding Farmers in DCis great so I decided to try this location. I wont be back, at least not to the creamery. The shake is very think , very chocolatey,  the big paper straw is not working at least for me. Glad u got a spoon. The shake has caused a mess. I'm throwing it away. I haven't even driven off yet,but the disappointment at this new location caused me to write this reveiw.

The WORST most unprofessional business I've ever dealt with. Waited 4 hours for a tow. ETA was 90min called after 90 min they tell me 50 more minutes. A automated service called 30min later to say another 50 minutes. I Called them 8 times no answer. I called from my wife phone they answered immediately, The woman receptionist who answered was VERY RUDE I told I been waiting over 3hours.(at this time I already called a new road side service) she was very ignorant,I let her know about there professionalism...while talking to her the other tow company pulled up.So I tell her to cancel that service.She replied " I don't care u are the one waiting not me "and hung phone up

We were excited to try this last minute restaurant choice after driving through Germantown and reading reviews on open table and yelp.  Our dinner reservation was just before 6pm and we were two of only a few people people in the restaurant.  It took our waiter about 10 min to come to our table to greet us, and overall the service was mediocre.  Our food was also mediocre. The Brussels were very disappointing. Tough and had a strong vinegar taste.  The ones we make at home are much better. The pork chop was tender and delicious but the smokiness of the cabbage that accompanied it was overpowering and off putting. The steak was hugely disappointing. We were told the cut was filet but no way!  It was tough and very under seasoned... and there was no salt on the table. Our food wasn't even hot when it arrived at our table, which was very surprising considering they were not busy. We ordered two draft beers and one was hot. Doubt we will be back as we sure didn't have the great experience that others have described.

My friends and I booked 2 rooms for 2 nights. On the second night, I woke up itching but thought it was maybe a mosquito. The next morning while my friend was laying in bed, she spotted a bed bug. We immediately packed up and notified the front desk manager, Sid. He seemingly did not believe us and asked us to show him. We went back to the room and showed him the bug. He touched the bug and it started crawling very fast. He then picked it up and killed it with his hand. Even after seeing the bug himself,  Sid refused to give me back my money. He began to insinuate that we planted the bug because we knew exactly where it was (which was where we saw it duh). I am very disappointed in this hotel. I am still waiting to hear back from Best Western headquarters on this matter. I am still in shock as to how we were treated and how they are not taking this matter serious enough.  I am now traumatized and will have my home inspected to make sure I did not bring any home. If I don't hear from anyone  and receive my refund soon, I will make this into a legal matter. I would advise you all to  think twice and pick a better hotel with a more professional staff. NEVER AGAIN!!

Sushi seemed to be freshly removed from *some* ocean, but It was served at room temperature. The service was simply despicable. If you sit at the bar, expect your bartender to pay you minimal attention and work for no more than a 5% tip. Show up full, because you'll build up quite the appetite waiting for your food.

The best way I could describe the food would be cafeteria quality.  One or two items were good but the rest were disappointing.   Service was not good at all.  Had to ask about bread.   Reminder to waitress 10 minutes later about bread.   Never got any bread.  Will not be back.

ordered a 10 inch birthday cake to try rhis place out being it had 4 plus stars..have to say it wasn't what its cracked up to be at all..first the icing which I was asked what type I liked either BUTTER CREAM or sugar I choose the butter cream ..that was to to sweet.ALSO THE  BUTTER POUND CAKE  the flavor LACKED BUTTER tasted just as a pound cake. WAS WHITE CAKE NOT THE YELLOW FOUND IN the look of the cake...THE OUTSIDE LOOK was OK as I was told for my day NEW YEARS eve EVE there's no decorations done..ALSO AFTER CALLING THE BAKERY AFTER THE PARTY  I WAS TOLD BY THE YOUNG LADY  she two Questions asked me 1.if the other's at my party liked it. 2. that all the cakes were made the day of dec 31st.  which I knew then I was talking with the owner... THEY MAKE YOU SIGN A PIECE OF PAPER IF YOU LIKE IT BUT AFTER TASTING IT I WOULDN'T HAVE  ORDERED. IT HERE AT ALL .. The Price was $43. also..THEN she got done telling me .she was going to talk with the owner's and they would get back to me..which hasn't happened at all..I have to say" DONT ORDER THE CAKES" the doughnuts and pastry are an A.RATING  . F RATING for no  follow ups THAT'S  poor communications..not good..NO PROFESSIONALISM  HERE.....last time for this experience..

This was the worst Chile Relleno Burro I have ever ordered from a Los Betos chain!!! I have ordered the same Burro from the los betos on Grant and Silverbell and it has always been great, but i was short on time so I thought I would give this one a try.  The service was fine, the lady at the deive through window was super nice and threw in a couple extra salsas, but when i bit into the burrito, i tasted a rancid kind of taste. at first i thought maybe the sour cream gave it a weird taste but then i think the actual relleno or the pico de gallo tasted like old food that had soured with almost a vinegar-like taste. I was so hungry i tried to see if maybe with another bite it would start tasting better but it just got worse! I am 6 months pregnant and i hope I dont get sick but I do know I will never try this place again!!! Too bad because it is the closest to my work.  I didn't go back to tell them because I didn't have time before I had to go to work, but i am going to call to let them know how horrible that was!
Nice place for quick lunch, cheap mill. But the dish sizes are small.  Make you you are not that hungry when you go.

I came here tonight with my cousin and had a nightmare experience. There was only one server tonight and this man was the WORST. We ordered a Deluxe Pho to share. The order came out rather quickly. As my cousin started eating, she discovered a long piece of curly hair in her noodle. We decided to notify the server about the situation. He said that my cousin put it in there. We were so angry. I said to him that how could it be her piece of hair when her hair is straight and mind you her hair was pulled back in a ponytail. We requested a new bowl, but decided to leave because he was rude and threw a hissy fit the whole time. As we were leaving, he started to yell at us. 

Just never ever again.

worst nail experience. i've been getting my nails done on and off for about 4 years now, i went here because it's close to my house and that was a mistake! i had acrylics done at a previous salon and wanted a fill. the lady said it would be no problem and got me in right away. from the start it was horrible, when she was using the automatic filer it was getting hot and burning the side of my finger, i would tell her this and she didn't do anything about it. next she did the gel and it was so thick that when i tried to take the nails off they wouldn't fit through nail clippers. when she did the polish she did the color very uneven and the coats were awful. when she put my hand under the UV light it burned my hand which has never happened before. it took almost 3 hours and my nails were not the shape i wanted and they were all different shapes. this is the worst nail experience i've ever had. DO NOT GO HERE!!!!
I got robbed when I was living here awhile ago. I don't recommend living here save your money..
